FLY TO CHAING MAI. Today we’ll make our way to the airport for our flight to the amazing capital of the north - Chiang Mai. You’ll have time to relax once you’ve checked in. Later, we’ll explore the city and Chiang Mai’s night markets.

TEMPLES & WATERFALLS. Experience a full day of exploring all the culture and natural wonders Chiang Mai has to offer. We'll checkout the iconic Doi Suthep Temple, following it up with an epic buffet lunch. To end our day of exploring we'll head off to see the fascinating 'sticky' waterfalls.
HILL TRIBE TREK. Trek through and stay overnight in the amazing jungle of Chiang Mai. Wander through beautiful rice paddy fields, see stunning waterfalls and visit a local hill tribe.
HILL TRIBE TREK. We continue our trek before bamboo river rafting our way back home! You’ll arrive back to your guesthouse to relax or check out more of Chiang Mai’s nightlife.

ELEPHANT SANCTUARY EXPERIENCE. Today we'll visit a sanctuary focused on protecting elephants rescued from hard lives. We’ll learn about their history and important connection to rural communities, and see them interact in their natural environment.
CHECKOUT. Your epic adventure comes to an end today! Your group leader will help you with your onward travel.

tourName: Southern Thailand adventure holiday
placesVisited: Bangkok, Klong Klone Mangrove Forest, Kuraburi, Khao Sok River, Koh Surin, Khao Lak, Phuket
generalInfo:
This trip is a must for all those adventurous types out there! From the hustle and bustle of Bangkok to the remoteness of Khao Sok National Park, this tour takes you to the quiet jewels of the south while staying in some quirky accommodations. In Bangkok, spend a muddy day experiencing the Klong Klone Mangrove Forest and by night stay on the banks of the Chao Phraya River in the super eco-friendly Bangkok Tree House, a quiet oasis from which to explore this exciting city.

A Khao Sok Safari is one of the reasons people come to Khao Lak and is by far our most popular excursion. With repeat bookings year after year, the place always guarantees to amaze. This trip is everyone’s favourite, with lots of activities including elephant trekking (no riding elephants or tricks!) and canoeing. You can tour the river and see the limestone mountains, incredible rock formations and beautiful caves.

From here you will take a speedboat to the Surin Islands and then head out for your snorkelling adventure at Pakkard and Pae Bays. Not a snorkelling fan? Then you can also go nature trekking along the national park trails in Mai Ngam Bay.

End your adventure with 5 well deserved nights at the breathtakingly beautiful natural sanctuary of the Kantary Beach Hotel. Tucked away from the busy tourist spots of Phuket this elegant beach front hotel is located on one of the few remaining stretches of pristine beach in Phang Nga.

This trip aims to avoid some of the busier regions of the country to offer you a true 'off the beaten track' Thailand experience.

dayInfo.description: Departure: Depart the UK and fly to Bangkok.

Arrive Bangkok: On arrival at Bangkok Airport, you will be welcomed by your local English speaking guide and transfer to the jetty where you will board a local public boat for short transfer to the resort on another side of the Chao Phraya River. This evening you may join a complimentary boat trip to see Fireflies - arranged by Bangkok Tree House.

Klong Klone Mangrove Forest: Experience an active and 'muddy' day trip starting at the Klong Klone Mangrove Conservation Centre. Learn about the mangrove eco-system and the local community revitalisation project before setting out by long tail boat to feed the crab-eating Macaques and witness the local way of life, collecting blood cockles using a mud sledge and catching catfish and krill to make shrimp paste. After lunch at a local platform cottage, help with planting mangroves and enjoy skiing by mud sledge. (B.L)
Bangkok - Kuraburi: This morning return to Bangkok Airport and take the short flight down to Phuket. On arrival you will be met and transferred to your hotel. Enjoy the afternoon at leisure. (B,D)

Kuraburi - Today you will depart from your hotel at around 08:30 for a full day with jungle and canoeing along the Khao Sok River. A Khao Sok Safari is one of the reasons people come to Khao Lak and is by far our most popular excursion. With repeat bookings year after year, the place always guarantees to amaze. This trip is everyone’s favourite, with lots of activities including hiking and canoeing. You can tour the river and see the limestone mountains, incredible rock formations and beautiful caves. (B,L)
Day at leisure to relax or explore your surroundings. (B)

Koh Surin: This morning you will be collected from your hotel for the transfer to the pier where you will register and choose your suitable snorkeling equipment. At around 9am you will take a speedboat to the Surin Islands and then head out for your snorkelling adventure at Pakkard and Pae Bays. Return ashore to the Surin National Park restaurant for lunch before more snorkelling this afternoon at Sapparto and Bon Bays. Tonight will be spent in your private tent on the beach at Surin National Park. (B,L,D)

Koh Surin: Following breakfast you will travel out by long tail boat to 2 wonderful snorkelling areas. Return to the National park restaurant for lunch. This afternoon you will head off to explore 2 more snorkelling sites before returning the park for your evening meal and overnight on the beach in your private tent. (B,L,D)

Today you will take breakfast before deciding on your morning activities which are either a traditional long boat to a snorkelling spot or nature trekking along the national park trails in Mai Ngam Bay. (B,L)
Khao Lak: Enjoy days at leisure relaxing at this beautiful. natural sanctuary. (B)
Departure: Transfer to Phuket Airport for your flight home. (B)

tourName: Thailand 2 week discovery tour
generalInfo:
Travel around Thailand on a small group, 15-day trip and explore its temples, jungle, and beautiful beaches! From island hopping on a long-tail boat to jungle trekking in one of the oldest rainforests in the world, you won’t be disappointed in the Land of Smiles. Thailand’s stunning landscapes and laid-back vibe make it the perfect getaway! Thailand’s breathtaking landscape, mouth-watering food, relaxing massages, and laid-back vibe make it the perfect travel destination. Did we mention a massage is only $8?! No matter your style, Thailand has something for everyone.

Shop like a local: Visit Bangkok’s largest and most authentic fresh market, where locals buy their daily ingredients—from fresh fruits and vegetables to creepy-crawly delicacies—before learning to cook authentic Thai dishes with a local chef.

Picture perfect beaches: Visit the laid-back town of Railay, accessible only by boat and pedestrians. The beaches here are straight from a postcard!

Sleep in a treehouse!: Stay the night in a teak forest in treehouse bungalows. This is a one-of-a-kind experience that not many tourists get to see.

INCLUDED:
- 14 nights seaview accommodation (double occupancy)
- 3 domestic flights
- Private, air-conditioned ground transportation
- Speed boat/ferry transfers
- Activities as noted on the itinerary
- All breakfasts, 7 lunches, 5 dinners
- Local trip leader throughout

dayInfo.description: BANGKOK ARRIVAL - Welcome to Thailand! Bangkok is an intoxicating and sometimes jarring mix of modern and ancient with its breathtaking skyline, traditional architecture, and gleaming temples bustling with tourists and locals. Everywhere you go, the aroma of street food that truly captures the essence of Bangkok’s rich culture will engulf you. There is a welcome meeting with your Thai trip leader this evening. Depending on your arrival time, you’ll have time to explore your new surroundings before the meeting. Or you maybe you'll want to stretch your legs and relax at the hotel's rooftop pool if you'd like to unwind after the long journey. *Airport pick-up is not included. You can easily take a taxi at the airport or pre-arrange an airport pick-up with a company such as Welcome Pickups or one that you may find on travel sites such as TripAdvisor. Check out our blog about getting to Bangkok from the airport for more information. *INCLUDED - Activities: Welcome meeting • Accommodation: Boutique hotel

BANGKOK - This morning, make your way to Klong Toei wet market to pick up ingredients for today's cooking class. Anything and everything is sold at this truly local market that few farang (foreigners) get to see, including live ducks, insects, and snakes! As you walk through the market, you can taste exotic fruits and if you’re brave enough, sample some of the creepy, crawly delicacies! After the market, master the art of Thai cooking in a class from which part of the proceeds goes to the Klong Toei slums. After the cooking class, return to the hotel for some free time. Later, go for a drink at a rooftop bar with 360° panoramic views of Bangkok at sunset. Then, grab dinner at a restaurant whose income helps local family planning initiatives. Can you guess what almost everything is made of inside the restaurant? *INCLUDED - Activities: Klong Toei wet market; Cooking class (w/ lunch); Free time; Rooftop bar; Welcome dinner • Meals: B, L, D • Accommodation: Boutique hotel

RAILAY BEACH - Journey south to Railay today where you'll enjoy lunch and some time to get familiar with your new surroundings. Railay is a welcome relief after the hustle and bustle of Bangkok as the town is completely pedestrian and there are no cars or motorbikes around so you can easily explore without getting lost. Railay is special because it is surrounded by large limestone cliffs which make it accessible only by boat. It is well-known for its rock climbing and is one of the most photogenic spots in all of Thailand. One of Thailand’s most photographed beaches all to yourself! Later today, head to Phra Nang Beach which is less than a 10-minute walk away. This is the best time to visit this beach since all the daytrippers from Phuket will have left and you'll have the entire beach to yourselves! On the beach, head over to the "penis temple” where Thai women leave penis statues with hopes of being blessed with good fertility. Then, sit back and watch the sunset on the vast stretch of beach in peace! *INCLUDED - Transfers: Bangkok - Railay Beach by plane, van, and boat (approx. 3.5 hrs) • Activities: Free time; Phra Nang Beach • Meals: B, L • Accommodation: Boutique resort hotel

RAILAY BEACH - This afternoon, hop on an old Thai sailboat for a cruise around massive intricate rock formations protruding from the ocean depths. The cruise starts after lunch and as you cruise, there'll be stops for snorkeling. Alternatively, you can just chill on the boat and enjoy the views with a drink in hand. Inner tubes and paddleboards will also be available. We'll sail and take in a breathtaking sunset followed by dinner and the option of snorkeling to see the bioluminescent plankton light up around you. *INCLUDED - Activities: Free time; Half-day cruise (w/ dinner) • Meals: B, D • Accommodation: Boutique resort hotel

RAILAY BEACH - Today, everything you'd like to do is completely up to you. Your trip leader will suggest some ideas of things to do in Railay the day before and can help make arrangements if needed. Most activities can be arranged at little to no notice. You might opt to go kayaking, rock climbing, snorkeling, island hopping, scuba diving, or just lounge around on the beach and get massages. It's your vacation so you can do what you'd like! *INCLUDED - Activities: Free time (optional activities at your own expense) • Meals: B • Accommodation: Boutique resort hotel

KHAO SOK NATIONAL PARK - Wonders of the ancient rainforest. Khao Sok National Park's rainforest is the second-oldest in the world, thriving for more than 160 million years. Upon arrival, you'll enjoy a delicious lunch, and the rest of the day is yours to explore at your own pace. You’ll also have the option of inner tubing down a river with beautiful fauna everywhere you look. *INCLUDED - Transfers: Railay Beach - Khao Sok by boat & van (approx. 2.5 hrs) • Activities: Free time; Inner tubing (optional and at your own expense) • Meals: B, L • Accommodation: Rainforest resort

KHAO SOK NATIONAL PARK - Today is a completely free day to enjoy Khao Sok at your own pace. Your trip leader can help arrange any activities you’d like — from canoeing to hiking to participating in a jungle cooking class. If you'd rather take it slow, you can go for a gentle jungle walk, explore the hotel grounds, walk into town, or treat yourself to a massage. *INCLUDED - Activities: Free time (optional activities at your own expense) • Meals: B • Accommodation: Rainforest resort

CHEOW LAN LAKE - A unique, once-in-a-lifetime experience! Get ready to spend the night in a floating lake hotel. Head to the edge of the lake and hop in a boat to the accommodation. During the boat ride, don't forget to look up at the large limestone cliffs and dense jungles in their full glory. We'll enjoy lunch at the floating lake hotel and then, head out for a scenic hike in the jungle (easy to moderate, approximately 30 minutes each way). You'll also have the chance to explore a cave covered in stalactites, stalagmites, and fossils that are between 250-400 million years old! At the end of the day, unwind at your floating lake house where you can take a dip in the lake or kick back and relax. After dinner together, you have the option to take an evening boat safari to try to spot wild elephants! *INCLUDED - Transfers: Khao Sok National Park - Cheow Lan Lake by van & boat (approx. 2 hrs) • Activities: Boat ride on lake; Jungle hike; Cave visit; Free time; Evening boat safari • Meals: B, L, D • Accommodation: Floating lake house hotel

CHIANG MAI - Chiang Mai: A place of history and wonder. This morning, head north toward the mountains of Chiang Mai where there is much to see and do in addition to this historic city's temples. Chiang Mai boasts a rich culture and ethnic diversity as well as many elephant sanctuaries, cooking and massage schools, outdoor activities, handicraft workshops, cultural performances, and waterfalls galore! The rest of the day is free to do what interests you. The hotel is in the heart of the city so there’s a lot to see and do nearby and you can easily venture out on your own. Tonight, you'll visit the farang (foreigner) food market that is full of food trucks and stalls serving everything from pad thai to pizza if you'd like to have dinner here. Then, onward to the night market for some souvenir shopping. *INCLUDED - Transfers: Cheow Lan Lake - Chiang Mai by boat, van, & plane (approx. 3.5 hrs) • Activities: Free time; Night market • Meals: B • Accommodation: Boutique hotel

CHIANG MAI - Begin the day with a tuk-tuk tour around the city and stop at Wat Sri Suphan (Silver Temple) and Wat Chedi Luang. As you visit the temples, you'll see monks doing their mantras and meditating. If you'd like, you can sign up for a monk chat at one of these temples on one of your free days. A monk chat is a conversation between tourists and monks to ask questions you may have about Buddhism or Thailand. This also gives the novice monks a great opportunity to practice their English! After the tuk-tuk tour, stop for lunch to enjoy a bowl of khao soi, the most iconic dish of the north. The rest of the day is yours to do as you please and your trip leader will be there to point you in the right direction. *INCLUDED - Activities: Tuk-tuk tour; Free time • Meals: B, L • Accommodation: Boutique hotel

CHIANG MAI - This morning, drive to the outskirts of Chiang Mai where the elephants roam in peace. Observe the daily patterns of these jungle giants, see how they graze and socialize with others, and get up close to feed them. The expert caregivers will teach you about their efforts toward sustainable tourism and conservation. Enjoy some refreshments near the elephants' mud pit but be careful not to get sprayed! The afternoon is at your leisure and later in the day, we will meet up and head to the Chiang Mai (Ploen Ruedee) Night Market to explore the delicious street food and fun souvenirs. After the sun goes down, meet up for a ladyboy show with all the flash and pizzazz associated with the ladyboys of Thailand! *INCLUDED - Activities: Elephant sanctuary; Ploen Ruedee night market; Ladyboy show • Meals: B, L • Accommodation: Boutique hotel

CHIANG MAI - Today is a free day and you're free to decide what to do. Chiang Mai boasts a rich culture and ethnic diversity as well as cooking and massage schools, various outdoor activities, handicraft workshops, cultural performances, and waterfalls galore! The hotel is situated in the heart of the city so there’s a lot to see and do nearby and you can easily venture out on your own. *INCLUDED - Activities: Free time (optional activities at your own expense) • Meals: B • Accommodation: Boutique hotel

CHIANG MAI - Enjoy a leisurely morning before we head to the outskirts of Chiang Mai toward the Sticky Waterfalls. You'll just have to wait until you get there to find out how they got their name! Afterward, we'll continue onto a teak forest where your treehouse bungalows and home for the night await you. You will be able to disconnect from the hustle of daily life in this beautiful forest where trees tower above you and the gentle sounds of nature fill your ears. *INCLUDED - Transfers: Chiang Mai - Sticky Waterfalls & treehouse resort by van (approx. 1 hr) • Activities: Sticky Waterfalls; Free time • Meals: B, L, D • Accommodation: Treehouse bungalow eco-resort

BANGKOK - Time to head back to Bangkok where you can enjoy your last massage, fruit smoothie, and pad thai on the famous (or should we say infamous?!) Khao San Road. Later in the day, we'll meet up to visit Wat Arun, "Temple of Dawn", a major landmark on the west bank of the Chao Phraya River. We'll cross the river and have one last dinner together with views of Wat Arun in the backdrop as you say goodbye to your new friends. *INCLUDED - Transfers: Chiang Mai - Bangkok by plane (approx. 2 hrs) • Activities: Free time; Wat Arun; Farewell dinner • Meals: B, D • Accommodation: Boutique hotel

BANGKOK DEPARTURE - Depending on your flight time, you will have free time on your own in Bangkok before catching your flight home. *INCLUDED - Activities: Free time; Departure (at your own expense) • Meals: B **Itinerary is subject to change.

tourName: Thailand 7 day tour
generalInfo:
This 7-day Thailand tour captures the country’s ultimate highlights – follow the popular backpacking path, experience the buzzing energy of Bangkok on a night tour and immerse yourself in local life with a homestay in Chiang Mai. Walk alongside gentle giants during an elephant observation experience, and explore the spiritual heart of Thailand with a visit to a Buddhist temple. Whether it’s your first visit or a return adventure, this trip promises an unforgettable journey through Thailand!

Included in all tours:

An epic Adventure Leader, aka a local legend, to turn your trip into the adventure of a lifetime
All local transport within Thailand
Accommodation (including hostels, one local homestay, & one sleeper train)
Meals provided: 4 breakfasts, 2 lunches, & 2 dinners

Accommodation style:

In true backpacking style, our accommodation is in shared, mixed-gender dorm rooms as standard on this tour. But if you’d prefer a little extra comfort and your own space to relax after an action-packed day, room upgrades are available. Please request this on booking.

Included in all tours:

Pre-departure briefing (Bangkok)
Dinner & Tuk-Tuk tour (Bangkok, Unmissable)
Chiang Mai Homestay Experience (Chiang Mai)
Monk chat & Wat Doi Suthep visit (Chiang Mai)

dayInfo.description: Bangkok: Your Thailand adventure commences today! Upon your arrival in Bangkok, you'll rendezvous with your group and Adventure Leader, marking the beginning of an exciting two weeks ahead. Following your arrival, prepare for an evening filled with culinary delights aboard a tuk-tuk tour! Embark on a thrilling ride to a rooftop restaurant, where a plethora of tantalizing Thai dishes await your selection. After dinner, your tuk-tuk will whisk you away on a nighttime tour of Bangkok's iconic landmarks, offering mesmerizing views of the city under the stars. Conclude your first night with a visit to one of Bangkok's enchanting rooftop bars, providing a panoramic vista of the cityscape before retiring for the evening.

Bangkok: Begin your morning at your own pace, with the enticing option of joining a tour of the Old City, offering insights into Bangkok's illustrious history. This immersive experience will guide you through iconic landmarks such as Wat Pho, Wat Arun, and the majestic Grand Palace. Please note that if you opt for the Old City tour, you'll need to check out of your hostel before departing. Upon returning to your hostel, take a moment to refresh before we gather at the train station, poised to embark on our journey to Chiang Mai.

Chiang Mai: Upon your arrival at Chiang Mai station, a warm and hearty welcome awaits you at our overnight homestay! We'll swiftly transfer to the accommodation to drop off our luggage before setting off for an adventurous afternoon in the wilderness. Our journey will take us to the starting point of our jungle trek, where we'll embark on a 4-6km hike through the lush terrain. While the trek may span a couple of hours, fear not, as we'll pause for a refreshing break at a scenic waterfall, allowing us to fully immerse ourselves in the beauty of the jungle. Following our adventure, we'll return to our homestay to relish in a delightful evening meal together.

Chiang Mai: After bidding farewell to our homestay, we'll embark on an unforgettable adventure this morning—a half-day at an ethical elephant sanctuary! Here, you'll have the unique opportunity to observe these majestic creatures under the guidance of knowledgeable professionals. Learn about elephant behaviours and the sanctuary's dedicated conservation efforts in Thailand. You'll witness their playful antics in mud pits and even have the chance to assist in preparing treats for them. To top it off, we'll indulge in a delectable vegetarian buffet lunch on-site. There will always be a proximity of 10-15 metres from the Elephants in order to closely follow a more natural environment for the animals and without exploitation for tourism. Following our time at the sanctuary, we'll make our way back to the city where your luggage will be awaiting you at the hostel. As evening descends, you'll have the option to participate in either a cooking class or immerse yourself in the excitement of a thrilling Muay Thai show.

Chiang Mai: We'll kickstart the day with an enlightening Monk chat at the initial temple, followed by a scenic ride on public songthaews, those iconic Thai red trucks, to explore other captivating temples. After soaking in the spiritual allure of Wat Doi Suthep, we'll return to the hostel. For those craving an extra adventure, consider embarking on a trip to the breathtaking limestone Sticky Waterfall, accessible by a 1.5-hour ride on the charming songthaew.

Chiang Mai: Today offers a blank canvas for adventure, with an array of thrilling options to choose from. Gear up for an adrenaline-pumping Whitewater Rafting excursion, or test your mettle behind the wheel of an ATV. Alternatively, embark on another exhilarating trek through the stunning landscapes. If you prefer a more leisurely pace, explore the old town independently, with your leader on hand to offer recommendations. For a taste of local culture, meander through the bustling local market, brimming with souvenirs and delectable street food. The choice is yours!

It’s time to wrap up your incredible adventure! This morning, you’ll check out of the hostel and say goodbye to your travel crew. If you’re not ready to leave just yet, let us know – we can help arrange extra accommodation or transfers so you can keep exploring.

tourName: Thailand and Vietnam experience tour
generalInfo:
Explore two of the most amazing countries in Asia in style on our Thailand + Vietnam Experience! This trip will have you seeing the very best of Thailand and Vietnam over 27 action-packed days.

You’ll discover Bangkok by boat, visit ancient temples, stay overnight on floating bungalows, explore tropical islands, visit an elephant sanctuary, trek the mountains of Sapa, cruise Ha Long Bay, be charmed by Hoi An, learn about the Vietnam War, experience local life in the Mekong, treat yourself at rooftop bars, and so much more.

Oh, and did we mention that we’re including a bunch of activities, premium accommodation, an experienced group leader, and an instant new group of friends? Get ready for the trip of a lifetime!


HIGHLIGHTS

– Enjoy our hand-selected premium accommodation including four-star hotels & upgraded local home stays
– Cruise Bangkok’s canals & experience local life
– Spend the night in floating bungalows & magical treehouses in the heart of Khao Sok National Park
– Float around the idyllic Phi Phi islands on an exclusive boat trip
– Learn how to care for elephants at an incredible sanctuary
– Dive into the culture, food & fast paced lifestyle of buzzing Hanoi
– Trek with the locals through the stunning green landscapes of Sapa
– Sail, kayak & swim the emerald waters of Ha Long Bay
– Experience local village life in the jungles of the Mekong Delta

INCLUSIONS

- Personal Airport Pickup To The Hotel 24/7
- 26 Nights Premium Accommodation
- All Transport & 3 Internal Flights
- Awesome Group Leader
- Bangkok River Cruise
- Visit Ancient Temples
- Cooking Classes
- Experience Local Life
- Party in Bangkok
- Khao Sok National Park
- Floating Bungalows
- Jungle Treehouse Experience
- Kayaking & Tubing
- Island Tour & Snorkelling
- Beach BBQ
- Muay Thai or Yoga Experience
- Thai Massage
- Snorkelling
- Phi Phi Islands Boat Trip
- Phi Phi Viewpoint
- Elephant Experience
- Walking & Rickshaw Tour of Hanoi
- Night Out in Hanoi
- Sapa Mountain-Side Accommodation
- Sapa Trekking with Locals
- Overnight Boat Trip on Ha Long Bay
- Local Homestay Experience
- Bicycle Tour of Ninh Binh
- River Boat Trip
- Dragon Mountain Viewpoint
- Traditional Crab Fishing Basket Boat Tour
- Night Out in Ho Chi Minh City
- Overnight Mekong Delta Experience
- Local Village Visit
- Cu Chi Tunnels Tour
- Help with Onward Travel

dayInfo.description: ARRIVE IN BANGKOK: We’ll pick you up from the airport and take you to the hotel in Bangkok. You’ll have plenty of time to relax and meet everyone in your group.

TEMPLES & TUK TUKS: We’ll cruise on a long-tail boat through the heart of Bangkok before visiting sacred temples as well as travel by tuk tuk through the crazy streets! At night we’ll head out to experience Bangkok’s nightlife.
THAI COOKING CLASS: Learn the secrets to preparing Thai cuisine with a traditional cooking class! Then sit back and enjoy the sights when we board the overnight train south.
FLOATING BUNGALOWS: Enter the magical Khao Sok National Park, a hidden paradise of pristine lakes and limestone cliffs. Go tubing, kayaking and sleep overnight in floating bungalows!

JUNGLE TREEHOUSES: We’ll continue further into the untouched rainforest to experience local life in the jungle. Visit a local family’s plantation and then go tubing or kayaking down a beautiful turquoise river. Tonight we’ll stay overnight in tree houses!

TRAVEL TO KOH PHANGAN: We’ll travel by boat to the beautiful tropical island of Koh Phangan. After checking in to our beachside bungalows you can spend the afternoon exploring the island or just relax by the pool. We’ll then head out for dinner and have a party on the beach!

ISLAND TOUR: Today we’ll discover the beauty of the island as we travel to some of the most amazing beaches in the world! Chill, soak up the sun, snorkel in crystal water and check out some of the island’s amazing viewpoints. We’ll then kick back with a beach BBQ.
MUAY THAI OR YOGA: Today you have the choice of learning the art of Muay Thai boxing, or bringing some harmony into your trip with a yoga class. Then relax with a traditional Thai massage!
TRAVEL TO PHI PHI: We’ll make our way to the Phi Phi Islands by boat and bus, then check-in before a taste of island nightlife!

PHI PHI BOAT TRIP: We’ll head off on our exclusive, private speedboat to the beautiful Phi Phi Lei. Explore hidden lagoons, snorkel blue water and discover hidden sandy beaches, truly an unforgettable day!

VIEWPOINT & TRAVEL TO PHUKET: Enjoy a morning hike to the iconic Phi Phi viewpoint, and relax on some beautiful beaches before we jump on the ferry to Phuket. We’ll check in to our boutique hotel and treat ourselves to a sunset dinner.

ELEPHANT EXPERIENCE: Ending our time in Thailand on a high, we’ll spend the day getting up close and personal with elephants at an incredible sanctuary, then head out to a delicious dinner and drinks.

ARRIVE IN VIETNAM: Goodbye Thailand, good morning Vietnam! Landing in Hanoi we’ll take you to your hotel in the old quarter. Spend the afternoon relaxing and noticing what differentiates Vietnam from Thailand!

EXPLORE HANOI: Immerse yourself in the bustle of Hanoi with a walking and rickshaw tour of the capital as well as fuelling up on delicious street food. Tonight we’ll head out for dinners and drinks to experience Hanoi’s nightlife

SAPA TREKKING: This morning we’ll take a limousine bus to the rolling hills of Sapa. We’ll head off on a short trek up the Muong Hoa valley. Tonight we stay with a local family, learning about their way of life over dinner and a little rice wine.

VILLAGES & MOUNTAINS: Today we trek through terraced hills and discover local villages. A quick drive will take us back to Sapa in the afternoon, where we’ll check in to our beautiful mountain-side hotel and take in the serenity of our surroundings.
EXPLORE SAPA TOWN: Explore Sapa at your own pace, or take the cable car up to Fan Si Pan peak for incredible views. Tonight we’ll ride an overnight train back to Hanoi.

HA LONG BAY: We’ll head to the stunning natural wonder of Ha Long Bay and board our luxurious boat for the night. Known for its emerald waters, magical caves and limestone mountains covered in rainforest, we can kayak and sunbathe on deck.

TRAVEL TO NINH BINH: Today we head south to the beautiful countryside of Ninh Binh. This evening we’ll check in to our unique traditional homestay and watch the sunset whilst relaxing in our riverside bungalows.

EXPLORE NINH BINH: We’ll hop on bicycles to ride through rice paddies, then take a local rowboat through rivers and caves. This afternoon we’ll tackle the iconic Dragon Mountain viewpoint for jaw-dropping views over the rural landscape. We'll then board our surprisingly comfortable overnight train bound for Hoi An.

EXPLORE HOI AN: Hoi An is full of markets, colourful alleyways and lanterns lighting up the streets. Here you can wander the streets, sip a drink by the canal or get measured for custom clothes at a local tailor. Tonight we’ll go out for dinner and drinks to soak up the buzzing nightlife of the town.

BASKET FISHING & COOKING CLASS: Be guided by local fisherman through coconut groves and learn the art of crab fishing before a Vietnamese cooking class. The afternoon is free for you to relax by the pool, get a massage or try on your new tailored clothes.
BEACH DAY: This morning we’ll learn how to make lanterns. We’ll then enjoy a chilled day at a beach club before enjoying our final night in Vietnam together!

HO CHI MINH CITY: Enjoy the last bits of Hoi An before we catch our flight to Ho Chi Minh City. We’ll head straight out to the markets for dinner then up to a rooftop bar to treat ourselves to a drink.
LOCAL LIFE: Today we’ll explore the lush beauty of the Mekong Delta, learn how locals live on the river and check in to a traditional family-run homestay for the night.
CU CHI TUNNELS: Today we learn history at the Cu Chi tunnels. We’ll arrive back to Ho Chi Minh city this afternoon before heading out for our farewell dinner and drinks!
CHECK OUT: Your amazing 27-day adventure comes to an end. You can either check out and make your way home or continue your travels with help from your group leader.

tourName: Thailand and Vietnam tour, 4 weeks
generalInfo:
Experience two of the most spectacular countries in Asia on this mind-blowing 29 day combo tour!
Discover the absolute best of Thailand and Vietnam with all transport, activities and accommodation included. Plus, you’ll have an awesome group leader with you from the moment you step off the plane, an instant group of friends to share your adventure with and help with all your onward travel.

dayInfo.description: ARRIVE AND MEET THE GROUP: When you land in Bangkok after your long flight we’ll be at the airport to meet you and take you to the guesthouse. You’ll have plenty of time to recover from your flight, chill out and meet everyone in your group.

RIVER CRUISE AND TEMPLES: Discover Bangkok from a different perspective as we take a relaxing cruise through the heart of the city. We’ll then visit Bangkok’s most sacred and ancient temples and travel by tuk tuk through the crazy streets! At night we’ll head out and experience Bangkok’s nightlife!

THAI COOKING CLASS AND OVERNIGHT TRAIN: Learn the secrets to preparing delicious Thai cuisine first hand with a traditional Thai cooking class. Then you can sit back, relax and enjoy the sights of Thailand when we board the overnight train and travel down south.

KHAO SOK NATIONAL PARK: We’ll wind through limestone cliffs in a long-tail boat to a pristine freshwater lake and will stay overnight in floating bungalows. You’ll also go kayaking, tubing and monkey spotting!

ARRIVE IN KOH PHANGAN: Arrive on the beautiful island of Koh Phangan, home to the world famous Full Moon parties. Check into our amazing beach side bungalows, relax by the pool and enjoy your first island sunset and beach party!
TRADITIONAL THAI MASSAGE AND BEACH TIME: A day to unwind, relax and get some well-deserved beach time. We’ll also treat you to a traditional Thai massage.
ISLAND TRIP: Discover the beauty of the island as we travel to some of the beautiful beaches! Chill, soak up some sun and swim in crystal clear water. We’ll then kick back with a beach BBQ!

MUAY THAI OR YOGA EXPERIENCE: Today you have the choice of learning the art of Muay Thai boxing or bringing some peace and harmony into your action packed trip with a private Yoga class. We’ll then head out for our last night on Koh Phangan.

TRANSPORT AND ARRIVAL TO PHI PHI ISLANDS: You’ll leave Koh Phangan early morning and arrive in Phi Phi late afternoon on this day. You’ll then check into your guesthouse and head out for dinner, drinks and a beach party!

PHI PHI ISLANDS EXPERIENCE: Take off on an amazing boat trip around the stunning Phi Phi Leh. Snorkel, kayak, see an incredible underwater light show at night and enjoy a few drinks and dinner under the stars. It’s a truly unforgettable experience! *There is a possibility we may not be able to enter right into Maya Bay at certain times of year due to government closures.

PARADISE ISLANDS BOAT TRIP: Hike to Phi Phi’s iconic viewpoint in and then explore Phi Phi’s amazing Paradise Islands on an awesome private boat trip. Snorkel in crystal clear waters and then head out for dinner and to experience Phi Phi’s awesome nightlife.
CHILL OUT IN PHI PHI: This morning we'll take a ferry to Phuket, before having a chill afternoon and enjoying sunset dinner and drinks.

FLY TO CHIANG MAI: This morning we'll fly to Chiang Mai. Checking in to our accommodation, we’ll have time to explore the city, chill by the pool or do some shopping. Tonight we'll check out Chiang Mai's nightlife.

TEMPLES & WATERFALLS: Today is a full day trip exploring the culture and natural wonders of Chiang Mai. First up is the iconic Doi Suthep Temple followed by Thai style lunch before visiting the fascinating ‘sticky’ waterfalls
HILL TRIBE TREK: Trek through and stay overnight in the amazing jungle of Chiang Mai. Wander through beautiful rice paddy fields, see idyllic rivers and visit a local hill tribe
BAMBOO RAFTING: We continue our trek before bamboo rafting down the river! You’ll arrive back to your guesthouse to relax or check out more of Chiang Mai’s nightlife.

ELEPHANT SANCTUARY EXPERIENCE: Today we'll visit a sanctuary focused on protecting elephants rescued from hard lives. We’ll learn about their history and important connection to rural communities, and see them interact in their natural environment.
FLY TO HANOI: Your Vietnam group leader will meet at the Hanoi accommodation. You’ll have plenty of time to chill out with everyone in your group.

HANOI CITY TOUR: Discover what makes the chaotic capital of Vietnam so special with a walking and rickshaw tour of the city. Experience the bustling streets, fascinating culture and delicious street food. We’ll then head out for dinner and experience some of Hanoi’s best nightlife!

HALONG BAY: Experience the stunning natural wonder of Ha Long Bay, cruise on beautiful emerald green waters through towering limestone mountains topped with rainforest. Go kayaking through caves and enjoy some drinks aboard our overnight boat!

HALONG BAY AND NINH BINH HOME STAY: Today we head south to the beautiful countryside of Ninh Binh, a landscape of endless rice paddies and epic limestone mountains. Check in to our unique and amazing local homestay and watch the sunset whilst relaxing in our private riverside bungalows for the evening.

NINH BINH AND OVERNIGHT TRAIN: Today we explore magical Ninh Binh. We’ll take a bike ride through the rice paddies and then a local row boat along a network of rivers and caves. We’ll then tackle the iconic Dragon Mountain Viewpoint before boarding the overnight train south to Hoi An.

ARRIVE IN HOI AN: In the morning we’ll arrive in Hoi An, one of the most beautiful and fascinating towns in Vietnam. You’ll have some time in the afternoon to chill out, go shopping or even get some clothes made!

BASKET FISHING & COOKING CLASS: Be guided through coconut groves by local fishermen while you try your hand at some crab fishing! We’ll then learn the secrets of preparing delicious Vietnamese food with a traditional cooking class.
LANTERN MAKING CLASS AND BEACH DAY: This morning we'll learn how to make lanterns. We'll then enjoy a chilled day at a beach club. That evening we'll head out for dinner together.
FLY TO HO CHI MINH CITY: Today we catch a short flight to Ho Chi Minh City and arrive early afternoon. You’ll have the rest of the day to relax and explore the city.

MEKONG DELTA: We’ll explore the incredibly lush green beauty of the Mekong Delta, learn first-hand how the locals live, visit local villages and experience daily life on the Mekong. We then stay overnight in the Delta.

CU CHI TUNNELS: Today we discover the Cu Chi Tunnels, a fascinating network of underground tunnels used as supply routes, hideouts and living quarters during the Vietnam War. We’ll arrive back to Ho Chi Minh City in the afternoon before heading out for our farewell dinner and party!
CHECKOUT AND ONWARD TRAVEL: Your amazing 29 day adventure finishes today. We’ll help you plan and organise your onward travel.

tourName: Thailand beach holiday
placesVisited: Bangkok, sleeper train, Wat Pho, Kho Pitak, Chumphon, Ko Tao, Ko Samui
generalInfo:
This small group holiday to Thailand is all about islands and beaches - think bright blue sea, powder soft sand and simple beach bungalows. The pace is as laid-back as the surroundings on this trip, and you’ll be heading out to the country’s southern islands to chill out in the sun and sample the region’s famous cuisine.

After meeting your fellow travellers in Bangkok, and taking a tour of this exciting city, you’ll board an overnight train south to Langsuan. From here you’ll take a a ferry to the small island of Koh Pitak for a night in a village homestay, where you’ll be able to witness local life first hand and eat typical southern Thai food. Back on the mainland you’ll make your way to Chumphon, where you’ll stay at a guesthouse on Thung Wua Lan Beach. There’s time for relaxing on the beach as well as spending a full day snorkelling out on the local reefs.

Next, you’ll make for the beautiful island of Ko Tao, famed for its incredible coral reefs. There’s also a lively (but small) bar and club scene if you want to stay up late into the night. The island of Ko Samui is your final stop. Thailand's third largest island, it provides quite a contrast to your previous beachside stops, with vibrant nightlife, plush spas, Michelin starred restaurants and lively shopping districts all on offer. As well as enjoying the many attractions here, there’s the option to take a day trip to Ang Thong Marine National Park, a sublime archipelago made up of around 40 mostly uninhabited islands.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok.
dayInfo.description: Sa-wat dee! Welcome to Thailand. Your adventure begins in Thailand’s bustling capital, Bangkok with a welcome meeting at 6 pm tonight. Bangkok is famous for its tuk tuks, khlong boats and street vendors who serve delicious Thai food. If you arrive early, maybe visit the Grand Palace and the Temple of the Emerald Buddha, wander down the tourist mecca of Khao San Road or relax with in a Thai massage. After the meeting tonight, maybe gather your fellow travellers together and tuck into some world-famous street food.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok / Overnight train.
dayInfo.description: Start today with a visit to Wat Arun – the Temple of the Dawn. Named after the Indian God of Dawn, Aruna, this impressive landmark sits on the west bank of the Chao Phraya River. The rest of the afternoon is free for you to explore at your own pace. Maybe visit Wat Pho, home to the country's largest reclining Buddha, take a riverboat to Chinatown and wander its crowded streets or travel by longtail boat down the Chao Phraya River to explore Bangkok's famous 'khlongs' (canals). Tonight, you’ll board an overnight train southbound for Surat Thani.

dayInfo.title: Khao Sok National Park.
dayInfo.description: Arrive at Surat Thani in the morning, then travel by minivan to Khao Sok. Set amid hectares of thick jungle, waterfalls, limestone cliffs and an island-studded lake, the Khao Sok National Park is a nature lover's paradise. Here, you’ll hop in a traditional longtail boat for a calm sail to your accommodation on the water. Keep your eyes out for wild bull elephants, gibbons and spectacled langur (dusky leaf monkeys). Khao Sok National Park is the wettest spot in Thailand with some of the oldest jungles in the world. Your accommodation tonight will be in a traditional raft house, surrounded by turquoise waters of the lake in the front and one of the oldest jungles at the back.

dayInfo.title: Koh Tao.
dayInfo.description: This morning, you’ll wake up in the oldest evergreen rainforest in the world. Your raft house sits right inside the park, so you’ll have time this morning to catch the mist drifting along the lake as you search for wildlife in the jungle on a longtail boat. Before lunch, take a jungle hike around the park, and depending on the season, maybe see waterfalls or head up high to a panoramic viewpoint. If you're lucky, you might catch a glimpse of an elephant, hornbill or langur monkey. After, make your way to Koh Tao. Best known for its vibrant coral reefs, tis little island is popular with divers and those just looking for beautiful, palm-fringed beaches like Sairee. Soak up some free time to relax or maybe join a cooking class, visit a local spa or go swimming. Koh Tao also has a small but lively nightlife for those looking for a dance on the beach.

dayInfo.title: Ko Tao.
dayInfo.description: Today, you’ll discover the underwater world that surrounds Koh Tao with an exploratory snorkelling trip. With abundant coral and tropical fish, this is undeniably one of the jewels in southern Thailand – and you might even see a timid reef shark among the corals!. Sail south from Mae Haad Pier, navigating around the southern tip of the island until you reach Shark Island. Look out for the occasional leopard shark! Drop by Luek Bay for one of the best swimming beaches on the island, with fish-filled reefs on either side, then stop at Hin Wong Bay for lunch aboard the boat. Then, head to the privately-owned Nang Yuan Island and take a short hike up to a viewpoint, relax on the beach, snorkel through schools of parrotfish or chill out on the boat.

dayInfo.title: Koh Samui.
dayInfo.description: After breakfast, jump on another boat and cruise over to Koh Samui. Known simply as Samui by locals, this spot has beautiful white sandy beaches, coral reefs and coconut trees. In the afternoon, visit Khum Sa-ke Village – an organisation working to improve the eco-environment of the village. Walk along their birdwatching route and rice paddies and learn about their waste management and organic gardens. Wrap it all up with a hearty home-cooked dinner full of southern Thailand flavours and see how important coconuts are to this delicious cuisine.

dayInfo.title: Koh Samui.
dayInfo.description: It’s up to you what you’d like to do today! If you feel like getting active, maybe set off on a daytrip to Ang Thong Marine National Park – an archipelago of around 40 islands (many uninhabited). If you choose this option, you’ll sail around the steep limestone cliffs to an inland saltwater lagoon called Emerald Lake (Talay Nai), which is fed by an underground cave. If you prefer to stay on land today, maybe check out the Samui Elephant Sanctuary and see the gentle giants as they roam, socialise and bathe. Or simply relax on the beach with a good book.

dayInfo.title: Ko Samui.
dayInfo.description: As there are no further activities, your Thailand adventure comes to an end this morning. This doesn’t mean you have to go home! If you’d like to stay longer, just speak to your booking agent ahead of time.

tourName: Thailand beach & rainforest holiday
placesVisited: Bangkok, Phuket, Khao Sok National Park, Elephant Hills Camp, Cheow Larn Lake, Khao Lak, Optional snorkelling trips to the Similan and Surin islands
generalInfo:
This itinerary uncovers some of the more unusual and unseen parts of Thailand, getting you away from the established tourist trail. The trip makes the most of Thailand's diversity with time in the buzzing city of Bangkok, a national park and on one of the country's quieter beaches at a charming boutique hotel.

Exploring with experienced guides, you can discover some of Thailand's hidden spots with a city safari through Bangkok and trekking through the dramatic jungle and hills of Khao Sok National Park. Finish your trip by relaxing on the unspoilt beaches of Khao Lak where you can snorkel at the nearby Similan Islands, enjoy fresh and delicious seafood, or simply relax by the sea.

dayInfo.description: Fly from your home airport to Bangkok. Overnight on the aircraft.
Meet your guide at Bangkok Airport before being driven by private transfer to your boutique hotel which provides a peaceful oasis within the city.

Have a private guided tour of Bangkok today visiting the capital's key attractions: the Grand Palace, Wat Po, and Jim Thompson's house. Get used to Bangkok's different forms of public transport - the Skytrain, public taxi boa and of course the famous Thai tuk tuk.

An early start today for your private transfer to the airport to catch your internal flight to Phuket, a journey of around one and a half hours. Upon arrival at Phuket Airport you'll be met by staff from Elephant Hills to take you and other guests to the Khao Sok National Park. The Elephant Hills Camp is a fantastic rainforest and elephants experience. The welfare of the elephants is at the heart of this camp and it has received numerous awards for this. This is one of the few places where you can see elephants without chains, enjoying their natural habitat. Upon arrival at the camp, meet the elephants and learn more about these magnificent creatures. After a traditional Thai lunch, take a jungle canoe paddling past stunning limestone karsts with an experienced guide in a small group.

Today after you've had breakfast you will transfer to a local mangrove forest to cruise through the water on a traditional Burmese junk boat. You will also have the chance to canoe through the waterways. After lunch return to the main camp where you may enjoy a cooking demonstration or dance performance.

After breakfast you will head inland by road and then by boat for your scenic journey to the relatively untouched and stunning Cheow Larn Lake. This is a great place to be amongst nature with more than 100 islands and limestone mountains rising up from the shore. Bring your swimming costume if you would like to swim in the lake's warm waters. Lunch will be served at a floating raft house on the lake where you can relax and take in the stunning scenery before returning to your camp in the afternoon.

This morning you will have the option to join your guide and fellow guests on a walk through the jungle listening to the chorus of the many primates, reptiles and birds that inhabit the national park. After lunch, take a small group transfer to your beach accommodation where you can spend the remainder of your holiday relaxing by the sea.

Today is free to relax and enjoy your surroundings. In addition to the beach there is plenty to do on Khao Lak and your time can be as busy or as relaxed as you like. The nearby Similan Islands are one of the world's top dive sites and there are great snorkelling trips out to the Surin Islands which can be arranged from your hotel.

Day at leisure. You may like to consider a day trip to Pung Chang cave with its fascinating rock formations which is accessed via a bamboo raft or head out on a long-tail boat to visit the famous James Bond Island! These trips can be booked locally, or your specialist can pre-arrange a trip for you.
Your driver is on hand to collect you from the hotel for your private one and a half hour transfer to Phuket Airport in time for your onward flights home.

tourName: Thailand beach tour, West Coast
placesVisited: Bangkok, Sleeper train journey, Tour of Krabi beaches, Ao Nang, Ko Yao Noi, Phuket
generalInfo:
This Thailand beach tour is a nine day trip through peninsular paradise. Starting in busy Bangkok , where you have a day to explore its myriad highlights, be transported into another world by taking the sleeper train (yes they are air conditioned!) from the capital all the way south to Surat Thani. From here we head to the resort town of Ao Nang in the Krabi Province.

Krabi is the place to enjoy swimming, kayaking, climbing the limestone cliffs and scuba diving. We spread our wings further afield and spend two days on the island of Ko Yao Noi, just one example of the limestone islands sprinkled around Phang-Nga Bay. Snorkel, take a boat trip, swim and chill. And then have a massage on the beach. Another tough Thai day.

Our last few days are spent on Phuket, Thailand’s largest and most popular island. Although it is known for its party scene, Phuket has plenty of other aspects to it, which you will discover hiking to waterfalls, exploring Khao Phra Thaeo Wildlife Sanctuary or taking trips out to other nearby smaller islands. No matter where you go, this southern peninsula will never disappoint when it comes to palm lined, silver sand beaches. They are two a penny.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok.
dayInfo.description: Sa-wat dee! Welcome to Thailand. Your adventure begins in Bangkok, where world-class cuisine and lush landscapes only the beginning. You’ll have a welcome meeting at 6 pm tonight to meet your local leader and fellow travellers. If you arrive early, why not explore this city of tuk tuks and street food at your own pace. Maybe watch the traditional khlong boats winding down the Chao Phraya River or walk around and get to know the local spots. After your meeting, you might want to walk down Khao San Road, grab dinner and get to know each other.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok.
dayInfo.description: You’ll start today with a visit to Wat Arun – the Temple of the Dawn. Named after the Indian God of Dawn, Aruna, this impressive landmark of Bangkok sits on the west bank of the Chao Phraya River. The rest of the afternoon is free for your own exploration. Perhaps head next door to the Grand Palace and the Temple of the Emerald Buddha or visit Wat Pho – home to the country's largest reclining Buddha and keeper of the magic behind Thai massage. Maybe take a riverboat to Chinatown and explore the crowded streets, or travel by longtail boat down the Chao Phraya River to explore the famous khlongs (canals) of Bangkok. Life along these canals seems a world away from the chaotic streets of the capital. Tonight, board an overnight train southbound for Surat Thani.

dayInfo.title: Ao Nang/Krabi.
dayInfo.description: Arrive at Surat Thani this morning and continue by bus to the resort town of Ao Nang in the Krabi Province. Ao Nang has a main street with open-air restaurants, shops that light up the sidewalk and bars perfect for kicking back with a beer. You can also hop on a longtail boat to places like Railay Beach and the idyllic islands surrounding the bay. There's plenty of free time to relax on the beaches and get into the spirit of southern Thailand. You might like to take a cycling trip through back country tracks, getting to know local culture and taking an afternoon dip in a waterfall. Treat yourself to a relaxing massage on the beach or just sit back with a good book. In the late afternoon, visit Baan Na Teen village to take part in Batik Making. Learn about this ancient technique of dyeing, then join a local family for some home-cooking.

dayInfo.title: Ao Nang/Krabi.
dayInfo.description: This morning, head out to Ao Nang beach and board a private longtail boat to start today’s exploration. As you sail, take in the beauty of the coastline, stopping at Phra Nang Cave, Railey Beach, Koh Tup and Koh Gai along the way. See the coral and tropical fish in the crystal clear waters below on snorkelling excursions and enjoy a half day of swimming and sailing. Tonight, why not grab some of your fellow travellers and stroll down the main drag to find a seafood restaurant.

dayInfo.title: Khao Lak.
dayInfo.description: Say goodbye to Ao Nang this morning and continue your journey to Khao Lak. On the way, stop at the community-based tourism initiative of Baan Nai Nang village (supported by Mangrove Action Project) where you’ll spend the better half of the day. Soak up the amazing nature and learning about local culture. Then, get active and venture out in a kayak to explore the water, limestone cliffs and mangrove forests at Khao Ka Rot. Return to the village and learn to prepare the organic local mulberry leaf tea, sitting down with your hosts for a home-cooked lunch. Head out for a walk through the village’s organic fruit orchards before hopping back on your bus to Khao Lak.

dayInfo.title: Khao Lak.
dayInfo.description: Enjoy a free day to explore Khao Lak at your own pace. Maybe visit Lam Ru National Park, known for its nature trails, secluded beaches and Ton Chong Fa Waterfall. Or take a daytrip to the Similan Islands or the Surin Islands, soaking up the gorgeous natural landscapes. Your local leader will be on hand with suggestions and to help you out with logistics.

dayInfo.title: Phuket.
dayInfo.description: This morning, you’ll leave the natural paradise for Phuket – Thailand’s largest and most visited island. When you arrive, you might like to stop at the Tsunami Memorial. Then, continue to the Royal Thai Navy Sea Turtle Conservation Center, which supports the protection of turtles, focusing on marine biodiversity. Learn about the important work that they do here and see the different type of turtles at the foundation. Later, continue to Patong Beach, where you’ll stay in the heart of it all near local shops, restaurants and nightclubs awaits.

dayInfo.title: Phuket.
dayInfo.description: Phuket is ringed with beaches and you can find everything from a party vibe to something a little quieter. If you can pull yourself away from the curving coasts, Phuket also has a range of activities to fill your day, from Thai boxing exhibitions to cabaret shows. If you love getting out on the water and exploring the islands, then perhaps use your last day to take a daytrip to the Phi Phi Islands and Khai Nok – a tiny island surrounded by white sandy beach, perfect for swimming and snorkelling. If you want to spend some time with Thailand’s elephants, maybe visit the Phuket Elephant Sanctuary. Here, you can see the elephants in the safety and security of their natural home and get an insight into the behaviour and personal history of each elephant. Tonight, maybe get together with your fellow travellers for dinner and toast to a trip well travelled.

dayInfo.title: Phuket.
dayInfo.description: There are no activities planned for the final day, and you can depart the accommodation at any time. That doesn’t mean your adventure has to end! If you’d like to continue to soak up the very best of Phuket, just get in touch with your booking agent ahead of time.

tourName: Thailand, central & south 15 day tour
generalInfo:
Embark on a 15-day journey through the heart of Thailand, blending rich culture, breathtaking beaches, and lush natural landscapes. Your adventure begins in the bustling city of Bangkok, where a warm welcome awaits, followed by a relaxed day to soak in the vibrant atmosphere.

The next stop is Kanchanaburi, where you'll experience a scenic train ride along one of Southeast Asia’s historic railways, winding through picturesque riverside views. Cruise along the River Kwai on a traditional long-tailed boat to admire the iconic bridge and explore the area’s fascinating history, including a visit to local war memorial sites.

From Kanchanaburi, travel to the lively Damnoen Saduak Floating Market in Ratchaburi, where colorful boats brimming with fresh produce and snacks provide a feast for the senses. Pedal your way to the charming Amphawa floating market, with the option of a magical evening boat ride to witness fireflies lighting up the riverside trees like twinkling stars.

Continuing south, relax in Hua Hin, known for its sandy beaches and vibrant seafood scene. Visit the serene Klai Kangwon Palace, the summer retreat of the Thai royal family, and enjoy free time to unwind by the sea. Further down the coast, Prachuap Khiri Khan welcomes you with its beautiful bays and the striking views from Khao Chong Krachok, home to a hilltop monastery and playful monkeys. Your day concludes in peaceful Bang Saphan, where a beachside barbecue awaits.

Your adventure continues with island hopping, starting in Koh Tao, a diver’s paradise with crystal-clear waters and vibrant coral reefs. Enjoy the day at your own pace or take a short boat trip to the stunning sandbars of Koh Nang Yuan. From Koh Tao, sail to Koh Pha Ngan, a lush island famed for its pristine beaches and laid-back atmosphere. Spend the day exploring or simply relaxing on the sands, surrounded by breathtaking scenery.

On Koh Samui, marvel at the island’s cultural landmarks, including the Big Buddha and Wat Plai Laem, or stroll along palm-fringed shores. Then, journey inland to the lush wilderness of Khao Sok National Park, where you’ll discover the serenity of Cheow Lan Lake. Cruise past limestone cliffs and take in the surreal beauty of this pristine landscape, with opportunities to swim and canoe in the tranquil waters.

From Khao Sok, make your way to Khao Lak and on to the stunning shores of Ao Nang in Krabi. Here, dramatic limestone cliffs meet azure seas, offering a day of pure relaxation. Conclude your Thai adventure in Phuket, with its golden beaches and vibrant island life, before departing for home, taking with you unforgettable memories of this captivating land.

This thoughtfully designed itinerary combines adventure and leisure, allowing you to explore Thailand’s diverse landscapes and vibrant culture at a relaxed and enjoyable pace.

This is a suggested itinerary and can be shortened or expanded in any way to suit your travel needs.

dayInfo.description: Bangkok arrival On arrival Suvanabhumi airport in Bangkok, your guide will welcome and take you to your hotel. The rest of the day will be free on leisure. You’ll spend the night in Bangkok.

Bangkok/ Kanchanaburi Have breakfast at the hotel before departure for Kanchanaburi for more than 2hours by road, we arrive at Wang Pho. We will take 30 minutes train to enjoy the beautiful view from train along the river. This is one of Southeast Asia's historic railways, the remaining part of the "Death Railway", departing from the provincial capital to the Railway Station from Namtok. After that we will take a long-tailed boat ride on the River Kwai to the bridge where we will take the photo, visit the old nice bridge. Kwai River Bridge: known to the world through several films and books, it is still used today. Main attraction, the river is dotted with restaurants, souvenir shops and jewellery stores. A steam locomotive from the era of the Second World War and an astonishing hybrid car / wagon vehicle from the same period are part of a small Railway Museum on the edge of the bridge. After that we will visit the World War II memorial including the Jeath War Museum, Cemetery. Your accommodation will be in Kanchanaburi.

Kanchanaburi – Ratchaburi – Samut Songkhram Today we will transfer by private mini-van to Ratchaburi. Visit the floating market of Damnoen Saduak. Discover the scenery and colours of the markets in a teeming atmosphere. The Damnoen Saduak Market is renowned for keeping all its authenticity and remains today one of Thailand's most famous floating markets. This small village is a must-see of the Kingdom. These floating markets, the largest of which is Ton Kem, will take you on the canoe and will make you discover delicious fresh products. Some women can even cook them under your eyes. Our visit continues to Samut Songkhram. Afternoon, bike ride to reach the floating market of Amphawa: it is different from other floating markets thanks to its canoes that are moored to the banks of the canal. You will take a canoe to discover attractions such as the old chapel of a temple. You will continue biking at 16h toward where we stay. At Samut Songkhram, you will have the opportunity to take an evening boat ride on the Maeklong River (optional) to admire thousands of fireflies that populate and illuminate trees such as Christmas trees. Stay overnight in Samut Songkhram. Amphawa market opening days : Friday-Sunday Opening hours : 2.00-8.00 p.m.

Samut Songkhram – Hua Hin After breakfast we transfer to Hua Hin which is well known for its traditional fishing port, seafood restaurants and beautiful sandy beach which stretches for three kilometres. Hua Hin is known for being one of best places to spend a beach holiday. The royal family also resides there for part of the year. It is ideal for families and for all those who want to escape the hustle and bustle of big cities. You will get chance to the visit of Klai Kangwon Palace. Composed of three Spanish-style villas, facing the sea, this summer palace was built in 1926 north of Hua Hin by King Rama VI. Rest of time is for free. Stay overnight at a hotel in Hua Hin.

Hua Hin - Prachuap Khiri Khan – Bang Saphan Breakfast and departure for Prachuap Khiri Khan which is a fishing port located in the heart of an exceptional bay. Beautiful beaches are nearby. Visit the Khao Chong Krachok (the Mount of Mirror): you will see a venerated monastery at the top of Mountain. 395 steps to a small pagoda populated by many monkey players. You will then go to Ao Manao (Bay of Lemon). Famous for its calm, this beach is the most pleasant to relax and swimming. The calm of this place is replaced by many animations on weekends. There is also a place where you will find a monkey monument, which is very cute. Afternoon transfer to Bang Saphan. Paradise for nature lovers and tranquility, Bang Saphan develops at its own pace. Its main attraction is the large sandy beach lined with coconut palms and bungalows. The afternoon is free. We suggest you visit the local market in the city and participate in a typical barbecue on the beach in the evening. Stay overnight at a hotel in Bang Saphan.

Bang Saphan – Chumphon – Bateau – Koh Tao Breakfast and transfer to Chumphon we you will board a join boat trip from Chumphon to Koh Tao. Koh Tao is an island in the Gulf of Thailand about 70 kilometers from the coast. His name means "Turtle Island". This island is a Royal property. Koh Tao is a world famous scuba diving spot. Thanks to its clear waters, its many diving schools attract tourists from all over the world. Lunch and the rest of time would be free at your own. You might consider our below optional tour Option: You can travel by boat from Koh Tao to Koh Nang Yuan Island. Koh Nang Yuan consists of three small islands connected by a sandbar, offering an endless stretch of white sand and fabulous coral. Stay overnight at a hotel in Koh Tao. Boat trip: Chumporn-KohTao- Departure time from Chumporn 7:00 hrs. & 13:00 hrs.

Koh Tao – Bateau – Koh Pha Ngan Breakfast and transfer to the port and boarding boat trip from Koh Tao to Koh Pha Ngan. Koh Pha Ngan or Koh Phangan is another island in the Gulf of Thailand in the south-east of the country just north of Ko Samui. It belongs to the province of Surat Thani. The most convenient way to get around is the scooter especially if you want to visit the less touristic corners of the island. This island is a destination mainly known for its beaches, and to host the "Full Moon Party" party celebrating a musical mix that takes place on the beach of Haad Rin, southeast of the island. Lunch and the rest of time would be free at your own. Overnight in Koh Pha Ngan. High Speed Ferry: Koh Tao – Koh Phangan. Estimate time 09.30 – 11.30

Koh Pha Ngan free day The day will be free on own to do anything you wish. Koh Phangan, a beautiful Thai island where you can go on an adventure trip and have fun. You can try scuba diving or snorkeling, go canoeing, take boat trips to Ang Thong National Marine Park, watch Thai boxing match, go fishing, yoga, archery, guided tours, elephant rides and enjoy the beauty of the landscapes. a) Scuba diving: Koh Phangan, excellent site for scuba diving or snorkeling, whether for beginners or more experienced. You will have the possibility to make excursions, of variable durations, by boat to discover the aquatic life. Sailrock is certainly the most famous dive site on the island, or even the Gulf of Thailand. b) Hiking: possibility to do it all around Koh Phangan Island. Many backpackers enjoy hiking on the trails between Haad Rin and Haad Tien beaches. You will be able to take full advantage of the landscapes, the beaches and the jungle on the island. c) By boat to Bottle Beach: Located in the north of Koh Phangan, Bottle Beach is accessible by boat and very calm and relaxing beach. The beach is spacious, the white sand is very fine, and the water is very clean, ideal for swimming. Overnight at a hotel in Ko Pha Ngan.

Koh Pha Ngan – Koh Samui free Breakfast and transfer to the pier where you board a boat trip from Koh Pha Ngan to Koh Samui. Located in the Gulf of Thailand, Koh Samui is the third largest island of Thailand. You will enjoy its beautiful beaches, tropical trees, exotic fish and resplendent corals. Monkey Theater: here the monkey has been used for centuries to harvest coconuts from trees. You can admire shows of monkeys but also elephants. East of Bophut on a small island connected by a dirt road, there is the Big Buddha which is a golden statue of Buddha 12 meters high, sitting at the top of a staircase richly decorated with dragons. At the Northeast tip of the island not far from the Big Buddha, It is Chinese Buddhist temple of Wat Plai Laem, especially recognizable by its huge statue of Guanyin (Guanyin, with 18 arms, the goddess of Mercy and Compassion). Overnight in Koh Samui. Speedboat: Koh Phangan – Koh Samui Estimate time 11:00 – 11.30

Koh Samui – Don Sak – Surat Thani – Khao Sok Breakfast and transfer to the pier where you will take a ferry trip from Ko Samui to Don Sak. Transfer by vehicle from Don Sak to Khao Sok National Park. Lunch by your own. The rest of the day will be free on own to troll around the Khao Sok Treehouse area. Khao Sok National Park is located in southern Thailand. Well known for its dense vegetation and limestone hills, the park is very impressive. You will be seduced by its thriving jungle, its lake and its animal species, among which you will be able to see tigers, leopards, elephants or small Malay bears. Speedboat: Koh Samui - Donsak Estimate time 08.30 – 09.30

Cheow Lan Lake Khao Sok Full Day Tour (join-in) – Khao Lak Chiew Larn Lake, located 65km from the entrance of the park, is the real jewel of Khao Sok National Park and our favorite. It is therefore impossible to come to Khao Sok without taking a boat trip on Lake Chiew Larn. This vast expanse of water forms an amazing lacustrine landscape from which emerge limestone rocks and ghostly tree tops engulfed by water. At dawn, the landscape emerging from the fog takes on mysterious airs. At dusk, the shadows of limestone pinnacles evoke a fantastic movie set. Stay overnight at a hotel in Khao Sok National Park. 08:30 Meet in the reception area of Our Jungle Camp Eco Resort or get picked up in or around Khao Sok Town. 09:30 Arrive at Rachabrapa Dam, check in with the National Park and board your boat. 10:00 – 12:30 Explore the lake by local long-tail boat, taking in the majestic scenery of striking white lime stone cliffs, surrounded by emerald green waters. Stop by at the famous 3 Rock landmark, the Guilin of Thailand before proceeding for a short hike to a cave after which you continue onwards to the floating restaurant. 12:30 – 13:30 Lunch break at a Raft House, enjoy a 3 dish Thai set lunch amongst the stunning scenery. 13:30 – 16:00 Enjoy the afternoon at leisure, with some time for swimming and canoeing around the beautiful scenery of Cheow Lan Lake. Finally transfer from Khao Sok to Khao Lak with driver only. Overnight in in Khao Lak.
Khao Sok – Krabi - Ao Nang Breakfast departure from Khao Lak to Krabi without guide. Stay overnight at Ao Nang in Krabi.
Krabi free day The day will be free on own to relax or whatever takes tour fancy.
Krabi to Phuket (3 hours’ drive) Breakfast and departure from Ao Nang to Phuket. Stay overnight at a hotel in Phuket.
Phuket departure The day will be free until be driven to the airport for your homeward flight.

tourName: Thailand countryside tour, rivers & reef by train
generalInfo:
Explore Thailand focusing on the countryside of the north and central regions. This trip covers a contrasting mix of must-see historical sights, interaction with local communities, exploring jungles, and discovering some hidden and less visited beaches.

Making the most of the train network where possible makes the holiday feel less frantic, allowing time to relax and soak up the countryside as you roll through different provinces on your way to your next destination. It's also a fun and comfortable way to travel.

Highlights include:

A scenic train journey through the northern hills to the small town of Phrae, where you’ll visit Phrae Muang Pi Forest Park

A behind-the-scenes tour of Bangkok’s most interesting backstreets, including a cooking class in a hidden garden restaurant.

Relaxing on the jungle island of Koh Kood, close to the Cambodian border

And much more, including some gorgeous hotels, an ethical elephant sanctuary, Chiang Mai and Kanchanaburi.

This is a bespoke holiday suggestion and we can change this holiday to suit your budget, style and expectations

dayInfo.description: Depart the UK on your flight to Chiang Mai

Chiang Mai: Your Thailand adventure will begin with a tour of some of Chiang Mai’s most interesting temples. Your guide will explain the history and significance as you admire the intricate decorations and ancient Buddhist imagery as the local people go about their daily prayers. Getting between the temples will give you a feel for the city’s atmosphere and layout, ensuring you feel comfortable and connected. You’ll take an excursion out of the city and into the hills that surround it to visit ChangChill an ethical elephant sanctuary and meet some of its resident elephants, as well as the people who take care of them. Elephants sometimes have a tough time in Thailand, often being used as work animals or for entertainment, but the tide is shifting, and there are many sanctuaries like this one which rescue the animals and give them a safe and natural environment. During this strictly hands-off experience, you’ll learn about the animals’ individual personalities and their complex social structures.

Chiang Mai to Phrae By Day Train: Depart Chiang Mai and take the train southbound into the province of Phrae to experience an off-the-beaten-track region of Thailand. Check in to your traditional Thai house accommodation and get to know your hosts for the next couple of days over a home-cooked dinner. It’s time to explore Phrae on Day 6. You’ll visit the morning market and the local village of Ban Nun for an insight into daily life in rural Thailand. Observe the art of rice farming and, if you’re lucky, witness a spiritual Bai Sri ceremony. The next day you’ll explore the unique terrain of Phrae Muang Pi Forest Park and learn how the natural erosion of sandstone has created a mysterious landscape and the local folklore surrounding the area. You’ll also visit the local Moh Hom (Thai denim) handicraft village and see how this traditional craft is still practiced and its effect on the local economy and community. In the afternoon, you’ll board the 6-hour day train to Bangkok; the journey offers time to rest and reflect on your Northern Thailand experiences as you snake south through the central provinces.

Bangkok: Today take a guided tour walking tour through a maze of side streets and shophouses before boarding a tuk-tuk to explore some of Bangkok’s ancient temples and bustling markets. Cross the river to experience the charm of Kudijeen, a small Portuguese area with a quaint Catholic church and centuries-old teak houses. From here, you’ll take a boat down small canals to a hidden restaurant where you’ll be served lunch from their own organic garden before trying your hand at making delicious Thai desserts.

Kanchanaburi by Train: After exploring the city it’s back to the countryside with a leisurely train journey to Kanchanaburi province, east of Bangkok. Once you’ve arrived, you’ll visit the Thailand-Burma Railway Centre and the Hellfire Pass Interpretive Centre, where you’ll learn about the area’s history and significance during World War 2 and be able to walk the old tracks, now a short, scenic trek. At the end of an interesting and informative day, you’ll take a longtail boat up the River Kwai to check into your luxury floating bungalow. After waking up to the sound of the river flowing past your door, the adventure will continue with a walk to Sai Yok Waterfall, a visit to a traditional village and an exploration of the Lawa Caves.
Bangkok: Return to Bangkok by train in the afternoon and have a day to yourself exploring the city

Koh Kood: Today, you’ll be picked up for the drive down to the island of Koh Kood, close to the Cambodian border, to check in to your beachfront resort. Use your final couple of days to relax on the beaches of this beautiful jungle island. Koh Kood has a more adventurous feel than some of the more popular Thai islands, and there’s plenty to explore, from hidden away beaches to off-road adventures to serene snorkelling trips. During your stay, we can arrange a Scuba diving course or an immersive full-day experience learning about and participating in coral propagation and planting in the area – a great way to learn about and help protect the fragile reef ecosystems.
Fly back to the UK: Depart Koh Kood today for your journey back to the UK.

tourName: Thailand cultural holiday
generalInfo:
Fly in to Bangkok to begin your adventure through Thailand, your first day on arrival will be at leisure to relax after your long-haul flights.

Venture out in to the bustle of the city today with your guide to enjoy a food tour, sampling the famous street-food delicacies of Bangkok from stalls, markets and small shops. This evening you may like to visit Asiatique night market, a busy and vibrant entertainment area on the river, packed with market stalls, restaurants, and live entertainment.

Today explore the highlights of the city such as Wat Po and the Grand Palace, using a selection of public transport options; this is both a great introduction to the city and the country, and a chance to ask questions, as well as a good way to get to know the best ways to travel around the city. As the traffic is very busy in Bangkok, using the public river boats, the BTS sky train and tuk tuks locally are much more time and cost effective, as well as more eco-friendly.

After the busy centre of Bangkok, today enjoy some time in the surrounding countryside as you visit Bangkok's most unique markets. Whilst Damnoen Saduak is the most famous of Bangkok's floating markets, unfortunately it has now become very touristic and busy, losing much of its original charm.
Because of this, instead you will visit Tha Kha floating market for the Authentic Thai Floating market experience and to see the locals selling their wares in this lively and visually exciting adventure. Overnight you will stay out in Amphawa, offering a chance to stroll around it’s canal walkways in the evening.

Travel down from Bangkok today to Kui Buri National Park. Upon arrival into Kui Buri you will enjoy a lunch and learn more about local village life in Thailand. Drop off your bags and freshen up before continuing to the National Park in a 4x4 open-air truck. Spend the afternoon in Kui Buri National Park with a local guide who will point out wildlife on the drive and search for herds of wild elephants. For dinner you will join a local farming family under the stars and stay overnight in a charming homestay.

This morning is an early start to enjoy sunrise from the rangers station, before enjoying a local tour to the village temple and a chance to meet some of the locals and learn about the community. After lunch you will transfer on to Kanchanaburi and the famous River Kwai.

After seeing wild elephants in Kui Buri, today you will have a chance to support their conservation and get a little closer to a small herd of rescue elephants at Elephants World - a sanctuary for sick, old and rescued elephants. Sure to be one of the most memorable days of your trip, this educational day offers the chance to meet these gentle giants as they go about their day.

The Kanchanaburi region is best known internationally from its history in the 1940s, when thousands of allied prisoners of war lost their lives building the Thai-Burma railway under Japanese occupation. You have some flexibility today with what you are most interested to do and see in the region to learn about the atrocious conditions and the tough work that these soldiers endured; you may want to visit the JEATH museum, Thai-Burma railway centre, or the interactive Hellfire pass museum – you will be able to discuss this with your guide.
