You may like to take a train across the infamous Bridge Over the River Kwai itself, as well as the Tha Kilen viaduct; the bridge was bombed in 1945 after just 22 months of use but has been rebuilt for use by tourists and trains since.

Departing Kanchanaburi, you will transfer on to Koh Samet by private car and boat to enjoy a few days of luxurious relaxation on this gorgeous national park island, located conveniently just 3 hours from Bangkok for your return flights home.

dayInfo.description: Today you begin your journey by boarding your international outbound flight to Bangkok.
On arrival at Bangkok Airport you will be met by your guide and transferred to your boutique hotel located in a peaceful area of Bangkok's bustling city.

Thailand is a country renowned for its food. This morning you will have the perfect introduction with a guided food tour of Bangkok's street vendors, small shops and markets. You will have the chance to try some of Thailand's famous dishes, experience the different tastes and flavours and learn some words that may help you for the rest your holiday e.g. not spicy!

Today you will have a private guided tour of Bangkok visiting the capital's key attractions such as the Grand Palace and Wat Po (home to the reclining Buddha). You will use Bangkok's different forms of public transport - the Skytrain which winds its way through the skyscrapers and shopping malls, the public taxi boat, a long-tail boat and of course the infamous Thai tuk tuk. This is a fun excursion which gives you a fantastic insight into the capital as well as the people that call Bangkok home. Your afternoon will be at leisure to continue exploring Bangkok by yourself. In the evening you may like to visit one of Bangkok's rooftop bars for sunset.

The countryside around Bangkok is home to a number of fascinating markets. With your guide you will visit the famous railway market approximately 1 hour from Bangkok where vendors sell their produce and goods alongside a working railway-line. You will then continue onto the area's most authentic floating market where locals continue to arrive by boat to sell their fresh produce. You will stay overnight nearby at the small town of Amphawa with its popular canal walkways.

This morning you will be transferred to the Kui Buri National Park. This is arguably the best place to see Thailand's national animal, the elephant, in the wild. Joining a local ranger you will have a jeep tour in the National Park to spot these magnificent creatures. In the evening you will have dinner with a local farming family to give you a fascinating insight into the conflict between the wild elephants and the local community.

This morning you will enjoy sunrise over the park at one of the ranger stations before going on a guided tour of the local community to gain an insight into the lives of the local families. Alternatively you could join an early morning trek within the National Park for further wildlife-spotting opportunities. After lunch you will transfer to the town of Kanchanaburi for your stay by the famous River Kwai.

After seeing elephants in the wild you will now have the chance to learn more about these creatures and get up close to them with a day visit to Elephants World - a sanctuary for sick, old and rescued elephants. In addition to preparing food for the elephants you will help to feed them, an experience you are unlikely to forget!

The Kanchanaburi area is renowned for its time during the 2nd World War when Allied POWs were used by the Japanese to build the Burma-Thailand Railway. Today you will gain an insight into this history with a private guided tour of the main points of interest: the Thailand-Burma Railway Centre, the infamous Bridge on the River Kwai and Hell Fire Pass. The tour includes a scenic boat journey up the River Kwai and a train journey on the infamous Death Railway.
Today you will be transferred by car and speed-boat to the tropical island of Koh Samet to spend your last 3 nights enjoying the island's sandy beaches and crystal clear waters.
Day at leisure to relax or enjoy one of the activities on offer in the area. The bays and waters around Koh Samet are renowned for its snorkelling and diving.
Day at leisure to relax by the hotel's infinity pool or take a boat out for some deep-sea fishing or to end your trip in Thailand with a sunset cruise along the picturesque coastline.

This morning a private speedboat will transfer you back to the mainland where a car will be waiting to take you to Bangkok Airport for your onward flight home. Your return flight will arrive the same day.

tourName: Thailand cultural tour
generalInfo:
This fast-paced 16 day trip takes you on an immersive and adventurous cultural journey through Thailand. Throughout your trip you will learn of the cultural differences to be found from the center of Thailand to the rural North or laid-back south - all with a focus on community based projects and low-emission experiences.

In Bangkok after discovering the famous highlights of this exciting city, you will slow the pace to explore the historical Klongs - or canals- by kayak, witnessing a quieter, more traditional, side of Bangkok where the locals go about their daily lives away from the tourist center of the city.

Spend the night rushing past lush countryside as you travel by sleeper train up to Chiang Mai - fondly known as the cultural heart of Thailand. Here you will explore forgotten cities and tea plantations, taking in the sights by traditional long-tail boat and rickshaw, as well as a blessing from the monks at the impressive Doi Suthep.

Travel over to Chiang Rai at a leisurely pace, stopping at local markets for fresh fruit and snacks and enjoying the famous Northern countryside. In Chiang Rai a once-in-a-lifetime experience awaits as you visit a small ethical elephant sanctuary, dedicated to rewilding rescued logging elephants. Your day here will be as low impact for the elephants as possible, focusing mostly on observation and education, with the chance to feed them a treat by hand at the end of your visit.

Following this, you will travel in to the remote countryside outside of the city, to a community based initiative stay at Lanjia Lodge. Here you will learn of the traditions and daily life of the Hmong and Lahu people, as well as having the chance to plant trees with the Herbal Plant Nursery Project. The rest of your time here is spent trekking through the stunning scenery, visiting waterfalls and even the chance to meet a local shaman or watch a traditional performance.

Your last few days are spent among the iconic limestone karsts of Khao Sok National Park with your private guide. Sleep in floating accommodation on Cheow Larn lake, visit the local communities and organic farms and explore impressive cave systems before flying home from Phuket or Krabi.

dayInfo.description: Today you begin your journey by boarding your international outbound flight to Bangkok.
Upon arrival into Bangkok you will be transferred to your hotel, where you have the evening at leisure.

Have a private guided tour of Bangkok today visiting the capital's key attractions: the Grand Palace, Wat Po (home to the reclining Buddha) and Jim Thompson's house. Get used to Bangkok's different forms of public transport; the Skytrain which winds its way through the skyscrapers and shopping malls, the public taxi boat, a long-tail boat and of course the ubiquitous Thai tuk. This is a fun excursion which gives you a fantastic insight into the capital, without contributing to Bangkok's already heavy traffic.

A trip along the Chao Praya river is a must for any visitor to Bangkok. A great way to do it without adding to the noise pollution of the many long-tail boats, is to kayak along a quieter section of the channel. As well as reducing emissions, it has the added benefit of allowing you to see a different side of Bangkok as river life is key to those in the city. Later this afternoon, transfer to Bangkok's train station in time for your overnight sleeper train to Chiang Mai in the north of the country.

On arrival into Chiang Mai, your private guide will meet you from the train and transfer you to your hotel, where you have a few hours to relax and freshen up. Later this afternoon, head out of the city and up to Wat Pratat Doi Suthep, where you can experience a monk blessing and enjoy stunning views over the surrounding countryside.

Explore the highlights of Chiang Mai today using a mixture of local public transport. Take a long-tail boat down the Ping river, enjoy a rickshaw ride through the city, and cycle around the old forgotten city of Wiang Kum Kam.

Today you will have chance to discover the tea and coffee plantations of northern Thailand, with a visit to Mae Kampong, just outside of Chiang Mai. Enjoy a delicious local lunch and a traditional Thai massage before returning to the city late this afternoon.

Your guide will meet you after breakfast, and you will make the drive from Chiang Mai to Chiang Rai. This takes between 4-5 hours with stops along the way, including a chance to taste the delicious pineapple along the road. Arrive into Chiang Rai this afternoon, and relax at your hotel, perhaps heading into town for dinner.

Elephant Valley is a fantastic sanctuary in Chiang Rai, and today you will have chance to visit. Enjoy your time with the elephants, learning about the amazing work that the sanctuary does in terms of elephant care and conservation of the species, as well as exploring the surrounding countryside by bike.

From Chiang Rai head to the delightful community-based initiative of Lanjia Lodge to spend time with the Hmong and Lahu people, learning about their culture and traditions. There is also chance to plant trees at the Herbal Plant Nursery Project — an initiative set up to improve the quality of life of local people by teaching them how to grow vegetables and about the importance of the ecosystem in their village. This evening you will have dinner at the lodge and watch traditional Hmong performances. All your meals are included at the lodge.

Spend the day exploring the local villages around the lodge today. You have chance to trek to a local waterfall, visit the house of a local shaman and to enjoy the stunning scenery around the lodge with your private guide.

After breakfast, bid farewell to your hosts and transfer back to Chiang Rai in time for your flight down to Phuket. Transfer around two hours along the coast to Khao Lak, where you have the evening at leisure.

Transfer around an hour to the Khao Sok National Park today with your private guide, and head to the village of Khao Pang. Enjoy a tour around the village's organic farm and a delicious local lunch, before moving onto the next village. Enjoy a fantastic canoeing trip through the mangroves before transferring to your hotel for the evening, where dinner is included.

After breakfast, head towards Ratchaprapa Dam on the edge of the Cheow Larn lake. Enjoy a boat ride through the striking limestone karsts, before arriving at your floating camp — home for the night. All your meals are included here.

Have an early breakfast this morning at your accommodation to start your day’s activity before the majority of other visitors arrive on the lake. Embark on a long-tail boat with your guide, spotting wildlife as you head towards the Coral Cave. Explore the cave, before returning to the mainland, where your transfer will be waiting for your onwards journey.
Arrive home today to complete your journey.

tourName: Thailand family 11 day tour
generalInfo:
Whether your family is craving the energy of a lively city, the serenity of lush jungles, or the beauty of crystal-clear beaches, Thailand offers the perfect mix for an unforgettable group adventure.

Start your journey in bustling Bangkok, where you’ll dive into colourful markets and zip through the city streets. Then, slow the pace as you head to the tranquil countryside of Kanchanaburi. In Chiang Mai, connect with local culture and wildlife before wrapping up your adventure in sun-soaked Phuket—complete with speedboat trips to explore dreamy paradise islands.

What's Included
All transport during your tour, including an overnight train and a flight to Phuket. (Excludes airport transfers)
Tuk-tuk tour & welcome dinner (Bangkok)
Erawan Waterfall + National Park visit (Kanchanaburi)
Visit to Ayutthaya UNESCO World Heritage site (Kanchanaburi)
Homestay experience + painting workshop (Chiang Mai)
Ethical elephant sanctuary visit (Chiang Mai)
Wat Doi Suthep visit & monk chat (Chiang Mai)
Phi Phi Islands speedboat day tour (Phuket)

dayInfo.description: Bangkok: Welcome to Bangkok – the thrilling gateway to your Thailand family group adventure! After touching down in the vibrant capital, you’ll check into your accommodation and have some time to unwind before meeting your fellow travellers and Adventure Leader in the late afternoon. During the welcome briefing, you’ll get the lowdown on the next 11 days, helpful tips for adjusting to Thai culture, and essential advice to keep everyone safe while exploring. Then it’s time to dive into the action! We’ll kick things off with a fun-filled tuk-tuk tour through Bangkok’s lively streets, giving you a taste of the city’s energy and a glimpse of its iconic sights. To round off your first evening, we’ll enjoy a welcome dinner—perfect for getting to know the other families on the tour as the adventure begins.

Bangkok: Today is your first full day in Bangkok – and how you spend it is totally up to you! You’ve got several fantastic options to choose from: Market Marvels: Join a day tour to two of Bangkok’s most fascinating markets. First, see the famous Maeklong Railway Market, where vendors quickly pack up their stalls as trains roll right through the middle! Then, hop aboard a traditional long-tail boat to reach the floating Damnoen Saduak Market. You’ll cruise through canals, shop for fresh produce, and get insider tips on Thai market culture from your guide. Hop-On, Hop-Off River Adventure: Cruise the Chao Phraya River on a sightseeing boat with unlimited stops along the way. Your Adventure Leader will take you on a guided tour, with chances to explore riverside sights and enjoy lunch at a local market. It’s a relaxing way to discover Bangkok’s heart at your own pace. Teak Boat Canal Cruise: Take a peaceful 2-hour journey through Bangkok’s lesser-known waterways on a teak boat. Wind your way past stilted homes and riverside villages along the serene Daokanong Canal, with stops to admire the stunning Wat Arun and Wat Paknam temples. Prefer to roam solo? No problem! Your Adventure Leader will be happy to share ideas for exploring Bangkok independently. This evening, you’re invited to rejoin your group for dinner and a visit to one of Bangkok’s lively night markets – perfect for tasting even more local treats and picking up unique souvenirs.

Kanchanaburi: This morning, we’ll check out and make our way to the next stop on your adventure – the charming town of Kanchanaburi. En route, we’ll stop for a private day trip to one of Thailand’s most breathtaking natural spots: Erawan Waterfalls. Set within lush jungle, this series of cascading turquoise falls is perfect for a hike, a refreshing swim, or simply soaking up the stunning scenery at your own pace. By evening, we’ll arrive in Kanchanaburi and check into our new accommodation. The rest of the night is yours – take it easy, wander the local area, or grab a bite to eat and enjoy the laid-back riverside vibe.

Kanchanaburi: Your morning in Kanchanaburi is yours to enjoy however you like – take it slow and soak up the peaceful atmosphere, or choose from two optional adventures to make the most of your final hours here: Fancy some pampering? Head to a riverside hot springs spa where you can unwind in 13 different pools, dip your toes in a fish spa, and treat yourself to a traditional one-hour Thai massage – all set against the serene backdrop of the Kwai River. Feeling active? Hop on an e-scooter for a countryside tour! Glide past rice paddies and local farms, spot native wildlife like monitor lizards and zebus, and stop for a refreshing break in a local café. The ride ends at a stunning Chinese temple and finishes at the famous River Kwai Bridge. Whichever you choose, you’ll return in time to check out just after lunch. Then we’re off to our next adventure: Chiang Mai! But first, we’ll stop at the Ayutthaya ruins, a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Once the thriving second capital of the Siamese Kingdom, today its atmospheric temples and historic structures offer a glimpse into Thailand’s rich past. After some time to explore and grab dinner, we’ll make our way to the train station for an overnight journey to Chiang Mai – ready to wake up in Thailand’s cultural north!

Chiang Mai: You’ll arrive at Chiang Mai train station bright and early, where we’ll be waiting to greet you. After a quick stop for a local breakfast, we’ll head straight to one of the most memorable parts of your trip – a stay at a traditional homestay in the peaceful countryside. After settling in and enjoying a delicious home-cooked lunch, we’ll dive into a creative afternoon with a painting workshop inspired by Chiang Mai’s most iconic animals – elephants! Let your imagination run wild as you learn traditional techniques and create your own elephant-themed masterpiece. Later, we’ll take a guided walk through the nearby village, giving you the chance to meet locals and learn about everyday life in northern Thailand. Then it’s back to the homestay for a hearty dinner and a well-earned rest in your cosy home-away-from-home.

Chiang Mai: After breakfast at your homestay, we’ll set off for a truly unforgettable day – a visit to an ethical elephant sanctuary. Here, you’ll have the chance to observe these gentle giants in a natural, respectful environment, learning all about their care and conservation. A delicious lunch will be served during the visit, giving you time to relax and take in the stunning surroundings. In the early afternoon, we’ll transfer to our next hotel in Chiang Mai, where you’ll have a chance to freshen up and unwind. The evening is yours to enjoy however you’d like. But if you’re still up for adventure, why not join us for an optional Thai cooking class? You’ll learn to prepare classic dishes from scratch – and the best part? You’ll get to eat your creations for dinner!

Chiang Mai: This morning kicks off with a peaceful and insightful visit to a local temple, where you'll take part in a monk chat. This unique experience gives you the chance to learn about Buddhism, daily monastic life, and Thai culture directly from a practicing monk. Afterward, we’ll head up the mountain to explore Wat Doi Suthep, one of Thailand’s most iconic temples. With golden spires, intricate shrines, and panoramic views over Chiang Mai, it’s a must-see moment of your journey. Returning around lunchtime, the afternoon is yours to enjoy. If you’re up for more adventure, you can opt to join us on a trip to the Sticky (Bua Tong) Waterfall. Thanks to the grippy limestone surface, you can actually climb up the waterfall – a unique and fun experience for all ages! We’ll head back to the hotel in the evening, so you can rest up before heading to the final stop on your Thailand family tour.

Chiang Mai to Phuket: This morning, we’ll check out of our hotel and head to the airport – bound for Phuket! Once we’ve landed, we’ll transfer to our hotel, ready for you to spend an evening at leisure.

Phuket: Today is all yours to enjoy at your own pace! Phuket is a tropical paradise bursting with golden beaches, lush scenery, and vibrant culture — so whether you’re looking to chill out or dive into adventure, there’s something for everyone. Here are a few fantastic ways to spend your free day: - Lounge in style at the luxurious YONA Floating Beach Club, soaking up the sun in total comfort. - Explore the island on a half-day tour of Phuket, with stops in the colourful Old Town and the sacred Wat Chalong Temple. - Paddle through the magic of Phang Nga Bay, where an evening canoe trip reveals the glowing beauty of bioluminescent plankton. - Dive into the deep with a beginner-friendly scuba diving course and discover the underwater wonders of the Andaman Sea. - Cook like a local with a hands-on Thai cooking class, including a visit to the local market to learn about regional ingredients. However you choose to spend the day, Phuket is the perfect place to unwind, explore, and make memories.

Phi Phi Islands: Today’s all about island-hopping paradise! You’ll join us for an unforgettable speedboat tour around the stunning Phi Phi Islands and nearby tropical gems. Hop aboard as we cruise across turquoise waters, stopping for some incredible highlights along the way: - Snorkel at Viking Cove, where crystal-clear waters reveal vibrant coral and colourful marine life. - Swim in Pileh Lagoon, a hidden emerald lagoon surrounded by towering limestone cliffs. - Sink your feet into the soft white sands of Maya Beach, made famous by The Beach. - Chill out on Bamboo Island, a serene spot perfect for sunbathing and snapping a few final photos. A delicious lunch will be served on board, giving you more time to relax and soak up the sunshine. Once we’re back in Phuket this evening, you’ll have your final night free to grab a farewell dinner, swap stories with your fellow travellers, and toast to an epic adventure in Thailand!

Phuket: Sadly, today marks the end of your Thailand family group tour. If you’d like, we can help you arrange a transfer back to the airport – or if you’re planning on staying longer, we can help you arrange post-trip accommodation.

tourName: Thailand family adventure holiday
placesVisited: Bangkok, Kanchanaburi, River Kwai, Elephant sanctuary, Erawan National Park, Overnight sleeper train to Chiang Mai, Cycling and kayaking in Sri Lanna National Park, Fly to Koh Samui Island, Optional speedboat ride to Angthong National Marine Park
generalInfo: This family adventure through Thailand has been designed for children of eight years and upwards. The trip is an ideal introduction to Thailand or to show your children a country you have traveled to before and loved. You will start in Bangkok to get acclimatized and to explore the sights with an innovative excursion that makes use of the city's modes of public transport. Bangkok is also an amazing place to sample Thailand's famous cuisine before getting more adventurous later in your trip. Next stop is Kanchanaburi for an informative history lesson and encounters with the Asian elephant, giving insight into Thailand's incredible wildlife. You will then hop on the overnight sleeper train to Chiang Mai to spend a few days exploring the city, as well as spending time with a local Thai family. Finish with a few days of relaxation at the beach before returning home.

dayInfo.description: Fly internationally from your home airport to Bangkok.
After being welcomed by your guide at Bangkok Airport, take a private transfer to your hotel.

A private guided tour of Bangkok is a great introduction to Thailand today. Visit the capital's key attractions: the Grand Palace, Wat Po (home to the reclining Buddha) and Jim Thompson's house. Try out Bangkok's different forms of public transport - the Skytrain which winds its way through the skyscrapers and shopping malls, the public taxi boat, a long-tail boat and of course the infamous Thai tuk tuk. This is a fun excursion that gives you a fantastic insight into the capital as well as the people that call Bangkok home. As this is a private tour, your guide is able to go at a pace that suits your family.

Your guide collects you from your hotel this morning for your private transfer to Kanchanaburi, a journey of about two and a half hours. This area is renowned for its time during the 2nd World War when Allied POWs were used by the Japanese to build the Burma-Thailand Railway. Gain an insight into this history with a private guided tour of the main points of interest: the Thailand-Burma Railway Centre, the infamous Bridge On The River Kwai and Hell Fire Pass. The tour includes a boat journey up the River Kwai and a train journey on the infamous Death Railway. In the evening, relax in your river camp's beautiful setting.

Experience one of Thailand's most magnificent creatures today with a shared tour at Elephant's World, an elephant sanctuary that looks after old, sick, handicapped and rescued elephants. The sanctuary's motto is 'we humans work for the elephants, they will not work for us' - experience this for yourself as you spend the day looking after them: feeding, and preparing their food.

The morning is at leisure. You may like to relax in the camp's rock pool by the River Kwai, use your camp's complimentary mountain-bikes or visit the beautiful falls at the Erawan National Park. Your guide collects you for your private transfer to Bangkok, assisting you to catch the overnight sleeper train to Chiang Mai, located in the north of Thailand. The train journey should take 12 hours however trains in Thailand are notorious for being late so this could extend by two to four hours.

Meet your waiting guide at the train station in Chiang Mai who accompanys you and your family on your private transfer to your hotel. After settling into your hotel you have the rest of your day at leisure. Late afternoon is a great time to visit Chiang Mai's most famous land-mark: the temple of Wat Phra That Doi Suthep. This is one of Thailand's most important temples and has fantastic views of the city. In the evening you may like to visit the city's famous night bazaar.

Today you and your family get a fantastic experience into Thai life as you and your family are collected by a local man to visit him and his family at their home. During your stay learn how to cook authentic Northern Thai flavours and enjoy a home-cooked lunch with the family.

Meet your guide this morning for your private cycling and kayaking adventure. The tour starts about one hour's drive from Chiang Mai in the lovely Sri Lanna National Park. The bike ride is a scenic 15-20 km (10 - 13 miles) ride and the kayaking takes place on a lake, passing jungle-clad hills to a small village of floating houses. Traditional Thai lunch is included at the village and afterwards you can relax in the village, go for a swim or explore further in your kayaks before you are taken back to your hotel by boat and road.

The beach part of your holiday starts today. Your guide is on hand to accompany you on your private transfer to the airport for your direct flight to Koh Samui. The flight takes 1 hour 45 minutes. After being met upon arrival, take a private transfer to your lovely small boutique resort nestled in tropical gardens and overlooking emerald waters and the white sands of Maenam Beach.
Today is free to relax, or explore the island.
Another day free to explore. A popular tour that you might like to consider is a speedboat ride to the nearby Angthong National Marine Park.

Today is your last day by the beach before heading home. With calm waters, the beach is ideal for younger children to try for the first time, or for more advanced trips, guided snorkeling tours are available.
Depart from the hotel this morning for your private transfer to the local airport for your onward flight.

tourName: Thailand family adventure holidays
generalInfo:
A two-week tailor made holiday that includes all the exciting experiences you dream of in a family holiday in Thailand, plus a few extras too!

Kick off your adventure in the capital Bangkok, taking in all the city’s must-see temples and bustling canals, as well as experiencing a slice of local life at the flower market and China Town. Then fly to Chiang Mai for an encounter with elephants at one of the most ethical sanctuaries in the country, with time to explore this lovely city, sampling some of its famous street food and visiting the night market. There’s also a day to explore the forests here the adventurous way, with treetop ziplining and white water rafting.

Next, you spend a night in a floating rafthouse on the beautiful and peaceful Chiaw Laan Lake, enjoying all kinds of activities from hiking, swimming and exploring caves to dawn and dusk boat safaris to spot tropical birds and monkeys. Your journey finishes with relaxation time on the white sands of one of Thailand’s famous islands, where you can explore the crystal-clear waters by snorkelling, scuba diving or even sea kayaking.

dayInfo.description: Touch down at Bangkok airport, where you’ll be warmly greeted by our local representative before being whisked off to your hotel. The rest of the day is yours to relax or explore the city’s vibrant streets.

Kick off day two with the mesmerising chants of monks at Wat Pho, home to the 45-metre-long Reclining Buddha. Next, explore the iconic Grand Palace, with its dazzling temples and the revered Emerald Buddha. After lunch, hop on a traditional long-tail boat for a cruise along Bangkok’s serene canals. Spot stilted houses and watch life unfold along the waterways. Spend the afternoon wandering through Chinatown’s bustling alleys, where you’ll discover hidden markets, Taoist temples, and quirky tea shops. Kids will love the colourful stalls and unusual trinkets! (B/L)

Fly to Chiang Mai, the “Rose of the North.” After settling into your hotel, enjoy a lively evening exploring the city’s street food markets. Sample local delicacies like pad Thai, sticky rice with mango, and Thai coconut pudding, guided by tantalising aromas and your host’s expert tips. Adventurous eaters might even try the local rice whisky! (B/D)

On day four you’ll visit the Chang Chill Elephant Sanctuary to learn about their “no-touch” conservation philosophy. Observe the elephants in their natural habitat, prepare their food, learn about the mahout’s role in Thai culture and hear stories about the local community’s way of life. Return to your hotel by evening, with free time to explore the lively night market. We also offer a 2 day elephant experience staying in a hilltribe village. (B/L)

A free day to enjoy Chiang Mai your own way or add an optional tour: a thrilling morning in the treetops on a zipline course featuring 19 lines plus sky bridges, choosing from a kilometre-long zipline or a rollercoaster-style ride; or an afternoon white-water rafting on the Mae Tang River, navigating exciting rapids with expert guidance. Return to Chiang Mai for a relaxing evening. (B/L)

Fly to Phuket and head straight to Khao Sok National Park, where your family will stay in an enchanting treehouse. Unwind with a traditional Thai massage before enjoying a delicious dinner surrounded by the sights and sounds of the jungle. (B/D)

This morning you can choose your morning activity: 1) Canoe trip: drift down the Sok River, spotting monkeys and colourful birds. 2) Tubing (June–Oct): float along the river, with rope swings for added fun. 3) Cave & raft trek: a scenic hike to explore a serene cave, followed by a peaceful bamboo raft ride. In the evening, enjoy a jungle cooking class, learning to make dishes like green curry using bamboo. Later, you’ll embark on a night safari to spot nocturnal wildlife. (B/D)

Journey to Cheow Lan Lake and hike through pristine rainforest with a local guide. After lunch with a local community, you’ll cruise across the lake’s emerald waters to your floating bungalow. Spend the afternoon swimming or canoeing, then join an evening wildlife boat safari. Dinner is served under the stars, with fresh fish and southern Thai specialities. (B/L/D)

Wake early to the calls of gibbons and enjoy a morning boat safari. After breakfast, take a scenic drive and ferry ride to one of Thailand’s beautiful Gulf islands, such as Koh Samui or Koh Phangan, where tropical beaches await. (B/L)
It’s time to say goodbye. Transfer to Samui airport for your onward flight, taking home incredible memories of your family’s Thai adventure. (B)

tourName: Thailand family holiday
placesVisited: Bangkok, longtail boat ride on the Chao Phraya River, Kanchanaburi, Bridge on the River Kwai, Erawan National Park, swim at Erawan Falls, Ayutthaya, overnight train to Chiang Mai, Doi Suthep, elephant sanctuary, village walk guided by local people, Hua Hin beach stay
generalInfo:
Thailand’s a fantastic destination for families, while also feeling a little adventurous, and this Thailand family holiday pulls all its charms together in one 12 day break. Discover the country’s culture, delicious food and a great mix of exciting activities, with beautiful scenery the backdrop to it all.

Explore Bangkok by longtail boat, see the Bridge on the River Kwai and discover the ruins of Ayutthaya, once the capital of Siam. Travel to Chiang Mai where in the north of Thailand, where a range of fun and educational activities await. You can see the elephants at a dedicated sanctuary and take a nature hike through the foothills of Chiang Dao, picking up some ancient wisdom about natural medicines and wild foods as you go. Your holiday ends with time relaxing on Thailand’s famously beautiful coast at Hua Hin.

The warm welcome families receive in Thailand is part of the joy of travelling here. We’ve chosen friendly hotels in each destination that will make sure everyone is comfy and happy. Thailand’s tasty cuisine will tempt children and adults to tuck in, too.

No one wants to feel rushed or pressured on holiday, so this Thailand trip has been carefully paced. There are lots of activities to amuse and engage children, but also plenty of down time so you can all relax, swim, stroll and just enjoy the beautiful coast and jungle locations you visit.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok.
dayInfo.description: Sa-wat dee! Welcome to Thailand. Your adventure begins with a welcome meeting at 5 pm. If you arrive early, there is plenty to see and do in this exciting city. Bangkok is famous for its tuck tuks, khlong boats and street vendors serving up delicious Thai food. Perhaps take a riverboat to Chinatown and explore the crowded streets, uncover the magnificent Grand Palace and the Temple of the Emerald Buddha, wander down the tourist mecca of Khao San Road, or indulge in a Thai massage. After the meeting, head out for an optional group dinner to get to know your leader and the other families on your trip.

dayInfo.title: Kanchanaburi.
dayInfo.description: After breakfast, set out to explore some of Bangkok's hidden treasures. Visit the flower Market, where you and the family will learn how to fold a lotus petal. Then, hop on the underground to get to the Chao Phraya River, where you’ll board an EV boat and explore the famous khlongs (canals) of Bangkok. Life along these canals seems a world away from the busy streets of the capital. Stop at an artists house to make a special keepsake before enjoying some lunch at a local riverside restaurant. Then sit back and travel by private transfer to Kanchanaburi, where you’ll be staying for the next two nights in a unique floating rafthouse resort.

dayInfo.title: Erawan National Park .
dayInfo.description: This morning travel to the stunningly beautiful Erawan National Park. Located in western Thailand in the Tenasserim Hills of Kanchanaburi Province, this national park boasts the incredible Erawan Falls, a famous seven-level waterfall with turquoise pools and exotic tropical fish. It's a great place to explore or simply swim and relax. If you do some exploring of the lush surrounds, keep your eyes peeled for eagles, pheasants or leafbirds among many others who might be soaring above or perched in the treetops. Then return to your rafthouse resort where you and your family can enjoy swimming in the pool or you may like to experience a raft ride down the river.

dayInfo.title: Ayutthaya.
dayInfo.description: Transfer by minibus to the nearby city of Ayutthaya. Once the capital of ancient Siam, Ayutthaya offers a great opportunity to stroll the World Heritage-listed ruins of this once magnificent city, and you’ll get the chance to do exactly that on a guided tour of the picturesque ruins and temples spread across the town. The ruins at Wat Phra Mahathat provide many photo opportunities and the Buddha head surrounded by Banyan tree roots is perhaps the most photographed site in Ayutthaya. After, you’ll have access to a day room at a local hotel in Ayutthaya to relax, have a swim in the hotel pool and freshen up before the overnight train journey north.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Mai.
dayInfo.description: Wake up in Chiang Mai, the most vibrant city of Northern Thailand. As well as amazing temples and an interesting old town, the city is known for its friendly, smiling locals. You'll have a chance to explore the town and enjoy some lunch before driving along a scenic, winding mountain road that ends at an impressive 300-step Naga-guarded stairway. The rewards will justify the climb, as Doi Suthep, one of Thailand's most stunning temples, reveals itself. You'll be treated to panoramic views of the city from up here, and you might even be able to listen to the evening chants of the resident Buddhist monks. Return to Chiang Mai, and with free time in the evening, perhaps wander through the colourful night bazaar or visit one of the quality restaurants along the riverfront. In any case, don't miss out on the signature northern dish kao soy – yellow wheat noodles in a curry broth with chicken or beef.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Mai.
dayInfo.description: Today, you’ll and the family have a special time visiting the Chang Chill elephant experience. Drive out of Chiang Mai to Chang Chill, where you’ll begin to learn how this organisation supports the protection, conservation and lifestyle of free roaming elephants in the region. You’ll observe the daily patterns of these jungle giants from a safe distance, seeing how they graze and socialize with their other friends. The expert local guides will be able to give you a ‘live lecture’ on the elephants themselves, its sustainable tourism practices and conservation efforts in the area. Enjoy some refreshments nearby the elephant’s mud pit – but be careful not to get a spray! After lunch, head back to Chiang Mai and arrive in the late afternoon. You’ll have some free time to maybe visit the night markets or take a wander around the city. We will have lunch at the Sanctuary before heading back to Chiang Mai arriving in the late afternoon. You will have some free time to maybe visit the night markets or take a wander around the city.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Dao village visit .
dayInfo.description: Set off early through the Chiang Dao Valley to the rural village of Ban Hua Tung. Arrive at the warm and welcoming village where the community will invite you and your family for a truly unique experience. Once you’ve had some time to settle in, join local guides for a walk around the village, giving you the chance to learn about their agricultural practices and traditional basket weaving. Visit the forest which the local Hua Tung people manage together as part of a new community initiative. The biodiversity of the forest is protected by a sacred 'forest ordination' by Buddhist monks whereby trees are ordained as monks – the people nurture the forest, and the forest nurtures the people in return. There's a yearly bamboo harvest which raises money for the village. The locals take great pride in showing you the development of their village and the many different herbal medicines and wild foods in the forest. Join your hosts for a homemade lunch prepared by the community and learn a little more about their lives. Then return to Chiang Mai for the final evening of your Thailand adventure.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Mai.
dayInfo.description: Join your fellow travellers for a final breakfast, and then you can depart anytime following check-out. Looking to spend longer in Thailand? There’s still plenty to enjoy in this bustling capital, or you may like to venture south and explore some of the beaches and limestone cliffs in Southern Thailand.

tourName: Thailand family holidays
placesVisited: Bangkok, Ayuthaya, Kanchanaburi, Train ride over the River Kwai, Erawan National Park, Overnight sleeper train to Chiang Mai, Doi Suthep hilltop temple, Forest Canopy Tour, Night markets, Two-day jungle experience, Palong tribal village, Krabi
generalInfo:
This fantastic Thailand family holiday lets you experience the country on a local level with a combination of cultural excursions, exciting activities and excellent accommodation adding to plenty of lazy days spent by the beach - all in two weeks. Starting your trip in Bangkok really chucks your family in to the centre of the action; however, you’re bound to come up swimming within a city that never sleeps and never fails to excite and enthral in equal measures. From tuk tuks to long tail boats, there's certainly more than one way to travel around the capital, with sightseeing tours featuring the Grand Palace, Wat Pho and the banks of the Chao Phraya River all adding to an array of fascinating sights and sounds to expand the mind, body and soul.

After making the most of your time in the capital you'll head to Kanchanaburi, where jungle rafting, luxury safari camping and the famous setting for the Bridge over the River Kwai are an excellent introduction to life in the jungle. You'll then be whisked north to Chiang Mai, a beautiful walled city surrounded by mountains and forests. This is an excellent base from where to explore Thailand's second city with night markets, cooking courses and spa massages promising something for every member of your tribe. Just outside of Chiang Mai you'll be led on an exotic outdoor adventure with bamboo rafting expeditions, overnight stays with hill tribes and zip wires through the jungle canopy. From Chiang Mai it’s also possible to fly south to Koh Samui Island or Khao Sok National Park where you can choose your own adventure with kayaking, hiking and nights in the jungle along side soft white sand and seafood.

Get in touch for more information on how we can turn a family holiday in Thailand into an experience to savour as sweetly as fresh mango and sticky rice.

dayInfo.description: BANGKOK Arrive in Bangkok where you will be met by one of our representatives then taken to your hotel. The rest of the day is free for you to unwind.

BANGKOK After breakfast, you will take a public river taxi to the Pak Klong Dalat flower market, a wonderfully colourful start to your tour and a great introduction to Bangkok. From here you will continue to the Grand Palace for a guided tour around this beautiful building and the temple of Wat Phra Kaew. The palace walls are covered with intricate and rather gruesome depictions of battle scenes from Buddhist mythology, which are fascinating. You will also visit Wat Pho, one of Thailand’s most important temples. After lunch at a local Thai restaurant you will take a water taxi across the river to visit Wat Arun with its elongated Khmer style tower. From here you will board a ‘longtail boat’, a long wooden boat with an outboard engine, and will spend a couple of hours navigating the maze of waterways and canals of this more hidden part of Bangkok, a far cry from the hustle and bustle of the centre.

BANGKOK – KANCHANABURI Rise with the sun to drive to the old fishing port of Samut Songkram, well known for its lively railway market which it literally on the train tracks, the vendors displaying huge trays of vegetables, fruit and fish until the (very slow moving) train comes and they have to temporarily move to the sides! From here you will drive northwest into Kanchanaburi province, through endless rice paddies, until you reach Kanchanaburi town. Here you will board the train to Nam Tok over the infamous Burma Railway, constructed during the Second World War by POWs. Later you will visit the War Cemetery, containing the graves of some of the Prisoners of War who perished during the construction of the bridge.

KANCHANABURI In the morning you will head to Erawan National Park, a very picturesque series of falls that cascade down the mountainside. There is a path that climbs up beside the falls and you can stop off along the way to swim with the fishes. After a simple lunch at the waterfalls you will proceed to the lovely Prasat Muang Singh temples, which date back to Angkorian times and are similar to Angkor Wat although on a smaller scale. The ruins are almost always deserted, stunningly beautiful and great fun to explore.

KANCHANABURI – AYUTHAYA In the morning take a cookery class in Kanchanaburi and learn some of the secrets of Thai cookery. The class includes a visit to the local market to select your ingredients. Typical dishes that you will learn to make include pad thai, thai green curry and tum yum soup. After you finish the class you will be able to taste the delicious dishes that you have made. Later, explore Ayuthaya; the ancient capital of Thailand. Why not visit the night market that comes to life every evening at around 5pm. It is packed with stalls selling a wonderful collection of delicious local dishes such as Khao Mok Kai (Muslim-Thai style biryani rice, Nam Prk Pla Tuu (chilli mackerel), freshly grilled corn on the cob and much more. There are also many stalls selling clothes and nik oaks for those souvenirs your promised.

AYUTHAYA Today you will have the full day to explore the sights around Ayuthaya by bike. You will start with Bang Pa In, the old summer residence, and will then take a lontail boat trip along the Chao Phraya River, ending at the impressive Phananchoeng Temple. In the evening you will transfer to the train station to board the overnight train north to Chiang Mai.

CHIANG MAI Once settled you will then proceed to Chiang Mai’s most famous landmark, the temple of Doi Suthep Temple perched on a hilltop on the outskirts of town. The temple is stunning with beautiful views over Chiang Mai, and there are always many local people making offerings of flowers and incense. The afternoon is free for you to explore Chiang Mai on your own, sample local delicacies and take photos galore.

CHIANG MAI Today you will take a short drive into the jungle outside Chiang Mai and will then fly through the forest canopy on a series of exciting zip lines. The kids will love the adrenalin rush and there are stunning views over the surrounding landscape.

CHIANG MAI Today you head up into the hills outside Chiang Mai. First stop is a local market where you can see lots of weird and wonderful produce before continuing to a rafting camp to climb on board a bamboo raft for a gentle float down a river, enjoying the scenery, sun and the sounds of the birds. After lunch in a Karen hilltribe village in a beautiful mountain location you will start trekking. Along the way your guide will be able to explain the various uses of the plants and trees that you can see on the sides of the path. Spend the night in a village homestay, getting to know the locals and the culture.

CHIANG MAI After breakfast in the village you will have a chance to explore with your guide and can visit the village shrine and perhaps the local school. Later you will hike to a Karen village from where you will meet your vehicle for the return journey to Chiang Mai. Why not stop at off one of Chiang Mai’s famous orchid nurseries along the way.
CHIANG MAI – KOH SAMUI Today you fly to Koh Samui. On arrival you will transfer to your hotel where the rest of the day is free for you to relax.

KOH SAMUI Three full days to relax and enjoy the beach. There are numerous activities that you can arrange on Koh Samui, including visiting other beaches, water sports, snorkelling and boat trips to outlying islands.
BANGKOK Time to say goodbye to Thailand and head home.

tourName: Thailand family tour
generalInfo: With paradise islands, street food to rival any and a smile at every turn, Thailand is everything you’d want for a family getaway… and so much more. Experience the very best bits on this activity-packed adventure, where we search for wild elephants, relax with three days on beautiful Koh Samui and dive into the world-renowned national cuisine. There’s plenty more excitement too, while our expert tour leaders provide plenty of local insight and make sure the trip runs safely and smoothly.

dayInfo.description: This family adventure starts in Bangkok, the enthralling and energetic capital of Thailand. If you want to do some sightseeing our hotel is a 20 minute walk from The Grand Palace, an ornate complex once used by royals. Alternatively take a refreshing dip in the hotel pool. Around 6pm, say sawasdee to your tour leader and fellow travellers, when we gather as a group for the first time to get to know each other and learn more about the adventures ahead. Your tour leader then ensures a big Thai welcome by arranging a group dinner at a local restaurant. Want extra time in Bangkok? Secure pre-tour hotel nights through your sales representative. Accommodation: New Siam Palace Ville Hotel (or similar)

This morning, we take a private transfer to Bang Krachao, a human-made jungle island. This oasis provides a welcome space to unwind in a city primarily known for its bright lights and electric atmosphere. The best way to explore is by bike, so we take a leisurely cycle (approximately 1.8mi-3mi/3km-5km) along flat pathways, visiting the Sri Nakhon Khuean Khan Park, home to fish ponds and bike trails. In the evening, we discover Bangkok on a leisurely walk around the old town, where we see architecture dating from the King Rama V era plus the Giant Swing, a grand Brahman monument once used for ceremonial purposes. That’s followed by a street food tour for dinner, in which we stall hop to sample a selection of the tastiest Thai dishes. Options could include crispy pork noodles, dumplings and the much-loved mango with sticky rice, a must try in Thailand! Accommodation: New Siam Palace Ville Hotel (or similar)

We leave Bangkok after breakfast, transferring (approximately two hours) to Damnoen Saduak, where we board boats and meander through the most famous floating market in Thailand, which is located on the Damnoen Saduak canal. At this 100-year-old market, we can watch the vendors go about their daily business and, perhaps, buy some fresh fruit from them. We continue to Kanchanaburi (approximately three hours), an area of natural beauty that’s popular with families for its caves, waterfalls, river trips and, for the adults, Second World War history. Along the way, we have a short stop at the Kanchanaburi war museum and cemetery, where we have the chance to pay our respects to the thousands killed constructing the Death Railway. This evening, we dine at a floating restaurant by the river overlooking the River Kwai Bridge, which was reconstructed after the war and recreated in the Oscar-winning war film The Bridge on the River Kwai (1957), an ideal opportunity to take in our tranquil surroundings and reflect on the day. Accommodation: River Kwai Bridge Resort (or similar)

This morning, we visit the OurLand Project, an animal reserve and research station working on human-wildlife conflict. After an introduction to their work, we take a one-hour jungle hike to a known habitat for wild elephants, where we hope to see these incredible creatures in the flesh, while also learning more about their lives from our expert guide. After, the adventure continues as we take a one-hour transfer to Erawan National Park. The picturesque waterfalls here are named after Erawan, the multi-headed white elephant from the Hindu religion, which the seven-tiered cascades are said to resemble. Your time is free to enjoy the views, swim, or walk to the top of the falls (1.25mi/2km, approximately a two-hour round trip). Accommodation: River Kwai Bridge Resort (or similar)

Following breakfast, we take a 30-minute transfer to Baan Nong Khao, an agricultural village specialising in the production of palm sugar. Here, we spend the morning learning about village life and roll up our sleeves to participate in making (and then tasting) a delicious Thai dessert known as khanom tan (palm fruit muffin). This afternoon, we transfer (approximately one hour) to the city of Nakhon Pathom, where we catch our overnight train to Surat Thani later in the evening. We have use of the day rooms at a local hotel to freshen up before our train journey. We also have the chance to visit the lively Phra Pathom Chedi Night Market before we depart. Accommodation: Overnight train

Upon an early morning arrival into Surat Thani, we first enjoy a local breakfast before transferring (approximately 1hr 30min) to our riverside resort near Khao Sok National Park. We have time to freshen up from our train journey before regrouping in the afternoon for a leisurely kayak on the Klong Sok River, a relaxing activity that covers approximately 2.5mi (4km) with opportunities to swim and spot birdlife along the way. Accommodation: The Cliff and River Jungle Resort (or similar)

After breakfast, we transfer (approximately one hour) to Khao Sok National Park for a day of adventure! Considered one of the most beautiful and unspoiled locations in Thailand, the park is home to some of the oldest rainforests in the world, plus towering limestone pinnacles, secluded hiking trails and the emerald-green waters of Chiew Larn Lake. In the park this morning, we enjoy a longtail boat ride on the lake and visit Prakay Phet cave, which has unique coral, stalagmites and stalactites. After, we enjoy lunch aboard a raft house, feasting on traditional Thai dishes such as Thai omelette, fried fish, stir-fried vegetable dishes with steamed rice, and fresh fruits. This afternoon, we have time at the lake to relax, swim and kayak, plus the option to hike (approximately one hour) to a nearby waterfall before returning to our resort. Accommodation: The Cliff and River Jungle Resort (or similar)

Following breakfast, we depart the resort and drive (approximately three hours) to Don Sak to catch a catamaran ferry (approximately 45 minutes) to Koh Samui. Upon arrival, it’s a 30-minute drive to our beach resort, where we spend the next three nights. Chaweng Beach is one of the most popular beaches on the island, a great choice for families. After we’ve settled in, the leader conducts a short orientation walk and provides options on how you and your family can best spend your time on Koh Samui. Accommodation: Matcha Samui Resort (or similar)

Today is free to explore or unwind on Chaweng Beach. Alternatively, there may be the option (additional cost, payable locally) to join a snorkelling trip to Koh Tao and Koh Nang Yuan or a half-day trip around Koh Samui. Please refer to the trip notes for further information on these optional excursions. Your tour leader will be able to advise further on how to make the most of your free day on Koh Samui. Accommodation: Matcha Samui Resort (or similar)

After breakfast, we transfer (approximately 20 minutes) to the Bangrak Pier to board our speed boat for a day of discovery and snorkelling in Ang Thong Marine National Park. Consisting of jungle-covered islands and crystal-blue waters, the national park is a nature lover’s playground. Today, we visit a selection of islands: first stop is Wao Yai, one of the best locations for snorkelling, followed by Koh Mae Koh to a viewpoint overlooking the dramatic Emerald Lake. We also visit Koh Phaluai, where we have lunch, before transferring to Koh Wua Ta Lap, the main island in the park, where we can relax and swim at the beach or hike up to the Pha Chan Charat viewpoint for wonderful vistas over the islands. Accommodation: Matcha Samui Resort (or similar)

The morning is free to relax before a long travel day, in which we start our journey back north. Bidding farewell to Koh Samui, we transfer (approximately 20 minutes) back to the pier, where we board a ferry (approximately 1hr 30min) for a relaxed journey back to the mainland. Upon arrival in Don Sak, we have private transport (approximately two hours) to Surat Thani station, where there is free time to have dinner, before boarding our overnight train in the evening back to Bangkok. Accommodation: Overnight train

Arriving in Bangkok early morning, we’re back to where the adventure started! Following breakfast, the day is free for last-minute shopping, sightseeing or you may join an optional Thai cooking class, your leader can advise during the trip (additional cost, payable locally). Alternatively, you may wish to relax by the pool before our final evening together. Please note, hotel rooms are normally available from 2pm. We can store luggage and access the hotel pool before then. Accommodation: New Siam Palace Ville Hotel (or similar)
Our adventure ends after breakfast. Catch your free transfer to the airport to begin your journey home. Alternatively, speak to your sales representative to extend your stay in this thrilling city.

tourName: Thailand floating market & beach tour
placesVisited: Bangkok, Amphawa riverside market, pomelo orchards of Bang Phlap, Samut Songkram, Mae Klong river cruise, floating market at Ta Kha village, sugar palm cultivation in Ban Thamrong, visit local homes, Kaeng Krachan dam and reservoir, Phetchaburi, Maruekatayawan Palace in Hua Hin, Sirinath Rajini Center for Mangrove Forest Studies
generalInfo:
This Thailand cultural tour gives an authentic taste of Thai life and food, as we travel through the heart of the country before heading to the coast. You’ll find out how Thai foods and ingredients are grown and produced, from sugar palm to pomellos, and will have the opportunity to tuck into wonderful, authentic dishes that aren’t served in Thai restaurants back home. You will also meet local producers and growers to learn more about their agricultural methods.

Begin by enjoying two days of exploration in the canals, villages and spend two days exploring the canals and villages, farms and orchards west of Bangkok. Then head to the coast at Hua Hin, a resort little visited by tourists, for fishing and relaxing. This is a fully tailor made tour, so stop offs can be extended or dropped as you choose.

dayInfo.description: Leave Bangkok on a morning train towards Samut Songkram, stopping at the “Umbrella Market”, a coconut plantation and Amphawa riverside market. Learn how villagers produce traditional coconut sugar, which is a key ingredient in Thai cooking. You will see the whole process, from climbing the tree to stirring coconut juice over a wood fire and taste some fresh authentic desserts. After lunch continue to Bang Phlap, famous for its organic pomelo orchards as well as the community’s profit sharing system, which funds their children’s education. It is a popular place to learn about organic agriculture, turning waste fruits or plants into charcoal and traditional methods of food preservation. Round off the day by hopping in a local boat down the Mae Klong river, cruising past tropical fruit orchids and rare ancient-style Thai houses. (L/D)

After breakfast, depart to Ta Kha village to board a small sampan (paddling boat) and explore Thai canal life and a traditional floating market. Then travel the ‘salt road’, passing vistas of salt farming, local food stalls, dried fish and the strange multi-storey homes of swifts used to make bird's nest soup. After lunch you'll visit Ban Thamrong, famous for thousands of sugar palm trees that are harvested for fresh sugar juice, palm sugar, toddy palm cake, palm seed in syrup, palm-leaf hats, palm-wood containers and many other uses. You can visit some local houses to learn about the daily work of sugar palm cultivation, learn about the vocational training in traditional skills run by the community and even have a go at palm-leaf weaving. Finish the day with a delicious dinner and relaxation at your hotel, set amongst tropical forest on the banks of the Phetchaburi River. (B/L/D)

After breakfast, we'll drive you to Kaeng Krachan dam and reservoir. There are some wonderful nature walks around the area where you can experience the beautiful Thai countryside up close and plant a tree to offset the carbon footprint of your holiday. Lunch is served at a local restaurant on the banks of the reservoir. In the afternoon, go on to Hua Hin and the stunning Maruekatayawan Palace, a wooden palace on the beachfront built by the King in 1923. Hua Hin is a popular seaside spot for Thai people but few international tourists come here. The rest of the day is yours to enjoy the town and beach. Dinner is at your resort, with an option to visit the night market in Hua Hin. (B/L/D)

The morning is at your leisure, before you have lunch at a local restaurant. Then depart for Bangkok to continue your adventure around the rest of this incredible country. On the way back you also have the chance to visit the Sirinath Rajini Center for Mangrove Forest Studies, dedicated to helping rehabilitate mangrove ecosystems. The centre was designed for learning and conserving these endangered trees, as well as providing a nursery for marine aquaculture and educating people how to live in harmony with the forest. (B/L)

tourName: Thailand for families holiday
generalInfo:
Thailand is one of the most family-friendly holiday destinations in Southeast Asia, and this Thailand for Families itinerary covers the best that the south of the country has to offer. Beginning in Bangkok, you’ll get to discover the capital on a treasure hunt through some of its historical and cultural sights, adding an exciting twist to your exploration of the city. No visit would be complete without a boat ride on one of Bangkok’s canals (khlongs). In this itinerary you’ll discover the Thonburi khlongs, a section which offers a glimpse into the capital’s rapid development, where traditional teak houses rub shoulders with modern mansions.

From Bangkok you’ll travel overland to its southern beaches, passing through some of Thailand’s most spectacular scenery along the way. Stop at Petchaburi, which is home to the Wildlife Friends Foundation Thailand (WFFT) who do an excellent job at rescuing wild animals, providing sanctuary for sick or disabled animals and promoting natural resource conservation. You’ll visit the centre, learn about the work they do there and stay overnight in their ecolodge.

An overnight stop will also be made at Kuri Buri, home to a community village involved in the production of sustainable goods, as well one of the best national parks to spot wildlife in the country. You’ll also visit Chumphon and Ranong, where you can do some island hopping without the crowds, visit a community enterprise coffee plantation and kayak through a mangrove forest.

Perhaps the highlight of this itinerary is the incredibly beautiful Khao Sok National Park and the Elephant Hills program which is based there. You’ll stay in luxury tented accommodation and enjoy a variety of activities on and around the lake area, including a visit to the elephant sanctuary, wildlife spotting, jungle trekking, and canoeing.

The itinerary ends at Khao Lak, a stunning area of white sand beaches and home to three national parks. Here you’ll join a fun cooking class and the rest of your time will be at leisure to relax on the beach or arrange day trips locally.

dayInfo.description: BANGKOK: On arrival at the airport in Bangkok, you’ll be met by your guide and transferred to your hotel in the city. Enjoy the remainder of the day at leisure.

BANGKOK: Meet your guide for a fun morning of city discovery. Join other visitors on a treasure hunt where you will split into teams and head to historical sites and neighbourhoods to take part in missions, find clues and meet with friendly locals. In the afternoon you’ll be taken on a boat tour of the Thonburi khlong, an intricate network of canals in a residential part of the city. You’ll board at the Chao Phraya River and pass the iconic Wat Arun before heading into the narrower waterways. Pass by historical neighbourhoods with teak houses and see people relaxing on their porches overlooking the canals. Visit temples rarely visited by tourists and learn about the role they play in their communities. End at an orchid garden and fruit plantation before heading back to your hotel for an evening at leisure.

PETCHABURI: This morning you’ll transfer south to Petchaburi, which is home to the Wildlife Friends Foundation Thailand (WFFT). Join the foundation’s wildlife program and learn about the work they do rescuing neglected wild animals, providing sanctuary for sick and disabled animals, educating people, and promoting conservation of natural resources. You’ll also get to visit their elephant refuge, where you can get up close to these magnificent creatures but in a way which is non-exploitative and cruelty-free.

KURI BURI: Head further south this morning to Kuri Buri district, home to a community village where you’ll see and experience some of the sustainable activities which go on there, such as making paper from elephant dung, rubber tapping and silk making. After lunch at the village, you’ll head to Kuri Buri National Park to observe the wildlife living there. The park is home to species such as elephants, guars, deer and monkeys. After your visit, you’ll enjoy dinner at a local restaurant before heading to tonight’s accommodation.

CHUMPHON: This morning you’ll travel onwards to Chumphon, a coastal town close to a large area of mangrove forests and islands, known as Chumphon Islands National Park. Stroll along the 1km wooden walkway, which passes through the mangroves, and then head to a viewpoint which offers stunning views of the town and natural scenery below. Continue to Hat Sai Ri beach and the shrine of Prince Chumphon, the founder of the modern Thai navy, before finishing the day with some kayaking through the mangrove forests.

RANONG: Transfer onwards to Ranong province and stop by at Gong Valley, a community enterprise which produces chemical-free coffee using hand-roasting techniques that gives their coffee a distinctive flavour. Observe the coffee making process before heading to your accommodation in town.

RANONG: Today you’ll spend your time hopping between tropical islands off Ranong’s coast. Enjoy sunbathing on sandy beaches and swimming or snorkelling in the pristine waters surrounding the islands. You’ll also have an opportunity to hike to a viewpoint above a beautiful half-moon shaped beach. Spend the evening back in town where you can head to the Walking Street and browse the goods being sold there.

KHAO SOK: Journey on to Khao Sok National Park and arrive at Elephant Hills, which runs two luxury tented camps and an elephant sanctuary. Your first activity while here will be a visit to the elephants, where you can watch them being washed, feed them, and watch them play in their natural surroundings. After this, you’ll get to enjoy a canoe safari on the national park’s lake, passing through some of the most incredible scenery in Thailand. This evening’s accommodation will be at the Elephant Camp, where you can watch a movie presentation about Elephant Hills, enjoy dance performances and watch a cooking demonstration.

KHAO SOK: Today’s activities begin with a trip to a local market, where you’ll get a glimpse into rural life in the area. After this, head back to the lake for a boat trip where you can try to spot more wildlife on the shores. Arrive at the floating Rainforest Camp, your accommodation for this evening, and enjoy lunch here. In the afternoon you’ll trek into the forest to try and spot wildlife and learn more about the rainforest. This evening you can kick back and relax, taking in the wonderful scenery from your floating porch.

KHAO LAK: The final leg of your journey through Southern Thailand will take you to Khao Lak, a stunning coastal area of white sand beaches which is also home to three national parks. Arrive at your beach resort in the afternoon and enjoy the remainder of the day at leisure.
KHAO LAK: Today you will be free at leisure to relax on the beach at your resort or arrange a daytrip locally. The nearby coral reefs of the Similan and Surin Islands are well worth exploring.

KHAO LAK: This morning you’ll join a fun cooking class in the local town. First head to the market, where you can select your ingredients for the meal, and then on to the cookery school where the chef will guide through how to cook a couple of dishes using classic Thai techniques. After all your hard work, sit down to enjoy your dishes for lunch. The afternoon will be at leisure to continue exploring the local area or relax on the beach at your resort.
KHAO LAK: Enjoy the day at leisure. You can choose to arrange more activities locally with your resort or simply kick back and relax on your final full day in Thailand.
KHAO LAK: Meet your driver and transfer to Phuket Airport for your onward international flight.

tourName: Thailand holiday, culture and beach
placesVisited: Bangkok, long-tail boat cruise, village visit to see brown palm sugar being made, Tha Kha floating market, Bridge over the River Kwai, floating bungalows, rice barge cruise, Ayutthaya, Chiang Mai, Thai cooking class, Elephant Nature Park, Buddhist monks chanting, hilltribe lodge, beaches
generalInfo: If you want to experience all the things that make Thailand one of the world’s top holiday destinations, this 12 day Thailand highlights holiday is the trip for you! You’ll see the stunning architecture and vibrant street life of Bangkok, visit a local floating market, then enjoy the serenity of the River Kwai from a river raft hotel. Explore the temple ruins of Ayutthaya then head by overnight train to Chiang Mai to take a Thai cooking class, meet Buddhist monks and encounter rescued elephants. The last few days are spent trekking to stay with a hilltribe community in the mountains and if you like, add some relaxation time on the beautiful beaches. There you have it – the best of Thailand, with a twist!

dayInfo.description: Arrive at Bangkok airport, where you’ll be greeted by a local representative and taken to your hotel. Standard check-in time is 14:00.

Begin your Bangkok exploration at Wat Po, home to the iconic Reclining Buddha and Thailand's traditional medicine school, where you’ll witness the monks’ morning chants. Visit the Grand Palace, including the revered Emerald Buddha. After lunch, explore Bangkok’s canals by long-tail boat, taking in stilted homes and local life. Visit the striking Wat Arun, then wander Chinatown’s vibrant alleys, markets, and temples on foot. Return to your hotel late afternoon. (B/L)

Set out early for Tha Kha floating market, a traditional trading hub, where you take a paddle boat to explore the canals and stop by a coconut sugar factory, before continuing to Kanchanaburi. Visit the War Cemetery, Bridge over the River Kwai, and the moving Hellfire Pass Memorial, learning about WWII history. Check into your floating hotel for a peaceful evening. (B/L)

Enjoy a free morning - perhaps paddleboarding or visiting a Mon village. Travel by boat and car to Ayutthaya, the ancient capital. Evening at leisure. Optional: Romantic sunset dinner on a traditional rice barge. (B/L)

Explore Ayutthaya’s UNESCO-listed temples, including Wat Si Sanphet and Wat Mahathat, with its tree-entwined Buddha head. Stroll through the Muslim Quarter and try candy floss roti, then take a boat trip along the Chao Phraya River to the impressive Bang Pa-In Summer Palace. After dinner, board an overnight train to Chiang Mai. (B/L/D)

Transfer to your hotel upon arrival. Later, visit the Buddhist University of Chiang Mai at Wat Suan Dok to meet monks and learn about Buddhist practices. End the day with a trip to Doi Suthep, a sacred hilltop temple offering panoramic views and a chance to see the monks’ evening rituals. (B)

Join a hands-on cooking class with a local family, learning traditional techniques and recipes and buying ingredients at a nearby market. After enjoying your creations, return to your hotel. Spend your evening exploring Chiang Mai’s lively streets or night markets, some of the best places for handicrafts and souvenir shopping in the country. (B/L)

Travel to Chang Chill Elephant Sanctuary to observe elephants in their natural habitat. Help prepare food for the animals and learn about elephant conservation. You also have time to chat with the mahouts about their lives and role in Thai culture, before returning to Chiang Mai. (B/L)

Journey north to Fang stopping at the Chiang Dao cave complex or the Sticky Waterfalls, then relax your muscles at Doi Pha Hom Pok National Park’s hot springs. Tonight you stay in a Lahu family-run guesthouse with authentic décor and a warm welcome. (B/L/D)

Trek up Doi Phu Muen mountain for around 2 hours to a remote Lahu hill tribe community, where you will learn about their way of life and how the villagers make a living from organic tea and coffee farming. You'll join in daily activities, share home-cooked meals and be treated to traditional Lahu dances. Accommodation is basic but offers a unique cultural insight. Note: Families with young children can skip the trek and travel by 4WD. You can also stay at the hotel in Fang rather than the village. (B/L/D)
After breakfast with your hosts, have a go at making and tasting "Khao Puk", a traditional sticky rice bun. Return to Fang to change vehicle and continue back to Chiang Mai. (B/L)
Transfer to Chiang Mai airport for your onward flight or extend your stay on a stunning southern beach. (B)

tourName: Thailand island hopping holiday
generalInfo: For a quintessential white-sand, tropical paradise beach holiday, look no further. Spend a week in Koh Chang National Marine Park, starting a couple days relaxing and exploring Koh Chang itself, then on tiny Koh Mak, a haven of peace and tranquillity where traffic is just a couple of motorbikes and pick-up trucks and there are no supermarkets to be seen. Finish with a couple of nights on Koh Kood for more beaches, hidden delights and laid-back island life, but you may find yourself wanting to stay a little longer!

dayInfo.description: Pick up from your Bangkok hotel and travel by minibus and ferry to Koh Chang (around 6 hrs). It is also possible to take a domestic flight to Trat to shorten the journey.

Gentle cycling (20km) to explore Koh Chang, taking in a local village, Chinese shrine, a secret beach and pine forest and a viewpoint where you can see the whole island laid out below. Finish with a dip in a waterfall and lunch at a local restaurant.

Depart for Koh Mak where traffic is limited to a couple of motorbikes and pick up trucks and there are no shopping centers, supermarkets or ATM machines. The perfect place to get away from it all! Optional trip to Koh Kham, which has a fantastic powdery white beach where you can enjoy the afternoon sunbathing, swimming or snorkelling. Later head back to Koh Mak for a delicious dinner. (B/L/D)

Today, take a boat trip to the islands of Koh Rang, the best area for snorkelling in Koh Chang National Park and also renowned among scuba divers. After marvelling at the multitude of tropical fish, enjoy lunch on the boat and return to Koh Maak at your leisure. (B/L)

Hop over to your next tropical island, Koh Kood, right next to the Cambodian border and still heavily forested, making it as much of a nature-lovers paradise as a beach-bum’s. Relax after disembarking directly at your hotel, or take a kayak out to explore the lush coastline and nearby reefs. (B/D)

Tour the island by local bus and visit the most attractive beaches, swim in the fresh waters of the island’s main waterfall and explore the oldest fishing village on the island, Ao Salat, where local pirates harboured in the old days. Lunch is provided at a renowned local restaurant before returning at your leisure to the hotel. (Optional: kayaking in mangrove forest) (B/L)

Spend the morning lapping up the last of the sun on the golden sands, before leaving the beach behind and heading back to your Bangkok hotel. Of course you may just want to stay a little longer... (B)

tourName: Thailand Lantern Festival tour 2026
generalInfo:
This tour includes the awesome attractions, the most must-do activities and exclusive cultural experiences in Thailand.

!!!As the Yipeng Festival event is only held on November 5-6, 2025, your land travel time must include one of them. The other days can be different.

Tour Highlights:
Embrace the Exotic Allure of Bangkok: Immerse yourself in Thailand's vibrant capital, where ancient traditions fuse with modern marvels.

Magical Lantern Release: Secure a prime spot at Thailand's grandest lantern festival venue to participate in an unforgettable illumination spectacle.

Full Moon Krathong Celebration: Craft your personalized Thai krathong and cherish a moonlit evening by the river, complemented with a delightful dinner.

Elephant Nature Park: Observe the elephants and learn about the elephants' habitat and history.

Sacred Summit at Doi Suthep: Undertake a pilgrimage to Northern Thailand's holiest temple perched on a majestic mountain, adorned with golden grandeur.

Phuket’s Beachside Bliss: Conclude your journey with serene relaxation on Phuket’s pristine shores, soaking up the sun before bidding Thailand farewell.

dayInfo.description: Arrival in Bangkok – November 2th. Bangkok Beckons Land in the vibrant embrace of Thailand and let our private transfer whisk you away to your hotel in the heart of Bangkok. Meals: No

Bangkok's Spiritual & Cultural Gems – November 3th. Wat Pho: Begin with a soul-stirring visit to Wat Pho, home to the majestic Reclining Buddha, where morning rituals fill the air with sacred chants. Tuk-Tuk Adventure: Zip through Bangkok's streets to the resplendent Grand Palace. Wat Arun: Cross the Chao Phraya River by water taxi to the iconic Temple of Dawn. River Life: Glide past temples and local life on a long-tail boat ride. Chinatown: End your day immersed in the bustling energy of Bangkok's vibrant Chinese quarter. Meals: Breakfast

Local Markets & Flight to Chiang Mai – November 4th. Damnoen Saduak: Experience the floating market's colorful chaos early morning. Maeklong Railway Market: Witness market stalls swiftly adapt to passing trains. Flight North: Enjoy a leisurely lunch (self-arranged) before flying to Chiang Mai. Chiang Mai Welcome: Relax at your hotel, nestled in the city's tranquil heart. Meals: Breakfast

Sacred Peaks & Yi Peng Festival – November 5th. Doi Suthep: Ascend to Wat Phra That and Wat Suan Dok, spiritual pillars of the North. Rickshaw Tour: Navigate Chiang Mai's lively streets and hidden alleyways. Yi Peng Festival: Premium access to the lantern release, with round-trip transfers, 2 lanterns per person, and a sumptuous dinner amidst Thai flavors. Meals: Breakfast, Dinner

Full Moon Celebrations – November 6th. Leisure Morning: Start the day at your pace. Lantern Making: Afternoon workshop followed by a riverside dinner. Wish Upon a Lantern: Release your handmade lantern at dusk and join the festival parade near Tha Phae Gate. Meals: Breakfast, Dinner

A Half-Day Visit to Elephant Nature Park– November 7th. Embark on a guided walk with our knowledgeable staff and the elephants. We will take you to the river that skirts the park, where you can observe the elephants and learn about the elephants' habitat and history. Elephant Nature Park emphasizes a no-riding policy. Optional tour: Cook authentic Thai food in a local organic farm. Visit a local family. The hostess will welcome you and walk you through her organic vegetable garden to collect the different kinds of herbs and vegetables that will be used in the various Thai foods that you will be preparing. You will learn how to make some of the best home-cooked dishes that you can easily cook for each other when you return home.
