Surin/Khong Jam Breakfast, visit a village of Argentiere: Ban Khwao Sinarin and continuation to the Khmer Sikhoraphum temple. Stop at Ban Sam Kho village. Remained very traditional and completely unknown to tourists, this village deserves a walk to discover a lifestyle unchanged. Silk fabrics are produced in almost all houses (or rather "under" houses built on stilts), probably one of the best places to offer you a fabric of "Pha Mai" (Silk Thai) at a lower cost, from the producer to the consumer. Continue to the beautiful Sikhoraphum temple and visit its 5 towers and its central chedi which is the place of worship for locals. Then departure for Kamphaeng Yai and visit this little-known Khmer site. Dating from the 11th century it consists of 6 buildings. You will discover sculptures of Hindu deities Shiva and Vishnu on the lintels as well as inscriptions in Khmer. Every year in March, an important celebration of the Khmer community is held there. Have lunch on your own. Continue to Kong Jiam, a city located on the majestic Mekong, the eighth largest river in the world and the third largest in Asia. Originating in Tibet, it travels 4,500 km, crossing China, Burma, Laos, Thailand, Cambodia before throwing itself into the sea in Vietnam. Stay overnight in Kong Jiam

Khong Jiam – Mukdaham – Nakhon Phanom Breakfast at the hotel then departure for Mukdahan, border town with Savannakhet in Laos where you can walk in its lively and colorful market where sell and exchange products Laotian, Thai, Vietnamese and of course Chinese. Mukdahan has become a staging area for game-loving Thais visiting Savannakhet in Laos, where casinos, banned in Thailand, have been created for them. You can of course make new culinary experiences between a rice rat curry (a quality meat and expensive contrary to popular belief), eggs of red ants or cobra or monitor curry, not to mention a multitude of fried insects and peppers! Afternoon, continue to Nakhon Phanom and stop in one of the most important temples of the region of Isan for its inhabitants, like Wat Phra That Phanom built in a purely Laotian architecture. Before arriving at Nakhon Phanom, stop to visit the small village of Ban Na Chok where Ho Chi Minh lived from 1923 to 1929. Arrival in Nakhon Phanom and check in your hotel at the edge of the Mekong

Nakhon Phanom – Sakhon Nakhon – Udon Thani Breakfast and departure for the visit of Sakhon Nakhon where you will participate in the ceremony of sacred thread that a monk attaches to your wrist, a sign of merits and omens, the opportunity to make a wish. It is also an animistic practice where, according to the beliefs, the body is made up of 32 souls that can fly away. Also the threads tied around the wrists are a way to prevent diseases by attaching Souls to the body. Continue to visit the traditional pottery and weaving village of Ban Chiang, famous throughout in the country. In 1966, it was here that a Harvard student updated one of the most important archaeological sites in Southeast Asia. The excavations that followed revealed pottery and bronze tools dating back more than 3,500 years on a site that had been inhabited for at least 2000 years. His discovery revolutionized the knowledge of this period of history by uncovering evidence of mastery of livestock (pigs, chickens and cattle) and rice farming and the use of metal tools. The site is a UNESCO World Heritage Site since 1992. Continue to visit bamboo weaving work at Dong Yen Village and pottery painting at Baan Pulu. Afternoon transfer to Udon Thani. Departure for the south of the city for visit of the lake : the "Talay Bua Daeng" translates literally the "Red Lotus Sea". From December to February, a lake is covered with red lotus flowers. You will enjoy a pleasant boat trip in the heart of the "Red Sea". Stay overnight in Ubon Thani.

Udon Thani – Nong Khai – Flight to Bangkok – Departure Having breakfast and depart in the morning to visit the Orchids farm. The owner of this farm gave birth to a variety of endemic orchid with a delicate fragrance in 1977: the Udon Sunshine. Continue to Nong Khai, a small border town with Laos. Visit Sala Kaew Ku, a park with sculptures inspired by Buddhism and Hindu deities, some of which are 25 meters high. Visit the picturesque market of Tha Sadet where there are products and crafts of Indochina, trading with Laos. Afternoon you return to Udon Thani for your flight to Bangkok. Tour ends!

tourName: 12-Day Highlights of Thailand Tour
placesVisited: Chiang Mai, Chiang Rai, Bangkok, Koh Samui, Phuket, Phang Nga Bay
generalInfo: Pearl-white beaches line crystal clear waters, magnificent mountains tower up from the earth, golden palaces glimmer under the sun, and grand temples share a wealth of insight. Award-winning restaurants cover the vibrant city streets, and coral reefs yearn to be explored. Thailand boasts many enchanting experiences across its diverse and tropical landscape. On this specially-curated, 12-day tour, you will explore some of the best sights and attractions that this country has to offer. Journey to the Land of Smiles and create memories that will last a lifetime as you uncover what makes this destination truly special and unique.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Mai – A Tranquil Arrival Amidst Nature
dayInfo.description: Thailand’s secluded beauty is best experienced in the Northern capital of Chiang Mai. The diverse landscape and isolated experiences make for an incredibly immersive and captivating stay. Upon your arrival, you will comfortably transfer to your lavish boutique resort that will be nestled at the base of Doi Suthep Mountain. Built into the mountain, your private will villa offer exceptional tranquility within nature. Picture-perfect vistas of the greater Chiang Mai area and first-class amenities make this your ideal destination to rest your head after your long flight into Thailand. You can relax in the private pool before fine dining at the distinguished resort restaurant to let the afternoon slowly slip into the evening.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Mai – A Soaring Tour in a Private Hot-Air Balloon
dayInfo.description: The morning may bring with it a spectacular sunrise that you cannot afford to miss, and there is no better way to witness it than from thousands of feet in the air while you overlook the sprawling landscape in the comfort of a private hot-air balloon. Your sky-high expedition will share magnificent vistas of the slowly rising sun as it lights up the surrounding region. You will capture incredible sights of the glimmering temples, majestic mountain ranges, and luscious hills before returning to land and celebrating with a glass of prestigious champagne. Your morning will continue in glorious fashion as you transfer to a leading, ethical elephant sanctuary. Underpinned by strong, sustainable values, the sanctuary highlights the importance of caring for our planet and the creatures that inhabit it. You will encounter the magnificent elephants up close as you spend time feeding and washing them. You will become in-tuned with the secrets of the jungle as well as these unique creatures. All of this will take place within an untamed jungle paradise, providing you with picturesque photo moments. Your day will culminate with an exquisite fine-dining experience that overlooks the city, and you will witness the sky illuminate as the sun sets beyond the horizon while you delight in your delectable Thai cuisine.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Mai – Share Stories with the Locals
dayInfo.description: The following day, you will journey via private coach to the neighboring city of Chiang Rai. Chiang Rai, a city off the beaten path, shares its serenity with those who are exploring the diverse wilderness and cultural landmarks for which it is famous. During your day trip to this destination, you will encounter traditional Thai living with a local hill tribe. Accompanied by your experienced tour guide, your day with the friendly locals will reveal fascinating insight into their authentic lifestyle. You will share delightful meals with the tribe and witness traditional Thai performances, and the spectacles will instill a great sense of admiration for the country’s heritage. Finish your inspiring day with a brisk hike up Doi Suthep Mountain once you have returned to Chiang Mai. Atop the mountain, you will encounter the world-renowned Wat Phra That Doi Suthep temple. The views from up here are immaculate, and the cave complex in which the temple is constructed will be a delight to explore. You will capture riveting memories of your bold adventure before returning down the mountain for marvelous meals.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok – Rise to the Clouds
dayInfo.description: Bangkok, the second stop on your tour, boasts many of Thailand’s essential highlights. The capital is known for its captivating cultural heritage and chic experiences. Your stay in the exuberant city will give you the opportunity to explore Thai authenticity in a luxury-orientated environment. Beyond the riveting activities that await, you will indulge in the magnificent cityscape and vibrant lifestyle that is ever-present. Upon your arrival, you will transfer to the city center. Here, you will check-in to your premier, 5-star hotel. From the striking skyscraper, you will have uninterrupted views of Bangkok’s surroundings, and your sophisticated, private room will serve as an idyllic escape after each day of your adventure. Fit with first-class amenities and professional staff, your stay will be nothing short of exceptional in every aspect. During your first evening, after an afternoon to acclimatize to the area, you will transfer to a prestigious rooftop bar. The towering bar will boast a 360-degree vista of the cityscape that you will enjoy over an award-winning, multiple course meal. The picture-perfect moments will prove that opulence in Bangkok leaves nothing to be desired.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok – Delve into a Cuisine of Tremendous Depth
dayInfo.description: The following day, you will further explore the magical tastes of Thailand. Your knowledgeable guide will meet you at your hotel for an in-depth food tour of the city. You will venture to coveted hotspots that are hidden throughout the city. From authentic culinary experiences with traditional local eateries to exquisite Michelin-starred meals that are accompanied by revered chefs, you will experience the best of both worlds on this tour. Each stop will provide you with the opportunity to meet the people behind the cuisine and gain the inside scoop of what makes this country’s food so special. Your prestigious chefs may even impart a few culinary secrets as a token of goodwill. These tips will come in handy throughout the rest of your day because shortly after, your private guide will transfer you to a world-famous cooking school within the city limits. Set amongst a natural backdrop and established within a traditional Thai building, your culinary classes will exude luxury while retaining charming authenticity. Over the course of the following few hours, an expert chef will train you in the mastered art of cooking Thai dishes. The magic of these meals will unfold before your eyes as you learn more about the enchanting culture. You will conclude your day of delightful delicacies with a gourmet, Thai meal that will be accompanied by traditional, dancing performances. The colorful show and exquisite food will spark immense joy, bringing the evening to a perfect close.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok – Trace Back Thailand’s Cultural Roots
dayInfo.description: Before setting off for your next destination, there will still be much to explore in Bangkok. Your final full day in the city will provide a wealth of insight into the country’s culture. Grand, golden temples will glimmer under the sunlight, and palaces will exude sheer beauty in all directions. As you tour the sacred grounds of Bangkok’s coveted temples, you will feel the historical atmosphere embrace you. The majesty of the multi-colored, imposing Wat Arun and the 150-foot golden Reclining Buddha can only be vaguely expressed in words. You will witness these incredible sites and capture the meticulously crafted age-old complexes in all their glory, and you will create unforgettable memories while you learn more about Thailand’s historical roots. Your cultural excursion will continue at the world-famous Jim Thompson House. Here, you can revel in the intricate blend of Western and Eastern architectural design as you uncover the history of the Thai silk industry and its rise to prominence in the Western fashion world. You will depart for Koh Samui the following morning with an expanse of knowledge into the country’s rich heritage.

dayInfo.title: Koh Samui – Experience Luxury on Sand and Sea
dayInfo.description: Koh Samui, Thailand’s second largest island, is an endearing destination and must-visit location during your tailor-made tour of the country’s highlights. The hotspot is home to an array of exclusive experiences that are perfectly suited for your luxurious stay in Thailand’s tropics. Stretching sands, coconut groves, and palm tree-lined cliffs will welcome you to its sunny shores. You will make your way to an exceptional resort, which is where you will experience ultimate opulence for the duration of your time on the island. Your private villa will be set amongst the green hills and will seamlessly blend into the natural surroundings. It offers absolute privacy amid a remarkably tranquil seaside setting. From your balcony, you can marvel at stunning views of your private beach, which will only be a short walk away. Fine dining at the resort’s stellar restaurant will bring your relaxing afternoon to a wonderful close.

dayInfo.title: Koh Samui – Island Hop to Idyllic Hideaway Spots
dayInfo.description: An atmosphere of peaceful serenity resonates from the island, and the experiences that have been handpicked for your journey are geared towards maximizing the leisure of your stay. On your first day, you will be swept away to incredible white-sand shores and snorkel crystal-clear waters as you explore the isolated islands off Koh Samui’s coast. Indulge in this luxurious, island hopping experience from the absolute comfort of a private yacht. You will capture memorable moments at untouched beaches and witness majestic sea life that resides in coral reefs. Furthermore, brief stops at the pivotal islands will reveal the country’s incredible wildlife, and you can leisurely traverse the rainforests in search of flowing waterfalls and magnificent creatures before boarding your cruiser and venturing back to your suite. To end your day, unwind at an award-winning restaurant that overlooks the azure ocean, sip on tasteful cocktails, and dine on outstanding local dishes as the setting sun illuminates the sky.

dayInfo.title: Koh Samui – Absorb an Island Steeped in Heritage
dayInfo.description: Beyond beautiful beaches and world-class cuisine, Koh Samui is known for its Buddhist background. Its cultural heritage is reflected in the stunning spiritual sites that genuinely showcase the country’s true ambiance and grandeur. The following day, your experienced guide will transfer you to these essential highlights. The tour will reveal the riveting allure of the island’s beloved temples as well as take you to the Secret Buddha Garden. Set on top of Pom Mountain, the serene garden will whisk you away from the crowds below. The hideaway location shares intriguing views of unique Buddhist sculptures that are set amongst the sweeping, green forest. You can absorb the invigorating energy as you reflect upon your splendid experience thus far, and to conclude your captivating stay, you will journey to an authentic fishing market later this afternoon where you can peruse the energetic night bazaar that is complete with hundreds of fascinating stalls and lean-tos. From mouthwatering traditional food to stunningly hand-crafted jewelry, there will be an abundance of wealth to explore. Afterward, you can settle down at an international restaurant for a global taste or authentic Thai dish that will satisfy your every craving before you make your way back to your luxurious accommodation for a peaceful night's sleep.

dayInfo.title: Phuket – Cherish an Evening Supper on the Lagoon
dayInfo.description: One of the Andaman Sea’s most coveted paradises, Phuket, is a short way from Koh Samui. The tropical destination, which is where you will spend a few days in complete grandeur, boasts a collection of pearly white beaches with sapphire seas. You will meet your private transfer shortly after your arrival and venture to the sought-after Laguna Beach area. This opulent, seaside location is home to one of the island’s most-beloved luxury resorts. Here, friendly and professional staff members will welcome you with smiles. They will usher you to your private villa that will be surrounded by thick greenery and sprawling seascapes. You will bask in the untamed beauty and gorgeous seclusion of your 5-star accommodation for the duration of your stay. You will spend your first evening soaking up the wonderful setting. You may jump-start your lavish relaxation with a well-deserved spa treatment at your resort’s premier wellness center. You will escape on a revitalizing journey as your experienced masseuse uses ancient Thai practices to work away any tension that you may have accumulated from your travels. To perfectly round off your evening, you will delight in gourmet Thai cuisine from the comfort of a private long-tailed boat. The cherishable experience will take you along the destination’s lagoon as your exclusive chef prepares incomparable meals right in front of you on the boat. The fine-dining experience may complete with remarkable sunset vistas that encompass the lagoon.

dayInfo.title: Phuket – Glide Across Phuket Island as a VIP
dayInfo.description: Totally immerse yourselves in Phuket on the following full day of adventurous exploration. You will your day from your resort with a delectable breakfast shortly before meeting your private transfer. You will witness the island’s charming countryside as you journey to a nearby heliport. Upon your arrival, a group of experienced pilots will welcome you and direct you to your comfortable VIP seats inside a well-kept helicopter. You will hover over immense mangroves, sweep past majestic limestone cliffs, fly by rural jungle settings, and circle the famous Big Buddha statue as you explore Phuket and Phang Nga Bay. These are only a few of the marvelous sights that you will treasure on this captivating sky cruise. In addition to the majestic sights that you will see, the feeling of flying through the gorgeous, Thai landscape will give you a feeling that you will be chasing for a lifetime. Later today, you will enjoy a delightful lunch in celebration of your stunning, sky-seeing exploits. In the afternoon, you will continue your exploration of the impressive island by boarding a luxurious speed boat and traversing the open waters of the Andaman Sea. All the while, your knowledgeable guide will share intriguing information about the archipelago and wondrous sea life. Your trip will take you to secluded beaches, far off the beaten track, where you may snorkel in search of precious creatures. You will create lifelong memories of wildlife sightings and relaxing, seaside ambiance during this day on the ocean.

dayInfo.title: Phuket – The Best of Phuket’s Allure
dayInfo.description: The following day, to conclude your stay in Phuket, you will discover the impressive cultural sites and environmental landmarks that are scattered around the island. Your private guide will ensure that your expedition is insightful and comfortable. You will visit immaculate Buddhist temples, striking monuments, and vivacious viewpoints as you uncover what makes the destination so special. At each stop, you will delve into the delightful tastes of Thai cuisine. From premier restaurants with sweeping ocean vistas to vibrant markets that exude local authenticity, you will experience some of the best sights and attractions of Phuket before departing Thailand.

tourName: 12-Day Thailand Immersion Vacation for Families
placesVisited: Chiang Mai, Bangkok, Pattaya, Hua Hin, Phuket, Koh Phi Phi
generalInfo: From seclusion amid the mountainous region of Northern Thailand to the tropical beauty that runs along the palm-tree-bordered, white-sand shores of Phuket, you and your family will revel in fun-filled adventures on this handcrafted tour to Thailand. You will encounter ornate temples, unspoiled natural wilderness, and vibrant coral reefs as you visit beloved destinations that are both sought-after and less traveled. You and your family will be thoroughly enthused throughout your expedition as you share captivating experiences throughout your immersive, 12-day stay.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Mai – Surreal Sweeping Vistas of Northern Thailand
dayInfo.description: Very rarely does one return home from a lavish family vacation in Thailand without exploring the famous city of Chiang Mai. It is a wonderfully rugged city that continues to retain an element of old-world charm. The destination’s appeal mainly stems from its sweeping landscape settings and striking mountains that tower over green forests. Moreover, the cultural heritage is masterfully reflected in the shimmering temples and significant landmarks that are sprawled across the city. Shortly after you and your family have landed in Thailand, you will meet your private transfer and head to your luxurious, boutique accommodation that will be nestled at the foot of Doi Suthep Mountain. You and your family will delight in the first-class and family-friendly amenities at this home away from home. A lavish poolside setting will look out over the stretching, green landscape below while expert chefs prepare gourmet cuisines that send tantalizing wafts of savory flavors through your resort. You will have a few hours to acclimatize to the area upon arrival. The locals’ friendly smiles and welcoming faces will have you at ease in no time. In the comfort of a luxurious private transfer, you will journey to significant cultural landmarks where your guide will share intriguing insight into Thailand’s heritage regarding the pivotal sites that are dotted around the city. Your tour will culminate at the top of Doi Suthep Mountain where the renowned Wat Phra That temple complex stands tall. A brisk hike to the top will reveal the most remarkable sunset vistas, and you will feel on top of the world as you witness the tangerine sky atop this striking mountain. Shortly following, you can encounter the majesty of the golden temple and explore the enticing cave complex in which the temple has been built. Your family will be thoroughly enthused, and you will conclude your day with fantastic Thai food at the resort’s premier restaurant.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Mai – Educational Encounters with Wildlife
dayInfo.description: The warm Thai sun will peek through your blinds, and the blissful sounds of untamed nature will greet you in the morning. Today, you will explore the wondrous wildlife that inhabits this fantastic location. Accompanied by a knowledgeable guide, you will venture to the surrounding countryside. The rural setting will exude a calming atmosphere, while enthralling activities provide a wealth of entertainment. Today, you will become more familiar with the creatures of Thailand as you visit an ethical elephant sanctuary. You and your family will be in complete awe as you experience up-close encounters with the magnificent mammals. All the while, you will capture stunning pictures of your family as they care for the creatures in their natural environment. You will return to your resort, feeling genuinely inspired by the educational expedition. In the afternoon, you will transfer to the local airport where you will board a plane and travel to Bangkok.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok – A Spectacular City Skyline
dayInfo.description: Bangkok shifts the tropical aura of Thailand to one of complete opulence. You will witness this drastic contrast as you land in the capital. From your private transfer, you will see towering skyscrapers and illuminating billboards that encompass the city limits. It will be an impressive display of first-world development in a country that is still firmly rooted in tradition. Here, luxury will be at the forefront of experiences, and your stay is tailored to exploring the grandest family-friendly adventures of the city. As a result, there is no shortage of authenticity in Bangkok, and there are uniquely captivating activities that pay homage to Thai culture, such as discovering the coveted temples, which are some of the most distinguished in the country. You will experience it all during your stay before resting your heads at a luxury hotel in the heart of the city. This exceptional accommodation will be fitted with world-class amenities, and your incredible private suite will share uninterrupted views of the bustling city. Professional staff will ensure you all feel most welcome throughout your stay.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok – Sacred Ornate Spiritual Complexes
dayInfo.description: The following day, you will venture on a riveting excursion to the revered temples of Bangkok where you can marvel at the sheer magnificence of these meticulously constructed buildings. Though adorned in gold and glimmering under the sun, a humble atmosphere will resonate from their sacred walls. Years of tradition and exceptional work resulted in the formation of these beloved buildings, and you will encounter the most significant temples, or Wats , during your tour. Each one is home to distinct monuments and statues that may take your breath away. Furthermore, your experienced guide will share valuable information about the country’s passionate devotion to spirituality. The insightfully educational tour will inspire you and your partner and entertain your children. Afterward, you will discover the secrets behind the world-renowned cuisines of Thailand. Your guide will usher you to prestigious restaurants along the vibrant streets where you can stop to sample delectable Thai delicacies and meet the incredible chefs behind the award-winning dishes. You and your family will revel in the flavors of Thai haute cuisine.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok – Discover a Mouthwatering Culinary Culture
dayInfo.description: You will begin your second day like you ended the last: by exploring the mouthwatering tastes of Thailand. You and your family will transfer to a leading culinary school where you will uncover the secrets behind famous Thai meals. With professional chefs to guide you and world-class equipment on hand, you and your family will find yourselves thoroughly immersed into the culinary scene as you prepare your expert dishes. The experience will be set inside a state-of-the-art kitchen within an immaculately-restored building. This will give you an immersive taste of what it is like to be a chef at a Michelin-style restaurant in Bangkok. You will continue your impressive adventure as you transfer to engaging museums throughout the city. You and your family will share in educational entertainment as you reveal the history of Thailand through captivating digital displays. Finally, you will round off your evening with a sunset dinner cruise along the Chao Phraya River. You will indulge in the gourmet meal as you witness unforgettable, panoramic views.

dayInfo.title: Pattaya – Unspoiled Natural Beauty in Thailand
dayInfo.description: While Pattaya is well-known for its fabulous nightlife, the renowned city is home to a wealth of family-friendly activities that you cannot afford to miss. Just a short drive from Bangkok, you will swiftly make your way to the city in the comfort of a luxurious coach. Along the way, you will witness the natural beauty of the countryside, and as you approach the city, the stretching green hills will give way to views of deep blue ocean and white, sandy beaches. Shortly afterward, you will find yourselves in a tropical, palm tree-lined destination that is part of the mainland, which will be your sign that you have arrived at your premier resort that overlooks the ocean. It will be a picture-perfect contrast to the bustling cityscape of Bangkok. Pattaya offers endless fun, and you will immerse yourselves in enthralling activities from the moment that you step foot in the amazing city. You will meet your private transfer and journey to the paradise of Nong Nooch Tropical Garden. Once a vast collection of fields, the garden has since been transformed into a vibrant flower haven. You and your family will weave your way through the park and encounter immaculately-kept plant life and monuments. With traditional architecture that blends seamlessly with the natural life, the destination is a horticulturalist’s dreams. There will be wonderful photo opportunities to delight in as you explore the orchid and succulent gardens as well as the various creative plant displays. Finally, you will culminate your nature experience with some of Pattaya’s finest vegetarian food at an award-winning restaurant.

dayInfo.title: Pattaya – Soar across the Rainforest Canopy
dayInfo.description: The following day, you will explore the incredibly engaging museums and art halls that are dotted around the city. The captivating displays will engage all of your senses and will spark a feeling of joyous fun for your whole family. Then, you will transfer to a truly unique jungle experience, which is where you will make your way to a thrilling zipline park in the Chonburi jungle. Harnessed into the zipline, you will soar across the rainforest canopy and witness nature from a completely different perspective. As the wind rips through your hair, you will witness the gorgeous forest and all of the indigenous flora and fauna that call this forest home. This expedition will bring your stay in Pattaya to an enthralling close, and you will top it all off with delectable dishes at a prestigious, seaside restaurant before resting in preparation for your day ahead.

dayInfo.title: Hua Hin – Emerald Beauty atop a Magnificent Mountain
dayInfo.description: Hua Hin is another immensely popular seaside town that is located across the Gulf of Thailand from Pattaya. You will comfortably make your way across the open waters on a regal cruise liner, where you can enjoy the fantastic ocean views as you approach Hua Hin’s thriving shores. The former fishing village has become one of the most sought-after destinations in Thailand. This is as a result of an influx of fashionable development for the purpose of creating an enchanting escape from the bustle of the mainland. Here, you will settle into your exceptionally prestigious resort with remarkable views and world-class amenities. You can spend your first afternoon exploring the town’s grand palaces and beautiful buildings. Then, in the evening, you will transfer to the famous Khao Takiab Mountain for unforgettable sunset views. The hilltop temple is home to a troop of monkeys, an old-world-styled bell, and a magnificent shrine, and your journey to the top will be as leisurely as it is beautiful.

dayInfo.title: Hua Hin – Discover a Hidden Cave worth Sharing
dayInfo.description: The following day, you will explore the beloved Phraya Nakhon Cave. Shrouded in myth and mystery, this rarely seen location is a must-visit treat for a once-in-a-lifetime experience. With the help of your dedicated tour guide, you will brave a thrilling adventure in search of the marvelous green and gold pavilion that is hidden away in the cave. The journey will be well worth it as this is one of the few sights that others will not have the luxury of exploring. Later this evening, you will transfer to Hua Hin’s exclusive shopping district in search of exquisite keepsakes to take back home with you. The luxurious retail destination will be the perfect place to spoil your family before heading to your final destination of Phuket. You will conclude your impressive stay with a luxury spa treatment at a prestigious wellness center the following morning where you can completely unwind as you revel in a traditional Thai massage. This will perfectly culminate your stay in marvelous fashion.

dayInfo.title: Phuket – Secluded Slice of Heaven
dayInfo.description: Last but certainly not least is your adventure in Phuket, which is a tropical island paradise on the Andaman Sea. Renowned for its postcard beaches and sophisticated resorts, the island shares uninterrupted leisure at every corner. You will settle into your ultra-chic resort that overlooks the crystal-clear waters of the Andaman Sea. At the foot of your door, your private penthouse will offer charming vistas of the sprawling white sand beach. It will be a secluded slice of heaven, which will be perfect for the remainder of your opulent family holiday in Thailand. With a gourmet dining establishment within your resort, you will end your day in style as you tuck into delicious dishes and lounge around the pristine pool.

dayInfo.title: Phuket – Explore the Magic under the Sea
dayInfo.description: On your first full day in Phuket, you will meet your private ocean guide and board a luxurious speed boat. You and your family will venture to world-class hideaway beaches that hug the expansive coastline. Your children will have a blast as they play in the white sand and wade in the cool waters. Equipped with snorkels, you can dip into the sea and search for the unique creatures that inhabit the vast ocean. Against the rugged cliff edges of the bay, you may encounter picturesque coral reefs that are teeming with sea life. If you are lucky, you can swim with schools of fish and capture images of octopuses as they traverse the depths of the sea. The wondrous experience will be supplemented by an incredible seaside lunch that awaits you after your swim. You will delight in the lavish lunch spread with seaside views before returning to your luxurious accommodation later this afternoon. For sunset, you will jump on horseback and trek across the soft, sandy beach, where you will feel at one with nature as you trot across the unspoiled landscape and soak in the endearing sights.

dayInfo.title: Phuket – Visit the Colorful Island of Koh Phi Phi
dayInfo.description: Your final day in Thailand will leave nothing to be desired, and you will meet your private speed boat transfer and venture to Phuket’s famous neighboring island of Koh Phi Phi. The dreamlike destination boasts some of the finest beaches in the country, and as you traverse the open waters, you will feel the breeze flow through your hair and brush briskly upon your face. Soon, you will enter Phi Phi bay where magnificent limestone cliffs and palm tree-lined beaches welcome you. You will venture past the tourist hotspots in search of secluded paradises that are off the beaten track. Your knowledgeable guide will know just where to travel for a private and thrilling snorkeling expedition. You will find yourselves comfortably settled on secret beaches with picture-perfect coral reefs as you create lifelong memories and play games in the sand. You will return home later today for an elaborate and fun-filled Thai performance before setting off for a local performance at a cultural theme park. The experience will be one-of-a-kind, perfectly capturing Thai tradition in flamboyant and colorful fashion. This show will bring your Thai adventure to an end, and tonight you will rest your heads feeling completely content. The following day, you will enjoy one last Thai breakfast before transferring to the airport and making your way back home.

tourName: 14-Day Cultural Tour of Thailand’s Islands
placesVisited: Koh Phi Phi, Koh Lanta, Krabi Town, Phang Nga Bay, Phuket, Koh Yao Yai, Railay
generalInfo: Explore Thailand’s cultural character, dynamic culinary scene, and captivating history during this handcrafted 14-day tour across the Andaman Sea. Travel to the velvety shores of fabled locations to absorb the diverse aspects of local life and to wallow in the majesty of premier palm tree-lined beaches. Encounter the delectable cuisine, beloved museums, and humble villages.

dayInfo.title: Phuket – Appreciate the Seascape
dayInfo.description: To begin your trip, you will land in Phuket, and a private driver will greet and transfer you to your accommodation. Your accommodation will provide you with world-class amenities for moments of leisurely retreat between day trips. You may spend your first evening unwinding from your long journey in glamorous style by sipping on tasteful cocktails and delving into Thai cuisine. The following day will allow you to snorkel over the luminescent coral reefs or to relax on hammocks under the shade of palm trees.

dayInfo.title: Phuket – The Island Culture
dayInfo.description: Today, you will tour cultural landmarks across the island. Chaperoned by an experienced guide, you will witness the bustling scenes that typify Phuket’s local lifestyle. First, you will arrive at the base of the hallowed Big Buddha statue before continuing to a few more of the island’s iconic temples. Your journey will conclude along the vibrant Thalang Road, which is in one of the island’s ancient districts. You can then peruse dignified exhibits at memorialized museums, where you will begin to uncover Phuket’s intriguing timeline of significant events.

dayInfo.title: Koh Yao Yai – World-Class Thai Massage
dayInfo.description: This morning, you will be whisked away across the Andaman to a boutique resort that blends into the sunbaked jungle and overlooks the beach. After your sea transfer, you will settle into your accommodation. You may even spoil yourself with a world-class spa treatment at the resort’s exalted center. Signature specials performed by highly experienced masseuses will invigorate your entire body and senses. After your massage, you will have the rest of the evening to spend at your leisure.

dayInfo.title: Koh Yao Yai – Thailand’s Fishing Culture
dayInfo.description: After breakfast, your guide will lead you on a tour that will reveal the time-honored traditions of Thailand’s humble fishing culture. When you arrive at the village on the ivory-colored banks of an isolated beachfront, you will converse with friendly locals. You will then venture to lush coconut groves and rubber plantations, where you will learn more about their importance as a source of sustainable nourishment for the locals. Afterward, you will transfer to your accommodation, where you can indulge in another spa treatment or relax on the beach.

dayInfo.title: Koh Yao Yai – James Bond Island
dayInfo.description: Your final day in Koh Yao Yai will have you sailing across the Andaman Sea on a private yacht to Phang Nga Bay. Specifically, you will visit James Bond Island, which was featured in the 007 franchise. Your captain will prepare kayaks for closer encounters with the wilderness highlights, allowing you to paddle over the reefs and through hidden caves. You will then arrive at an isolated lagoon. Your voyage will draw to a close when the sun begins to set. As you sail back to your accommodation, you can indulge in a Thai dinner on the boat.

dayInfo.title: Koh Phi Phi – Phi Phi’s Staggering Hilltop
dayInfo.description: After breakfast, you will transfer to Koh Phi Phi’s white-sand beaches. When you arrive, you can unpack your things before strolling along the electrifying pathways that weave their way through the island. You will then amble through to a hiking trail that winds its way to the tallest peak on Phi Phi. This brisk hike will lead you to the mountain’s summit, where you will have a 360-degree view of the island. You will descend back to Koh Phi Phi and have the remainder of the evening at your leisure.

dayInfo.title: Koh Phi Phi – Scuba Dive to Surreal Sites
dayInfo.description: Koh Phi Phi is a particularly popular destination for discovering Thailand’s marine life because it boasts an assortment of esteemed scuba diving destinations. Today, you will partake in a diving expedition off the coast of Koh Phi Phi. You will set sail from the docks and arrive at practice diving destinations, where you will learn to master your diving under the close supervision of your experienced instructors. Once you get the hang of it, you can dive deeper into the depths of Koh Phi Phi’s coveted scuba locations.

dayInfo.title: Railay – The Archaic Caves of Krabi
dayInfo.description: Today, you will transfer to Railay, which is a tropical island-style destination that is home to mesmerizing landmarks, breathtaking scenes, and treasured sites. Shortly after you have arrived, you will venture to the shores of Phra Nang Beach to bask in the sunshine and Diamond Cave. Afterward, you will transfer back to your accommodation as the sun begins to dip below the horizon. Tonight, you will watch the sunset from the vantage point of the sea.

dayInfo.title: Railay – Traditional Thai Cuisine
dayInfo.description: Today, you will be completely submerged in the cultural highlights of Railay and the greater Krabi region. First, you will visit an endearing market. Accompanied by an expert chef, you will weave your way to modest stalls of delicious fare. You will then transfer to a cooing school, where you will have the opportunity to learn the secrets behind the country’s revered dishes with the help of your culinary mentor. The afternoon will lead you to a fish farm to learn about sustainable initiatives that are practiced by the locals.

dayInfo.title: Koh Lanta – Beaches and Markets
dayInfo.description: After breakfast, you will transfer to the island of Koh Lanta. After you have settled in to your accommodation, you can check out the stunning beaches, which are imbued with a peaceful and tropical aura. The remainder of the day will be at your leisure before the following day provides you with a day of tropical bliss. A trip to the night market will spotlight the culinary staples of the region.

dayInfo.title: Koh Lanta – Explore the Old Town
dayInfo.description: After breakfast, you will venture to Koh Lanta’s Old Town, which is a tranquil hamlet that embraces its traditional heritage. During your time here, you may be invited into a local family home to enjoy a meal around their dining table. With the help of your bilingual guide, you will have the one-of-a-kind opportunity to connect with the locals and discover more about their way of life. The evening will be yours to enjoy at your leisure.

dayInfo.title: Krabi – Departure
dayInfo.description: You will have some free time before transferring to the international airport for your flight home.

tourName: Adventures in Thailand Tour: Bangkok, Kanchanaburi, Chiang Mai & Doi Inthanon
placesVisited: Bangkok, Â Kanchanaburi, Chiang Mai, Â Pai, Â Mae Hong Son, Â Mae Sariang
generalInfo: Follow that path that takes you away from the cityscape and along the cultural villages on this custom tailored tour through the diverse world of Thailand. Make your way from the opulent architecture and history of Bangkok to the celebrated but hidden tribes in the northern jungle. Traverse the tremendous landscape that stretches over mountains and tumbles down waterfalls. From contemporary war museums to tea plantations, an emerald Buddha relic to Long Neck hill tribes, you will take the jungle road and find the indelible splendor of a lesser-travelled path.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok - Finding the Path
dayInfo.description: The streets of Bangkok are paved with culture and modernity, running the depths of bustling to peaceful, towering skyscrapers to trickling waters. Arrive at the airport and be taken to your accommodation within the heart of the city by a private transfer. The city’s vibrancy is immediate, all encompassed within the stunning shapes of the sky and the rich scents that emanate along the walkways. Coconut oil sizzles and drifts along the wide paths. You can see the gentle rush of the Chao Phraya River beside the rising luxuries of your hotel. Settle into the city with a taste of Thailand while the remarkable reaches of Bangkok calm around you. Have a seat at the Arun Residence giving you a glowing view of the Temple of Dawn across the water, and highlighting the historic river highway draped in the aroma of fresh spice and herbs simmering in the evening light.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok - The Road To Royals
dayInfo.description: There is an endless mystique to the morning air as you wake up to the luscious aromas of fresh-squeezed orange juice and sweet pineapple. After breakfast, you will find the splendor of the most historic highway in the city, the Chao Phraya River. The history of the water is displayed on its shores where you can find rising temple spires, opulent hotels, vibrant cultural boats, and the lavish grounds of the Grand Palace. The grounds were built in the late 18th century and have housed the royal family with intricate details woven into the architecture. The inner court resembles the structure of a small city, with designs inspired by the European architecture, from large windows to the baroque façade; however, the roof has remained quintessentially Thai. The manicured gardens lend an herbaceous scent to the air as you venture into the Temple of the Reclining Buddha, known locally as Wat Pho. The gold-leafed Buddha lounges over 45 feet high and over 129 feet long. There is opulence in the decoration but tranquility within the hall itself as the image overlooks with the gallery in the nirvana pose. In the morning, you can hear the harmonious chants of monks in dedicated piety echoing amongst the pillared interior.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok - The Deep Roads of Thailand
dayInfo.description: The morning rises over the river and glistens off of the spire of the Temple of Dawn in the distance. In the early hours of the day, you will find yourself in the rush of the Floating Market at Damnoen Saduak. The aroma of the market is immediate, filled with fresh produce, from bananas to jackfruit, giving a creamy and semi-sweet scent to the air. The atmosphere is vivacious, as people on the riverbank shout to vendors on long-tail boats—their vessels almost overflowing with fruit and vegetables, seafood, and flowers. Over the exuberant crowd of locals that come to do their daily shopping, you can hear the sizzle of woks frying up coconut and bananas, prawns, and more. The vendors place the food within a bag, hook the bag to a long stick, and guide the sumptuous cuisine to the happy patron. In the early afternoon, you will come to the peaceful town of Kanchanaburi known for its quiet river that was once home to egregious Japanese occupants during World War II. The movie The Bridge Over River Kwai highlighted the contemporary history of the town whose beauty was once overshadowed by its past. The JEATH War Museum gives a remarkable account of the city, the soldiers, and the Prisoners of War during the city’s occupation. JEATH stands for Japan, America, Australia, Thailand, and Holland, which represents the nationalities of all prisoners, and more, who were forced to work on the railroad system meant carve through the treacherous pass into Burma. Found within the temple Wat Chai Chumphon, the current Chief Abbot is responsible for the museum’s upkeep, from the bamboo stages to the photos documenting the infamous project. The river is calm and gentle, forging the stunning countryside, reminding locals and visitors of the promising future that can arise from a questionable past.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Mai - Within the Jungle’s Trail
dayInfo.description: In the morning light, you can see the city come to life, the streets churning with energy with open shops, active locals, and the scent of coriander and coconut never far away. After breakfast, you will have a private transfer to the airport where a brief flight will carry you to the largest northern city in Thailand, Chiang Mai. The city itself is the second-largest city in Thailand, situated within an open circle of jungle beneath the elegant summit of Doi Suthep. The pace feels calmer than Bangkok. The surrounding mountain charm, from rising lush greenery to cooler air, makes the expansive streets feel more like a town, while the colonial fortress within the historic center of the city makes the past more palpable. Along the summit of Doi Suthep, you will come to the fabulous temple where over 300 steps, flanked by colorful serpents, will guide you to the lower terrace of the stunning religious center that overlooks the cityscape. The bells that surround the lower promenade are rung by pilgrims in search of good luck, filling the mountaintop with a delightful song all beneath the gaze of the great chedi built in the 16th century.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Mai - The Northern Route
dayInfo.description: The jungle outside of Chiang Mai is lavish, with dense greenery that seems to open and close to its surroundings along the rolling hilled horizon. Make your way out of the city and into the countryside, finding yourself in the cozy charm of Pai. The cosmopolitan town is wrapped around close knitting of main streets surrounded by the open countryside. The illustrious canyon opens the forest and has amassed trails throughout the area while the narrow path of Pam Bok Falls filters the rushing water down into the cooling pool below. In the evening the streets come to life with enthusiasm for the local cuisine, open through vibrant restaurants, and the nightly burst of street food beginning at 6 pm. The scent of the city quickly turns to that of rich food, from crispy fried savory pancakes to skewered beef accompanied by a tangy, spicy sauce. Your first day along the Mae Hong Son route will surely be a tasty delight.

dayInfo.title: Mae Hong Son - The Pathway to the Countryside
dayInfo.description: The sensations of Thailand’s countryside aren’t confined to wildlife but are also found in its landscapes, especially in the north. Today you will make your way out of Pai and venture through the wondrous scenery en route to Mae Hong Son, arriving at the sensational caves of Tham Lot. The magnificent and ancient cave system creates an exotic subterranean world filled with mystique, from natural beauty to ancient findings of carved wooden coffins and pottery. Venture onto a raft to traverse the brook the meanders through the caverns filled with over half of a mile of stalactites and stalagmites. The limestone drips and spikes, looking as though it has melted and frozen in place. The boats are flat and long, guided by a local villager who takes you through the dripping earth beneath the mountain. Each splash of water echoes and every word you whisper carries. After your tour of the cave, you will arrive at the small city of Mae Hong Son for which the path through the mountains is named. For a grand introduction to the city, you can visit Wat Doi Kong Mu, the temple situated atop the mountain that overlooks the valley. Mountains climb over one another in the distance while the city sits peacefully below. The temple itself is an immaculate construct of white chedis and sits over 770 feet above the surrounding countryside. Look between the Burmese styled lions for a fantastic view of the secluded city.

dayInfo.title: Mae Aw - Borders and Peoples
dayInfo.description: Outside of the provincial capital, you will come to the city of Mae Aw, a Chinese outpost situated along the Myanmar border and brimming with a unique culture. On your way to the outpost, you will come across lush and clean riverside villages belonging to Shan communities, such as Mok Champagne. The local Shan people live on the border of Thailand and Myanmar and cultivate various crops within the fertile land that they inhabit. The fresh greenery gives a simple earthen aroma to the air. Shaggy water buffalo graze the idyllic scenery, helping the Shan with their farming to produce sesame, while Mae Aw is surrounded by tea plantations brought over from China in 1949 by people fleeing communist rule. Whether sipping the locally brewed tea while overlooking the border crossing to Myanmar or sitting in the lap of comfort at Pang Un, a popular getaway for Thai people in search of forested peace, picture-perfect villages of bamboo houses, and the tranquil sounds of nature, you will come to a day filled with picturesque countryside and cultural splendor.

dayInfo.title: Mae Sariang - The Pathway to the Hillside
dayInfo.description: The hillsides of the north hold the secret cultures that have inhabited the mountainous forests for centuries. Whether nomadic or stationary, the lavish jungle and rich soil have provided shelter and sustenance to numerous ethnic tribes. The variety of villages in the area shows the diverse cultures that have been able to survive with the expansion of countries, cities, and technology, including the famous Kayan, the Longneck tribes of northern Thailand. The brass rings are placed around the women’s neck beginning at a young age, increasing with their years. The villages are colorful, filled with the vibrant shinning textiles that are often made locally by hand. Many homes display blankets and shirts, bags and spices woven and reaped within the village, most often within that person’s home. The scenery stretches from along the mountainside to the waterway below, glistening like a mirror. In the late afternoon, you will arrive in Mae Sariang ready to relax in the temperate evening.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Mai - Turning Around the Path
dayInfo.description: The morning drapes over the landscape brining the outer reaches of hillside terraces covered with rice. The climbing tiers of the mountainside create a precise image from your imagination, almost curving through the foothills and texturing the valley. There is an endless wonder to the landscape whether just outside of town or stopping in Doi Inthanon National Park to overlook the surrounding scenery of Thailand’s northern jungle and its highest peak at over 7,600 feet. A lookout brings you to the serene edges of the vista with a panorama over an evergreen cloud forest known not just for the rising trees but the blanket of clouds that come and go throughout the day in a marvelous display of natural beauty. As you make your way along the winding mountainous roads of the Mae Hong Son Loop you will arrive back in Chiang Mai in the early evening ready for the comforts of the big city with the luxuries of quaint charming ambiance.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Mai - Along Diverse Paths
dayInfo.description: The day brings with it the unforgettable scents of coconut and pineapple, filling the air with luxurious freshness. Soon you will have a private transfer the airport to begin your journey home but for the moment you can delight in breakfast and remember your treasured vacation along with Thailand’s diverse culture and varied landscapes. From rivers to mountains, waterfalls to wildlife, you have experienced the history and hill tribes, luxuries, and mountaintops that bring Thailand’s variety of past, present, and future to life. Thailand vacations can always be extended or customized. Browse the Thailand tour reviews for ideas and traveler reviews.

tourName: Amazing Family Vacation to Thailand
placesVisited: Bangkok, Ayutthaya, Kanchanaburi
generalInfo: Family comes first on this custom tailored family vacation that will take you through the best of Bangkok and its surroundings, meant for anyone and everyone that has ever wanted to whisk the family to a fabulous getaway. Whether you’re in search of wildlife or city life, temples or palaces, museums or boating, this tour has everything that you will need to ensure that the family that travels together laughs together. From the banks of the Chao Phraya River to the glistening ruins in Ayutthaya and the gilded spires of the Palace complex, your family will praise you and your Thailand vacation will relax you, where all you have to do is get up and go.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok - Strengthening Ties
dayInfo.description: Welcome to Bangkok, the capital of Thailand and the beginning of your luxurious family vacation. The city has become one of the most well-known metropolis’s in the world, where the culture and history of the country is alive and well beneath the fabulous high-rises that decorate the skyline. Secret niches are what make Bangkok such a diverse and joyous city to explore, where the fresh food reaches out of cafes, jovial people stroll the walkways, and the fun of the city never seems to stop. Whether traversing the shops on Sukhumvit Road or relaxing in the hidden neighborhood of Banglampoo, there is always more to see. You are taken to your sensational hotel by a private transfer, allowing you to settle into the hustle of the metropolis before embarking on your first experience of the city. Meet your guide before arriving at the fabulous Erawan Shrine. The Brahman shrine was erected in the 1950s where a hotel was once supposed to have also been constructed. The crowds that comes to pay respects to the shrine is endless, bringing people from around the world all waiting to see the gilded gods, including Than Tao Mahaprom, whose four faces represent, mercy, kindness, sympathy, and impartiality. Against the backdrop of colorful and glistening textiles, the idol continues to shine. The bright yellow flowers are offerings from people paying their respects. It not only gives a vibrant hue to the already vivacious shrine, but adds a floral aroma to the air.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok - The Many Poses of Buddha
dayInfo.description: The morning brings with it the many flavors of Thailand, from the fresh fruits to the fresh juices, where the luscious scent of coconut milk drifts through the hotel; the sweet tartness of fresh squeezed orange juice is always appealing. Today you board a boat and drift along the famous Chao Phraya River, once the most used highway in the entire city. As you float along the gentle waters of the river you can see the impressive expanse of the city, where the skyscrapers peak into the clouds in the distance. Closer on the shores you see thin, towering spires as you make your way to the Grand Palace. The palace complex was built in 1762, and now stands as a symbol of the Royal Family’s residence made up of several buildings, halls, and pavilions. It is easy to be swept up in the Palace’s magnificence, including the charm of the simple structures, such as Phra Thinang Sanam Chan . The traditional Thai pavilion is decorated with red roofs and yellow fringe. The wooden pediments contain gilded carvings while the glass mosaics are arranged in floral designs that boast both Western and Eastern influences. Continue to the sensational temple of Wat Pho where you can witness both the enrapturing culture and inspiring statue of the Reclining Buddha. Located behind the marvelous Temple of the Emerald Buddha, Wat Pho is one of the largest temples in Bangkok and houses an image over 130 feet long, completely covered in gold leaf. The gentle aroma of incense fills the hall. The serene room gives a relaxed atmosphere to experience the splendor of the statue, the sculptural feat and dedication. His feet are textured with images, including footprints that swirl around the toes and 108 different panels that explain the various symbols by which Buddha can be identified, from flowers to tigers, and more. As the day winds down you will board your longboat and return to your hotel, getting ready for an evening of traditional Thai dancing that gives shows the rich culture of a storied history.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok - A Farmer’s Market
dayInfo.description: The endless wonders of Thailand stretch far beyond Bangkok, where the culture and traditions are continually practiced and enrich the modern cities, and allure its visitors. Best visited in the earlier morning, the family will be awash with wonderment as you witness the tremendous life at the Floating Market of Damnoen Saduak. Long-tail boats swarm the river as cheerful and excited voices echo on its banks. There looks to be an endless amount of boats, each one filled with produce and freshly cooked food, from coconuts to bananas, pineapple to jackfruit. The aromas are delicious and embracing. A woman carves a coconut in front of you. You can hear the crackle of another person frying eggs. Every boat contains another vibrant color and powerful flavor, where the only urge you have to fight is buying everything. Samut Songkhram is the coconut plantation district where the fields of lush crop stripe the sky. The sweet scent of coconut milk surrounds the district. You can watch the locals demonstrate how to make coconut sugar. Although sugar cane and brown sugar have all but replaced the coconut sugar, you can imagine the enhanced curry, or the sweet tea, just by the way the fragrance of the drying fruit beckons you. As you come closer to Bangkok you can see the remarkable salt farms that stretch along the marshes. Pools of water are partitioned, eventually evaporating leaving salt ready for the harvest. You can see men and women piling the white mounds into woven baskets, balancing the harvest around their shoulders, and carrying it to the storeroom.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok - To Ayutthaya Where Ancients Live
dayInfo.description: Follow the road outside of town on a day trip that will acquaint you with the fabulous history of Thailand within the treasured city of Ayutthaya. The city was once the capital of Siam for over 400 years and was abandoned after the Burmese were able to overtake the city in the 18th century. Share in the history of the Bang Pa-In Royal Palace, known as the Summer Palace, constructed in the early 17th century. The stunning Chinese Pavilion is one of the most opulent structures in a complex made of lavish architecture, mixing the best of both East and West. Past the goddess statue on the bridge, where the intricate leaves shade the woman from the sun, the stunning greens, yellows and reds of the pavilion shine over the glassy lake. The spire reaches into the sky while the porticos are built restricting, climbing over one another and into the base of the pinnacle. Enter the Ayutthaya Historical Park where the heart of the ancient city lies. The open courtyard brings you to the base of multiple chedis , rounded temple basins, decorating the open space of the ancient site. The rough stones have darkened with age but the magnificent stature remains. Stairs reach into the heightened entrances; the spires are coiled into constricting circles, as various pagodas sit parallel like guardians of the city’s history. Look within the trees to find the famed head of Buddha wrapped in the dangling vines. No one is sure how the head became entwined in the tree but the majesty of the incident has not been ignored and, due to its elegance, will never be forgotten.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok - Along Wild Lines
dayInfo.description: A short distance outside of the boisterous streets of Bangkok is the city of Kanchanaburi, located along the riverbanks and known for more than just the setting of the movie, “Bridge Over River Kwai.” The city feels more like a village with a sleepy river running through. The air is warm and the trees are plentiful. You can hear the gentle trickle of the water lingering in the air. The sleepy quality of the city is a wonderful reprieve from the hurried air of Bangkok. As the stories of World War II reach further into global history the lesser-known pasts of Kanchanaburi are coming to light. A visit to the Death Railway Museum is an interesting way to witness the history of the city, international troops, and the way that the past can be remembered. Around 61,000 Allied prisoners were transferred to the city throughout the war for the purpose of building a railway for the Japanese from Bangkok, Thailand to Rangoon, Myanmar. The museum houses many photos and personal stories from prisoners of war that give greater detail to the tragedies that befell the area. There is a small stretch of railway known as Hellfire Pass that you can walk through, giving you a spine tingling view of the scene from the stories within the museum.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok - Ready to Stay
dayInfo.description: Your family ties have been tightened during your time in and around Bangkok, where the luxuries of history and the wonder of the wilds have been brought into the open for you to explore and discover. Today you will have one last private transfer to the airport where you will board your flight home. There will always be more to explore in Thailand, where your family can traverse the jungles and riverbanks of the countryside; however, you know that your time in Bangkok has brought you the vacation you desired. The fun and mystique were endless, bringing the family together, closer, and happier. Read the reviews of Thailand tours for additional ideas on how to customize your trip. Also consider adding on to your seven days in Thailand.

tourName: Amazing Island Tour of Thailand: Koh Samui, Koh Tao & Khao Luang
placesVisited: Koh Samui, Koh Tao, Nakhon Si Thammarat, Khao Luang National Park
generalInfo: The sparkling blue of the island water brings an unimaginable color to light on this custom tailored tour through Thailand and its eastern islands. From the diverse landscapes of Koh Samui to the elegant national park along the South China Sea, you will find the natural grandeur of the coastline swimming beneath the sea while the remarkable greenery of the jungle houses celebrated elephants and tigers. Thailand luxury tours mean spending your days reveling in the sand, exploring in the trees, and discovering just how incredible island life can be.

dayInfo.title: Koh Samui – An Island Welcome
dayInfo.description: Welcome to Koh Samui, Thailand’s second largest island, filled with both the luxury of urban living and the splendor of an island paradise. The Gulf of Thailand shimmers a light blue that shifts colors with the tide. You will be met at the airport in Chaweng by a private transfer and taken to your lavish accommodation which overlooks the pristine coastline. The beaches range from soft sand to marvelous boulders jutting out into the water. There is an aroma of natural sweetness from palm trees and coconuts strewn around and within the cityscape. The island is a collection of cosmopolitan lifestyle and seclusion, where the city offers sensational restaurants and the beaches offer comfort away from the energetic rush of the city streets. The lush and dense greenery at the center of the island is ripe jungle, filling so much of the empty space; whether vivacious trees or glistening beaches, you will find the ambience of the island embracing, giving you the best of every and any world imaginable.

dayInfo.title: Koh Samui – Beauty and the Beach
dayInfo.description: The morning sun springs off the water bringing brilliant light to the colors of the sea. Often you can see the coloration differ between the shallow water and the deep water brimming with coral. After breakfast you will have the day to explore one of the most gorgeous beaches in Thailand, where the water and sand, the rocks and the wake combine for a unique and delightful landscape at Lamai. Whether letting sun drape over you while the warm sand creates a comfortable mattress below or visiting the Hin Ta and Hin Yai , there are endless possibilities. Hin Ta and Hin Yai are fabulous rock formations that capture the essential diversity of the island’s natural grandeur. The rocky outcrop has been shaped and smoothed by the elements and time rising over the luscious water and pristine sand in what has been dubbed Grandpa (Ta), and Grandma (Yai) rocks, due to their particular shapes, guarded by the surrounding formation. Locals give credence to the rocks’ shapes based on an island legend that continues to grace the rocks, the beach, and the ethos. If the sunshine hasn’t already lulled you into a relaxed state beside the water you can journey up to Lamai Overlap Stone, a series of boulders that can be seen protruding from the jungle-clad mountain. The arduous hike will reward you with a view of the island’s eastern shore and the sensational look of the boulders that seems to have been pressed together like puzzle pieces rather than rocks.

dayInfo.title: Koh Samui – A Different Kind of Park
dayInfo.description: The beauty in and around Koh Samui is endless, lifting through the trees and stretching out deep into the horizon with colors that would seem unimaginable if you weren’t witnessing them first hand. The aroma of breakfast is sweet, filled with fresh fruits, from succulent rambutan to sumptuous fresh coconut. After a relaxing start to your morning you will brave the sea on a tour of the remarkable Ang Thong National Marine Park, consisting of 42 islands that create an opulent archipelago. A full day tour will have you meandering through the tremendous limestone karsts that climb through the water and into the air like natural skyscrapers. The landscape is inescapably brilliant, and noted in the novel The Beach , by Alex Garland. On Koh Mae, which means Mother Island, you can journey inland to find a saltwater lagoon known as Emerald Lake. The water tends to glow as if carved from a collection of emerald stones, sitting against limestone cliffs which are overrun with wild brush. At the top of the nearby peak you can see how much the lagoon shines in the daylight. Journey from island to island where the stretch of sand and rocky hills never look the same and are never less than incredible, including the dramatic rock arch off of Koh Sam Sao.

dayInfo.title: Koh Tao – Turtle Island
dayInfo.description: The early light washes over Koh Samui and brings a calm energy to the day. Soon a private transfer will take you to the port where you will climb aboard a ferry that will have you on the shore of Koh Tao in no time. The cool breeze brushes through your hair as you look out over the picturesque islands that speckle the water. Koh Tao means Turtle Island and was named so for the abundance of turtles that were found along the coast and shores. There is an immediate difference to the island’s atmosphere than that of Koh Samui. Although the streets around the port can be lively, the island feels more relaxed, a slower pace among the jungle filled mountains, but the natural gorgeousness of Koh Tao is as prevalent, if not more so. The island is known as one of the best places to learn how to scuba dive, its waters filled with glistening coral reefs and a haven for the harmless but heartbeat raising sharks. Your private transfer will have you comfortable in your beachside accommodations shortly, overlooking the calm sea where charming fishing boats travel in the distance.

dayInfo.title: Koh Tao – Into the Water
dayInfo.description: The day is at your leisure to enjoy and explore Koh Tao. There are endless delights to experience on the island, whether relaxing above or below the water. You could take the opportunity to traverse the rich waters on a full day diving excursion. The sea in the Gulf of Thailand is brimming with exotic tropical fish and effervescent coral reefs. In the morning you will be guided through the steps, from equipment to hand signals, even how to properly disembark the boat. Once within the water you will find yourself on an underwater tour through a world not many get to see. Stingrays glide through the water and float as if their body were made to fly. Light pierces the surface and can shine to almost 200 feet below. Oftentimes you can see a turtle’s natural grace up close as it swims beside the fishes, along the dazzling yellows and oranges of the reefs. Although the grandeur of the islands can be tremendous, the world below, one that moves with fluidity and color, is truly captivating. If you prefer to stay above the sea’s surface you could pass part of the day at the Trapeze School, feeling the breeze on your cheeks and the wind at your back as you learn how to glide effortlessly through the air instead of beneath the waves.

dayInfo.title: Koh Samui – Mesmerizing Coastlines
dayInfo.description: It is often hard to leave Koh Tao, filled with its natural wonder and bursting with hiking opportunities through jungle mountains and surrounded by worlds of coral and aquatic life. After breakfast you will return to the luxurious island of Koh Samui where the comforts and allure of the various beaches and expansive jungle await. On the northern coast of the island sits the splendor of Wat Phra Yai, known for the shimmer of its over 76 foot tall golden seated Buddha that has watched over the island since the early 1970s. You many have noticed it upon first arriving to the island. You can see devout locals offering fresh fruits and flowers to the statue, leaving their gifts at the base or lighting incense that fills the air with a simple spice. You follow the staircase, flanked by colorful dragons protecting the temple from spirits, up to the magnificent statue; it is easy to see the detail, devotion, and splendor of the statue, apropos of the island itself.

dayInfo.title: Koh Samui – The Central Jungle
dayInfo.description: The morning is filled with excitement, not from the usual rush of the starting merchants and fresh squeezed orange juice, but from your coming tour through the jungle-heart of the island. Stepping away from the emerald and sapphire water will eventually take you into the mountains, first finding your way through the tree line in an all-wheel-drive jeep. Within the hills you will come to an elephant camp that houses a number of the celebrated animal within the open space of the countryside. The trees seem to be all encompassing while the elephants are playful and curious. Their small ears and rambunctious trunks wiggle in the earthen air. You will climb aboard and find yourself venturing through the hills on the pachyderm’s back, one that is a symbol of strength and royalty. When you come to deep water you will find how gentle and mischievous an elephant can be, dipping its body into the water and spraying itself, and you, as it bathes near Namuang 1, a fabulous waterfall that spreads down the craggy hillside. You will also find yourself in the Secret Buddha Garden, erected in 1976 by a fruit farmer who started to create and place animal and deity statues around his property.

dayInfo.title: Nakhon Si Thammarat – Playing with Shadows
dayInfo.description: On the South China Sea, sitting at the south of Thailand, is the region of Nakhon Si Thammarat. You will depart Koh Samui by ferry and arrive within the walled city, where remnants of the 14th-century stronghold continue to stand proud. Overlooking the city is the most important temple in the south known as Mahathat . The temple is said to date back one thousand years and is meant to house precious icons. 77 chedi fill the complex along with one large stupa which has a diameter of over 231 feet, topped with a golden spire. There is a palpable elegance to the temple, almost as if it crowned the city itself. One item that shouldn’t be missed is the Shadow Puppet House. With two different types of storytelling techniques that date back to as early as 400 BC, you can see intricate detail of the puppets and the motions sitting against the light and projected onto a white screen. Venture into the Shadow Puppet House Museum to see the history, construction, and showcase of the marvelous theater that has brought legend to life for millennia.

dayInfo.title: Nakhon Si Thammarat – The Picture of Picturesque
dayInfo.description: Rising in the northeastern distance you can see the summit of the over 5,500 foot high Khao Luang, southern Thailand’s highest mountain. Situated within Khao Luang National Park, the lavish landscape of the mountain’s peak is only the beginning as you make your way into the stellar natural scenery that is home to tigers, cloud leopards, and over two hundred types of birds. The bright coloration of orchids, from pink to white, yellow to purple, blossoms throughout the canopy. The scent of fern and rhododendrons is inescapably blissful. Soon you will find yourself at Krung Ching Waterfall, an impressive display of nature that sweeps between the crevice of the pressing mountains. Just after the rainy season the waterfall is an empowering display of nature, with a sound that resounds beneath the canopy and a rush that shrouds the mixture of craggy greenery. In the dryer season the falls are still lovely in their magnitude if not their force, winding down into the pool below as the sounds of the jungle combine with the splash.

dayInfo.title: Nakhon Si Thammarat – Over the Islands
dayInfo.description: The day begins as simply as the last one ended, with the sounds of the quiet town mixing with the vivid imagery of your time in Thailand. After breakfast you will have a private transfer to the airport where you will begin your journey homeward. You have traversed islands and jungles, surfed elephants and witnessed splendid waterfalls. There is an endless array of beautiful landscapes and stunning wildlife that covers the country, from islands to mountaintops, jungles to coastline, but your time above and below the surface of the sea will always be remembered, and one day, maybe soon, even revisited. Consider adding on to this 10-day tour. Be sure to read the Thailand tours reviews for additional ideas and to read traveler reviews.

tourName: Bangkok, River Kwai, and Thai Countryside Tour
placesVisited: Bangkok, Kanchanaburi, Surat Thani, Koh Samui, Koh Phangan
generalInfo: Between Bangkok and Koh Samui lies a collection of incredible experiences within Thailand that are waiting to be discovered during this exceptionally handcrafted 14-day tour across the countryside and Gulf of Thailand. The mesmerizing temples of Bangkok, staggering spectacles of Surat Thani’s wilderness, and splendid seascape scenes of Koh Samui are only a few of the treasures that you will experience during this absorbing adventure with thrilling family activities.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok - A Golden Skyline
dayInfo.description: Thai culture comes to life throughout the city of Bangkok and is presented by humming markets and evocative temples. You will lose yourself in the wonders of the city from the moment you arrive and transfer to your comfortable accommodation in one of the city’s flourishing districts. From here, you may appreciate the distinctive scenes of Thai life from your balcony that will overlook the sprawling city.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok - Exploring Bangkok’s Temples
dayInfo.description: Revered for its ravishing temples, golden Buddhist statues, and ornate stone carvings, Bangkok is a treasure trove of Thai heritage, and you will explore all of this on a guided tour. From the Reclining Buddha dressed in gold beneath the walls of Wat Pho to the smaller jade Buddha statue in the Temple of the Emerald Buddha, Bangkok will share Thailand’s hallowed heritage with you during your tour. You will also visit a few other Buddhist temples throughout the city.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok - The Green Lungs of Bangkok
dayInfo.description: Bangkok is a metropolis littered with imposing skyscrapers and bustling streets, and there are efforts to bring back Thailand’s forested wonders to the city. These efforts are most notable in the Bang Kra Jao Green Lung of Bangkok, which is a park that boasts tranquil lakes and prolific forests. You will explore the artificial island by bicycle, which will allow you to encounter the beautiful nature that lines the narrow pathways. Afterward, you will tour Bangkok’s street food districts for dinner.

dayInfo.title: Kanchanaburi - Retreat on the River Kwai
