dayInfo.description: You will retreat from the palpable energy of Bangkok for a taste of traditional jungle living in one of the most stunning riverside resorts above the River Kwai. All meals will be included at your gorgeous accommodation, and each dish will showcase the delectable flavors of Thai cuisine in addition to being curated by a local master chef. Your transfer through to Kanchanaburi will reflect the rural charm that reverberates from Thailand’s lesser-traveled regions, honoring the more traditional roots of the country’s hill tribe origins.

dayInfo.title: Kanchanaburi - The Thai Countryside
dayInfo.description: There are several enchanting ways to explore the unspoiled paradise of Kanchanaburi, and you will partake in most of these exciting activities today. Starting with a tour of the dramatic Death Railway, you will learn about the country’s tribulations that are a significant part of Thailand's history. Afterward, you will explore the surrounding wildlife during a leisurely bicycle ride through the bucolic countryside, which will culminate with an adventurous bamboo raft experience. Your tour will bring you to a glamorous river camp where you will spend the night among the wildlife.

dayInfo.title: Surat Thani - The Erawan Waterfall
dayInfo.description: Before leaving Kanchanaburi, you will have an opportunity to hike the evergreen wilderness to Erawan Waterfall. Within the jungle haven, the sounds of birds will ring from the canopy, and you may catch a glimpse of small creatures as they burrow through the shrubbery. After an included lunch, you will transfer to the train station for an overnight trip within a first-class cabin. During your journey, you will have all your needs fulfilled.

dayInfo.title: Surat Thani - One With Nature
dayInfo.description: Your train will finally arrive at Surat Thani station, where you will meet your driver and transfer to a jungle cabin in the woods of Khao Sok National Park. You will bask in the wondrous wilderness when strolling a light trail route through the jungle to calm lakes. Here, you may refresh yourself and lap up the untamed scenery. From monkeys that swoop between that overhead branches to chirping birds that soar through the sky, there will be many memorable moments to capture and experience during your stay within this forest paradise.

dayInfo.title: Surat Thani - Gliding Across Cheowlan Lake
dayInfo.description: The phenomenal Khao Sok National Park is home to one of Thailand’s most breathtaking lakes: the Cheowlan Lake. Today, you will head to the lake and board a little boat that will glide across the water. Around you, scenes of dramatic mountains will appear to lick the clouds, and caves will open to colossal holes in the precipes. Throughout your journey, you may soak up the natural splendors that are available on this remarkable lake cruise.

dayInfo.title: Koh Samui - Thailand’s Tropical Shores
dayInfo.description: Thailand’s most resplendent island of Koh Samui will await your arrival today. A long journey to the Tapee pier and a brisk ferry ride will lead you to the island’s white-sand beaches. You will transfer to a palatial resort on the banks of one of the island’s premier shores that are fringed by palm trees and run into the Gulf of Thailand. With nothing planned for the day, you may take pleasure in the paradisiacal scenes of karst islands rising from the water and forested headlands that surround the bay.

dayInfo.title: Koh Samui - Tropical Island Splendor
dayInfo.description: You will have a free day to revel in the resplendent charm across Koh Samui, from the award-winning restaurants owned by world-famous chefs to the exquisite spa centers in the emerald headlands. However you choose to spend the day, you will do so regally in addition to treating your palate and bodies to the wondrous experiences of Koh Samui. In the evening, you can catch a bewitching sunset over the karst island while savoring Thai Haute cuisine.

dayInfo.title: Koh Samui - Island-Hopping to Koh Phangan
dayInfo.description: Koh Samui is one of the many phenomenal Thailand islands worth discovering during your stay. Today will be designated to seeing the marvelous scenes of another beloved destination: Koh Phangan. You will board a private sailboat this morning and voyage from the shore across the sea to the picture-perfect isle. The panoramas from your boat will be admirable, and the activities in the sea will be enthralling and will include kayaking around castaway caves to snorkeling over colorful reefs. A refreshing lunch aboard your boat will conclude your fabulous island-hopping adventure.

dayInfo.title: Koh Samui - The Island’s Culture and Heritage
dayInfo.description: With another free day to explore Koh Samui at your leisure, you can take this opportunity to check off some pivotal highlights. From the golden statue of Big Buddha that towers above the island to the charming fishing villages that serve mouth-watering seafood dishes, a wealth of exploration awaits your discovery. You may conclude your evening by watching an elaborate Thai performance while tucking into delightful delicacies served by talented local chefs. These moments between your adventures will allow you to appreciate your time in Thailand.

dayInfo.title: Koh Samui - Moments with Thai Elephants
dayInfo.description: In parts of Thailand, elephants are revered and spiritually honored. Today, you will venture to an ethical elephant sanctuary to learn about the importance of these creatures to the local people and the efforts of many to quell the mistreatment of them. Your day will also be incredibly rewarding because you will play in the mud with the marvelous beings and feed them freshly grown produce. You will feel blessed to be a part of this amazing initiative while making lifelong memories with the elephants.

dayInfo.title: Koh Samui - Departure
dayInfo.description: As the sun kisses the Thai sky on the final morning of your trip, Koh Samui will be highlighted by a radiant orange glow. You will make your way to your resort’s fancy restaurant for breakfast and savor every bite. You will soon return home with a collection of memories to share with the rest of your friends and family.

tourName: Bangkok Senior Vacation: Serene City Highlights
placesVisited: Bangkok, Kanchanaburi, Ayutthaya
generalInfo: Boasting Thailand’s most significant landmarks and picturesque settings, Bangkok is a must-visit destination for all ages. On this tailor-made trip, a few of the highlights you will experience include visits to Bangkok’s remarkable heritage sites, exploration of the ancient cities nearby, fine-dining at Bangkok’s world-class restaurants, and a delightful, luxury river cruise on an old-world rice barge. 9-days of Bangkok’s most relaxing and insightful expeditions will leave you feeling utterly inspired and completely invigorated. Do not miss out on the once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to discover what makes Bangkok truly special.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok – A Luxurious Arrival
dayInfo.description: Bangkok is a bustling city with sky-high buildings that elegantly juxtapose the vibrant energy of traditional living amid the streets. The majesty of Bangkok’s modern flair and authentic culture will be especially evident as you approach Suvarnabhumi Airport. From the comfort of your first-class suite, you will peer out of the plane windows and witness the opulent city center that is complete with golden temples and exuberant markets. After meeting your private transfer, you will soak up the diverse surroundings while traversing through the busy streets. The short drive will culminate in the heart of the city, and you will be wowed by the sophisticated 5-star hotel that awaits your arrival. Here, you will check-in to your peaceful room with uninterrupted views of the cityscape. Fitted with first-class amenities, the luxurious hotel will be your home away from home for the first few nights of your trip. Briefly after unpacking your things, you will venture out to the streets of Bangkok in search of a delectable dinner in which to indulge. Situated in Bangkok’s premier district, your hotel will only be a few minutes from the city’s top-tier restaurants. A private tuk-tuk will arrive at your hotel to fetch you. This eccentric mode of transport, which is open to the air, offers an enthusing experience that is unique to Thailand. Feeling the breeze on your face while you whizz through the streets is a lovely way to explore the city. A short drive later and you will arrive at a prime, fine-dining establishment. With fluent waitresses serving you, you will have no trouble selecting your preferred dish. Then, delve into the masterfully curated and authentic Thai meals that will be produced by the award-winning head chef. With gorgeous views of the city and a beautiful sunset to marvel at, you will feel completely comfortable in this enchanting city. After your meal, you will transfer to your cozy room for a truly peaceful sleep.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok – Temples Shimmering Under the Sun
dayInfo.description: You will rise feeling well-rested and fresh on your first morning in the city. Today, you will discover the city’s extensive heritage on a private, guided tour of its significant historical and cultural landmarks. To ensure that you are fueled for the day, your hotel will have a delicious breakfast prepared for you. After eating, you will meet your knowledgeable guide for a private tour of the city. You will weave your way through the streets, witnessing the vibrant morning energy with bright-eyes. Shortly afterward, you will arrive at one of the country’s most coveted temples. Wat Phra Kaew, or the Temple of the Emerald Buddha, is a magnificent spiritual compound that consists of multiple gold-adorned structures and statues. Within the temple is a green jade Buddha, which is an exceptionally significant talisman that is held in the highest regard among the Thai people. After a thorough exploration of the grounds, you will journey to more of the landmark temples. You will share picture-perfect moments and make unforgettable memories amid each temple’s awe-inspiring ambiance and wondrously decorous design. After the guided temple tour, you will board a riverboat and transfer to more prominent points of interest. A visit to Chinatown will yield the opportunity to enjoy authentic and delicious Thai street food while witnessing the Flower Market. The guided boat tour will transfer you to these premier locations for a complete cultural discovery of Bangkok. Later today, you will return to your room for an hour or two of leisure. Then, in the evening, you will journey to one of the country’s unsurpassable restaurants. Here, at the Michelin-Starred restaurant, you will be served an immaculate multiple-course meal that will be masterfully crafted by the renowned chef. Every aspect of this gourmet dining experience will captivate you, and the esteemed restaurant will exceed all expectations.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok – The Best of Bangkok's Exquisite Cuisine
dayInfo.description: On your third day of your journey, you will explore Bangkok’s bustling markets, experience the authentic tastes of Thailand, and encounter the city’s riveting arts and culture. Your day will begin with a large breakfast spread from the comfort of your hotel. After which, you will privately transfer to a local market for the morning. Here, you will peruse the vibrant lanes of colorful stalls and food vendors. As you pass by eager sellers of trinkets and tokens, the wafts of stir-fried dishes will tantalize your taste buds. The buzzing energy will invigorate and inspire you as you further explore Bangkok’s authenticity. After the immersive market discovery, you will meet your private transfer and venture out on a captivating food tour of the city. Your insightful guide will take you to established premier restaurants and traditional local eateries. Each of these authentic hotspots will offer charming culinary experiences. The tasting tour of Thailand’s incredible meals will provide a behind-the-scenes look into their food culture, which will be completed by meet and greets with the recognized chefs. After indulging in stunning Thai food, you will transfer to the hub of art and culture in the city. Your private guide will take you to Bangkok’s leading galleries where you will learn more about the history of art in Thailand and encounter compelling pieces along the way. The tour will culminate with a trip to the famous Jim Thompson House where you will learn more about the man who revived the Thai silk industry and introduced it to premier fashion houses around the globe. His remarkable life story and the Eurocentric-inspired Thai architecture of the house will prove enthralling. After witnessing further tributes, you will transfer to your hotel for a late afternoon around the pool. For dinner, you will travel to a nearby fine-dining establishment for exquisite seafood on the banks of the beautiful Chao Phraya River. You will bask in the picturesque sunset views as you delight in your elaborate meal.

dayInfo.title: Kanchanaburi – An Evening under the Stars
dayInfo.description: Though the buzzing energy of Bangkok is enlivening, you will transfer to the tranquil area of Kanchanaburi on your fourth day in Thailand. Here, you will have the opportunity to explore more of the country’s rich heritage and unwind in complete luxury. After breakfast, you will reach the train station where you will board your cabin and enjoy a whimsical ride through Bangkok’s lush surroundings. Once outside the city limits, vast fields will welcome you, and mountainous regions in the distance will serve up picture-perfect moments. The journey will be peaceful, and as you approach the famous River Kwai, you will have serene views of the riverside scenery. Upon arrival, you will check-in to your romantic getaway hotel on the river. The immaculate rooms sit above the water, offering an unrivaled nature-bound experience with panoramic vistas of the wildlife. You can spend the morning at your leisure, enjoying the fine amenities and setting. For lunch, you will transfer to one of the delightful restaurants in the Kanchanaburi area for a splendid meal. Later this evening, you will sit back comfortably under the stars and delight in an exceptional Thai dinner by candlelight before returning to your elegant room on the river. As you prepare for bed, you can let the unhindered sounds of the environment lull you to sleep.

dayInfo.title: Kanchanaburi – Tour of Tribal Thailand
dayInfo.description: Kanchanaburi boasts a wealth of history, with many significant museums and landmarks that can be found within the area. Day five will be spent exploring more of the surroundings and the country’s heritage. You will have breakfast by the river before transferring to interesting museums for an immersive experience. Your first stop will be the JEATH War Museum. Here, you will discover the dramatic past of Thailand through enthralling displays and exhibits. After which, you will journey to the other key destinations, another standout location being the renowned Bridge on the River Kwai. You will be completely engrossed on this dramatic tour that highlights the effects of World War II on the area. Later today, you will transfer to a traditional Mon village via tugboat. The tribal Thai culture is still thrillingly represented in this friendly and joyful community. You will be welcomed with open arms and explore the many facets of traditional rural living. You will witness Thai dancing and performances as you enjoy a lunch that will be prepared by the villagers. This once-in-a-lifetime experience will highlight the sheer happiness that is shared by the country’s people despite their tumultuous past. The tour will end as you cruise back to your hotel. From the boat, you will have gorgeous views of the surrounding greenery and distant mountains. You will marvel at this magical moment before you arrive on the shore. Later, before getting some much-deserved rest, you will set off for an intimate supper at a gourmet restaurant in the area.

dayInfo.title: Ayutthaya – An Ancient City with Old-World Charm
dayInfo.description: In the morning, you will feel completely rested for the day. After a sumptuous breakfast spread, you will board a luxury coach and make your way to Ayutthaya. Along the scenic route, you will observe more of nature’s splendor with extraordinary views of the landscapes that surrounds the roads less traveled. As you approach the ancient city of Ayutthaya, you will be seemingly transported to an area that shares a boutique experience while capturing old-world Thailand. Your luxuriously charming hotel awaits your arrival. After checking-in to your room along the banks of the Chao Phraya River, you will have a few hours to relax. Then, your private transfer will meet you in the lobby and take you on a private, guided tour of the age-old Ayutthaya Historical Park. The ancient city tour is teeming with temple ruins and grand palaces that showcase traditional Thailand. On this captivating journey, you will delve deeper into the history of the country and visit significant heritage sites. You will encounter antique relics and spectacular landmarks while you learn a wealth of knowledge about the location. After your engrossing tour, you will transfer to a luxurious lunch spot for afternoon delights where you can enjoy the gourmet dining experience before making your way to your room. You will spend the afternoon at your leisure, soaking up the sun or doing whatever else you desire. In the evening, you will transfer to a premier seafood restaurant for an exceptional wine and dine. You will enjoy the freshly caught seafood that will be served with meticulous attention to detail.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok – A Scenic Cruise in Style
dayInfo.description: Your hotel will have a brilliant breakfast ready for you once you wake. After enjoying a peaceful morning in the city of Ayutthaya, you will board a regal river cruise bound for Bangkok. The luxuriously restored rice barge will offer an unparalleled tour to the city along the gorgeous Chao Phraya River. Complete with a patio view of the environment, elegant tea room, and loungers to leisurely relax on, you will be in pure bliss as you glide across the still waters of the river. During your journey, you will experience a traditional afternoon Thai tea where you will be served an assortment of local delicacies and delicious beverages. As you sip on the flavors of Thailand, nature will be attracted to life around you. Chirping birds will flutter through the riverside trees as other wildlife rustles through the thick greenery. It will be an idyllic way to spend your afternoon. Later this afternoon, you will arrive later and transfer to your stunning hotel that will be located in the heart of the city. Fit with world-class amenities, you will have the afternoon and evening to enjoy however you desire. Relax in true style at your fashionable hotel before venturing out for dinner. Located along the Chao Phraya River, Bangkok boasts impressive restaurants with riverside views. Here, you will enjoy gourmet multiple-course meals that will be perfectly paired with flamboyant Thai dancing and performances. The marvelous displays will exude the colorful energy of the city, bringing the dream-like day to a wondrous close.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok – High-End Shopping in the City
dayInfo.description: Your final full day in Bangkok will be dedicated to spoiling yourself and searching for unique gems to take back home with you. After breakfast, you will transfer to Bangkok’s premier retail district to explore the fashion-forward malls and stores. Encapsulating the city’s modern style, the stores in the famous Siam Square offer a shopping experience like no other. You can slowly peruse the boutique shops and find delicate goods to fit into your suitcase. You will eventually depart the city with one-of-a-kind gems as gifts for friends and family. To round off the delightful shop, you can treat yourself to a traditional Thai massage at a leading wellness spa. Let the relaxing massage completely invigorate you while you reminisce on the grand memories that you have made thus far. After the day of spoils, you will transfer to a premier rooftop bar in the bustling city of Bangkok. You will make your way to the top of one of its largest skyscrapers and have 360-degree view of the cityscape. Elegant cocktails and delicious food will be served to you as you marvel at the skyline and slow setting sun. The stylish night will complete your perfect trip in this vibrant and culturally rich city.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok – A Charming Way to Start the Day
dayInfo.description: The spa treatment the day before and the restful sleep in luxury will leave you feeling invigorated on your final morning in Bangkok. You will pack your things as you trace back the immersive trip with unforgettable memories and irreplaceable images. Then, you will check-out and transfer to an endearing cafe along the river for breakfast. Take in the enchanting city one last time before you are satisfied and ready to bid your farewells. Your private transfer will meet you shortly and take you to the airport where you will leave ecstatic that you experienced the best Bangkok has to offer.

tourName: Best 10-Day Thailand Wilderness and Cities Tour for Seniors
placesVisited: Chiang Mai, Chiang Rai, Pai, Bangkok
generalInfo: The vast area of tropical highlights will present itself to you during this luxurious 10-day adventure of its iconic destinations. Luscious forests proliferate across Thailand, and its culture shines through its welcoming communities. Whether you are indulging in a steamy bowl of Thai broth, connecting with the spirited locals at an ethnic hill tribe, or watching the wildlife rustle through the tree line, you will be absorbed by the incredible beauty that emanates from the landscaped locations on this tour for seniors.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Mai – The Lively Culture
dayInfo.description: Once you have breezed through customs, the temperate climate will embrace and welcome you to Thailand. When you have collected your things and met your private driver, you will be transferred to your luxurious accommodation in the heart of the city. With a private infinity pool in your suite, you can admire the scenes of the immaculate landscape from the comfort of your room. This evening, you will transfer to a local night bazaar, where the culture will be imbued in the handcrafted items and woven fabrics. During your time here, you can navigate the aisles by the fragrances of sizzling dishes, which will introduce you to the unique flavors of Thai cuisine.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Mai – Pha Chor and Flora of Sirikit
dayInfo.description: Thailand’s diverse topography is categorized by rising cliffs, sprawling meadows, and tranquil rivers. You will certainly be absorbed by these wilderness scenes as you transfer through the countryside with your knowledgeable guide after breakfast. Pha Chor Canyon is an iconic sandstone valley situated outside of Chiang Mai, and you will traverse the rugged terrain from base to peak to witness its archaic beauty. Your tour will then lead you to the heartland of Chiang Mai, where you will arrive at the entrance of Queen Sirikit Botanic Garden. The enrapturing display of indigenous flora was designed for research and biodiversity purposes, and it is now considered one of the most significant gardens in the country.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Mai – Encounters with Elephants
dayInfo.description: Though elephants have suffered abuse at the hands of unethical tourism, there is an increasing shift toward the ethical treatment and rehabilitation of these animals. This encourages foreigners to witness and support the livelihoods of indigenous elephants. Chiang Mai prides itself on several sanctuaries that have pioneered this mentality, and you will enjoy the luxury of visiting one of them and their stunning elephants today. Upon your arrival, you will be welcomed by a representative of the organization who will trace the philosophical shift regarding elephants in Thailand. For dinner, you will enjoy some of the finest Thai cuisine at a celebrated restaurant in the jungle.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Rai – Soothing Spa Therapies
dayInfo.description: Although Chiang Rai city has a vibrant energy, there will be no better way to enjoy the illustrious countryside that fringes the city center than with a luxurious accommodation huddled between the forest canopies. Your transfer will lead you to the mountainous side of Chiang Rai, and you will feel worlds away at this hidden gem. World-class tents will be positioned in the shade, under the trees, and within them. Unwind upon your arrival, you may delight in an unrivaled spa therapy with gorgeous jungle views. With a collection of ancient and ritualized therapies on offer, you will be spoiled for choice as to how you soothe your spirit this sunny afternoon.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Rai – Ethnic Hill Tribe Traditions
dayInfo.description: Today, you will discover the endearing simplicity of the local lifestyle as you tour ethnic hill tribes dotted throughout the region. When you are ready, you will be transferred to an Akha village, where the people will don elaborate and colorful costumes representative of their tribal roots. Your tour will continue to a Yao hill community, which is situated at high altitudes on top of the rolling greenery. Your hosts will prepare an elaborate spread of authentic Thai cuisine that you are unlikely to find anywhere else. You will leave the village with a great deal of knowledge about its people and their customs.

dayInfo.title: Pai – Memorable Wildlife Sightings
dayInfo.description: This morning, you will transfer to Mae Hong Son’s scenic destination Pai in a luxury vehicle and be wowed by the astonishing sights of golden rice paddies, imposing mountains, and evergreen pastures. Eventually, you will arrive at your luxurious accommodation in the forest. You will be endlessly entertained as you survey the forest with high-quality binoculars with the hopes of spotting a few colorful creatures in the canopy. The Tha Pai Hot Springs will be the perfect place to bask in the scenic splendor after your vitalizing walk through the forests of Mo Paeng.

dayInfo.title: Pai – Trace the Spirit of Santichon
dayInfo.description: The city center of Pai constantly bursts with cultural character, and you will be enthralled to witness it in action from its premier sightseeing location: the Buddhist temple of Wat Phra That Mae Yen. The intricate architecture will reveal its elegantly crafted details as you stroll through the golden-encrusted temples that surround the colossal statues. Afterward, you will travel out of Pai to the Santichon Village. This community was founded by Chinese Yunnan settlers and is now an intriguing display of their ancient traditions and customs. Clay houses line the streets, wafts of green tea emanate through the air, and authentic Chinese food sizzles on the grill.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok – Lavish Spoils in the Cityscape
dayInfo.description: Today, you will transfer by plane to Bangkok for a final few nights in the beating heart of Thailand. You will be totally immersed in the regality of Bangkok from the moment you land. You may wish to rest and relax once you arrive, but you may find yourselves yearning to explore. For your introductory tour, you will be ushered through traffic like a celebrity to Bangkok’s premier shopping districts. You will have the afternoon to shop until you drop at the city’s upper-class establishments, which are a treasure trove of unique pieces that you cannot find anywhere else. This evening, you will treat yourselves to a candlelit dinner on a royal riverboat.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok – Bangkok’s Art and Architecture
dayInfo.description: Today, you will cruise through the city on an exclusive tour to iconic sites to uncover Thailand’s unique culture. Your expedition will begin at the Museum of Floral Culture. A first of its kind, the recognized museum is housed in the halls of an age-old colonial mansion and shares bewitching floral exhibitions to commemorate the country’s long-established fondness for its indigenous flora. Your tour will conclude at the grounds of Bangkok’s spiritual complexes. Each venerated temple presents distinctive architecture, which highlights the incredible craftsmanship of their designers and shares a great deal of information about the traditions of Thailand.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok – A Morning to Reminisce
dayInfo.description: Locals rise early in Bangkok and will set up their stalls for a busy day. The sun will peek through the clouds before reflecting off the golden temples. Bangkok is a hub of activity, and your final morning will reflect this as you venture from your hotel to an esteemed cafe for a delicious cup of coffee and breakfast. Before you know it, you will have to catch your international flight. You will be collected from the restaurant by a private transfer, and all of your luggage will be safely stowed in the vehicle. Your driver will then transfer you to the international airport for your flight home.

tourName: Best of Bangkok Itinerary in 7 Days
placesVisited: Bangkok, Â Ayutthaya
generalInfo: Bangkok is the booming heart of Thailand, and a visit to the country would not be complete without an in-depth exploration of this incredibly diverse city. Bangkok boasts some of Thailand’s most attractive and awe-inspiring sights, as well as some of the most appealing and authentic Thai cuisine. This destination is full of life and energy, so you will have a busy 7-Day excursion for you to get the most out of the bustling city. With this truly unique and immersive expedition, you will explore the best of Bangkok in the most efficient way possible.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok – Take It All In
dayInfo.description: As you fly over Thailand and approach Bangkok, lush greenery will give way to magnificent skyscrapers and grand temples. Peer down at the landscape as you prepare to land, and you will quickly realize that Bangkok has so much to offer. It is a surreal blend of beautiful cityscapes and authentic Thai culture. Meet your private transfer at one of the city’s most impressive airports, Don Mueang International Airport or Suvarnabhumi Airport. From there, set off to a luxurious hotel where you will spend your vacation. Sit back and let the surrounding sights fill you with wonder and excitement. You will spot street vendors selling traditional Thai cuisine to eager passersby, temples adorned with gold, and groups of camera-ready travelers that will be huddled around points of interest. We have planned a busy week in the bustling city of Bangkok to ensure that you get to experience it all. However, Thailand is not a hop and a skip away, so some time to unwind is exactly what you may need on the day that you arrive. You will arrive at your 5-star hotel, check in, and make yourself at home. This is where you will spend the next seven nights in complete comfort after each fun-filled day of adventure. Take this time to relax by the pool or get a drink and check out the local scenery. In the afternoon, you will enjoy a leisurely stroll around the city to get acclimated to the area. The city is home to an array of exceptional eateries. Restaurants spread around the streets in abundance. You will find plenty, but there is nothing quite like the first restaurant you will experience. This fine-dining restaurant offers a panoramic view of the city while you delight in your delicious dining experience. From there, you can head back to the hotel for an early night.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok – A Temple Tour of Bangkok’s Best
dayInfo.description: There are over 400 temples in Bangkok and far too many to experience in one month, let alone one week. While you may not be able to see every temple, some stand out as the most majestic and famous within Thailand: Wat Phra Kaew, Wat Arun, and Wat Pho. On your first full day in Bangkok, you will visit all three of them as well as the Grand Palace. Today, you will fuel up for the adventure ahead with a complimentary breakfast. Be sure to slip on a comfortable pair of shoes and pack water, sunscreen, and snacks as you will not be returning to your luxury accommodation until later in the evening. Your hotel concierge will take care of everything for you. Once you have had breakfast, you can begin an immersive walking tour of Bangkok’s most attractive temples. The journey will begin with a short walk to Wat Phra Kaew, which is commonly known as the Temple of the Emerald Buddha. It is an easy trip to the temple, with a short stop by the amulet market on your way. Here, you may purchase charms, amulets, totems, and other jewelry. You will then continue on to The Emerald Buddha, which is a temple that is regarded as one of the most sacred in Thailand. It is adjoined with the Grand Palace, and together they are a truly astounding spectacle. Picture-perfect camera shots will be in abundance, so be sure to have your preferred device on hand. ? Thai food market called Tha Tien Market where dried, salted seafood and other goods are sold. Wat Pho is home to the awe-inspiring 46 meters-long, gold-plated, Reclining Buddha. Travelers flock to see the immense monument as its sheer beauty can rarely be rivaled. While you explore all that it offers, you can learn more about King Rama I and the temple’s construction. It was in this temple that the first ever traditional Thai massage was practiced. A temple tour of Bangkok will not be complete without visiting Wat Arun. The 70-meter tall temple towers up from the ground and is surrounded by smaller, but no less significant, temple sites and historical statues. The monument, encompassed in porcelain and glistening colored glass, looks over the Chao Phraya River. After the tour, you will return to your hotel for an hour or two that will be at your leisure. Then, you will make your way to Thip Samai for arguably Bangkok’s best Pad Thai. The local eatery is not to be missed, especially for those who are after a truly authentic meal. Touted as the best Pad Thai in Thailand by Anthony Bourdain, a slightly longer queue than usual will definitely be worth the wait. Once you are finished with supper, you will venture back to your room for a night’s rest.

dayInfo.title: Ayutthaya – The Ancient City of Ayutthaya
dayInfo.description: There are many great sights in and around Bangkok, and many more than will be possible to see in one day. So, on the third day of your trip, you will explore the most appealing and inspiring attractions that are north of the city. You will then transfer via private coach from Bangkok to Ayutthaya. Ayutthaya is an ancient city which developed in the 14th Century. Its historical context offers a wealth of insight into traditional Thai culture, and the temple ruins retain their impressive nature. A trip out to Ayutthaya will prove to be a humbling one that will deeply enrich your expedition. The coach ride will take a little over an hour and a half, but it will not fail to impress you along the way. You will take delight in the picturesque, scenic views of Bangkok as you make your way to the old city. Upon arrival in Ayutthaya, you will visit the Ayutthaya Historical Park. This UNESCO-listed Park contains grand palaces and a series of age-old monasteries, statues, and temples. Bang Pa-In Summer Palace, which is heavily influenced by both Chinese and European design, will be your first stop. A moat surrounds this aesthetically pleasing place that reflects its design origins in true style. After that, visits to Wat Mahathat and Wat Na Phra Men will allow you to further explore Thai heritage. The Wat Mahathat, which is the next stop, is famous for its Head of the Buddha in which the statue’s head is surrounded by the roots of a large Banyan Tree. This iconic image has become famous through travelers’ content, and it is one that you must certainly capture. Wat Na Phra Men, the next Ayutthaya-period temple, is remarkable in the fact that it was one of the few that was unharmed by troops during the Burmese-Siamese War. Furthermore, it is home to one of only five seated Buddha images in Thailand. After exploring more of the Park’s surroundings, you will find yourself sitting back comfortably on a river cruise along the Chao Phraya River. Delightful food and stunning views will keep you entertained as you make your way back to Bangkok. As you draw closer, witness the likes of Wat Arun and the Grand Palace from the comfort of the boat before docking and being transferred back to your hotel. From your hotel, you will transfer to Thara Thong via tuk-tuk or private transport for a stunning dining experience. The restaurant, which overlooks the river, caters to vegetarians with endless meat-free options on the menu. You will return back to your accommodation eager for the day ahead.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok – Treat Yourself
dayInfo.description: Bangkok offers plenty of stunning attractions, but the city also boasts a shopping experience that cannot be found anywhere else in the world. There is an abundance of stalls and malls where travelers can splurge on souvenirs. From high-end, multiple-story shopping complexes to budget-beating markets, the fourth day of your tour will be entirely dedicated to treating yourself. After breakfast, you will transfer from your hotel to Siam Square. Siam Square, better known as the heart of the city, is a mecca for shopaholics and travelers who are searching for keepsakes to take back home. The Siam area boasts some of Bangkok’s biggest shopping malls, and boutique markets can be found within the alleyways that connect the main streets. Your first stop will be Terminal 21, which is located on Sukhumvit Road. The incredibly unique aspect about the airport-inspired mall is that areas on each floor are dedicated to different major cities across the globe. The restaurants and shops are all themed accordingly. For instance, a short trip up the escalators will transport you from Tokyo to London. While it is not an entirely Thai experience, it is one that you cannot miss. This will be a great opportunity to pick up deals on fashionable items and tuck into any of the many, fine global cuisines. After shopping Terminal 21, you will head out of the complex and take a leisurely stroll around Siam Square. This area will be action-packed with endless entertainment to offer. Also located in the Siam Paragon shopping mall is Kidzania, which is an innovative ‘edutainment’ experience for young ones. Bangkok’s very own Madame Tussauds wax museum can be found in the Siam Discovery Center as well. After an exciting morning in and around the energetic area, you will visit the Jim Thompson House. The exquisite museum tells the story of an American man who fell in love with Southeast Asian art and culture. The American architect is most famous for his role in reviving Thai silk and pioneering the use of it in world-class fashion houses in Europe’s hottest cultural destinations. The meticulous craft and unique blend of Eastern and Western art admirably position the museum as one of the most awe-inspiring attractions in the city. Following the Jim Thompson House, your final destination for the day will be Pantip Plaza. The massive tech-focused mall can provide hours of shopping entertainment. If you wish to bypass shopping, you can transfer back to your hotel for an evening around the pool. For supper, you will have reservations at a local restaurant near your hotel. Your hotel concierge will make these reservations and will direct you to your local, Thai eatery. Finally, you will unwind over supper before returning to your hotel.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok – Master Thai Cuisine
dayInfo.description: Thailand is tremendously well-known for its cuisine and for a good reason. Traditional recipes have been handed down for centuries and authenticity is of the utmost essential aspects in the Thai kitchen. The heavy focus on elevating the senses and enriching all aspects of the flavor profile allows Thai cooks to achieve culinary excellence, even within unrecognized stalls and eateries. Although the processes behind the dishes are a mystery to most, you will be able to learn some of Thailand’s best-kept culinary secrets during this savory treat. After breakfast, you will transfer via shuttle to one of Thailand’s first-class culinary schools. Your cooking school offers luxurious cooking classes that retain Thai authenticity. The classes are set amongst a beautiful backdrop of serene gardens and traditionally-minded décor. The completely hands-on class will begin in the morning and take you through midday. Here, you will learn to perfect the art of creating four essential Thai dishes. You can expect to master meals like traditional Hot and Sour Prawn Soup and Chicken Green Curry. The equipment will be in pristine condition, and the mentors will be professionally trained chefs. For a fine-dining Thai cuisine experience, you will transfer from the cooking school to Suan Bua. The exquisite restaurant will serve traditional dishes with a modern flair and flavor. The authentically decorated restaurant overlooks a stunning garden setting and is the perfect way to end a cuisine-centered day. Afterward, you will transfer back to your hotel to relax and reset for the day ahead.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok – The Buzzing Markets of Bangkok
dayInfo.description: Bangkok hosts hundreds of markets as they form an intrinsic part of the local commercial culture. So, today will be dedicated to experiencing the best ones Thailand has to offer. As you stroll through the stalls, you will be enthralled by the buzzing energy that livens these markets. Tantalizing wafts of sizzling meat, and the cheers of entertainers chanting will fill the air. For today, you can look forward to a day of fun and food. You can skip breakfast at your hotel to save time for your first stop. You will transfer from your hotel to your destination, Sampeng Market, via riverboat ride. One of Bangkok’s best markets for shopping and food, Sampeng Market (Chinatown) will be a highlight to get the day underway. Here, you will enjoy authentic Thai street food from any of the hundreds of stalls that litter the streets. You may shop for souvenirs, trinkets, and other odds and ends at extremely affordable prices. After stocking up on snacks and treats, you will transfer to Amphawa Floating Market. A short trip from Bangkok, Amphawa Floating Market is a pivotal stop on your tour. Traditional floating markets will offer travelers the unique opportunity to explore stalls by boat. This particular market retains traditional practices and boasts a wide variety of vendors. So, sit back in the boat and wade through the river, hopping on and off to grab whatever catches your eye. From fresh and affordable seafood to local hand-crafted goods, there will be something for everyone on this delightful afternoon expedition. You will then transfer back to your hotel after exploring all Amphawa has to offer. You will have done most of Bangkok’s best markets by now, but a Night Market is still on the list. For dinner and evening entertainment, you will transfer to Asiatique, the Riverfront. This luxurious open-air mall/market is clean, organized, and fashionable. It is a must-visit destination for finding authentic goods of exceptional quality. You can take a trip around the 200-foot Ferris wheel for a romantic nighttime view of the city. Then, you may dine on some delicious food before transferring back to your hotel.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok – Aroma Therapy
dayInfo.description: At this point, the busy week will have undoubtedly taken its toll. For the final day in Bangkok, you will have the opportunity to relax and unwind before preparing to head home. You can take this time to revisit the experiences and review the incredible photos of your journey. After enjoying breakfast at your hotel, you will transfer to Bangkok’s best Wellness Spas. The luxurious property is popular among many stylish expatriates because of its excellent service, great rates, and a sophisticated approach to the traditional Thai massage. Soak it all in over an Herbal Aroma Oil Body Massage. You will then transfer back to your hotel, feeling completely refreshed, ready to pack, and prepared for your flight back home. Finally, you will transfer to the airport from your hotel, knowing that you have explored the best of Bangkok during your 7-Day stay.

tourName: Best of Thailand and Vietnam: 13-Day Culture and Beaches
placesVisited: Hanoi, Ha Long Bay, Chiang Mai, Khao Lak, Similan Islands, Phuket
generalInfo: Explore the depths of Vietnamese culture and the furthest reaches of the country’s sensational scenery in Hanoi and the emerald island garden of Ha Long Bay on this custom 13-day tour. Embrace northern Thai Khmer heritage in Chiang Mai before venturing south to the pristine pearl-white beaches of Khao Lak and Phuket. Experience the best of both on this vacation to Vietnam and Thailand’s coveted destinations.

dayInfo.title: Hanoi - Insider’s Food Tour of Vietnamese Cuisine
dayInfo.description: Hanoi continues to dazzle and delight despite Vietnam’s tumultuous history. Old-world heritage buildings built from wood, corrugated iron, cement, and other accessible materials in the area stand proudly alongside sky-scraping towers and decorated pagodas that punctuate the city’s deep cultural roots and spiritual underpinnings. The streets flow with the aromas of sizzling meat, and echoes of blenders buzz from sheltered market stalls as vendors prepare typical Vietnamese dishes and healthy juice cocktails. You will indulge in the culinary delicacies shortly after arriving and checking into your accommodation on an insider's street food tour.

dayInfo.title: Ha Long Bay - Set Sail in Vietnam’s Island Garden
dayInfo.description: Hanoi is a gateway to Vietnam’s spectacular seascapes that lie beyond the yacht-riddled harbors and fishers' villages sprinkled along the country’s eastern seaboard. Today, you will transfer to a bustling pier after breakfast and climb aboard a decked-out boat to enjoy a two-night cruise across the country’s garden of emerald islands, Ha Long Bay. You will share a toast of champagne as you step onto the deck to meet your captain and then set sail under the sun to discover the karst limestone cliffs and hidden golden beaches somewhere in the reaches of the idyllic isles.

dayInfo.title: Ha Long Bay - Meeting the Villagers of Viet Hai
dayInfo.description: You will step outside for a vitalizing Tai Chi lesson as the sunrise paints the boat’s deck yellow. A day boat will bob in the water alongside your cruiser and, after breakfast, you will join its knowledgeable captain to set course for the Viet Hai village. Forested pathways weave through the jungles surrounding the thatched hamlet, and creatures dwelling amongst the green will provide nature’s soundtrack as you greet villagers and explore their humble home to learn about their culture. You may swim in the refreshing waters in the afternoon and take part in an informative Vietnamese cooking class.

dayInfo.title: Hanoi - Paddling in the Mangroves of Ao Ech
dayInfo.description: Whether you wish to find comfort on a lounger overlooking the blazing sunrise scenes or jump-start your morning with another guided Tai Chi class, there are few better ways to wake up in Vietnam than on a boat sailing the sapphire seas. Before you head for land, you will hop in kayaks and paddle around the glistening waterways of the Ao Ech area. You will glide beneath the shade of mangroves hanging over the canals and search for caves carved into the cliffs before you return to the boat and make way for Hanoi.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Mai - Welcome to Thailand’s Northern Cultural Gem
dayInfo.description: Chiang Mai’s temples are dressed in gold, and its city is bursting with energy. The northern capital of Thailand boasts brilliant exhibits of former Thai eras in well-kept museums and brags luxuriant gardens for peaceful afternoon tea. Its districts are full of character and wonderfully friendly locals to meet as you wander from marquee market to treasured landmarks and everything in between. Today is yours to enjoy Chiang Mai as you please, from dining on distinct Khmer cuisine to cruising the neighborhoods in a traditional Thai tuk-tuk, an open-air three-wheeled vehicle.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Mai - Explore the Elephant Dream Valley
dayInfo.description: Elephants in Thailand are sacred creatures and highly regarded by traditional Thai spiritualists. Cruelty towards these magnificent animals is shunned, particularly by the guides and owners of Chiang Mai’s iconic Elephant Dream Valley. Elephants roam freely within the preservation grounds of the wilderness sanctuary. Within the proliferating jungle, savor this safe environment for these magnificent animals to flourish. Afterward, you will zip through the jungle’s streams on a bamboo raft for a unique and thrilling look at the forest.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Mai - Freely Wandering the Northern Capital
dayInfo.description: There is a lot to do in and around Chiang Mai, and you will choose from these options based on your personal travel preferences with the help of a knowledgeable local. They will point you in the direction of standout activities, such as walking tours to the summit of Doi Suthep mountain for panoramic views of northern Thailand and eye-opening temple tours of white-washed spiritual marvels and ancient, carved pagodas. With a wealth of colorful markets and welcoming locals wandering the streets of Chiang Mai, you will be consistently inspired to seek out the city’s unique experiences during the day.

dayInfo.title: Khao Lak - Escape to the Sparkling Seaside
dayInfo.description: You will venture from the reaches of Thailand’s inland jungles in Chiang Mai to the sparkling coastline wrapped up by the balmy waters of the Andaman Sea. Your journey will bring you to the popular piers of Phuket, and from here, you will be whisked away in a speed boat to the beautiful villages of Khao Lak in the Phang Nga province. A boutique resort nestled on the shoreline will be your escape from the hustle and bustle for the evening, a place for you to rest your head to the soothing sounds of swells rolling across the shore.

dayInfo.title: Similan Islands - Diving, Snorkeling, and Beach Exploration of Similan
dayInfo.description: Khao Lak is a popular jumping-off point for Thailand’s sensational Similan Islands, a diver’s marine paradise featuring 70 square kilometers of pristine, protected sea. The marine national park consists of impressive rugged islands, bright turquoise waters, pearl-white beaches, tropical rainforests, and coruscating coral reefs that you will have the opportunity to discover during an overnight stay on a luxe cruise liner today. The boat will veer off the beaten track, tacking you to less-crowded diving destinations and hideaway bays where you will partake in a range of wonderful watersports.

dayInfo.title: Khao Lak - Tantalizing Tastes of Andaman Cuisine
dayInfo.description: You will spend your morning appreciating every inch of the Similan Islands as your boat drifts with the tides to castaway shorelines, over coral reefs teeming with colorful marine life, and around forested headlands that sing with the sounds of nature. You will tuck into Thai cuisine prepared on the shores of a little, uncrowded beach before you head for Khao Lak to spend the afternoon unwinding in the comfort of your secluded seaside paradise. In the evening, you will treasure sunset scenes over the sea as you dine on freshly caught seafood dishes representing the height of Andaman cuisine.

dayInfo.title: Khao Lak - Venture to Phang Nga Bay
dayInfo.description: Khao Lak’s series of charming villages nestled along the sun-washed Phang Nga coastline are a delight to slowly discover, and you will leisurely peruse the many vibrant markets and decadent restaurants introducing you to the province’s unique cultural charms. You may also head for Phang Nga Bay if you wish to relish another exquisite speed boat tour of Thailand’s mesmerizing islands, including those famously featured in Hollywood blockbusters. The possibilities in and around Phang Nga are endless with the help of dedicated and expert guides.

dayInfo.title: Phuket - Indulge in the Pleasures of Phuket
dayInfo.description: The final destination of your Vietnam and Thailand tour is Phuket, an iconic island destination rising from the depths of the Andaman Sea that hosts many spirited locals and eager-eyed visitors. The island boasts rich slices of rainforest in its northern corners and popular sweeping white-sand beaches covering every inch of its coastline. It is also home to cultural highlights, including venerated Thai temples ornately embellished with jewels and expensive materials and crowded food markets serving an assortment of distinct Thai delicacies. You will be thrilled to explore the phenomenon that is Phuket shortly after you have arrived.

dayInfo.title: Phuket - A Busy Morning Before You Say Goodbye
dayInfo.description: The Thai sun will wash over Phuket in the morning, and the sounds of locals gearing up for the day as they open their stores and let the aromas of breakfast flood the streets will echo from the streets outside your suite. You may enjoy a light snack at your accommodation before you explore Phuket for one last time and savor every minute spent in Thailand. You may find refuge beneath the shady palms hanging over soft sands or seek out commemorative trinkets at morning markets before you meet your private transfer and head for the airport.

tourName: Best of Thailand and Vietnam Tour
placesVisited: Hanoi, Â Â Hue, Hoi An, Bangkok, Ayutthaya, Khao Yai, Halong Bay
generalInfo: Vietnam and Thailand both abound with stories and mysteries that continue to unfold. With landscapes of karst and caves, ancient temples of meditative bliss, enigmatic backstreets of sizzling food and unknown art all around, your eyes will struggle with where to look as you take it all in. Unwrap the secrets on this two-week insiders’ tour with superb local guides leading you through seven idiosyncratic destinations. Including two luxury cruises, this is a journey of history, heritage, wild landscapes, and cultural connections.

dayInfo.title: Hanoi – Touching Down in Vietnam
dayInfo.description: When you touch down in Hanoi, a plane makes a lighthearted introduction as the remains of a MIG jet fighter strewn beyond the runway is one of the first things you will see. As you venture into Hanoi with your local guide, the narrative goes far beyondjust period in history as rice noodles simmer on fragrant market-stalls, elegant architecture speaks of a much older past, and Hanoi’s Old Quarter is a great place to soak your senses into what the city is all about. Nothing specific is planned for the day, so you can see how you feel upon arrival your guide will be able to customize your plans accordingly.

dayInfo.title: Hanoi – Locals and Legends of Hanoi
dayInfo.description: Motorcycles beep their way past as locals perform tai chi around Hoan Kiem Lake. Cafe terraces peer out onto everyday life as you enjoy diving into a deeper exploration of Hanoi with a journey into its quirks as presented by the locals. Listen to stories from local traders, take a walk down Soviet lanes, and then share a bowl of pho with a decorated Vietnamese fighter pilot. These local encounters help to narrate a county’s history that is often misunderstood and gives you insight into a city that is proud to protect its tradition. Of course, along the way, you will see places as well, like temples and pagodas, parks and places where the history was written.

dayInfo.title: Halong Bay – Sailing the Bay of the Descending Dragon
dayInfo.description: The world called it a new seven wonder, but the locals call it the Bay of the Descending Dragon. You probably know it as Halong Bay, and it is a place that never looks real as a face of limestone teeth rises from the ocean with so many jagged peaks and islands. Most mornings these emerge from the mist, an iconic experience as you spend two nights on a luxury houseboat. You will cruise around and travel through the karst landscape as the panoramas seem to keep stretching forever. Disembark at caves and descend into a murky underworld. You can kayak, or take a tender boat, to small sandy islands and drift past floating villages. One day of cruising gives you a sense of the landscape, but two days allows you to fully explore as Halong Bay stretches for many hundreds of square miles. After the flight to Vietnam and the continual impressions of Hanoi, Halong Bay is also a place where you can unwind and ensure that you are rested for the journey that is yet to come. Sit back on the deck as sunset colors bounce off the limestone. Take breakfast on the deck, your boat enjoying solitude between the karst peaks. Stand outside and feel the wind past your ears as you travel by wind power, the houseboat using both sail and motor to travel around.

dayInfo.title: Hue – Imperial Histories and Regal Tastes
dayInfo.description: Hue really suffered during the war with the imperial capital decimated during the Tet Offensive. However, it has since been revitalized, and the city has retained the grace of a past era. After the drive back to Hanoi you will fly south to Hue, and have some time to explore the city at leisure. Hue is a good place to form your own impressions before your local guide takes you into the rich history. The late afternoon is when the city really comes alive, and that is when you can go walking with your local guide to see the remains of a time before war and buildings that have risen from the ashes.

dayInfo.title: Hue – Tombs, Pagodas and the Tet Offensive
dayInfo.description: Along the Perfume River you will travel with stops to admire the tombs of Tu Duc and Khai Dinh, with such elegance in their design. At a small pagoda, you can meet local monks and spend time discussing the country’s past and present. You will then see what has been left behind in what used to be known as the Forbidden Purple City, and there will be the chance to see where the battle-lines were drawn during the war. Hue is a changing city, and there is beauty to be found in places where you may not expect it, particularly as Hue makes its own transition into the 21st century.

dayInfo.title: Hoi An – Emerald Landscapes and Waterside Bliss
dayInfo.description: Vietnamese landscapes often appear as if from a dream, and now your eyes can drink in a patchwork of rice paddies and villages above the South China Sea. The drive from Hue to Hoi An is perhaps the most impressive of any in the country, especially as you are able to traverse Hai Van Pass which is generally closed to traffic. Stop at villages and a lagoon on route, and then enjoy a local seafood lunch before rolling into Hoi An, the country’s cutest city. Fully protected as a World Heritage Site, the old city center is the perfect place for strolling at leisure. Stop on the cafe terraces, explore the shops, take a look in the market and go down to the waterfront, where your hotel is perched amid the history. Wake the next day and go around with your local guide, and once again it is the people that best tell Vietnam’s story. There is an option to travel by bicycle as well, which can take you out along the city’s surrounding fields and canals, where basket boats and bamboo furniture are part of the experience. As part of these two days, expect to try plenty of Vietnamese coffee, savor some of the country’s best local delicacies, and meet the people that make Hoi An tick—the chess players and the craftsman, the antique restorers and the carpenters, artists and chefs.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok – City Colors and Cultural Idiosyncrasies
dayInfo.description: Flying away from Vietnam you will soon touch down in Southeast Asia’s bustling hub, Bangkok. Bangkok is full of hidden charm and redolent scenes, and the streets are very different to those of Hue. Tuk-tuks honk, lights flash and people rush by, yet beneath what initially feels like chaos is a world of local sights and flavors. Like Hoi An, late-afternoon to evening is the best time to soak your senses into what is happening. Set out on a private orientation tour, starting in the oldest parts of the city and then driving past the illuminated Grand Palace to Ratchadamnoen Avenue. Sit down at a famous Bangkok restaurant and look out on the city, stroll the flower market and listen to the excited chatter that overflows from the stalls. Return to your hotel along the river, lights flashing all around before they subside and the silence of your riverside hotel takes over.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok – Floating Markets and Stunning Sights
dayInfo.description: Including both the famous and the unknown, today’s tour will sink your senses into the metropolis. Join monks at Wat Saket, listening to their soft changing as incense spills into the air. Give alms before admiring the temple’s gold-gilded monuments and checking out the view. With a drive through old Bangkok, you can stop at hidden temples and Wat Ratchabophit before visiting an old Taoist temple where the Chinese community comes to pray. Later on, you will see the Grand Palace before heading out of the city to a floating market, where flowers fill the boats and that telltale sound of nattering traders fills the air.

dayInfo.title: Ayutthaya – Cruising Through Rural Thailand
dayInfo.description: Move next into rural Thailand, a houseboat taking you away from the bustle of Bangkok. The cityscape gives way to rolling countryside, skyscrapers disappear and are replaced by teak houses, temples rise on the riverbank as vestiges to the past. Stop at the Temple of Dawn, explore the royal boat collection at a large museum, and watch life unfold along the riverbank as you drift up the river towards Ayutthaya. Villagers wash and play in the river, children wave as you pass, and you simply drift on by. The houseboat docks outside Wat Bang Na temple, and your dinner is served on the deck, surrounded by sunset and a sense of history.

dayInfo.title: Ayutthaya – Amid the Ancient Siam Capital
dayInfo.description: Ayutthaya dates back to 1350 but has mostly been abandoned since the 18thcentury, when war with Burma meant it was no longer Thailand’s capital. The ancient temples are ready to be explored today, but only after you meet with the monks of Wat Bang Na for a blessing to future journeys. Many of the temples have been carefully restored, and it is easy to lose yourself in all the details, although some prefer the handful of temples still left in a state of ruin. Relive ancient history with your guide, and then spend the night back on board, the boat moored beside another temple, Wat Niwet Thammaprawat. Dinner is a regal affair, including many of the dishes from Ayutthaya’s time.

dayInfo.title: Khao Yai – Buddhist Temples and Thai Vineyards
dayInfo.description: There is plenty of time to explore more temples this morning, beginning with Niwet Thammaprawat, which was inspired by European Gothic styles. The royal mansions at Bang Pa-In palace blend European, Chinese and Thai influence, and you will enjoy them all. Traveling onwards, you will find one of Thailand’s lesser-known stories, its vineyards. These are the country’s best, and you will wander the vines, before tasting with sweeping views towards Khao Yai, today’s final destination. At a lodge amid the trees you hear monkeys and gibbons, perhaps even spot them swinging past. Hornbills bellow while the call of crickets swings into the night. The next two nights are spent in a quiet lodge on the edge of the national park, surrounded by a part of Thailand very different to what you’ve experienced before.

dayInfo.title: Khao Yai – A Day in Khao Yai National Park
dayInfo.description: Rounded prints suggest elephants wandered past as gibbons call from high in the treetops, their shout echoing between the trees. Other primates are here, shouting and sending their messages into the wild. Take a walk through the forest in search of the wildlife before continuing by car through the park, Heaw Suwat Waterfall a place for a picnic with a view. The park’s second highest peak can also be reached by road, and it provides a view that seems to stretch all the way to Bangkok. Later in the afternoon, you will be back at the lodge to enjoy the spa, and then after dinner, finish with a visit to a salt lick to watch and wait for the wild elephants to wander by playfully.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok – Departure
dayInfo.description: Coming out of the park, beneath the calls of monkeys, you will return to Thailand’s main roads and transfer to Bangkok. You will be dropped at the international airport for your homebound flight, taking back memories of the best of Thailand and Vietnam.

tourName: Best of Thailand in 12 Days
placesVisited: Bangkok, Chiang Mai, Phuket, Phang Nga Bay
generalInfo: From Bangkok’s bustling cityscape and sacred temples to Chiang Mai’s forested wilderness and Phuket’s culinary culture to Phang Nga Bay’s breathtaking karst island scenery, Thailand is a country of boundless beauty you may discover during 12 days exploring its iconic destinations and cities. Embrace the sophisticated atmosphere of Thailand’s finest experiences and introduce yourself to the humble heritage of the country’s traditional activities during this eye-opening adventure.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok - The Heritage and Future of Thailand
dayInfo.description: Thailand’s capital city, Bangkok, is a hub of lavish entertainment and a gateway into Thai tradition. The cloud-scraping cityscape is modern, yet its friendly neighborhoods reflect the country’s rich heritage. Bangkok is a blend of the old world and the new, a cosmopolitan that will introduce you to the grandeur of Thailand from the moment you touch down and transfer to your palatial accommodation pinned in the heart of the city. You may stroll the streets this afternoon under the city’s dazzling neon lights and tuck into Thai cuisine against 360-degree backdrops of the skyline at rooftop restaurants and bars.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok - Explore Thai Tradition in Bangkok’s Famous Temples
dayInfo.description: Temples and landmarks speckle Bangkok’s neighborhoods, decorating the cityscape in spiritual heritage and ancient tradition. You will join your private guide in the morning and set off on a tour of these sacred sites, with your first stop being the gold-tipped spires and colorful porcelain walls of Wat Pho. The echoes of monks chanting will fill the temple complex as you gander at the historic shrines and statues honoring the Thai Buddhist tradition. Your tour will continue at the Grand Palace, the Temple of the Emerald Buddha, and Wat Arun, spiritual grounds of tremendous significance nestled alongside the Chao Phraya River.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok - The Finest Thai Foods in Bangkok
dayInfo.description: Thailand’s culinary culture is world-famous, and its dishes serve as inspiration for restaurants in all corners of the globe. Today, you will indulge in the country’s cherished cuisine as authentically as possible with your first true taste of Thailand enjoyed at the Damnoen Saduak floating market. Onboard a traditional wooden boat, you will glide across the gleaming waterways to fruit and vegetable-filled boats bobbing on the canals while local chatter surrounds you. You will visit the iconic Lao Tak Lak Market afterward as well as the 200-year old China Town district of Bangkok to tuck into more exquisite Thai dishes.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Mai - Evening Tuk-Tuk City Tour of Chiang Mai
dayInfo.description: Chiang Mai is Thailand’s northern capital, a region of rich Muang heritage that is largely covered by tropical rainforest and sprawling, untouched landscapes. You will land and transfer to a delightful boutique resort nestled in the viridian hills of Doi Suthep Mountain, where you will have access to Chiang Mai’s unending natural beauty and spirited cityscape charm. In the evening, you will explore the city by traditional Thai tuk-tuk , an open-air vehicle, and visit significant sites, including the Iron Bridge, the Three Kings Monument, and venerated Chiang Mai temples.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Mai - Markets, Temples, and the Delicacies of Chiang Mai
dayInfo.description: You will visit Chiang Mai Gate Market this morning, a colorful food emporium laden with fresh vegetables, sweet fruit, tantalizing spices, and grilled meats. Here, you may purchase rice and incense should you wish to offer alms to the passing monks. In the afternoon, you will visit the Warorot Market’s floral aisles for a traditional flower garland-making workshop before you visit the ancient Wat Chiang Man, Wat Chedi Luang, and Wat Phra Singh temples. A culinary class alongside a Thai family this evening will teach you the art of Thai cuisine as you prepare an assortment of delectable delicacies.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Mai - Embracing the Magnificent Thai Elephants
dayInfo.description: Thailand’s elephants have been subject to ill-treatment as many locals offer unethical elephant rides across the country to eager visitors. The mistreatment of these magnificent mammals is devastating, but there are several sanctuaries scattered across Thailand dedicated to the proper treatment of the country’s revered creatures. Today, you will visit one such sanctuary to learn about the massive Southeast Asian elephants as well as prepare meals for them, play with them, and bathe them in the refreshing river waters. You will enjoy these experiences against a spectacular wilderness backdrop and capture remarkable images during the day.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Mai - Escape to Doi Suthep and FORRU
dayInfo.description: Atop the lofty peaks of Doi Suthep Mountain lies Wat Prathat Doi Suthep, a sacred temple dressed in gold that boasts incredible Buddhist statues and ancient artifacts that will showcase more of Thailand’s rich traditions and awe-inspiring spiritual beliefs during your journey to the summit of the rolling emerald hill. Afterward, you will stroll through the luxuriant canopy of FORRU, the forest restoration unit of Chiang Mai University. Stories shrouding the park’s giant fig tree and views of the towering wild banana, ferns, Pandanus fruit, and various palms provide a bewitching escape from the exuberant cityscape.

dayInfo.title: Phuket - Indulging in Unique Thai Delicacies
dayInfo.description: Phuket is a fascinating Thai island set on the sparkling sapphire stage of the Andaman Sea that has an interesting cultural influence from visitors and settlers from around the world. The cuisine is unlike any other, fusing traditional Thai delicacies with Arabian and French-inspired dishes to create a uniquely Phuket culinary culture you will embrace during your first day exploring the island’s restaurants and eateries. You will stumble upon hidden food vendors as you venture off the beaten path and indulge in an array of exquisite meals as you wander the streets of central Phuket.

dayInfo.title: Phuket - Explore the Khao Phra Thaeo Wildlife Sanctuary
dayInfo.description: A small part of northeast Phuket remains largely untouched, and you will visit this region on a tour of the island’s last remaining rainforest in the Khao Phra Thaeo Wildlife Sanctuary. You will peruse the lush jungle and arrive at the Gibbon Rehabilitation Center, a conservation initiative intent on reintroducing gibbons to the wild. After learning more about the center’s efforts, you will continue to Bang Pae Waterfall and hike to the crest of the pounding falls. Here, you may relax under the shady canopy or swim in the natural spring as birds and monkeys whistle from the trees.

dayInfo.title: Phuket - Full-Day Island Adventure in Phang Nga Bay
dayInfo.description: You will explore more of Phuket’s surrounding natural beauty today as you set sail across the glossy Andaman Sea to the emerald islands of Phang Nga Bay, a region of karst formations connected by jade-colored channels. You will board canoes and paddle across the web of water spreading around Koh Panak and Koh Hong, where you will glide alongside the imposing limestone cliffs and enter dim caves carved into their rugged walls. Your adventure will lead you to a modest fishing village on Panyee Island, where you will tuck into lunch and then the iconic coastline of James Bond Island.

dayInfo.title: Phuket - Wallowing on the Andaman Beaches
dayInfo.description: With nothing planned for your final full day in Phuket, you may enjoy the island’s pleasures at your pace and luxuriate in the peaceful atmosphere enveloping the shimmering shoreline. Today, you may spend hours with your toes in the silky soft sand under the shady palms lining Phuket’s pristine beaches. You may also swim in the translucent waters of the Andaman and snorkel over the dazzling coral reefs teeming with colorful marine life. Other watersports such as kayaking, jet-skiing, and speed boating are available for thrill-seekers staying on the postcard-perfect island.

dayInfo.title: Phuket - Heading Home from Picturesque Phuket
dayInfo.description: Phuket comes to life before the break of dawn as locals who wake up early for work flock to markets and coffee shops while the sun rises. The sounds of buzzing blenders making smoothies, fragrances of sizzling breakfast dishes on the go, and fresh sea breeze rolling off the Andaman typify a morning in Phuket that you will relish today before you leave. After breakfast, you will pack your belongings, meet your private transfer, and make your way to the international airport to catch your flight from picturesque Phuket back home.

tourName: Best of Thailand Tour: Bangkok, Chiang Mai, Phuket & Phang Nga
placesVisited: Bangkok, Chiang Mai, Phuket
generalInfo: There is an endless amount of history and charm, elegance and beauty for you to discover on this handcrafted Thailand tour. Temples climb mountains and adorn summits. Beaches sparkle with pure effervescence. Elephants continue to roam the jungles with jubilant cries. From the regal waterway of Bangkok to the solid gold Buddha of Tirmitr Temple, the stunning panorama overlooking Phuket Island to the quintessential Old City of Chiang Mai protected by a historic fortress, every day will be an experience; every day will be an endless discovery.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok – The Discovery Begins
dayInfo.description: Set down in the fantastic metropolis of Bangkok, Thailand. The city overtakes the horizon and continues in every direction. At first the streets can be overwhelming; however, the city easily welcomes and settles you in nicely. You will be met at the airport by a private transfer and you will journey through the inexhaustible energy of the city beside the banks of the Chao Praya River. The afternoon is yours to relax and explore the bustling neighborhoods at your leisure. You can always find a quiet elegance at one of the amazing local restaurants in the city, where you can sit on the deck and admire the spectacular view of the waterway and the city beyond.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok – Finding Grandeur
dayInfo.description: After a luscious breakfast of fresh juice, fruits, and so much more you will step out into the city to discover its stunning history set beside the riverbanks and beyond. Chao Praya River is known as the “River of Kings,” and was once the most bustling highway in the city. Now the water is calm and quiet as you come to the Temple of Dawn. Before visiting the Royal Palace you can see the immaculate construction and glittering exterior of the Temple of Dawn in the early morning and at dusk. The central spire ascends over 210 feet high, decorated with colored glass and porcelain to help catch the light at various angles. You can even climb the stairs to get an expansive view of the river and the surrounding cityscape. Your tour continues with a visit to the most iconic of Thailand’s over 40,000 temples, many of them located within Bangkok. The Temple of the Golden Buddha features a statue weighing over five tons, made of pure gold and which was once covered in stucco to protect it from the invading armies. The exterior of the temple is lavish white with gilded trim, with the roofs shaped into concentric triangles. The interior is focused on the pristine sheen of the Buddha, rested in the moment of enlightenment. Whether along the riverbanks or traversing the old Chinatown and the temple of Wat Po, there is endless wonder to be found along the streets of Bangkok.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok – Leisurely Pace
dayInfo.description: The day is yours to do with as you please whether strolling through the Sukhumvit Road, a center for shopping and eateries, or wandering through the variety of temples and markets that you may have missed. If you want to experience a wonderful tradition overlooked by many visitors to the city, you can venture to the Floating Market at Lat Mayom. The area is visited by locals and Thai visitors from around the country to appreciate the local food and easy prices. The boats are stocked with vivacious goods from jackfruit to seafood, and hover around the riverbanks stretching bags that dangle from poles, perfecting the reach from boat to land with the goods exchanged and money paid. Whether you prefer to stay on a boat and linger amongst the vendors or sit on the banks with the sizzling grills filling the air with both sound and aroma, the market is an experience that should not be missed. Lush pink lilies sprout in garden ponds. Some locals even open up their kitchens, cooking up succulent noodles.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Mai – Into the Jungle
dayInfo.description: After breakfast you will be met at your hotel by a private transfer who will guide you to the airport in time for your flight to Chiang Mai, the capital city of northern Thailand. The jungle clad north is also home to rustic tribal villages and the remarkable Old City within modern Chiang Mai that dates back 700 years. Even within the encompassing size of the city there remains an atmosphere more akin to a modern town, where the smiles are present, the streets are serene, and you can settle into the luxuries that include elephant rides and bamboo rafts, secluded cafes, and immaculate temples. You can see the spire of Doi Suthep rising over the trees on the mountaintop, shimmering in the afternoon sun.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Mai – Elephant Walks and More
dayInfo.description: The majesty of elephants dates back through Thailand’s illustrious history; their grandeur stemmed from their power and grace. After breakfast you will venture outside of Chiang Mai’s city limits and into the dense trees and meandering mountains, arriving at one of the many elephant camps that espouse the region and the once-revered animal. At the camp you can see the traditional techniques used to train elephants throughout Thai history, garnishing a lavish past and present that gives sanctuary to the gracious and friendly mammals. You have the option to climb aboard the favored elephant and journey through the forest as it marches between the trees and over the undulating grounds. Later in the day you will venture through the varied temples of Chiang Mai to discover the local splendor set within the towers and tremendous displays of dedication and spirituality. Near the 4,800 foot peak of Doi Suthep you will find the beginnings of a staircase beneath the overhanging trees. The stairs are laid with the colorful brick set between roaring dragons which have guarded the temple from spirits for centuries.
