Ascend the 306 steps and you will find yourself on the platform that overlooks the valley below. The rising chedi adorns that mountaintop like an extra peak while you stand beside the sparkling white elephant, said to have chosen this spot for the temple to reside.

dayInfo.title: Phuket – Over the Trees and into the Water
dayInfo.description: Delight in your superb breakfast beside the stunning tree line before you are met by your private transfer and whisked to the airport. Soon you will lounge along the pristine beaches of Phuket, located off the western shores of Thailand. The central mountain is where the island derives its name. Filled with lavish greenery and crystal water, you can spend days there relaxing or exploring, either option giving you the same sense of respite and fulfillment that you seek. The soft and sweet scent of the sea eases the warm day. You can hear the jovial cries along the shore and you are ready to sink into the sand and feel the cool reach of the water.

dayInfo.title: Phuket – Set Out Bayside
dayInfo.description: Today you will step out into the sun and off of the immaculate sandy shores of Phuket cruising out along Phang Nga Bay. The water mists into the air in a cool spritz on your cheeks. The wind blows through your hair as you venture along the water’s glassy surface. The famous limestone karsts stand erect and ominous in the water, jutting out like magnificent stalagmites located around James Bond Island, named for its appearance in “ The Man with the Golden Gun .” At Khai Island you can witness the unparalleled reef that encircles the sand. Copious fish that glow shades of yellow and orange can be seen whether you view them from above or below the water’s surface. The salty air is touched with a random sweetness that brings blush to your cheeks. The sun sparkles along the effervescent waterline as you make your way back to Phuket’s shores.

dayInfo.title: Phuket – Island Life
dayInfo.description: Wake up to the alluring scent of the sea and the freshly pressed coffee that calls you to breakfast. The day is at your leisure meant to give you the best of the island at your own pace, from the sea to the mountains, the trees to the reef. Whether you prefer to spend your time lounging in Karon beneath an umbrella with a cold drink by your side or adventure to the mountain summit to see the over 130 foot tall Big Buddha you can relax or explore, luxuriate or discover. For a trendy and overlooked spot that offers you an overview of Phuket Town, you can head to Khao Rang. Many people come to visit the Big Buddha; however, a grand and lavish time can be spent beneath the comfortable shade on the patio of Tung Ka Café. You can sip a drink or delight in a traditional lunch while watching the mixture of city and jungle extend to the sea. You can stretch your legs a little at Wat Kao Rang Nok, strolling through the three wooden praying rooms and various Buddha statues. You can hear birds chirping, monks praying, and the overall beauty of the island comes to a delicate stop.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok – Island Returned
dayInfo.description: Today you wave goodbye to the sweetness of Phuket Island as a private transfer takes you to the airport to return to Bangkok. Your return to the city will have you in close comforts to the airport giving you the day to explore or relax at your leisure. The city remains open and vibrant, continuing its energetic glow. For a relaxing and easy day you could visit the Golden Mountain, a lush, tree filled mountain that overlooks the city offering an escape from the bustling streets, and one more chance to stroll along the lush, tranquil greenery. Quiet music plays as frangipanis and thick vines line the walkway. Birds chirp, the gentle trickle of the waterfall lingers in the air, and you will have discovered another secret in a city of hidden whispers.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok – Discovered Returns
dayInfo.description: There is a sweetness to breakfast that drifts through the air; decadent banana and fresh squeezed orange juice lightens the already buoyant morning. A private transfer will take you from your hotel to the airport where your flight will soon have you soaring over the Pacific en route home. You have seen majestic islands and marvelous jungles, wandered through exquisite temples and floated in crystal clear water. Your time on this tour has taken you deeper into the whispers of Thailand’s grandeur, letting you discover the country’s wonder. Soon you will settle at home with every intention of returning to discover even more of Thailand.

tourName: Best of Tropical Thailand: Two-Week Highlights Vacation
placesVisited: Phuket, Koh Phi Phi, Bangkok, Ayutthaya, Chiang Mai
generalInfo: For those wishing to encounter the best of Thailand, we have handpicked a select number of premier destinations for the most enriching two-week tour that the country has to offer. You will journey to the most coveted Thai temples in the bustling city of Bangkok, explore the idyllic beaches on thriving islands, and immerse yourselves in the rich, cultural heritage of the local people. These are only a few of the captivating highlights that you can expect to indulge in during your luxurious stay in this Southeast Asian paradise.

dayInfo.title: Phuket – Grand Expeditions on Land and Sea
dayInfo.description: Phuket, Thailand’s largest island, is an inspiring destination that is teeming with diverse cultural experiences and entertaining highlights. After you check through immigration, you will meet your private limousine transfer and journey to Surin Beach. Here, you will stay at a premier 5-star resort, which will be just a minute’s walk from the shore. Your accommodation will exude opulence with its harmonious architectural design and first-class amenities. The professional staff will welcome you with friendly smiles and direct you to your extraordinary penthouse. Fit with your own private rooftop pool, your stay in Phuket will be the perfect island retreat. On the evening of your first night, revel in a marvelous gourmet meal with ocean views. You will catch wafts of fresh seafood cooking on the grill as you sip on elegant cocktails. Peer out at the horizon, and you will witness the sun slowly give way to the night, and as it sets, the sky turns crimson and shares a picture-perfect backdrop for your delectable dinner. The following day, you will meet your expert tour guide, and discover many intriguing facets of Phuket’s rich culture and rugged landscape as your guide imparts valuable insight along the way. Wat Chalong is an immaculately-kept, gold-adorned temple that glistens under the sun. As you uncover its deep history, you will be filled with great admiration for the peoples’ spiritual practices. Afterward, you will set off to the majestic Big Buddha where you will encounter a momentous 112 feet tall statue of Buddha that towers over the entire island. You will capture unforgettable memories with uninterrupted vistas from the heights of this viewpoint. Your tour will culminate with trips to idyllic beaches, and you will feel worlds away as you dig your toes into the soft white sand and wade in the glimmering azure waters. To conclude your adventurous stay in Phuket, you will transfer via private speed boat to the Similan Islands for an impressive Scuba diving experience. The archipelago boasts some of the most magnificent diving destinations in Thailand. Accompanied by professional guides every step of the way, you will feel completely safe as you swim amongst schools of hundreds of fish and encounter rainbow-colored coral reefs. You will laze around on the pristine beaches before you return to Phuket later this evening. Your final few hours in Phuket will be spent at a premier culinary school. In the morning, you will venture to an authentic market nearby in search of desirable fresh ingredients where you will feel the buzzing energy around you as you weave through the elaborate stalls. After you have collected your produce, you will learn to master the art of traditional Thai cuisine with the help of a revered, local chef. You will also be awarded a certificate to showcase your newly acquired skills before you depart Phuket.

dayInfo.title: Koh Phi Phi – Paradise in Phi Phi and the Greater Phang Nga Bay
dayInfo.description: You will transfer from Phuket via luxury speed boat to the renowned tropical island of Koh Phi Phi. Famous for its stunning white shores and turquoise waters, the endearing island will offer intimate experiences in stylish fashion. As you wrap around the bay, you will witness mighty limestone cliffs that are lined with lush green forests. The warm sea breeze will revitalize your body as it lifts up off the clear, shallow ocean. Through the transparent sea, you will encounter sprawling coral reefs. Shortly after, you will depart your boat and check into your elegant seaside resort. Amid the vibrant jungle setting, on a beach less traveled, you will be swept away in paradise. Your private guide will meet you with a luxury speed boat later in the afternoon. With insider knowledge of the surrounding environment, you will venture to pristine beaches that hug the rugged coastline. Each beach will offer a unique setting, which you will capture in all its glory. Spend your time in the bright blue water as you snorkel the spectacular reefs. Finally, you will arrive at the secluded and beautiful Nui Bay. The small stretch of shore receives only a handful of visitors, making this the ideal spot to bask in the sunset while you snack and sip your evening away. The following day, you will journey around the greater Phang Nga Bay, and your private speed boat guide will take you to coveted destinations that are dotted around the seascape. The highlights include a visit to the famous James Bond Island and a kayaking adventure to hideaway caves. You will capture unforgettable memories of the emerald-green ocean, mighty limestone islands, and daring cave complexes, and the distinguished tour will open your eyes to the unspoiled natural beauty that encompasses Thailand. Then, visit an upper-class wellness spa where you will completely unwind. The expert masseuse will release all tension from your bodies as you experience this mastered and ancient massage practice. Your stay in Phi Phi will be complete with gourmet dining experiences. With a wealth of tasteful restaurants to choose from, which serve a variety of cuisines, you will delight in wholesome meals throughout the trip.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok – Discover a Unique Perspective of Bangkok
dayInfo.description: Bangkok boasts an incredible cityscape that deftly blends Thai authenticity and first-world urbanity. As you approach the third destination of your luxury vacation, you will witness this remarkable landscape. You will venture to the heart of bustling Bangkok shortly after meeting your private transfer. Your fluent driver will take you to your opulent accommodation along the Chao Phraya River banks. The 5-star hotel shares unbeatable views of the city skyline and calmly flowing river. It is a private suite that is fit for a king, and a queen will await your arrival while professional service ensures that your check-in is seamless. Once you are settled, you can spend the afternoon at your leisure as you indulge in world-class amenities. For the ultimate Bangkok welcome, you will transfer to a fine-dining rooftop restaurant just before sunset. As you look upon the city from the towering heights of this premier location, the glowing sunset will radiate passionately in the sky. Once the sun recedes, you can tuck into your award-winning Thai cuisine while you enjoy the sumptuous splendor. You will witness the majestic city setting in great detail the following day. After fueling up on a delightful breakfast, you will transfer to a helicopter base site nearby. Highly experienced pilots will welcome you to the grounds as you prepare to board the airbus helicopter. You will settle comfortably into VIP Club seats as the vehicle propels itself off of the ground. Soon you will find yourselves thousands of feet in the air, and from these great heights, you will see the city like never before. You will sweep past skyscrapers, fly over grand temples, hover above the Chao Phraya River, and dart through sprawling landscapes. The life-changing experience will culminate with an incredible lunch as you return, and a knowledgeable guide will meet you shortly after you touch down. For the rest of the day, you will discover the city’s rich, cultural landmarks. There is an abundance of temples that are scattered around the city, and your expert guide will take you to the most coveted sites. The sheer beauty of these intricate constructions will be sights to behold. Wat Arun is blanketed by multi-colored porcelain while Wat Pho hosts a 150-foot long golden Reclining Buddha. These grand heritage destinations boast a wealth of picturesque photo opportunities. Your final day in Bangkok will reveal more of the city’s cultural highlights. You will privately transfer, accompanied by a dignified tour guide, to premier museums and art houses. The Jim Thompson House represents the restoration of the Thai silk industry and a riveting blend of Thai and Western design. The Bangkok Art & Culture Centre is a globally-renowned and breathtaking display of Southeast Asian creative talent. These are but a few of the significant highlights that await. Before you depart from Bangkok, you will visit the city’s famous retail district. The streets of Siam are lined with elite fashion stores and exclusive shopping malls, and you will discover the city’s chic style as you search for unique items to take back home. Indulge in one last exquisite supper as you fine-dine on a luxurious river cruise along the Chao Phraya River.

dayInfo.title: Ayutthaya – Uncover the City’s Ancient History
dayInfo.description: A luxury private coach will collect you from your hotel in Bangkok and transfer you through the diverse landscape that surrounds the ancient city of Ayutthaya. The magnificent city retains its age-old charm, and this will be increasingly evident as you explore more of it. You will arrive at a lavish boutique resort after the short drive, and the stunning accommodation will take inspiration from traditional Thai culture in order to create a truly authentic luxury experience. You will settle into your gorgeous room that exudes its charming Siamese influence. With top-tier amenities and a riverfront setting, you will revel in the secluded escape from Bangkok’s fast-paced energy and will the evening to a close with gourmet Thai cuisine under the blissful sunset. The most notable attraction in Ayutthaya is the monumental Historical Park. The park is home to a wealth of temple ruins and museums that protect valuable artifacts from the destination’s past. During the Burmese-Siamese War, the majority of this region was devastated. Though a large portion of the area has been rebuilt, the relics of temples and heritage sites remain in honor of the dramatic history. You will transfer to the park in the private comfort of a traditional Tuk-Tuk , which is a Southeast Asian open-are vehicle. You will feel the warm wind breeze through your hair as you approach the UNESCO World Heritage Site. Set amongst stretches of lush greenery, the mighty temple ruins will be a truly enchanting sight. You will make your way to pinnacle temples and fascinating ruins, and you will learn about the city’s cultural heritage and the aftermath of the war. The journey will culminate at the famous Wat Mahathat. The temple is home to one of the most iconic Ayutthaya images, and resting in the roots of a tall Bodhi Tree is the head of a Buddha statue. You may capture the symbolic image as you soak in the humble atmosphere that emanates from the spiritual grounds. To conclude your brief but captivating stay in Ayutthaya, you will transfer to the Bang Pa-in Palace. Also known as the Summer Palace, the grand compound is an ode to extreme regality. The royal residency blends various Southeast Asian architecture into what is one of the most marvelous palaces in the country. Surrounding by a gentle body of water, this tranquil setting will bring your tour to a perfect close.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Mai ��– Explore Authentic Thai Tradition
dayInfo.description: Your final destination will be the northern city of Chiang Mai. The Northern Thai capital is an inspiring destination that you cannot afford to miss as you discover the best of the country. Chiang Mai is a sought-after location that boasts exclusive accommodations across its diverse landscape. You will transfer to the city and arrive at your premier resort that is nested below the striking Doi Suthep Mountain. The boutique resort retains old-world, 18th-century charm and its rooms will exude opulence. The idyllic setting will be the perfect place to call home as your adventurous Thai tour nears its final day. You will fully immerse yourself in traditional Thai spiritual practices on your first day in Chiang Mai. With a cultured guide to accompany you, you will privately transfer to extremely significant heritage sites. Your journey will begin on the peaks of Doi Suthep Mountain at Wat Phra That where you will arrive at the glistening golden temple after a brisk hike up the towering staircase. From the heights of the temple, you will feel on top of the world and be met with panoramic vistas of the greater Chiang Mai region. Your tour will continue at other important temples, each standing out distinctly from the rest because of their intricate and meticulously crafted unique designs and settings. You will conclude the day by speaking with a resident monk and learning more about their age-old practices. The friendly conversation will provide you with a deep connection to a country that you will never forget. On your final day in Thailand, you will set off in search of Chiang Mai’s stunning waterfalls. You will escape the thriving city and will be accompanied by a knowledgeable guide to prestigious waterfall destinations. You will enjoy the morning soaking up the sun and dipping your heads in the powerful streams. In the afternoon, you will venture with your guide to an ethnic hill tribe where you will be welcomed by friendly smiles. With the help of your guide, you will get the opportunity to connect with the locals and make friends for the day. You will be served authentic traditional Thai cuisine and dine with the families. Furthermore, you will enjoy elaborate cultural performances by the locals, and the talented and captivating display will provide lifelong memories of an experience that is rarely explored by others. You will enjoy a marvelous candlelit dinner shortly after arriving back in the city to conclude your epic adventure. Tomorrow you will say your final goodbyes, ecstatic that you have had such a luxurious and enriching journey

tourName: Captivating 3-Week Highlights of Thailand Tour
placesVisited: Bangkok, Pattaya, Chiang Mai, Chiang Rai, Koh Samui, Phuket
generalInfo: With friendly faces awaiting your arrival and a bounty of joyous moments to be had, it is no wonder that Thailand is famously known as the Land of Smiles. If you have not yet had the opportunity to explore the spectacular country, then this 3-week tour is tailored for you when you will discover all of Thailand’s best highlights. From the immaculate white-sand, palm tree-lined beaches to the bustling sophisticated cityscape, there is a wealth to explore, and you will do it all. Delve into the country’s rich heritage and uncover the revered flavors of Thai cuisine as you journey to pivotal destinations across its sprawling landscape.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok – Where Tradition Meets Innovation
dayInfo.description: The epicenter of Thailand, Bangkok, is a bustling city that is complete with sophisticated skyscrapers and grand temples. Travelers from around the world flock to the destination because of its rich cultural heritage and world-class cuisine. It perfectly blends age-old tradition with modern innovation, thus offering you a riveting experience in the Land of Smiles. You will be met by a sprawling cityscape setting as you arrive in the capital. You will then journey to a lavish hotel along the Chao Phraya River. The dreamlike accommodation will serve as your peaceful home after exploring this diverse city. From the comfort of your private balcony that overlooks the great city skyline, you may unwind and take stock of the marvelous adventures to be had. Your stay in Bangkok will leave nothing to be desired. You will begin with an immersive tour of the city’s captivating highlights. Your knowledgeable guide will transfer you to Thailand’s most revered temples, and The incredible Wats will emphasize the country’s deeply profound history. You will learn a great deal about the spiritual practices as you explore each temple’s grand presence, in addition to capturing incredible images of their intricate designs. Wat Arun towers up from the ground, gloriously reflecting the sun from its multi-colored structure. The Reclining Buddha stretches over 100 feet across the temple floor and exudes a golden glow. The Grand Palace is an opulent treasure that showcases the country’s dedication to the architectural craft. Each temple possesses a radiant aura and offers a wealth of insight to uncover. During your tour, you will delight in Bangkok’s mouthwatering flavors at the vibrant markets. Eager vendors will sell delightful dishes and stunning trinkets at these exuberant locations. Let the sights, sounds, and smells captivate you as you soak in the bustling city energy. Bangkok is the creative hub of Thailand. The locals take pride in their crafts, drawing on years of practice to create outstanding work. Whether it is thought-provoking art or delicate cuisine, no skill is left unmastered. During your stay, you will fully immerse yourself into the culture where you will delight in world-class meals at award-winning Michelin-Starred restaurants with a behind-the-scenes food tour of Bangkok’s best dishes. With a cultured guide to lead you, you will transfer to the city’s premier art galleries and cultural destinations. The Jim Thompson House shares an endearing account of the revival of Thai silk while the Bangkok Art & Cultural Center showcases the city’s contemporary talent. With trips to Bangkok’s leading fashion establishments and high-end stores as well, you will marvelously wrap up your enthralling stay in the capital.

dayInfo.title: Pattaya – Ocean, Rainforest, and Everything in Between
dayInfo.description: The city of Pattaya is an established tourist hotspot. The destination offers some of the most enthusing activities and experiences to be had in the country. Thus, you will spend an engaging three days delving into the best highlights of Pattaya. You will journey to the city in a luxury coach, allowing you to revel in the sprawling surroundings along the way. The notable landscape and beautiful distant mountain ranges will provide a breathtaking backdrop during your short drive. Upon arrival, you will check-in to your opulent accommodation that will be situated on the beach. You can spend the afternoon soaking up the Thai sun before transferring to a premier dining establishment for remarkable meals and sunset vistas. On your first full day in Pattaya, you will transfer to a thrilling zipline adventure. Just as the Gibbons swing through the trees, you will soar across the jungle canopy. The enthralling day will culminate with a tour of Pattaya’s leading floating market. Travel in long-tailed boats as you discover the laid-back appeal of these authentic experiences. Finally, you will enjoy an award-winning Thai meal at a world-class restaurant. The rest of your stay will be as adventurous as your first day. The Nong Nooch Tropical Botanical Garden is an absolute pleasure. You will witness the beautiful, indigenous plant life while strolling through the lovely, green gardens. After encountering wondrous wildlife, you will enjoy the fruits of Thailand’s wine labor. The Silverlake Vineyard, which is one of the few winemaking destinations in the country, serves up picturesque views of the luscious landscape as you sip on carefully crafted Thai wine. The following day, you will delve into Pattaya history at the Sanctuary of Truth. The religious monument, which is completely constructed out of wood, will be a sight to behold. Your few days in Pattaya will completely revitalize your mind and body. After experiencing the wealth of engaging activities, you may culminate the afternoons with dips in the warm blue ocean. With your snorkels and fins equipped, you will encounter the stunning, brightly colored coral reefs that nestle along the coastline. You will bask in the tropical paradise as sunset vistas bring each splendid day to a perfect close.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Mai – A Journey to the Northern Capital
dayInfo.description: On the 8th day of your trip, you will retreat to what is commonly known as the northern capital of Thailand, Chiang Mai. This journey will reveal more of the country’s captivating culture and heritage. The city is a melting pot of Thai tradition. Furthermore, there is no shortage of activities to keep you thoroughly enthused throughout. A short plane trip will transfer you to the magnificent mountainous region. You will then arrive at an elaborate hotel in the city’s famous old town. Inspired by traditional architecture and capturing authentic Thai design, the highly rated accommodation will provide a unique taste of local living. Situated a short walk from Old Town Chiang Mai’s energetic night markets, you will make your way here and indulge in authentic cuisine on your first night. The following day, you will meet your dignified cultural guide for an immersive temple tour of the city. The destination boasts over 500 temples with many of them standing out as some of the most decadent within the country. You will weave your way through the streets in search of the most interesting ones. Your journey will finish with a trip to Wat Doi Suthep . Situated at the peak of the Doi Suthep Mountain, the mighty temple overlooks the greater Chiang Mai region. You will make your way up the winding trail and gaze out at the idyllic views. The green landscape will stretch out across the horizon, and the clouds will hang low above your head. The stunning pictures that you capture will express its beauty, and the personal memories will prove truly unforgettable. Chiang Mai is home to an incredibly unique wildlife innovation: the Chiang Mai Night Zoo. Here, you will encounter mighty predators and elegant creatures on a thrilling night safari tram tour. The following day, you will witness more of Thailand’s wondrous wildlife with a trip to Doi Inthanon. Ethnic hill tribes and graceful creatures call this high peak home. Here, you will discover more about traditional Thailand and visit the magical waterfalls. You will also have the opportunity to encounter mighty elephants at an ethical sanctuary. The immersive tour will shed light on the importance of looking after our planet and the wildlife that inhabits it. All the while, you will capture scenic images of the untamed wilderness and delightful activities. You will conclude your adventure-packed days with gourmet meals at 5-star restaurants to wrap up the sumptuous stay in Chiang Mai.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Rai ��– Broaden Your Cultural Horizons
dayInfo.description: The city of Chiang Rai is an idyllic destination that neighbors Chiang Mai. Though less popular, it offers just as much entertainment value. For this reason, it is an enchanting getaway from the hustle and bustle of Thailand’s typical travel destinations. During your stay in Chiang Rai, you will uncover the rural culture and history that underpins the Northern Province of the country. As it borders Myanmar and Laos, it shares a unique, influential blend of cultures while retaining authenticity in its ancient practices. Set amongst towering mountains and sweeping green hills, you will revel in the picture-perfect moments you share here. After a comfortable and alluring drive through rural Northern Thailand, you will arrive at your award-winning destination near the Mae Kok River. Shortly after making yourself at home, you will privately transfer to Wat Rong Khun. The amazing White Temple will gleam under the sun. It will be a humble alternative to the intricate, golden temples that you will have explored in great detail. With a charming appeal and surreal photo opportunities to be had, you will delight in the temple’s sheer brilliance. After which, you will return to the city center for gourmet dining along the river where you will let the day gently float on by as you tuck into delectably crafted and traditional meals. You will transfer to the beautifully kept Mae Fah Luang Garden. The colorful display of indigenous plant life will be enchanting. You will sit beneath the towering trees and enjoy a picnic at this serene location. After which, you will fearlessly traverse the lengths of the Doi Tung suspended bridge. The treetop walkway is nestled high up in the canopy, providing uninterrupted views of the tree line. All the while, chirping birds will gather around you, and the light breeze will rustle the green leaves. During your stay in Chiang Rai, you will hike the gorgeous jungle locations and soak your head in the dreamlike waterfalls. Then, you will tour to a local ethnic tribe for an authentic meal and flamboyant traditional performances. The leisurely tour of the diverse city will culminate with a private tour of traditional Thai buildings and statues. If this was not enough, the wonderful flavors of gourmet cuisine will captivate your senses each evening.

dayInfo.title: Koh Samui – Treasure this Tropical Paradise
dayInfo.description: Known for its plethora of pristine islands, a trip to Thailand would not be complete without exploring the best ones. The final week of your thrilling tour will be spent soaking up the sun on the tropical Thai paradises. From Chiang Rai, you will take a short plane trip to the island of Koh Samui. The island is located in the Gulf of Thailand and is the second largest in the country. It has become one of the leading tropical destinations for travelers around the world and for good reason. The white-sand shores are lined with striking palm trees, and the thick rainforest floods the landscape with rich foliage. The luxury villas sit majestically against the edges of stretching bays. It is the destination of a lifetime, and you will be exploring it in its entirety. You will arrive at your prestigious hotel that overlooks the crystal-clear ocean. With irreplaceable views of the surrounding landscape, you will marvel at the sheer beauty of this island paradise. You will feel the warm ocean breeze run through your hair and the witness the gently swaying palm trees from the comfort of your private balcony. You will soon set off on a greater exploration of the island, and you will be privately transferred to premier points of interest throughout the afternoon and evening. You will encounter a traditional fishing village for authentic, fresh seafood, visit the refreshing waterfalls in the tranquil rainforest, and discover the magic of the Secret Buddha Garden to name a few. In the evening, you will enjoy a superb supper that will be accompanied by the stunning sunset. In the following days, you will indulge in more of the island-style living where you will transfer to an array of gorgeous beach paradises along the rugged coastline of Koh Samui. Your private guide will transfer you to the pivotal snorkeling spots on the island where you can wade through the gentle waters and witness the vibrant reefs and sea life. While on this adventure, you can capture captivating scenes of your oceanic adventure before setting off for the famous Hin Ta and Hin Yai Rocks. The chronicled rock formation is set amongst a surreal atmosphere with perfect photo opportunities. Your stay in Koh Samui will culminate with a lavish cruise around the greater island, stopping at pivotal sightseeing locations along the way. The authentic cuisine that you will have the luxury of indulging in will tantalize your taste buds throughout the evening.

dayInfo.title: Phuket – Relax in Style before Departing for Home
dayInfo.description: You will transfer to the exuberant island of Phuket via speedboat for your last few days in the country. The island is one of the most coveted destinations in Thailand, and it is no surprise why. Here, you will explore pristine beaches and delight in world-class cuisine. The laid-back lifestyle that is shared on the foremost shores of Phuket will bring your adventure to an idyllic end. From the pier, you will journey to the luxury destination of Kata where you will comfortably settle into your top-tier accommodation on the pristine shoreline. With a wealth of first-class restaurants nearby and a beach outside your door, you will be in complete paradise for the remainder of your stay. You can spend the day exploring the area, visiting the trendy eateries and colorful stalls. Here, you may pick up a few charming gifts to take back home with you. You will also tuck into some of the finest food in Phuket. Your morning will be enjoyed on the comfortable white-sand beach, under the warming Thai sun. You may dip your head in the turquoise ocean or even jump on a jet ski and ride out to sea. During your stay, you will truly enjoy the opportunity to relax and unwind as you enjoy your beach day. You will then end your splendid day with cocktails and a beautiful sunset at a classy beach bar. During your second day on the island, you will learn the masterful craft of Thai cuisine. First, you will transfer to a high-end cooking class for an in-depth look into some of the country’s most coveted dishes. With all of your senses alive, you will revel in the divine experience. After which, you will return with a wealth of valuable knowledge and a few gourmet recipes that you can bring home. Then, you will delight in delectable dishes at an award-winning Thai restaurant where you will meet the master chef behind the revered meals. Finally, you will visit the energetic Phuket Old Town during your stay on the island. Here, the markets will pump, and the joyfulness will flourish as you stroll through the vibrant stalls in search of tantalizing local cuisine and delightful trinkets. You will find these in abundance as you discover what makes Phuket so special. Your tour of the island will culminate with a trip to Karon Viewpoint and vistas of the greater island landscape. You will pack your bags on day 21 in preparation for your bittersweet departure. Soon, you will arrive home with grand stories about your exceptional adventure to the Land of Smiles with dreams of returning very soon.

tourName: City & Nature Tour of Thailand: Bangkok’s Floating Markets, Royal Palace, Khao Yai & Kanchanaburi
placesVisited: Bangkok, Kanchanaburi, Ayutthaya, Khao Yai National Park
generalInfo: Take a walk on the wild side on this custom tailored tour through the historic cities and remarkable natural landscapes of Thailand. Whether trekking through stunning scenery within the Khao Yai National Park to witness wild elephants or cycling along the open fields outside of the old capital of the empire of Siam, you will find natural beauty in the countryside and celebrated ancient stones, tremendous temples and magnificent waterfalls. Within the heart of the wild you will find wonder.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok – The Urban Wild
dayInfo.description: Arrive in magnificent Bangkok, the capital of Thailand, a city that always seems to be filled with energy, from the temples to the river, the food to the people. You are met at the airport by a private transfer and taken to your accommodation at the heart of the city. You can feel the palpable buzz of the neighborhoods as you walk through the streets. There is a lingering scent of coconut oil and fresh noodles. Temple spires mark the sky beneath the towering stretch of skyscrapers. The city’s bustle can be almost overwhelming at first; within the expanse of the modern world, Bangkok’s culture and history continue to thrive within the hidden neighborhoods and beautiful greenery that gives peace and calm along the Chao Phraya River. Enjoy a sweet taste of Thailand at Khin Lom Chom Saphan, an open-air restaurant with three pavilions and a lotus pond situated with a charming view of the celebrated Ramah VIII Bridge.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok – The Wonderful Wilds of Royalty
dayInfo.description: The city was once stretched out beside the expanse of the Chao Phraya River, Bangkok’s historic waterway. Step onto a longboat, feeling the slight breeze along your cheeks with the fresh scent of the river urging your forward. There is a different history at work along the river, between the stretch of modern hotels and restaurants that hide behind the beauty of temples and the Grand Palace complex. It isn’t just within the opulent façade of the palace that has been home to Thai Kings and court for 150 years, but also in the collection of temples around the palace that help create an ambiance of grandeur, elegance, and majesty. The quintessentially Thai architecture of Wat Pra Kaew, with its retreating pediments and thin, circular spire, house the holiest relic in-country, the Emerald Buddha. The celebrated image was carved from a single jade block that dates back to the 15th century. Tremendous gold reliefs line the walls depicting traditional Garuda , a bird-man hybrid that dates back to Hindu origins. The one person in the country allowed to touch the sacred figure is the king, who changes the robes on the Buddha seasonally. The aroma of incense is compelling and calming as you take your time through the temple and the palace grounds.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok – In the Dawn
dayInfo.description: The true Thai culture in and around Bangkok can be seen just outside of the city in the early hours of dawn, floating along the watery streets of the markets found on the river. Just before the rush of merchant long-tail boats ascend on the waterway at Bang Khu Wiang you can see the gentle rowing of monks making their way through the narrow alleys in a daily routine of tak baat , collecting alms. This is where the traditions of life come into view, where boats skiff along the surface, filled with vibrant colors that almost glow with fresh produce, from rambutan to bananas, limes to chilies. The aromas are fresh and graceful, creating a mixture of spice and citrus as the market bursts with sales and tastes. The people call out from the shore to the ship asking for tastes, while other vendors cook food fresh, leaning long poles out to the banks to give and receive goods. The floating markets are truly unique and lively, an unforgettable and delicious moment to take with you as you make your way back to Bangkok with the rest of the day at your leisure.

dayInfo.title: Kanchanaburi – Along the River Kwai
dayInfo.description: The regal stretch of the Chao Phraya River will soon sit in the distance as you make your way to the charming city of Kanchanaburi known as the location for the movie Bridge Over River Kwai . The landscape is lush and tranquil along the riverbanks where a tumultuous occupation during World War II continues to sit within the city’s borders. The JEATH Museum is a collection of first-hand accounts from Prisoners of War, photos, and more, entitled to commemorate the countries in which the museum memorializes, its acronym standing for Japan, England, America, Australia, Holland. Founded in 1977, the Chief Abbot of the temple in which the museum is located is tasked with the responsibility of keeping the exhibits, from the construction of the railway to the quarters, available to the public. In the serenity of the greenery, with the cool sounds of the nearby river, the city’s bright present and future will begin with its past.

dayInfo.title: Ayutthaya – Lavish Waterfalls
dayInfo.description: The countryside of Kanchanaburi is filled with splendor, from rising mountains to lavish greenery, the calm rushing river winds along the landscape giving life to the riverbanks and beyond. Today you will visit an elephant camp that will show you the fabulous animal in a natural habitat, housed by local camps that have spent centuries revering the elegant and lumbering mammal. An elephant walk will take you through the lush trees and along the jungle path to a local watering hole. The largest land creature wobbles in a somehow gracious way, as you notice it checks its path to ensure no impediments are in its way. At the water, it steps quietly into the refreshing cool and starts to spray itself clean and, most likely, you along with it. Later in the day you will come to the effervescent Sai Yok Yai Waterfall. The water creates a beaded curtain tumbling down the textured terrace stand beneath the rushing water or just listen to the lovely rhythm as it falls and jumps from the rocks. The nature of Thailand, from the wildlife to the landscape, brings you further into wonder. The next morning, the endless greenery that surrounds the city brings a lush shimmer to the morning. As you step out into the city the fresh fruit fills the air. In the afternoon you will transfer to the old capital of Siam, Ayutthaya, and enjoy an evening surrounded by comfort and history.

dayInfo.title: Phak Hai – The Open Country
dayInfo.description: The day begins with the early light casting a shimmer over Ayutthaya. After breakfast, you will begin a two-day bicycle tour that will take you in and around the capital of Siam, through the gorgeous landscapes and along the spectacular history that continues to inspire locals and visitors alike. Find yourself among the opulent ruins of the historical park before the ride begins, traversing the open streets lined by impressive chedis . The city was founded in the 14th century and was the pinnacle of the kingdom until the Burmese overtook the capital in the 18th century. The rustic stone temples are surrounded by remarkable artistry, from large graceful Buddha statues lining the walls to the iconic image of a stone Buddha face peeking out from within a tangle of vines. The air is often scented with earth from the grounds and the prevalent stone architecture, bringing a historic world to life. Once aboard your bike, you will traverse the landscape, through the city and along the countryside; the open plains are speckled with tall palms, giving a gracious open view of the landscape as a breeze helps bring a soft cooling temperament to the air.

dayInfo.title: Ayutthaya – Continuous Landscapes
dayInfo.description: The morning stretches its light over the small town of Phak Hai. The small waterway that runs through the city is filled with bright orange in the early morning; monks paddle along the water performing their daily ritual while people line the riverbanks and offer alms in support, dedication, and blessing. The local village is vibrant with daily life, overlooking the luscious green fields that look to endlessly expand amidst the sporadic tower of palm trees. The countryside rushes past you, filled with continuous magnificence in the simplest and grandest ways, from vivacious colors to the local smiles. In the late afternoon you will arrive back in Ayutthaya with the luxurious comforts of your hotel, and the remainder of the day, at your desire.

dayInfo.title: Khao Yai National Park – Into the Thai Wilds
dayInfo.description: The tranquil world of nature will soon surround you as you make your way to Bangkok to soon venture into the secluded wonder of Khao Yai National Park. The park expands over four separate provinces of Eastern Thailand covering over 1340 square miles. The mountainous area is filled with amazing trees that spire and dangle, hiding waterfalls and wrapping around lakes, while open plains brush against the hillsides. The midday brings you to a Buddhist cave temple, used by monks for meditation, and offering you a quiet space to experience the natural world of Thailand. From reverberating echoes to immaculate natural light, the aroma of fresh incense mixes with the surrounding damp stone while stalactites suspend from the ceiling. A nearby cave houses wrinkle-lipped bats, small, furry animals that are dark, reddish-brown with creased snouts that resemble wrinkly lips. In the evening you will settle into your resort where the luscious surroundings are enough to bring in the gorgeous evening.

dayInfo.title: Khao Yai National Park – Wildlife and Waterfalls
dayInfo.description: The morning begins after the sun has risen over the remarkable trees of the national park. Once along the trail, you can feel the stunning wild surround you with greenery and open air, scented with evergreen. The trees rustle along the canopy. You can hear distant hoots and howls of gibbons and various monkeys. When you see a troop of gibbons you notice the lighter hair outlining their dark faces. Their limbs look almost comical, long and gangly, as they sit in the open space of high branches. You will eventually come to Haew Suwat Waterfall, known to many visitors as the waterfall from the Leonardo DiCaprio movie, The Beach . The water tumbles down around 45 feet into a lucid pool, where, during the dry season, the powerful curtain of water is split into two impressive streams. In the evening you will make your way to the celebrated salt lick in search of wild elephants. The troops tend to come and go as they please, spread throughout the park enjoying the freedom of the trees and the open plain. The salt lick gives natural nutrients to feed and chew on and offer the animals rich soil to spread across their skin to help cool them in hot days, turning even the darkest elephant red. In the dusk’s cooling air you may be able to spot one of the resident tigers that hunt through the open fields.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok – Returning to Urban Expanses
dayInfo.description: There are natural sounds in the morning light where gibbons and birds seem to be at their wakeful loudest littering the air with tremendous music. The cool early hours find you traversing the forest after a visit to the local Pak Chong Market, where you will come to a magnificent sandstone labyrinth. The rock pattern contains art that dates back over 2000 years, projecting a way of life within the jungle and the dense beauty of the wildlife of the time. You can see fig trees climbing along the rocks with twisting roots and branches. The birds and monkeys sing and howl within the trees. Look out over the second largest summit in the park where an over 82 foot tall Buddha watches the forest below. In the late afternoon you will return to Bangkok but for now you can watch over the national park listening to the natural grandeur of the Thailand almost like a wild lullaby.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok – Indelible Wild Memories
dayInfo.description: Today you will find breakfast to be as fresh as ever, with orange juice and coconut, creamy banana and more; however, there is lesser sweetness in your final morning in Thailand as you aren’t ready to say goodbye. After your meal you will have a private transfer to the airport to make your flight home. You have traversed the wild landscapes of Thailand, from Bangkok’s modernity to Ayutthaya’s history, Khao Yai’s precious wildlife to its gorgeous natural landscape. Your time throughout the countryside will provide endless memories to be revisited at your whim. And just as a memory can always be revisited, so can Thailand. Be sure to read the reviews for Thailand tour operators . You will read about what other travelers experienced in Thailand on their customized trips.

tourName: Classic Thailand Itinerary: Beaches, Markets & Elephants
placesVisited: Bangkok, Khao Yai National Park, Chiang Mai, Krabi, Koh Lanta
generalInfo: The hidden streets and alleys of Bangkok contain cultural treasures. Gibbons traverse the trees and elephants snack on salt licks in the undiscovered reaches of Khao Yai National Park. The quiet streets of Chiang Mai display elements of the city’s captivating history. The shores of Koh Lanta look out to the stunning turquoise Andaman Sea. Your custom tailored Thailand itinerary lets you experience the beauty of the land, sea, and jewels of Thailand. On this Thailand vacation, Immerse yourself in the flavors of the culture and cuisine, ranging from the mountainous jungles of the north to the coral reefs of the tropical south.

dayInfo.title: Signature Bangkok
dayInfo.description: Bangkok is a city bustling with activity at all hours of the day. The traditional world of Thailand hides behind lush trees and beside cobblestone streets. The city feels both familiar and exotic simultaneously. The historic Chao Phraya River winds by the shadows of skyscrapers. Monks stroll down the street in burnt-sage robes next to teenagers wearing brand new sneakers and leather jackets. When your flight lands at Suvarnabhumi Airport, your private transfer is already waiting for your arrival, ready to escort you to a luxurious hotel situated in the heart of Thailand’s capital city. Bangkok represents an unshakeable presence that embodies the past, present, and future of the country combined into one unforgettable metropolis. Banglamphu is a popular neighborhood next to the Chao Phraya River. A small park offers a quiet space to enjoy the atmosphere, and the riverside restaurants provide sumptuous aromas of fresh noodles and simmering ginger. River ferries cross the water. In the serene space of the neighborhood, you can experience the calmer sensations of Bangkok, along with a more Bohemian ambiance.

dayInfo.title: Alluring Histories of Thailand
dayInfo.description: In the morning, boats and ferries take to the current and float down Chao Phraya River. The streets become vibrant with locals making their way to work. The aroma of sandalwood emanates from lit incense drifting from neighborhood shrines and hidden temples. At breakfast, you can sip on freshly brewed coffee or enjoy a long steeped tea to brighten the morning. Your guide meets you in the hotel lobby and after a brief introduction, takes you out into the captivating city. Lak Muang was first erected in the 18th century when Bangkok became the official capital of Thailand. The pillar was erected again in 1853 across from the Grand Palace. Your guide leads you through the Grand Palace complex, which stands on the banks of the Chao Phraya River. The complex was erected in the 18th century and is used for important ceremonies, along with accommodating heads of state. It has a combined area of more than 2,350,000 square feet encircled by four walls. The conical roofs have a gilded tint. The white walls of the buildings reflect the sun and bring a luster to the grounds. The actual palace blends 19th-century European style with traditional Thai architecture for a stunning artistic effect.

dayInfo.title: Hidden History of Bangkok
dayInfo.description: In the morning, the aroma of fresh coconut and pineapple lingers at breakfast. The tropical fruits have a calming effect in the morning light, reminding you of the exotic and unique culture outside of the hotel. Your guide greets you after your meal. You are eager to explore more of the city and discover the hidden sights of Old Bangkok. The Giant Swing stands in front of Wat Suthat temple. The swing dates back to the 18th century, and was once used in a Brahmin ceremony. Your guide leads you through hidden alleyways and a labyrinth of wooden houses. You reach the amulet market and find a dense network of stalls running south from the river pier. The uniqueness of the goods draws you in. The aroma of burning incense drifts through the covered stalls. Each kiosk displays a different set of talismans meant to draw in collectors, monks, and visitors interested in the details of ancient customs and religion. Some collectors bargain with the vendors for a better price, looking through magnifying glasses to inspect the intricacies of the amulets, searching for luck, value, or a hidden meaning.

dayInfo.title: Heritage of the Forest
dayInfo.description: The wafting aroma of coconut pancakes gives sweetness to the morning. At breakfast, you can enjoy the juicy pineapples and soft bananas harvested locally and bought from one of the floating markets outside the city. After your meal, your private transfer meets you at the hotel and escorts you northeast of the city to Khao Yai National Park. The park encompasses 837 square miles and is home to one of the largest monsoon forests in mainland Asia. Your luxurious accommodation offers a 360-degree view of the park’s lushness. From your private pool, you can hear the sound of orange-headed thrushes twittering. Black giant squirrels rustle the leaves and branches. Wild elephants often roam along the main road that traverses the park; they enjoy the open space and freedom from the brush. Your spa offers an indulgent space to enjoy the tranquility of the forest and the relaxing nature. The park has more than 31 miles of hiking trails traversing the grounds. You easily settle into the majestic qualities the national park and in the evening, listen to the gentle calls of the red-headed trogon. You can see their red and blue feathers in the canopy.

dayInfo.title: National Grandeur
dayInfo.description: In the morning, a slight mist rolls along the forest floor. In the trees, gibbons call out to one another. The sound echoes through the park. At breakfast, you wrap your hands around a warm cup of coffee and listen to the gibbons’ colorful exclamations. The temperature warms when the sun burns away the layer of mist. Your guide meets you at your hotel and leads you through the dry evergreen forest of the park. Your guide points into the trees at a great hornbill. Their wingspan and extend to 60 inches long. Their bright yellow and black casque stands atop their bill. You can hear the rushing water of Haew Suwat, one of the most popular waterfalls in Thailand. The impressive cascade tumbles nearly 50 feet into the pool basin below. During the wet season, the beads of water cast a curtain over the caves situated underneath the rocky outcrop. The water is cool and refreshing in the warm air of the park. At the salt licks, you wait for passing elephants. The Asiatic elephant can grow up to nine feet at shoulder height with a length of up to 21 feet. They use their tusks to dig into the earth for more salt. Their presence is magnificent, casting a splendor over your already treasured moments in Khao Yai National Park.

dayInfo.title: Market Culture of Chiang Mai
dayInfo.description: The gibbons once again call out to one another in the morning. At breakfast, the staff points into the trees, where you can see the lesser apes sitting in the branches and even swinging from one branch to another. Spotting the gibbons is a pleasant farewell to the national park. After your meal, your private transfer escorts you to Bangkok where you board a short flight to the north of Thailand. The city of Chiang Mai is considered the capital of the north but offers a more relaxed pace than Bangkok. Jungle-rich foothills surround the city that was once the seat of the Lanna kingdom. Historic monasteries date back to the Middle Ages, centered around brick stupas that range in shape and style, now known as the historic city center. Your guide meets you at the airport and leads you on a delightful tour providing insight into one of the many gastronomic pleasures of the city, the markets. Near the moat outside the North gate, you find Chang Puak Market. The aroma of chive omelets fills the air and mixes with the scent of handmade soup that contains hints of lemongrass. The Warorot Market sits at the heart of Chinatown and excites both visitors and locals with antique allure. Handcrafts and flowers, along with ceramics and clothes, provide a colorful atmosphere and a natural thrill.

dayInfo.title: True Tastes of Chiang Mai
dayInfo.description: The intermittent trees and encompassing forest outside of Chiang Mai brings a fresh fragrance to the morning air. At breakfast, locals enjoy Joke , a thick rice porridge mixed with egg and pork. The aromatics of ginger and cilantro waft upwards from the bowl with the steam. A short distance outside of the city is a traditional home, in which a family has lived for generations. Your hosts welcome you with gracious smiles before taking you on a tour of the grounds. In the garden, the family grows ginger and chili peppers. The orchards provide mango and coconut. Your guide cuts open a fresh banana for you to taste. You pick out the freshest ingredients, helped by your guide. Your guide informs you about the connection locals have to their food and its flavor, allowing you to experience the culture of northern Thailand through the preferred tastes of the people. You help prepare the ingredients, on the long wooden table with a view of the gardens. When lunch is complete, you find a bowl of Kow Soy on the table. A deliciously fragrant curry broth soaks into the wheat and egg noodles. Shallots, pickled vegetables, and fried chilies provide a refined touch to layer the richness of the dish. The company and the experience are special.

dayInfo.title: Tangible Wonders of the North
dayInfo.description: The relaxed atmosphere of Chiang Mai continues throughout the day. Near the historic city center, cobbled streets wind around the old walls. Cafes add a slightly European ambiance with a rich Thai flair. The trees provide refreshing shade across the cityscape. After breakfast, you venture outside of the city for the day, making your way to the world’s first Elephant Hospital. Friends of the Asian Elephant Hospital was established in the early 1990s with the intent of nurturing injured or abused elephants. The protected space allows the elephants to roam freely during their rehabilitation. Some of the elephants roll in the mud to keep themselves cool in the forest heat. Other elephants spray water over their backs and at nearby workers. The friendly atmosphere brings joy to both visitors and the elephants. After your time at the Elephant Hospital, you continue to the town of Lampang. The town has a secluded feeling. Antique mansions refer back to lumber barons. Lanna era temples decorate the skyline. Horse-drawn carriages drive along the street. In the temple of Wat Chedi Sao, you find a 15th-century solid-gold seated Buddha statue standing over a square pond. Precious stones decorate the statue’s robe. The grandeur of the Buddha statue embodies the historic mansions, but the tranquility of the temple personifies the peacefulness of town.

dayInfo.title: Island Paradise Found
dayInfo.description: You wave goodbye to the lush forests and foothills encircling Chiang Mai, flying over the Gulf of Thailand to arrive in Krabi. A private vehicle meets you at the airport and escorts you the remainder of the way to the island of Koh Lanta, located in the Andaman Sea. The luxuries of the southern tropical landscape are immediately apparent. The water glows a clear turquoise. The jade trees rustle in the sea breeze. Radiant coral reefs rise out of secluded rock formations, populated by an endless variety of aquatic life. Your private transfer meets you at the airport and escorts you to your comfortable accommodation situated near the beach. You can hear the sea lapping at the sand. Your private resort style hotel encompasses 100 acres and offers stretches of secluded, pristine shoreline for you to enjoy. Thai temples hide in the tangles of mangrove trees. Tham Khao Maikaeo offers a complex of caverns and tunnels to explore, filled with chambers as large as cathedrals, decorated with stalactites and stalagmites. The wonders of the island reach far beyond the beauty of the beaches.

dayInfo.title: Adventure on the Andaman Sea
dayInfo.description: The lull of the waves over the sand reminds you of the dreamscape outside of your hotel room. The sea breeze brings the sweet scent of the ocean combined with the luscious aroma of fresh coconut. At breakfast, you can bite into a rambutan, a semi-sweet fruit similar to lychee. After your meal, your private transfer leads you to Old Town. The buildings of the historic center are made of wood and have been well preserved over the years. Old Town acted as the capital for nearly 100 years, during the 20th century. Restaurants line the pier, providing fresh seafood and overlooking the stunning water. You follow your guide onto a boat and leave the island behind for the day. The breeze carries the misting water. You can see beneath the turquoise surface of the Andaman Sea and find impressive karsts climbing into the sky. You can explore the sea caves on Koh Muk. The water is warm and refreshing. The limestone is strong and encompassing. The secret lagoon takes you on a 278-foot long underwater tunnel opening into a cavernous bay bordered by limestone cliffs. You emerge from the dark tunnel to a find a verdant paradise lined with a white sandy beach. The splendors of Thailand are endlessly enchanting.

dayInfo.title: Koh Lanta at Leisure
dayInfo.description: In the morning, locals venture out on their fishing vessels in search of their daily catch. Some prefer to wade in the shallow waters close to the beach and net their catch by hand. Coconuts speckle the beach and hint at the creamy aromas of the tropical paradise. After breakfast, the day is yours to bask in the pleasures of island life at your leisure. You dig your toes into the hot sand on the hotel’s private beach or indulge in a celebrated massage in the spa. North of Old Town is Sangka-Ou Village. Numerous Sea Gypsies continue to inhabit the village and live according to ancient customs. Sea Gypsies are considered the first inhabitants of the Andaman coast, preferring a nomadic lifestyle on the water. Their homes stand on stilts to account for storms and the moving tide. You can see the village en route to the secluded east coast beaches. You could always continue south to Mu Ko Lanta National Park, encompassing 50 square miles of protected land and sea. Monkeys laze in the shade of the trees. The peninsular cliff of Ta Noad Cape separates the twin beaches. At the center of the cliff, you can find the lighthouse with a view of several islands. The powdery white sand of the twin beaches stands out from the glowing blue water.

dayInfo.title: Thailand Wishes
dayInfo.description: In the morning, you bite into a juicy mango and recall the pleasures of your time in Thailand. You continue to listen to the sea’s wading water brushing against the sandy shores. After breakfast, your private transfer meets you at your hotel and escorts you to Krabi Airport. The scenic drive showcases the lush trees of the tropical south and the shimmering waters of the Andaman Sea. In the distance, you can see the rising karsts famous to this region of Thailand. Once in Krabi, you board your flight to make your connection in Bangkok. The culture of Thailand has an undeniable magnetism drawn from the cities, landscape, oceans, and wildlife.

tourName: Culinary Journey of a Lifetime to Thailand, Vietnam, and Cambodia
placesVisited: Koh Yao, Bangkok, Chiang Mai, Chachoengsao, Chonburi, Hoi An, Hue, Lang Co Lagoon, Halong Bay, Siem Reap
generalInfo: Indulge in diverse flavors and embrace luxury during your ultimate culinary tour of Thailand, Vietnam, and Cambodia. From secret island getaways to imperial delights, the cuisine that reveals the history of where regional flavors meet French technique, you will discover and experience the endless treasures of local gastronomy across Southeast Asia. You can find traditional recipes and contemporary aesthetics, private multi-course meals, and organic farming perspectives to uncover surprising diversity and fabulous elegance during your culinary trip of a lifetime through Thailand, Vietnam, and Cambodia.

dayInfo.title: Koh Yao Noi - Arrive in Thailand with Ultimate Luxury
dayInfo.description: The diverse beauty of Thailand encompasses white sandy bays and technicolor reefs along the southern shores giving way to lush forest and dramatic mountains in the north. Your flight will land at Phuket International Airport, where your private transfer will meet you upon arrival. After easing through immigration procedures with an exclusive Fast Track service, you will board a boat bound for the luxurious villas of Koh Yao Noi’s secret island paradise. You will quickly sink into the natural beauty of your surroundings as the tropical grandeur of Thailand’s islands comes to light. The mountainous backbone of the island at Ko Yao gives way to the unspoiled beaches. Birdlife brings songs throughout the day as the culture around the island supports the diverse heritage of Muslum fisher communities and captivating panoramas of the soaring karsts featured in Ao Phang-Nga National Park. The serene landscape and ultimate opulence of your private beachfront villa that overlooks the crystal-clear azure waters of Phang Nga Bay set the tone for your luxurious adventure to come as you bask in the subtle lingering aromas of the sea breeze and coconut.

dayInfo.title: Koh Yao Noi - Delight in an Island Paradise
dayInfo.description: The day will be at your leisure to delight in the surrounding wonders of the island paradise using your luxury boutique hotel as your base. The serene ambiance stems from diverse scenery with deserted beaches edging the island to the mountains and forests at the island's center. Limestone karsts rise out of the water like ruins of ancient pillars and give way to submerged worlds bright with life and color. You can venture out into the mountains in search of caves and waterfalls or kayak to shores of nearby Koh Nok island. The island is known for kayaking, snorkeling, and boat trips around the spectacular waters. You can take a kayak and venture into the crystal-clear sea for a comfortable introduction to the grandeur of the islands. The water will have a refreshing temperature as you weave in view of karsts or through mangrove forests where the scent of herbaceous leaves meets the briny aroma of the water. Your guide may pull you onto the sands and teach you how to crack a coconut in half, revealing the luscious milk and meat inside for a tasty, fresh treat.

dayInfo.title: Koh Yao Noi - Embrace the Island Delicacies
dayInfo.description: In the morning, wake to bask in the beauty of the surrounding tropical greenery by lounging in your private plunge pool overlooking the drama of the bay. After breakfast, you will have a wonderful tour of the resort’s private organic farm guided by a seasoned chef. The variety of fresh produce will reveal the beauty of the landscape and the exceptional quality of the soil that results in fortified flavors in each ingredient from the diversity of mushrooms growing in a single hut to the garden where spicy chillis and aromatic ginger thrive. You will continue to discover the farming practices and traditions of the island as you leave the grounds to meet with local farmers that produce rice, palm, coconut, and various fruits. At a local fish farm, you will learn about the techniques farmers have used for sustainable fishing practices on the island, raising fish like snappers and lobsters. You can choose your own fish or lobster before traveling to a secluded island where your private chef will prepare a stunning meal based on the ingredients you saw throughout the day. The scent of barbecue coals sweeps through the accompanied by the sea breeze as the colorful sunset reflects in the water.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Mai - Indulge in Island and Artisan Cuisine
dayInfo.description: After breakfast, you will transfer by speedboat to Phuket as the wind brushes your face leaving bits of salt on your skin. Before traveling north, you will have time to explore the charms of Old Town as the neighborhood in Phuket reveals a colorful blend of cultures that came to the island during the Rubber boom. Antique shophouses line the streets reflecting the aesthetics of centuries past from Sino-Portuguese facades to contemporary coffee shops showcasing local artists. The scent of fresh pancakes topped with coconut milk or stuffed with bananas may drift through the streets as your guide leads you past the local eateries to discover the tremendous food scene of the island. The heritage architecture will give way to dishes like Chinese fried noodles, spring rolls, and a renowned Michelin-starred restaurant serving crispy pan-fried oysters tossed in a delicious dressing of soy sauce and taro blending traditional Hokkien Chinese food with Thai flavors. You will fly from Phuket to Chiang Mai, where your private transfer will meet you at the airport. After checking into your riverside boutique resort, you can spend time relaxing in the lush gardens or igniting your taste buds with a drink at the a secret bar celebrated for crafting unique cocktails infused with exotic ingredients and fresh, local herbs. At dinner, you will have an introductory taste of Chiang Mai with a degustation menu at Blackitch restaurant serving you between 10 and 14 courses. The innovative menu blends artistic presentation with local ingredients resulting in a celebration of northern Thai tastes using ingredients like calamansi.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Mai - Enjoy a Tribal Culinary Experience
dayInfo.description: You will leave Chiang Mai for the day with your private driver to reach the Mae Tang district, one of the first organic tea plantations in the nation managed by a cultural tribe. You will meet with a representative of the Lisu Hilltribe community who manages the plantation and wander through the verdant fields where the scent of lush foliage stems from the thriving tea plants and neighboring crops. The garden resembles a sea of greenery filled with the aromas of white, green, and silk teas. Your guide will give you a better understanding of the traditional methods for cultivation, the connection with tea, and better insight into the heritage of the Lisu Hilltribe. The community’s traditions date back to their origins southwest of China giving way to the Tibeto-Burman highlands. Your guide may offer you insight into the religion focused on ancestor workshop and spirit appeasement as you learn more about the sustainable project. As you learn to pluck the leaves from the plant and place them in a basket strapped to your back, you will gain a new appreciation for the work and the importance of how and when the tea is harvested. As you sit to sample the selection of teas, the local tea master will explain the different properties, characteristics, and benefits of the different teas to guide you through finding the subtle notes or uncovering the layers of the tea. You will continue to the home of a local family and their traditional teak wood home to learn more about the traditional way of living in Thailand’s northern region. The organic farm may grow produce like tomatoes, tapioca, and basil beneath the sprawl of the rice field. Your cooking class will reveal the secrets of the Thai kitchen and the distinct properties of Northern Thai cuisine as you prepare things like spicy sour soup, dry red curry chicken, and eggplant with pork.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Mai - Explore Cultural and Culinary Charm
dayInfo.description: Close to dawn, you will make your way to a temple with your guide to experience the morning alms ceremony. Before the crowds of onlookers arrive, you can embrace the serene tradition as locals give alms to the monks draped in their auburn robes offering things like sticky rice or fruits. The calm and peaceful ambiance will only accentuate the subtle beauty of the moment set in front of the temple complex. You will continue to Warorot Market, where the aroma of a small cake made of fried sweet dough will fill drift down the aisles. You can sample the delicacy stemming from Chinese traditions often accompanied by soymilk, tea, or coffee. You may find crullers that look like animals such as elephants and crocodiles before you discover more of the artisan stalls providing delicious local snacks from herbal tea to dehydrated fruits. After visiting the famous ancient Lanna temples, you can stop in a local cafe to sample coffee made from beans source from a hill-tribe farm. You may find notes of caramel and maple drifting from the cup before you visit one of the most iconic vendors of Chiang Mai to indulge in an authentic bowl of curry. The combination of crispy noodles and pickled cabbage layer the flavors lime, coconut, or lemongrass as you notice notes of the aromatic herbs and spices. Your evening will fill with the remarkable flavors of a meal crafted by Chef James, known in Thailand as the “Boutique Farmer.” The specialty farm focuses on organic and sustainable ingredients produced with biodynamic methods resulting in incredible flavors sourced to many of Bangkok’s Michelin-starred restaurants. The chef will guide you through the farm before crafting a remarkable dinner using ingredients from the farm resulting in an exclusive and specialized meal.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok - Bask in a Private Sunset River Cruise
dayInfo.description: In the morning, you can relax in the comforts of your resort as you find the scent of white tea or rich coffee filling your suite accompanied by hints of rambutan. Your private transfer will meet you in the hotel lobby and escort you to the airport for your quick flight to Bangkok, Thailand’s bustling capital city. You will continue to the comforts of your luxurious accommodation that resembles an antique mansion set against the backdrop of the Chao Phraya riverbanks. Your terrace view may overlook the water and the boats traveling along the city’s original highway. The intricate details of the palatial grounds will shine as your private butler offers you a walk around the resort to get acquainted with beauty, charm, and opulence of the greater setting. At sundown, you will board a restored rice barge from the resort’s private pier for a relaxing panoramic view across the waterfront. As the sun drops behind the skyline, you can find the Grand Palace set beneath the glinting golden tower of Wat Arun, which stands 219 feet tall. You will return to the resort for a private gourmet dinner prepared by a master chef who will craft a stunning meal based on your culinary preferences for a fusion of Thai and western cuisine.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok - Experience a Historic Bangkok Food Tour
dayInfo.description: You will travel through time and along the waters of Bangkok as you board a longtail boat bound for the city's traditional neighborhoods found through the quiet canals. Antique pagodas will create a unique skyline shaped by the familiar soaring figure of Wat Arun, known as the Temple of Dawn. The charm of the 200-year-old community of Kudeejeen will reveal the unique combination of Thai and Portuguese heritage. The 18th-century Catholic Church located near a Chinese Shrine will carry hints of frankincense while aromas of sandalwood emulate from the burning incense. A typical bakery offers typical Portuguese-style cupcakes while the restaurant Baan Suklthong offers a unique fusion of Thai and Portuguese cuisine with recipes dating back to the 18th century. The old wooden house enhances the ambiance of the family-owned restaurant with dishes such as Thai dim sum, chor muang, and rice vermicelli with chicken red curry and coconut cream topping the menu. Your exploration of the city will reveal the depths of culture and history as experienced through the food, from the remarkable size of Chinatown to the aroma of the Nguan Soon Spice Shop tucked inside the centuries-old market. You will meet generations of family members working to safeguard the secret of Gold Medal Sriracha, known as the original sriracha sauce, with an award-winning recipe nearly 100 years old. The family will welcome you to the shop as hints of vinegar and chili fill the air. You can sample the delicious hot sauce in the customary workshop where the family still handmakes a limited batch of sauce for special clients. You can savor the elegant balance of hot, sour, sweet, and garlic seamlessly blending together. Before exploring another traditional neighborhood to sample original Thai dishes like pork satay and Radna noodles, you will meet an herbal specialist at Pho Pradi Shop to find pre-mixed packets for wonderful tea-infusions. You may learn about the different wellness properties of various Asian herbs and flowers as you sample a selection of specific infusions you can also take home.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok - Visit Chachoengsao and Chonburi
dayInfo.description: In the morning, your driver will meet you at the hotel to take you to Chonburi province and the old market street at Ang Sila. The traditional architecture of the antique fishermen village continues to showcase the best cuisine on the Gulf of Thailand through the fresh seafood on display in the bustling marketplace. Small grocers often absent in the big cities continue to populate the street, laying the foundations for the grander aisles of the seafood market. The scent of grilling fish and fresh squid may fill the air as you find new and exciting ingredients taken fresh from the sea that morning. As you discover the markets, you can venture from seafood to typical snacks like large bamboo tubes stuffed with sticky rice and ice cream before traveling to a coconut plantation to learn more about the iconic fruit bunched in the treetops. The luscious aroma of the coconut will fill the air as you tour beneath the trees. In the kitchen, your private guide will teach you the art of making refreshing ice cream by using the coconut shavings and milk to add depths of flavor, as well as an extra creamy texture. In the evening, you will bask in the two Michelin-starred restaurants of 2020, R Haan, to find dishes shaped by celebrity chef Chumpol who uses Thai cooking techniques brought back from extinction to create an artistic representation of locally sourced traditional ingredients with a set menu.

dayInfo.title: Hoi An - Travel to Vietnam at Historic Hoi An
dayInfo.description: At breakfast, you may find the aromas of tropical fruits like jack fruit and pineapple accompanying the rich layers of freshly brewed coffee. Your private transfer will meet you in the hotel lobby and escort you to the airport for your flight to Danang, Vietnam, and continuing onward to the atmospheric, historic town of Hoi An. The grand architecture will create a beguiling ambiance set along the riverside, shining a light on the historic charm steeped in a quieter pace. The Central Market near the river will reveal the lively contemporary nature of the city where locals find fresh fish and artisan crafts while the streets shine with enchanting colorful lanterns. The evening will turn romantic with a gourmet dinner featuring the beauty of the countryside set in the wonder of your private colonial-style villa. You can look out amongst the rice paddy fields as celebrated Chef Loic crafts a special dinner blending European culinary skills with the fresh local ingredients of Thailand. The unique blend of east and western aesthetics brings a contemporary touch to the meal with customary dishes crafted in a different way introducing you to the vibrant and layered flavors of Vietnamese cuisine.

dayInfo.title: Hoi An - Experience Hoi An with a Personal Shopper
dayInfo.description: The city of Hoi An retains its charm captured in the streets of Old Town.
