The antique architecture features the eclectic mix of culture stemming from the former trade that reveals the layers of Chinese, French, and Japanese influences. Your guide will take you on a private tour of the city to find highlights from the Phuc Kien Assembly Hall to the 400-year-old Japanese Covered Bridge. The Phung Hung House was built over two centuries ago and acted as a merchant house for a family who sold spice and silk. Vibrant hanging lanterns and a Japanese-style roof decorate the exterior while 80 columns designed with lotus bases adorn the inside, leading to private access to the canal. After enjoying an in-depth tour of the city, you will continue into the galleries and custom shops with a local expert who understands the history of artisans in the region and the specialties of Vietnamese tradition, from arts to handcrafts. You can meet with a local tailor to have clothes stitched perfectly suited to your body and style, or you could meet with a local woman in a historic shophouse outside the historical center who works with ceramics in the traditional method of a foot-powered potter’s wheel. For lunch, you will be introduced to Cau Lao Noodle at a famous eatery known mostly to locals, where the aromas of cilantro and lime drift into the streets as dishes like caramelized braised pork with a secret sauce creates an alluring layer of mouthwatering flavors.

dayInfo.title: Hoi An - Revel in an Organic Farm Experience
dayInfo.description: After breakfast, your private driver will take you out of the city to reach an organic family farm and their farmhouse. An easy bike ride will give you a stunning view of the scenery as you travel to the farm and a local village. Rice fields terrace the landscape alongside seasonal produce such as bitter melon and Malabar spinach. You can experience the work necessary to plant and harvest rice, from traditional planning methods to harvesting as your guide explains the elements of the soil and how the seasons affect the specific crops grown on the farm. You may find the aromas of lemongrass and chili as you take to the grounds. During your time on the farm, you will have unique access to the life of community engagement and farmwork in Vietnam through the lens of traditional and modern techniques that helps organic food production and sustainability. After a short boat ride across the Thu Bon River, you can visit a local woodcarver in a shop crafting customary figures revealing flowers, religious figures, dragons, and detailed etchings of myths and legends.

dayInfo.title: Hue - Explore Hue Via Lang Co Lagoon
dayInfo.description: You will leave Hoi An with your private driver bound for the former imperial city of Hue. The elegant capital retains an evocative sense of the Nguyen emperors as the 19th-century citadel walls rise out of the banks of the Perfume River. The scenic drive to Hue will give you a distinctive panorama of Vietnam’s diverse landscape as you cross over 78 miles of switchbacks and exceptional mountain views. As you travel through Hai Van Pass, you will find the views opening at an elevation of 1,627 feet above sea level set beneath the peak of Ai Van Son and overlooking the azure waters of the East Sea. When you reach Lang Co, you can stop at the picturesque lagoon to enjoy the powder-white sands of the beach and the lively local market at the heat of the village. You can take a boat onto the water with a local guide to learn about the fish and oyster farms in the area. The experienced fisher will take you in search of the biting fish and teach you how to harvest the fresh oysters from the farm. You will carry the scent of the sea with you as you travel from the beach to lunch, where an incredible display of Vietnamese seafood cuisine awaits you served in a traditional stilt house. Upon reaching Hue, you can relax in the comforts of a luxury resort shaped by Imperial garden houses, recalling a past era influenced by Imperial Mandarin. In the evening, you can bask in the grandeur of the Tha Om Garden House, which once acted as the home of the former minister to the emperor. As you descend into the opulence, you will find a soothing yet grand ambiance of rippling lotus ponds, elegant pavilions, manicured gardens, and the replicant designs of the original 19th-century residence. Your host will be a descendant of the royal family who will unveil the family history before a traditional dinner featuring dishes like banh loc tran or nem lui.

dayInfo.title: Hue - Uncover Imperial Past and Contemporary Art
dayInfo.description: After breakfast, you will have a private rickshaw ride around the imperial citadel of Hue. The bustling shops lead to aromatic restaurants that offer a sense of daily life amid the preserved architecture. As you uncover the wonders of the city, you will find vibrant reds and charming yellows decorating the facades throughout the palace complex before you reach Thai Hoa Palace. The design was meant to embody the physical and spiritual harmony of yin and yang. You may notice the large hall decorated with 90 timber columns and a majestic timber roof. The gallery was once used only for royal ceremonies and imperial events, such as crowning the emperor. A golden throne remains in the center of the hall, exuding the stately ambiance of the palace. You may also visit the Khai Dinh Mausoleum, home to the 12th emperor, and celebrated for its lavish blend of western and eastern aesthetics crowning 127 stairs. At lunch, you will once again find the allure of Hue cuisine as you dine at Cat Tuong Quan, a renowned retreat for Zen spiritualists that focuses on balance. During the meal, you will find fresh ingredients grown on the local organic gardens divided across the sprawling complex by meditation halls. You can participate in a meditation session learning the truth of the practice and its purpose. Your private driver will take you to Tu Hieu Pagoda to continue your tour of Hue at the sacred building in the 19th century, restored in the 1940s by a monk. Your guide will be an innovative art curator who specializes in the flourishing art community of Vietnam. The scent of the pine forest will surround you as your guide leads you through the pagoda and to her home built in the traditional imperial style of Hue with a front screen and miniature landscapes imitating the larger scale of the region. The stories and history of Vietnam will fill the night as the aromas of the royal imperial kitchen showcase the historical cuisine of the area steeped in savory flavor.

dayInfo.title: Hanoi - Fly to Hanoi for a French Quarter Excursion
dayInfo.description: You will have a morning flight to Hanoi, and your private transfer will meet you at the airport to escort you to the comforts of your luxury hotel situated in an iconic colonial building in the atmospheric French Quarter. The French colonial accents will embellish the opulence before taking a stroll through the charm of the historical district nestled into the banks of Hoan Kiem Lake. Locals enjoy Tai Chi along the water’s edge in the morning, and elegant boutique shops fill the restored colonial administration buildings that once shaped the “Champs Elysee” of Asia. The Opera House was built in 1911 and features a grand Neo-Baroque facade with ivory-colored columns and ornate balconies. The charming city will envelop you as you meet a long-term resident of the city for exclusive access to Vietnamese history. Your guide will take you through a different perspective of Hanoi, leading to an army bunker used during the Vietnam War, where you will learn the untold and personal stories as seen from an alternate viewpoint. In the evening, you will have dinner at Tung Dining, a restaurant that immerses you in originality while celebrating refinement and flavor. Modern aesthetic becomes the focus with a chef who has mastered taste by using 3D printing techniques to shape healthy dishes exploding with layers of flavor. The menu often changes, but popular dishes in the past have included foie gras and burrata ice cream or king prawn and pomelo.

dayInfo.title: Hanoi - Discover the Vietnam War through Food
dayInfo.description: You will have the unique opportunity to travel through time with your guide, who will uncover the complexities of the Vietnam War through food by starting on the bustling streets in the Old Quarter. The collection of 36 narrow lanes reveals how each street is dedicated to a specific trade. The foundations of the commercial center date back a millennium, showing pieces of the medieval era through the modern lens. Shophouse architecture leads to narrow two-story dwellings above stalls glowing with tropical fruits and vegetables. You will stop at a fascinating local restaurant where you can experience the post-war period of “Mau Dich” when food was rationed. Servers of the restaurant wear uniforms representing the old state-run shops and meals are purchased with food tokens. You can hear stories of the war from the perspective of a Vietnam veteran before visiting the spot where President Obama ate freshly grilled pork with rice vermicelli with the late celebrity chef and traveler Anthony Bourdain. The scent of spices and chili oil will fill the street as you sample the dish, tasting familiar notes accompanied by the legend of those who have eaten the dish before you. The day will come to a close as you travel with a famous French aroma hunter who has sought rare plants and exotic spices across Southeast Asia. Laurent Severac will guide you through a meal crafted by Chef Thanh, most famous for creating the Bun Cha Burger. Your menu will consist of spice blends exclusive to the meal shaped and curated by Laurent but fused with the creations of Thanh for a truly unique and unparalleled culinary experience customized to your tastes.

dayInfo.title: Siem Reap - Visit Halong Bay and fly to Siem Reap
dayInfo.description: Your last adventure in Vietnam will begin with a transfer to the airport for a private seaplane ride to Halong Bay. The magnificent display of nature features 1,600 limestone karsts sprouting of the aquamarine water, spanning more than 579 square miles. Your scenic panorama where sweep across the Gulf of Tonkin as the sunlight glints against the sea and narrow pillars emerging from the bay. You will board a private boat to get up close to the famous beaches adorned with pristine white sands, verdant islands, and deep caves. You may wish to visit Hang Dau Go, a giant cave with three chambers set beneath 90 steps. The ceiling reaches up to 82 feet high with dramatic stalactites dripping down like icicles. Upon reaching Hanoi, you will board your flight bound for Siem Reap, where your private transfer will greet you on arrival. You will find a home in the luxuries of an iconic hotel first built in the 1930s. The preserved elegance of the colonial architecture exudes impeccable taste and hospitality rooted in the local culture but featuring adornments like elegant Italian tiling and claw-foot tubs, a curated pool, and 15 acres of landscaped grounds with regal gardens and fresh herbs.

dayInfo.title: Siem Reap - Enjoy a Remote Village and Fine Cuisine
dayInfo.description: Your first outing in Cambodia will take you to Chao Srei Vibol, a secluded temple on a hilltop and surrounded by laterite walls. The unrestored sanctuary will highlight architecture dating back a millennium crowning the summit of the hill at over 98 feet above the surrounding plain. A nearby village will welcome you with a glimpse into the daily life of locals. Your host will create a simple but delicious feast featuring typical ingredients such as chicken and vegetables cooked on a skewer over an open flame. The spice blend may feature familiar flavors such as red chili peppers, star anise, and ginger before you learn how to make a traditional and delicious dessert using mango or another tropical fruit like tamarind. You will continue to a workshop to meet with an artisan who crafts the regional liqueur of Sombai. Rice wine and rum make the vibrant and spiced flavor before it is mixed with exotic ingredients to add depth and diversity. You can sample up to eight different flavors of the local liqueur, enjoying the sweet and lively flavors featuring ingredients such as banana and cinnamon or coconut and pineapple. Your tasty first day in Cambodia will lead you to a guided tour of the three most highly rated restaurants in Siem Reap with each kitchen led by a renowned chef. You will sample the remarkable flavors of each restaurant as you enjoy a starter, a main course, and a dessert to find the points at which the techniques, ingredients, and flavors connect and converge.

dayInfo.title: Siem Reap - The Ultimate Angkor Experience
dayInfo.description: It will be an early start as you enter the famous Angkor Temple complex to explore the world’s largest collection of religious buildings. The complex dates back to the 12th century and was constructed during the reign of King Suryavarman II. Your guide will lead you to the famous temples beginning with Angkor Wat, the iconic monument celebrated for its blend of symmetry and spirituality. The towers in the design mirror Mount Meru, the sacred mountain at the center of the physical, metaphysical, and spiritual universe. As you tour the temple, you can find the preserved etchings of the walls bringing to life the intricate details of the craftsmanship, such as with the bas-relief Churning of the Ocean of Milk that features demigods and divine beings churning the sea in an attempt to extract immortality. You will have a private picnic inside the archeological park to enjoy the lush jungle landscape and a selection of delicious bites that combine Cambodian staples and western favorites made from local farms or gardens. After visiting the preserved temples at Angkor Thom, the last capital of the Khmer Empire, you will have a scenic flight aboard a helicopter for a panoramic view of the entire Angkor complex sweeping to the floating village of Tonle Sap Lake and the ridges of Bakheng Mountain. In the evening, you will bask in the traditions of the Royal Khmer with a dinner focusing on a mixture of textures, aromas, and exhilarating flavors revolving around staples like rice, fish, shellfish, and garlic.

dayInfo.title: Siem Reap - Depart for Home
dayInfo.description: In the morning, you may find the scent of strong coffee filling the hotel's dining room. Many locals enjoy the more robust flavor of rich coffee sweetened with condensed milk and possibly poured over ice to mitigate the tropical heat of the region. As you finish breakfast, your private transfer will meet you in your hotel lobby. You will travel to Siem Reap International Airport to check-in for your flight home, bringing an end to your luxurious adventure through Southeast Asia and the dynamic gastronomy of Thailand, Vietnam, and Cambodia.

tourName: Cultural Coastlines of Thailand: Tour for Seniors
placesVisited: Bangkok, Koh Si Chang, Pattaya, Koh Chang, Ao Nang, Phang Nga Bay
generalInfo: Leave no stone unturned on this 2-week cultural tour through Thailand’s cherished islands. This tour leads you to exalted environments that are teeming with wildlife and cultural landmarks. Escape the hustle and bustle on castaway beaches, unravel Phuket’s industrious heritage, sail across sapphire seas, and submerge yourselves in the country’s complex blend of cultures.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok – Thailand’s Finest Delights
dayInfo.description: After landing, you will collect your luggage and meet your private transfer for a quick drive to your accommodation. After your long flight, you may wish to rest or see the city. You may luxuriate on velvet loungers around your rooftop swimming pool or set off along the spirited streets, where you will be enveloped by an exuberant ambiance that typifies Southeast Asia’s daily lifestyle. Vivacious markets serve traditional fare for hungry visitors who desire to tuck into the local cuisine.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok – Cultural Landmarks
dayInfo.description: Today, your guide will whisk you away to venerated highlights across the city. Your tour will begin on Bangkok’s ancient canals within a well-kept riverboat. You will sail into the soul of Thailand’s riverside life. Your boat will arrive at a small pier where you will disembark to pay Bangkok’s spiritual grounds a visit. Starting with the Grand Palace and Wat Phra Kaew, you will be engrossed from the beginning of your tour. Before you return to your hotel for an evening at your leisure, you may peruse the district of Chinatown.

dayInfo.title: Si Racha – Serene Spectacles
dayInfo.description: If the name Si Racha rings any bells, then it is likely that you have purchased or stumbled across Sriracha hot sauces at your local supermarket. Few are aware of its humble origins as a Burmese-inspired picante condiment in the heart of Si Racha, which was once a modest coastal town of Thailand. Today, you will cross the countryside to Si Racha. Upon your arrival, you will be met with a blend of modern and traditional sights. Once you have checked into your palatial suite and dropped off your belongings, you may venture to the sleepy town on foot for a stroll around the neighborhood.

dayInfo.title: Si Racha – Koh Si Chang’s History
dayInfo.description: Off the coast of Si Racha lies a small archipelago around the popular island of Koh Si Chang. Koh Si Chang is a forest-coated island that is steeped in culture. Today, you will ferry across the Gulf of Thailand from Si Racha on a casual cruise that will take less than an hour. Upon your arrival, you will embark on a tour that will lead you to spiritual sites, such as Tham Chakrabongse or the Yellow Buddha. If you are up for a journey, then you can embark on a brisk trek out of town to a replica of Buddha’s footprint within the four arches of Khao Nang Buat. Whether you opt to partake in the bracing hike or not, you will find yourselves digging your toes into the soft sand of Haad Tham Phang beach in the evening.

dayInfo.title: Pattaya – Witness Pattaya’s Appeal
dayInfo.description: Pattaya is another traditional Thai fishing village that has experienced a booming tourism scene. This morning, you will transfer across the short breadth of landscape that connects Si Racha and Pattaya. Pattaya hosts an assortment of appealing attractions that cater to an array of travel preferences. Today, will be at your leisure and you can decide on your adventure for the day. You can discover the craftsmanship of the Sanctuary of Truth, visit the Nong Nooch Botanical Garden, or discover the waterways of the Four Regions Floating Market. If you cannot choose, your guide can lead you on a tour that will allow you a brief stop at each location.

dayInfo.title: Pattaya – Koh Larn’s Shores
dayInfo.description: Koh Larn is a must-see island. The island is surrounded by crystal-clear water and pearl-white beaches. Although a ferry is a popular option for reaching the destination, you will hastily set sail across the Pacific in a speed boat. There are a host of activities that can keep you enthused during your day expedition to Koh Larn. The island is also endowed with illustrious beaches. For those with a vigorous lust for adventure, you can parasail from the pointed peaks for 360-degree views. You can also partake in a glass-bottom kayak tour.

dayInfo.title: Koh Chang – Sun-Kissed Beaches
dayInfo.description: The journey through to Koh Chang will take a few hours. Once safely in Trat, you will jump on a speed boat and zip across the sea to Koh Chang, where you will disembark at a seaside resort. Your first day will allow you to be swept away by the slow-paced lifestyle that glazes over Koh Chang. You will then spend the remainder of your day tucking into exquisite seafood dishes and lounging around your pool. The following day will bring more of this surreal tropical grandeur with it. After breakfast this morning, you will spend the day on the beach, where you will have the opportunity for watersports and a private Thai massage.

dayInfo.title: Koh Chang – Diverse Habitats
dayInfo.description: After breakfast, a shaded pathway will guide you through lush foliage. Soon, you will arrive at the base of an incredible waterfall. Once you arrive, you will be treated to the sight of the pounding cascade through the ravine. Smooth-surfaced rocks will provide the perfect place to set up camp. With lunch served alongside the river at charming restaurants, you will relish a spread of authentic Thai meals before you return to your resort. In the afternoon, you may participate in a private cooking class with award-winning chefs.

dayInfo.title: Ao Nang – Classy Dining with a View
dayInfo.description: The shores of Ao Nang abound with beauty. Limestone mountains rise from the seas and magical marine life which lives amongst colorful coral off the coastlines of pearl-white beaches. When you are not out touring the Andaman Sea, you will find yourselves adoring the tropical glamour represented by Ao Nang’s sprawling palm tree-lined coast, especially from the true splendor of your luxury suite. An airplane transfer will send you soaring across the sky from Trat, over a strip of the country which dissects the Gulf of Thailand and the Andaman Sea, for a swift getaway to this destination.

dayInfo.title: Ao Nang – Sail across the Sea
dayInfo.description: After breakfast this morning, you will transfer to Ao Nang’s pier where a friendly captain will welcome you aboard his vessel for a day on the ocean. When you are ready, you will set sail across the cerulean sea to the shores of Koh Poda. A gentle paddle in kayaks will reveal the illustrious scenes of the crescent bay. The warm-hearted locals will be ecstatic to treat you to an assortment of delectable dishes. You may share in conversations with them to learn about the contrasts of their way of life and the environmental conservation efforts they hold dear to their hearts.

dayInfo.title: Ao Nang – Explore Cliffs and Caves
dayInfo.description: Across Ao Nang are marvelous viewpoints that are situated on the summits of staggering peaks. Today, you will trek up these green hills to immerse yourself in the wildlife. With hikes that range from brisk and bracing to unhurried and leisurely, you will have a variety of options. Accompanied by a knowledgeable guide, you can select the expedition that appeals to you. Besides beaches and mountains of ceaseless charm, Ao Nang boasts impressive caves that are worth a visit.

dayInfo.title: Phuket – Departure
dayInfo.description: Your trip would be incomplete without a stop at the cataloged island of Phuket, which is Thailand’s largest and most culturally diverse tropical island. Although your stay will be brief, you will have bountiful experiences that will allow you to witness the varied scope of cultural complexities and delicious cuisine. Your guide will lead you on a private tour of the city before allowing you to spend the rest of the day at your leisure. The following morning, your guide will transfer you to the airport.

tourName: Cultural Thailand Tour: 3 Weeks of Heritage
placesVisited: Bangkok, Ayutthaya, Udon Thani, Chiang Mai, Chiang Rai, Hua Hin, Phuket, Similan Islands
generalInfo: The origins of Thai culture can be traced back through the country’s enchanting and sacred spiritual complexes, significant, heritage landmarks, and authentic, local ethnic tribes. These dynamic experiences will reveal the fascinating history of the country on this immersive and handcrafted, cultural tour. You will traverse its diverse landscape in search of revered sites that are home to a wealth of insight into the traditions that make Thailand unique. You will discover the renowned flavors of authentic cuisine and revel in the scenic beauty of beloved locations. This tailor-made tour will give you the ultimate taste of traditional Thailand.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok – An Opulent Taste of Thai Culture
dayInfo.description: Brimming with cultural highlights that are set amid an opulent cityscape, Bangkok is an essential stop on this handpicked heritage tour of Thailand. You will arrive at the sights of immense skyscrapers and bustling city streets, and there is an energy in this city, which is unlike any other that will completely sweep you away. Back alleyways will guide you in the direction of immaculately prepared Thai cuisine, coveted temples, or Wats , will invite you to share in age-old cultural tradition, and lavish retail districts will encourage you to spoil yourselves. You will explore these wondrous landmarks and much more throughout your stay. First, you will check into your luxurious hotel within the heart of the city and become acquainted with your surroundings. An evening at a premier rooftop bar will culminate your arrival with delectable cocktails, gourmet Thai meals, and sweeping vistas of Bangkok. You will begin the following day at an authentic Thai market where you can through the exuberant stalls in search of delicious delicacies. The smell of freshly pressed juice and stir-fried Pad Thai , a mouthwatering traditional noodle dish, will captivate your senses as you venture through the market. After filling up on an exquisite breakfast, you will meet your private tour guide for the day and continue on a riveting, cultural expedition. Transfer to the spiritual hub of the city where you will revel in the majesty of sacred historical Wats . The awe-inspiring golden temples resonate their ancient heritage. You will marvel at the intricately designed complexes as you learn more about their construction and traditional spiritual practices. Afterward, you will transfer via Tuk-Tuk , which is a Southeast Asian open-air vehicle, to a celebrated performance house where you will colorful displays of ancient Thai dance that are alongside traditional musical scores. You will enjoy an exquisite, gourmet meal as you watch the elaborate show. Before you bid your farewells to Bangkok, you will explore the flavors of Thailand on your final day. Your private tour guide will transfer you to revered restaurants and coveted local eateries to sample a collection of tantalizing meals. Prepared with love and crafted with meticulous attention to detail, this food tour will reveal the secrets behind the world-famous cuisine. Along the way, you will meet a few of the renowned chefs and learn what makes their dishes so unique. One final stop at Bangkok’s upper-class, riverside retail market will provide you the opportunity to purchase one-of-a-kind souvenirs to serve as memoirs of your stay.

dayInfo.title: Ayutthaya – A Historical Site of Grand Importance
dayInfo.description: You will be met by your private transfer the following morning after you have enjoyed a sumptuous breakfast at your 5-star hotel. Transfer, in the comfort of a luxurious, private vehicle, to the ancient city of Ayutthaya. Your journey will reveal the idyllic countryside landscape. Where you were once surrounded by towering buildings, you will now find yourselves amongst sprawling, green hills. Let the fresh, country air revitalize you as you approach Ayutthaya’s humble charm. You will arrive at a boutique hotel that will be filled with world-class amenities for your elegant stay. Check-in and laze around the pool to soak in the secluded splendor. In the evening, you will set off to a local fine-dining restaurant on the banks of the Chao Phraya River that will allow you to tuck into a professionally-cooked, local meal and take in the absolutely enthralling sunset vistas. Ayutthaya is home to the UNESCO World Heritage Site of Ayutthaya Historical Park. Within the borders of the immense park, you will discover its sheer beauty and history behind the ancient temple and palace ruins, which stand in varying degrees of construction. There is a wealth to explore within the confines of the park, but your knowledgeable tour guide will ensure that you visit the most sacred sites and the sites that you are most excited to witness. You will uncover the history of the Burmese-Siamese War as you capture the humble atmosphere that bounces off the ruins’ walls. Here, you can stand among pieces of the past and immerse yourselves in the dramatic history of this destination. Later today, you will visit the famous Bang Pa-In Palace, which showcases the country’s stylish blend of Thai and Chinese architecture. Return to the riverside city for one last immaculate dinner. You will comfortably settle in at a recognized restaurant and revel in a candlelit dining experience with beautiful countryside views. As you toast to your immersive adventures thus far, you will celebrate the exceptional experiences that are still to come.

dayInfo.title: Udon Thani – Authentic Simplicity amid Natural Splendor
dayInfo.description: Today, you will comfortably transfer back to Bangkok, where you will board a plane that is bound for Udon Thani. The short trip will reveal more of Thailand’s surreal, rural settings. Buildings give way to rice paddies, roads become rubble at the bases of magnificent mountain ranges, lush rainforests spread in all directions, and rivers gently flow through the grassy landscape. These are sights to cherish, and you will capture them in great detail shortly after you land. Your private transfer will collect you from the airport, and you will travel to your designer hotel in central Udon Thani. Eco-conscious practices sit at the heart of the hotel’s core values and underpin their sophisticated offering. You can luxuriate in your impeccable, spacious room and enjoy the spacious pool to unwind. You can also fine dine at the hotel’s gorgeous, rooftop restaurant for an endearing welcome. Ban Chiang, which is a renowned UNESCO World Heritage Site, is where you will uncover prehistoric discoveries the following day. It is a world-famous archaeological destination that boasts the earliest records of agricultural practices within the region. Furthermore, it is home to an incredible pottery heritage in which ancient civilizations mastered the practice. Here, you will explore relics of the past at the distinguished, national museum and learn more about the time-tested craft. Accompanied by a fluent tour guide, you will transfer to nearby villages and encounter friendly locals who will connect you with the regions age-old traditions as you immerse yourselves in their heritage. You can enjoy a fabulous, family-style lunch with a welcoming group before you are transferred back to the city for an evening at your leisure. The following day, you will venture to Phu Phra Bat Historical Park. Your private tour guide will transfer you through the prehistoric destination, where you will witness it in all its natural wonder. Capture images of the picturesque rock formations and encounter ancient shelters that have been carved into their faces. These enchanting landmarks, where monks found refuge in the past, are home to fascinating rock paintings that depict various animals and people. Finally, you will visit century-old relics and temple structures that showcase the Dvaravati period.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Mai ��– The Cultural Hub of Northern Thailand
dayInfo.description: Your culturally enriching adventures will continue in the Northern capital of Thailand: Chiang Mai. You will transfer via a short plane trip to the rugged, mountainous region. Nestled beneath the imposing Doi Suthep Mountain lies the thriving city, and you will arrive at a chic resort that is set along the cascading banks of the mountain. Here, you will have uninterrupted views of the far-reaching northern landscape and bask in its diverse beauty. Professional staff will happily welcome you and show you around your world-class accommodation. You can spend the afternoon at your leisure and delight in a multiple course, gourmet meal at your hotel’s revered restaurant to conclude your first evening. Today, you will explore the ancient settlements of Chiang Mai during your first full day in the city. Under the guidance of your knowledgeable tour guide, you will venture to pivotal heritage sites such as Wiang Kum Kam. Once lost underwater when the Ping River burst, the now recovered location makes for a truly intriguing visit, which will allow you to witness the incredible architecture of the uncovered structures that have been found within the region. You will also have the opportunity to encounter ancient artifacts that have been restored from the devastating floods. For the remainder of the day, you will learn about the rehabilitation of Thailand’s magnificent elephants. For this experience, you will transfer to an ethically recognized elephant sanctuary within a gorgeous nature park. Surrounded by the marvelous creatures and the unspoiled wilderness, you will capture unforgettable moments of companionship as you care for the elephants. Your deeply enriching experience in Chiang Mai will continue the following day from the towering heights of Doi Suthep Mountain. A brisk hike or cable car ride to the top will reveal unrivaled views of Northern Thailand. However, the most impressive display is the enthralling temple cave complex that is perched atop the mountain. You will traverse the winding paths and marvel at the ornate structures and temples amid the caves before capturing images of the gleaming, golden designs under the warm Thai sun. Then, you will venture off for an endearing lake that is located beneath the foot of the mountain for an afternoon of complete relaxation. Dip your head in the warm water and camp out in the shade beneath the bamboo huts as you absorb the nature around you. An authentic Thai meal at a local night market will awaken your senses tonight before you weave your way through the spirited market as you feed off of the positive energy and delightful treats.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Rai ��– Discover a World of Ethnic Tradition
dayInfo.description: Chiang Rai is Chiang Mai’s less-frequented, neighboring city. However, in terms of cultural seclusion, it leaves nothing to be desired. You will transfer to your immaculate resort that will be located along the banks of the Kok River. With stylish rooms, a luxury spa, and an infinity pool, you will feel completely at home throughout your stay. You can enjoy elaborate Thai cuisine that will be prepared by a master chef at your hotel’s premier restaurant while you sip on elegant cocktails and soak in the calm ambiance as the sun fades over the horizon. The following day, you will discover the historical highlights of Chiang Rai in all their glory. Accompanied by an experienced guide, you will venture forth to the age-old city of Chiang Saen. Settled on the banks of the Mekong River, the ancient city forms part of the world-famous Golden Triangle. You will discover the intriguing, sacred structures and buildings that are dotted around the destination, and your tour will culminate with an exploration of the Golden Triangle. While you are here, your guide will share fascinating information about the regions heritage and its role in the opium trade. Later this afternoon, you will visit an ethnic hill tribe and discover the true traditional Thai lifestyle. The locals will welcome you into their village, and you will feel great admiration for the friendly people that you meet along the way. You will tuck into authentically prepared meals and witness flamboyant, traditional performances. You will also make unforgettable connections and capture lifelong images of the fun-filled adventure that you will cherish for the rest of your life.

dayInfo.title: Hua Hin – Refresh Your Spirit in Style
dayInfo.description: All of the immersive and cultural explorations will leave you yearning for a short break, and your next stop will be dedicated to giving you the luxury leisure that you deserve. Transfer to the opulent Hua Hin resort region, which sits adjacent to the Gulf of Thailand. An impressive white-sand beach sprawls along the decadent coastline and immaculate resorts that overlook the crystal waters. You will check into your 5-star hotel and unwind in your chic, private suite. With sweeping views of the sea, you will revel in ultimate tropical seclusion as you spend the afternoon on the beach and enjoy a leisurely dip in the water. You will conclude your arrival with a sumptuous, seafood dinner at an award-winning restaurant where you will bask in the sunset vistas from the seaside balcony and celebrate your cultural adventures. Soak in the splendor on the following day at a world-class wellness center. With a collection of prestigious treatments and therapies, you will be spoiled for choice as to how you spend your day of complete relaxation. Whatever you opt for, you will be utterly satisfied with the professional service and incredible seaside backdrop that accompanies your luxurious spa experience. The expert staff will ensure that you leave without any tension and feel completely rejuvenated by your experience. You have the remainder of your day to spend at your leisure, so you can roam the fashionable streets in search of high-end items to take back home with you and dine on delectable dishes at revered restaurants.

dayInfo.title: Phuket – Where Culture and Cuisine Shine
dayInfo.description: Your cultural expedition will conclude on the magnificent island of Phuket. Hugging its diverse coastline are the white sands of premier beaches, and across the island lie coveted cultural landmarks that you will soon explore in great detail. You will transfer to a luxurious resort on a secluded beach. With surreal sea views and a spacious room to call home, you will bask in the tropical luxury of this paradise destination, primarily because you will be spending your evening at an award-winning restaurant that is known for its exquisite seafood dishes. The following day, you will visit a beloved culinary school for an immersive, Thai cuisine experience. With the help of professional chefs, you will visit a local market to pick out ingredients so you can cook a few of the country’s most admired dishes. You will indulge in your creations at the end of the course and delight in the marvelous meals that you have prepared. Later today, you will visit a vibrant market and further delve into authentic, Thai cuisine alongside an array of friendly locals. Then, you will conclude your evening with a stroll along the paper-white shores of an idyllic beach and witness sunset views that will definitely be worth sharing. The following day, you will set off to the famous Similan Islands via a luxury speed boat. During this day trip, you will learn how to scuba dive with the help of professional guides and launch at world-class diving destinations off of the immaculate coastline of these incredible islands. You can navigate the waters in search of unforgettable images of sea life in all its colorful glory. Then, you will be whisked to another world as you dive alongside the majestic creatures that call this whimsical place home. Before you return home, you will further explore the essential landmarks that are dotted around the island of Phuket. Accompanied by a cultured tour guide, you will transfer to pivotal destinations and encounter the sacred beauty of Phuket’s spiritual sites. Ornate temples, the Big Buddha statue, and panoramic viewpoints are a few of the exciting experiences that await you on this immersive tour of the island. Your impressive expedition to Thailand will culminate with a 5-star, multiple course meal at an exceptional restaurant that will be complete with seaside views. Tuck into one last immaculately-prepared, Thai dinner and reminisce on the fantastic cultural adventures that you have experienced. The following day, you will transfer to the airport and bid your farewells to this endearing destination.

tourName: Discover Thailand Tour: Bangkok, Chiang Rai, Chiang Mai, Krabi & More
placesVisited: Bangkok, Chiang Rai, Chiang Mai, Ayutthaya, Krabi
generalInfo: The experience of discovery will take you through the marvels of culture and wildlife on this custom tailored tour through the past and present traditions, unrivaled landscapes, and endless wonder of Thailand. From the Chao Phraya River to the Golden Triangle, pristine sandy beaches to incredible hill tribes, you will find the unique and the treasured, the fabled and the masterful as if were created just for you. Hidden within the spectacular flavors or wondrous jungle where temples climb over mountaintops, you will discover surprises and find experience is the ultimate reward.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok - Experienced Arrivals
dayInfo.description: Arrive in Bangkok, the fabulous metropolis of Thailand that rushes past in vibrant colors and endless energy. You will be met at the airport by a private transfer and taken to your plush accommodations at the Peninsula Hotel. Settle into the luxuries that overlook the fabulous Chao Phraya River, the graceful waterway that runs adjacent to the city’s classic history. There is a vivacious mixture of past and present swimming around Bangkok’s streets, filled with sparkling temples and pagodas, equally as impressive as the rising skyscrapers. It is easy to get lost amongst the wonder, from the effervescent aroma of the food to the quiet charm of the Golden Mountain. As you look out through your hotel room window over the expanse of the city you know the discovery has begun.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok - Discovering the Dawn
dayInfo.description: The morning brings with it a bright glow from the chedi of Wat Arun, the Temple of Dawn, where the spire gleams in the light and acts like a lighthouse against the backdrop of the city where the gentle trickle of the river runs through. After breakfast you will venture out into the city to find the spectacular culture of Bangkok’s history and modernity thriving all around you. Cruise along the river, wading between the wide shores of the city and arriving at the shimmering temple of Wat Arun, built between 1809 and 1851. The atmosphere is quiet and welcoming. The architecture breathes life into the city. A moment ago you couldn’t see past the skyscrapers; now before you is an immaculate façade with concentric circular shapes speckled with glass giving it a sparkling quality that mesmerizes you as you look upon its towering frame. Once you reach the shores of the Grand Palace the manicured garden sweeps around stunning temples and grandiose royal lodging. Construction began under King Rama I and has since displayed such spectacular culture such as Wat Phra Kaew, housing the famous Emerald Buddha, the symbol of Thailand. On a pedestal at the center of the far wall you will once again discover a shining example of the country; the Buddha sits poised in enlightenment, draped in one of three different robes that the king replaces with the seasons. The air is calm and touched with incense as every moment brings a new and wonderful encounter.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Rai - Discovering Gold
dayInfo.description: Today you will discover the hidden serenity of Bangkok, nestled beneath the energetic streets of the metropolis, sometimes even rising over them. Visiting Wat Saket brings you to the steps of the Golden Mountain, an artificial hill that is gilded by a 260 foot pagoda. The inspiring golden spire was once the highest point in the city and dates back to the empire of Siam and was restored in the late 18th and early 19th century. The greenery is like an oasis, offering pleasured shade within the warmth of the city’s overlaying heat. The tranquil atmosphere brings you to a lining of brass bells rung for blessings and prayer and eventually to the temple itself. The temple of Ratchanatdaram is also known as Loha Prasart , meaning, “Metal Palace.” With no shortage of splendid temples, you will find the elegance of the Metal Castle to be amongst the wonders of the city. Inspired by temples in India and Sri Lanka and built in the mid-19th century, the temple rises over 118 feet with 37 metal spires that represent the various virtues of enlightenment. The structure rises in concentric square levels on geometrically supporting pillars. Stroll through the alleyways that have been created by the vast amount of pillars and where history, from architecture to religion, resides. After your tour, you will make your way to the airport and arrive in Chiang Rai by afternoon. Let yourself get acquainted with the comforts of your hotel, situated within the open space of a jungle-clad city. The pool is decorated with lily pads, rushing like an infinity pool that overlooks the river. Each room is plush, whether overlooking the pool or the greenery where the northern expanse is never too far away.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Rai - Into the Surrounding Hills
dayInfo.description: Chiang Rai is the most northern city of Thailand and is considered the birthplace of the country. When looking around the city you can find inspired architecture influenced by Burmese and Thai, representing the eclectic mixture culture and history that has created the sensational city. However, outside the city you can still find the traditional communities that persist in their villages throughout the countryside. The Akha is originally from Tibet and can be found along the rolling plush hills throughout Southeast Asia. The villages tend to rise on stilts, climbing and falling with the landscape, draped in woven straw. The women have colorful dress, from dangling strings to graceful headgear. They thread cotton with a hand spindle and eventually dye their clothing with indigos and vibrant colors. Along Mae Sai, the most northern point of Thailand, you can see the point where Burma and Thailand converge; there are also wonderful goods from the market to be found that have crossed from Laos and Burma.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Mai - The Wandering Roads
dayInfo.description: Today you will venture south into the jungle en route to Chiang Mai, the former capital of the Lanna Empire. The streets wind and wander through the trees and you can hear the trickle of water in the distance. Between the cities you will visit the fantastic Karen Hill Tribe, known famously for the women who decorate their necks with opulent brass rings, making it look as though they have been elongated with the jewelry. The village itself resembles many others in the countryside sweeping across the forested landscape; however, the people are remarkably diverse in their traditions. There is a scent of cooking wood and timber that fills the trees. Many women have worn the brass rings since the age of five giving a giraffe-like shape to their shoulders and upward, all while wearing colorful and rosy headwear. Eventually, you will settle into Chiang Mai at your hotel, located along the river, next to a tranquil pool, and filled with modern luxury.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Mai - A Day With Elephants
dayInfo.description: The elephant continues to be Thailand’s most beloved animal, once revered for its luck and prosperity, along with its power and playfulness. Due to deforestation and the ever-expanding cities, there has been a widening effort to help protect the celebrated animal. After breakfast, you will make your way north to a local elephant sanctuary. In the cool shade of the early morning you will find the majestic creatures within the confines of the camp. The open space of the camp displays many qualities that have helped preserve the elephants and their futures, and is meant to familiarize elephants with handling, along with training local guides in proper management techniques.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok - Spires of Experience
dayInfo.description: Just outside of the city walls you will find Wat Suan Dok. The temple was constructed in the 14th century originally meant for priests and to shelter monks from the rain. Whitewashed pagodas are built in Lanna style with exquisite detail that gives a shimmering quality to the façade. Step into the assembly hall, an open air-pavilion with low comprehensive roofs and sweeping terraces. Assembly halls are generally closed-sided; however, the open-sided structure gives a unique quality and superb view to the structure where two focused Buddha images face opposite directions, one meditating, the other standing. Sitting at the top of Doi Suthep Mountain is the sacred site of Wat Prhathat, also known as temple Doi Suthep. Built in the 14th century, the temple stands at the mountain’s summit and watches over Chiang Mai like a vigilant protector. Stand at the first of over 300 steps, flanked by vivacious greenery and snarling serpent creatures that run the gambit of the stairway. The lower terrace offers a wonderful view over the city below and the far-reaching jungle. You can also find the legendary white statue of the elephant that chose this particular spot as the location for the temple. After lunch you will be transferred to the airport where you will return to Bangkok and the comforts of The Peninsula Hotel.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok - Beyond Siam
dayInfo.description: North of Bangkok is the impressive past world of Ayutthaya, a bustling city that contains the remnants of the once powerful empire of Siam. The city was once the capital of the Thai Kingdom for 417 years beginning in 1350 and was eventually destroyed by the Burmese. The city’s ruins are some of the most iconic images you will see in all of Thailand. Monks stroll through the streets in orange robes giving a spectral atmosphere to the towering, powerful stone ruins. The reddish hue that colors the concentric spires of Wat Chai Wattanaram display a collective uniqueness in what time and the elements can do to what were once grandiose creations. There is a scent of warm earth and drifting leaves. You will also notice Wat Mahthat, where the famous tree roots have enraptured a sole head of a Buddha image, enshrouding the semi-smiling face within the earth. As you make your way back to Bangkok you will board the Grand Pearl, a river cruise which will have you drifting along the Chao Phraya River beside wonderful landscapes displaying Thailand’s everyday life. You will pass the luxurious, historical palaces, sit within decadent aromas, and watch the lush landscape shift back into Bangkok’s cityscape.

dayInfo.title: Krabi - The Natural Steps
dayInfo.description: Today you will depart from Bangkok by private transfer to the airport, making your way to Krabi. You will soon be in the comfort of the resort overlooking the majestic ocean and marveled at rising karsts. The modern amenities will have you melting into the luxury, luxuries that include an around the clock personal butler. After you have found yourself settled within the wonderful accommodation you will begin to explore the famed white-sand beaches and untouched islands that the region offers. At Wat Tham Sua you will see a meditation center filled with history and archeological wonderment. The Tiger Cave Temple is alive with visitors and chanting monks, along with rambunctious monkeys that run through the tree line, along the ground, and over the cave. Hidden in the depths of the mountain are Buddha icons ranging in size and gild. Once there you can climb the 1,272 steps to mountain’s summit where the beehive spire towers over the province and gives you a view over the stunning rolling mountains and into an endless horizon.

dayInfo.title: Krabi - Never a Time To Be Krabi
dayInfo.description: The day is yours to explore the wonders of Krabi at your leisure. Whether enjoying the comforts and opulence of the Phulay Bay Ocean Pavilion or venturing out onto the exquisite beaches that line the coast, you will experience the sensations of the province and its surroundings. For a unique experience in Krabi you can step out of Railay Beach, where the powdery white sand helps bring the heat beneath your toes and a soothing touch from the cool water, and into Ao Thalane. The water curves its way around towering limestone karsts with a cold touch and gentle current. The trees hover over the water, dangling down and brushing the water’s surface. The bay tends to shift from dripping limestone and deep crystal surface to jungle branches and vivacious monkeys. When low tide brings the water to a non-traversable low you will see one of the most impressive displays of nature: the walking fish, or ambulatory fish, which uses its fins to walk from puddle to puddle in the dense mud of the bay. When you return from the bay you can let the plushness of your accommodation welcome you in to a restful evening.

dayInfo.title: Krabi - Discovered and Experienced
dayInfo.description: The morning light spreads over the remarkable shore casting a light on the rising stones in the center of the water. You can enjoy breakfast on your balcony overlooking the tremendous view for one last time before making your way to the airport where you will find yourself homeward bound. There is no end to the stunning luxuries and fabulous wonders that you have experienced during your time in Thailand. From north to south and all the marvels in between, every moment has been an extraordinary discovery.

tourName: Enchanted Highlights of Thailand Tour
placesVisited: Bangkok, Chiang Mai, Krabi Town, Koh Phi Phi
generalInfo: Lose yourself in the luxuries of Thailand on this elegant 12-day vacation to the Land of Smiles’ exquisite destinations, including the forested mountains of Chiang Mai, and the sparkling white sand beaches of Krabi. From spa therapies offered at your palatial resorts to animal sightings in the proliferating jungles, encounter the majesty of lands left unspoiled and city’s bursting with culture and heritage.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok - First Class in the Land of Smiles
dayInfo.description: You will touch down in the Land of Smiles, meet your private transfer at the international airport, and head for your palatial accommodation tucked away in one of the capital city’s towering skyscrapers. Enjoying the first-class amenities on offer at your spectacular accommodation, you will have no trouble acclimating to your new home for the next few days. This evening, you may settle in at any of the many award-winning restaurants peppering the dazzling skyline for a gourmet Thai meal prepared by an acclaimed chef.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok - Old Quarter Highlights and the Chao Phraya River
dayInfo.description: You will explore Bangkok by foot this morning, slowly strolling down the back alleys of spirited districts to discover the hidden gems off the beaten path. You will wind through the flowered boulevards of Bangkok’s Old Quarter, stopping to take in the wondrous scenes of the soaring cityscape and immersing yourself in the country’s heritage at several iconic landmarks including the Romaneenart Park and City Pillar Shrine. In the evening, you will sail across the Chao Phraya River beneath the light of the stars and watch the world go by while savoring a sumptuous dinner on the stylish deck.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok - Culinary Class with a Celebrity Chef
dayInfo.description: For lunch, you will join a celebrity chef at an esteemed culinary school in Bangkok for an afternoon cooking experience unlike any other. Under the guidance of this award-winning chef, you will curate a collection of beloved Thai dishes which you may lap up following your hard work to round off the captivating culinary experience. Using fresh ingredients and fragrant spices handpicked from a local floating market, the flavors on the plate will come to life in the most tantalizing way as you slowly savor each mouth-watering bite of your perfectly rendered dishes.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Mai - The Northern Capital of Thailand
dayInfo.description: Chiang Mai, Thailand’s northern capital, is steeped in heritage and shrouded in culture you will be thrilled to immerse yourself in during your stay in the buzzing city. Nestled at the foothills of the Doi Inthanon Mountain, Chiang Mai’s backdrop is a bewitching forested landscape that rises to meet the clouds and its city is laden with sacred complexes to discover each day. This evening, after unwinding at your grand accommodation, you will see Chiang Mai by tuk-tuk , a traditional open-air Southeast Asian vehicle, visiting an array of landmarked locations such as the Iron Bridge and the Three Kings Monument.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Mai - The Life of the Locals
dayInfo.description: To submerge yourself in the spirit of Thailand, you will step off the beaten path today and venture into the rural slices of paradise that lie beyond the borders of the city. Your destination, Mae Kampong Village, is a stunning traditional town where the friendly locals will welcome you and invite you to participate in their culture, learning about their distinct customs during your stay. Before you arrive, however, you will admire the Stone Garden, Teen Tok Royal, and Project and Pha Num Lord Cliff standing between Chiang Mai and the charming village.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Mai - A Day Caring for the Elephants
dayInfo.description: Across Thailand, several sanctuaries aim to combat the mistreatment of elephants as a result of the influx of tourism to various parts of the country. Today, you will visit an enchanting elephant sanctuary stationed within the verdant forest and learn more about their efforts to care for the majestic creatures. You will have the unforgettable opportunity to play with and wash the magnificent beasts, taking in the remarkable forested scenery that backdrops the experience while you do so and capturing incredible images of your time caring for the elephants.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Mai - The Dazzling Discoveries on Doi Inthanon
dayInfo.description: You will explore Doi Inthanon today on a magical Thai experience beginning with a trip to the temple where you may give alms to the monks draped in orange saffron robes. Afterward, you will stroll through the mountain forest alongside an experienced guide who will share information about the endemic flora and fauna as you scan your eyes to the colorful and vibrant creatures and plant life flooding the wondrous wilderness. You will capture images of giant fig trees who have rooted themselves in the forest for many years and hear the rustling of monkeys leaping through the canopy overhead.

dayInfo.title: Krabi - Elegant Cocktails and Orange Sunsets
dayInfo.description: You will leave Chiang Mai on the eighth day of your vacation and head for the pristine beaches that hug the coastline of Krabi to spend your remaining moments amidst the breathtaking seascapes and impressive karst islands that litter the Andaman Sea. Arriving in Krabi, you will transfer to a palatial seaside resort where you may spend your first afternoon appreciating the bewildering panoramas from your secluded balcony and sipping on cocktails at an elegant beach bar deck hanging over the ebbing sea as the sunset illuminates the sky in orange hues.

dayInfo.title: Krabi - Basking in the Golden Sunshine
dayInfo.description: After a few days of adventurous exploration, a day off in Krabi is exactly what you will need to refresh your mind and vitalize your body. You may spend your day slowly unwinding as you lounge on the soft, pearl-white sands beneath the shade of a looming palm tree or treating yourself to an aromatherapeutic massage at your world-class spa center. However you decide to spend your day, it will be glamorous and rewarding as you relish the finer experiences during your free day in the idyllic tropical paradise that is Krabi.

dayInfo.title: Krabi - Paddling the Waters of Koh Hong
dayInfo.description: Today, you will be swept away by the staggering environmental wonders circling Koh Hong island as you transfer to the natural paradise by boat and kayak across its emerald waters. Paddling slowly through caves, around coves, and along thin channels of water, you will admire panoramas of the giant rock formations flanking the waterways and peer through the translucent surface of the water to catch glimpses of colorful creatures swimming beneath you. The kayak trip will share many postcard-perfect moments to capture amidst the bewitching unspoiled land and seascape.

dayInfo.title: Krabi - The Curious Marine Creatures of Koh Phi Phi
dayInfo.description: Krabi is a gateway to the majestic islands peppering the Andaman Sea and today you will board a speedboat bound for the dramatic coastline of Koh Phi Phi. Gliding across the glimmering sapphire sea, you will soon see the rising karst schisms of Phi Phi jut out the ocean and before you know it you will anchor at secluded beaches where you may spend the afternoon basking in the golden sun. With snorkeling gear readily available, you may wallow in the water to see what lies beneath the surface and marvel at the colorful marine sightings below.

dayInfo.title: Krabi - A Lavish Goodbye to Thailand
dayInfo.description: Your lavish vacation will be coming to an end today and there is no better place to spend your final few moments in Thailand. As the sun rises above the horizon, its rays will dance off the glossy water’s surface, creating a dreamy backdrop to enjoy your coffee from your stylish terrace. After breakfast, you may have a dip in the temperate ocean one last time before you pack your belongings and transfer to the airport. You will soon return home with a wealth of memorable experiences acquired during your luxurious stay in Thailand.

tourName: Exclusive Tour of Thailand in 12 Days
placesVisited: Bangkok, Chiang Mai, Krabi Town, Hong Island, Koh Phi Phi
generalInfo: Experience true Thailand glamour and the thrill of Southeast Asian adventure on this 12-day insider’s tour to Bangkok, Chiang Mai, Krabi, and more. Visit uplifting communities where ancient spirituality and heritage shine, explore unwavering conservation areas where wildlife thrives, and discover pristine beaches and sparkling seascapes at premier island escapes as you peer behind the scenes to learn what makes Thailand tick.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok - Welcome to Bustling Bangkok
dayInfo.description: You will arrive in Thailand the day after your flight across the International Date Line and greet Bangkok after you pass through immigration and meet your private transfer. Your transfer and guide will drive you through Bangkok’s busy streets, past towering skyscrapers and down narrow roads in historic districts, to a decorated luxury hotel situated in Bangkok’s bustling cityscape. The rest of your day is at leisure, and you may enjoy a light stroll around the neighborhood, where you will introduce yourself to Thai culinary culture at lofty restaurants overlooking the twinkling cityscape this evening.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok - Brilliant City Highlights of Bangkok
dayInfo.description: You will meet a guide after breakfast for a private walking tour of Bangkok that will begin beneath the soaring red arch of the Giant Swing. You will stroll down back alleys to colorful markets riddled with trinkets and fresh produce and delve into ancient Thai superstitions at the City Pillar Shrine. Your walking tour will culminate at a pier on the Chao Phraya River, where you will set sail on a khlong , or canal, tour past antique galleries and riverside stalls. A visit to Wat Arun temple and a sunset cruise on the Chao Phraya will conclude your brilliant tour.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok - Floating Markets and Thai Cuisine
dayInfo.description: You will transfer from Bangkok city this morning to Nakhon Pathom, where you will spend your day immersing yourself in sensational Thai cuisine. Upon arrival, you will meet an excitable professional chef who will lead you to a little boat bound for the produce-laden wooden vessels gliding in and out of the Don Wai floating market. You will collect an assortment of fresh fruit and vegetables before you venture back to the culinary school for an introduction to authentic Thai cuisine. After creating your own Thai specialties, you will return to Bangkok for an evening in the big city.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Mai - Muang Culinary Culture in Chiang Mai
dayInfo.description: You will transfer to Bangkok International Airport after breakfast and enjoy a scenic flight from the crowded city to Chiang Mai’s forested countryside. The culinary culture of Thailand comes to life across Chiang Mai in the traditional modest Muang eateries and coveted restaurants peppering its spirited neighborhoods. After checking into your sensational boutique hotel, you will weave through Chiang Mai’s many colorful towns on bicycles to some of the region’s most famous foodie hotspots. Culminating on the banks of the Ping River, you will gaze over sunset views while savoring a spot of tea and tantalizing dessert treat.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Mai - Discovering Traditional Thailand in Mae Kampong
dayInfo.description: Your adventures will lead you from Chiang Mai to Mae Kampong today, via scenic routes passing Stone Garden, Teen Tok Royal Project, and Pha Num Lord Cliff. You will appreciate the natural history of these floral sanctuaries before you arrive at a village and meet humble Northern Thai locals. During your time in the village, you will come to learn about Khon Mueang culture as you observe skilled villagers engaging in handicrafts and other generations-old traditions. You may also enjoy a sip of the locals’ tea processing and fermentation yields before you visit the Seven Level Waterfall and Temple.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Mai - Magnificent Encounters at the Kanta Elephant Sanctuary
dayInfo.description: Elephants are sacred creatures in Thai culture, though they have been mistreated at the hands of tourism for many years. Fortunately, elephant sanctuaries across the country protect the magnificent animals as best they can and offer travelers an opportunity to ethically engage with the giant mammals. Today, you will visit the Kanta Elephant Sanctuary and change into traditional clothing before you prepare a hearty breakfast for the elephants. You will spend the rest of your morning preparing various meals for them, playing with them, bathing them, and learning about Chiang Mai’s unwavering conservation efforts.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Mai - Significant Spiritual and Environmental Experiences
dayInfo.description: Each morning before dawn, Thai monks don their orange saffron robes and quietly saunter along the streets with alms bowls in their hands. Residents and visitors gather on the roadside and offer rice and condiments to the monks as they pass, and you may partake in this spiritually uplifting alms giving experience. Afterward, you may visit several significant temples and landmarks, including the Sri So da temple, Wat Prathat Doi Suthep, and FORRU, the forest restoration unit of Chiang Mai University. From the gold-embellished walls of the sanctified sites to the emerald-colored canopy of the forest, Chiang Mai boasts awe-inspiring spectacles.

dayInfo.title: Krabi - Peace and Quiet on the Andaman Sea
dayInfo.description: Today, you will leave the hustle and bustle of Thailand’s cityscapes for the refuge and quietude of its seaside escapes. You will transfer to the shimmering white-sand shores of Krabi and check into a stately seaside resort boasting world-class views of the Andaman Sea. In Krabi, the sunlight dances off the sapphire sea, and visitors flock to the soft sands for mornings and afternoons kissed by the sun. You may also wallow in the peaceful pleasures of unwinding on the beach as you acclimate to your surroundings this afternoon.

dayInfo.title: Krabi - Lounging on Thailand’s Sun-Kissed Beaches
dayInfo.description: With a full day in Krabi ahead, you may spend it relaxing in style on loungers dug into the velvety sand beneath the shady palm trees hugging the promenade. The day is yours to enjoy at leisure, whether you wish to snorkel in the crystal clear waters or partake in thrilling water sport activities such as speed boat trips or jet skiing offshore. However you decide to luxuriate on the beaches of Krabi, you will be ecstatic to spend the day relishing Thailand at your own pace.

dayInfo.title: Krabi - Seaside Adventures on Hong Island
dayInfo.description: Krabi is a gateway to the Andaman Sea’s garden of islands, and you will revel in a guided long-tailed boat tour from the crowded Krabi beaches to the secluded sands of Hong Island. Fascinating rock formations littler Hong Island’s headlands and forests veil the landscape beyond the coastline. Upon arrival, you may admire the captivating scenery as you kayak across the glistening sea to shallow coral reefs and hidden lagoons. In the afternoon, you will explore the complex channels and canyon-esque passages composing the soaring karst formations of Ao Thalane.

dayInfo.title: Krabi - Kick Back on Koh Phi Phi
dayInfo.description: Arguably the most popular island in the Andaman Sea, Koh Phi Phi is an adored destination you will visit during a day trip from Krabi. There are a wealth of incredible beaches circling Phi Phi’s coastline, some of which have been made famous for their appearance in popular Hollywood films. From Maya Bay’s postcard-perfect beaches to Pileh Cove’s enchanting rock formations, your tour in and around Phi Phi island will show off the beauty of Thailand’s seascapes like never before. You will also delight in some of the best snorkeling and kayaking over the island’s marine life-swarmed reefs.

dayInfo.title: Krabi - Sparkling Views of the Andaman Sea
dayInfo.description: The sparkling seascape surrounding your suite is the backdrop you will wake up to on your final morning in Krabi. From your balcony, you will hear the sounds of the sea slowly lapping against the pearly shores and feel the brisk breeze against your cheeks while you indulge in a steamy cup of coffee. You may pack your bags before you head down to the restaurant for breakfast alongside panoramas of the Andaman Sea, after which you will meet your private transfer and make your way to the airport.

tourName: Family-Friendly 8-Day Tour of Bangkok’s Best Sights
placesVisited: Bangkok, Pak Chong, Kanchanaburi
generalInfo: Bangkok, the thriving hub of Thailand, is a must-visit destination for families that are yearning for a luxurious and entertaining getaway. The city boasts world-class hotels, stellar restaurants, and an abundance of delightful activities that are perfectly suited for your family. On this 8-Day exploration of Bangkok’s finest attractions and beautiful surrounding locations, you will delight in a truly unforgettable journey to Thailand’s most appealing destination. This hand-crafted tour offers unbelievably compelling cultural and entertainment experiences that will provide a premier family vacation.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok – A Place to Call Home
dayInfo.description: A large part of Bangkok’s travel appeal comes from its enchanting cultural energy and awe-inspiring attractions. For these reasons and many more, a family vacation to Thailand’s diverse capital is exceptionally enriching and entertaining. As you and your family approach the city, excitement for the adventure ahead will kick in tenfold. You will land at Bangkok’s busy Suvarnabhumi Airport, where your private transfer will await. You will be guided swiftly out of the airport and journey to your grand hotel. As you peer your eager eyes out of the window, you will discern what makes Bangkok one of the world’s most popular destinations. Skyscrapers will emerge from the streets and stand magnificently tall amongst the clouds while golden temples shimmer in the sunlight and signal you to take out your cameras. Steam will rise from vendors’ woks, releasing alluring aromas into the air. The city, which you will soon thoroughly explore, perfectly unites traditional Thai culture with modern global appeal. You will arrive at your home for the following few nights shortly thereafter. A luxurious 5-star hotel, which lies beautifully along the Chao Phraya River banks, awaits you and your family. Here, you can enjoy world-class amenities and exquisite cuisine when you return from your adventures. The hotel concierge and fellow employees will ensure that check-in is seamless, and you are settled comfortably in your room. You may take this opportunity to soak in the beauty of Bangkok in absolute style.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok – Museums with a Twist
dayInfo.description: Bangkok boasts an assortment of attractive and compelling museums. On this inspiring day in the city, you and your family will be delighted to explore them. After a scrumptious breakfast spread of local and global cuisine, you will meet your private transfer for a day of insightful adventure. You will visit surreal museums, which will provide entertainment for the entire family. You will visit Bangkok’s premier wax museum that is located in the heart of the city center of Siam. Here, you will brush shoulders with celebrities, legendary sports people, and iconic public figures through the ages. Rather than locking the wax statues behind glass, the museum affords entertainment enthusiasts the opportunity to step into the scene and snap photos with the sculptures. The curators and artists have paid meticulous attention to detail in crafting their pieces. It will be difficult to separate their sculpture designs from reality, which makes the photographs you take seem even more real. If you are traveling with very young ones, Bangkok’s leading child-orientated ‘edutainment’ museum can be found within the complex. It provides an unparalleled entertainment experience which will foster fun and learning growth for your children. A trip later this day to Bangkok’s best Trickeye Museum will yield more surreal images of you and your family. The attraction focuses on interaction and encourages visitors to engage with the intricate illusions. Grand displays will be set upon the floors and walls, allowing you and your family to step into each art piece. It is a one-of-a-kind experience you cannot afford to miss. After a day of fun, you and your family will board a first-class boat for an evening cruise along the Chao Phraya River. Here, you will relish in a multiple course, gourmet meal as the sunset illuminates the sky with vibrant orange and purple hues. From the comfort of the cruise, you can gaze out at Thailand’s magnificent temples and palaces. They will light up like beacons, guiding wandering eyes in their direction. It will be a picture-perfect end to a captivating day. Thereafter, you will transfer back to your serene room for a peaceful night’s sleep.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok – Arts and Culture
dayInfo.description: Despite rapid globalization in the city of Bangkok, it remains a thriving hub of traditional Thai culture and heritage. It is home to some of the country’s most significant age-old temples and continues to position itself as a hotspot for authentic, historical travel. Through the exploration of its arts and cultural highlights, the third day of your trip will be dedicated to discovering what makes Thailand so unique. After breakfast, you will transfer to the most appealing and sought-after temples in the city. Each will be within walking distance from one another, giving you and your family the opportunity to fully immerse yourselves in your surroundings. On your walks, you will encounter Bangkok’s best markets. Brightly colored stalls that will consist of local goods and produce that will have been scattered around the markets. The mouthwatering scent of Thai delicacies, such as Chicken Satay and Pad Thai, will surround you as you leisurely stroll from stall to stall. Some stalls will also sell flavorful juices, which are blended using fresh fruit. There will be a wealth of authentic food to indulge in on your journey around the city. After passing through these vibrant, bustling markets, you will make your way to the temples. The temples, which include Wat Arun and Wat Pho, each offer a spectacle like no other. At Wat Arun, the tall temple will tower over you as you ready your camera to capture the glistening, glass-covered monument. At Wat Pho, you and your family will be astounded by the sheer size and majesty of the 150-foot-long Reclining Buddha. There will be even more magnificent temples and palaces that await you and your family as you make your way through the tour. After an immersive exploration of Bangkok’s best temples, you will visit one of Bangkok’s most revered art houses. Here, you will learn a great deal about the traditional Thai silk industry, its revival, and its subsequent prominence within the European fashion industry. The house brilliantly merges traditional Thai and colonial design, expressing the deep ties that its American-founder had with the country. A beautiful day of sightseeing will come to a close over a fine-dining, Thai cuisine experience. You will be wowed by the excellent service and delectable flavors that will be presented to you with each dish. After all, Thailand is well-known for its peoples’ hospitable nature and its exquisite cuisine. You will journey back to your hotel humbled, content, and excited for the next day’s venture.

dayInfo.title: Pak Chong – Wondrous Wildlife
dayInfo.description: Your 4th day and night will be spent away from the busy city, giving you and your family the opportunity to unwind and discover Thailand’s wondrous wildlife. In the morning, you will check out before venturing to Thailand’s leading national park: Khao Yai National Park, in Pak Chong. Your very own private transfer will pick you and your family up and drop you off at the park. Along the scenic trip to Khao Yai, high-rise skyscrapers will give way to the natural environment and as you near the park rolling green hills, momentous mountains, and the lush forest will become increasingly evident. After checking in to your luxurious suite, a private transfer will collect you at the hotel. The day and night will be a truly invigorating exploration of Thailand’s diverse habitats. You will comfortably settle into your vehicle and begin the search for wildlife. The forest is thick and large trees tower up out of the earth. Gibbons will hang on them while other monkeys leap through the canopy. You will spot an array of animals, such as deer, squirrels, and birdlife such as Great Hornbills and Scarlet Minivets. From here, you will continue into the rainforest for a close-up discovery of the environment and wildlife. You will fuel up with a complimentary lunch before witnessing a renowned waterfall that was made famous in the movie ‘The Beach’ starring Leonardo Di Caprio. Then, you will search for elephants that are traversing the grasslands in all their might and majesty. You will enjoy dinner and drinks before setting off on an after-dark safari that will be guided by spotlight. After witnessing Thailand’s magnificent wildlife, a private transfer will take you back to your luxurious hotel to rest.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok – Explore Some More
dayInfo.description: After enjoying breakfast at your luxury accommodation, you will return to the Bangkok city center on day 5 of the trip via private transfer. The adventure to Khao Yai National Park and busy week thus far will warrant a day of leisure at your own pace. Upon arrival in Bangkok, you will check-in to your lavish apartment with panoramic views of the cityscape. You may relax by the pool and catch up with loved ones, or stay inside your accommodation all day. There will be an abundance of unique activities to do within the city center if you wish to explore some more. This hand-crafted tour is entirely customizable, and you may choose to treat you and your family to a day at one of Bangkok’s best wellness spas or unwind at one of Bangkok’s beautiful, tranquil parks. In the evening, you will take delight in a trip to a Bangkok fine-dining establishment before making your way to a truly unique Thai experience: Muay Thai.
