You will transfer to a prestigious cooking school for an insightful and intimate morning of mastering the culinary arts. After stocking up on local produce at a spirited morning market, you and your partner will work alongside an exceptional chef and learn to prepare world-famous Thai meals. You will return from the experience with a wealth of knowledge for your next Thai-inspired dinner party. Then, you will continue your romantic day with a leisurely stroll through Lumphini Park, where you can meander the winding paths of the pristine park and spend the afternoon amongst the plants. Finally, your day will end at Bangkok’s premier retail district, which is where you will have the opportunity to browse the upper-class stores in search of fashionable items and elegant keepsakes that you will struggle to find anywhere else. An immaculate meal alongside the Chao Phraya River will bring your fabulous time in Bangkok to an end.

dayInfo.title: Khao Yai – Escape to the Wilderness
dayInfo.description: The immense Khao Yai National Park, which is a UNESCO World Heritage Site, is one of Thailand’s greatest wildlife treasures. For nature-loving couples, this destination offers an incredible escape from the bustling energy of Thailand’s cities. You will transfer to Khao Yai via luxury coach from Bangkok. During the journey, you can capture riveting images of Thailand’s idyllic countryside as the rugged mountain terrain and sprawling green landscape will sweep you away. Afterward, you will be transferred to a tropical haven within the boundless national park. Luxury will exude from your accommodation that will be set among the pristine wilderness. The resort blends modern sophistication and authentic traditional architecture to create a space of luxurious intimacy. Your private suite will boast wondrous vistas of the enchanting wildlife, so you will have plenty of opportunities for sight-seeing from the comforts of your luxurious accommodation. Your stay will epitomize leisure and paradise, and shortly after you have arrived, you will experience a relaxing spa treatment as you are surrounded by nature. Expertly trained masseuses will ease away any tension as you and your partner re-center your minds and bodies. You will finish your elaborate welcome spoils with gourmet dining at the resort’s prestigious restaurant. With a spread of local and international cuisine on the menu, you will be utterly spoiled for choice.

dayInfo.title: Khao Yai – A World that is Bursting with Life
dayInfo.description: The following day, you will be whisked away into the wilderness on a safari that will give you unparalleled experiences with local wildlife. You will traverse the tropical rainforest in search of majestic creatures that are indigenous to Thailand. As you venture further, you may marvel at peaceful elephants that are rumbling across the jungle floor and capture images of colorful birds as they flutter overhead. Delight in sights of gibbons as they leap through the canopy. In the rainforest, there will be an abundance of wildlife to discover on this impressive safari excursion that you may not forget any time soon. You will further experience the wonderful nature around you as you enjoy an intimate hike to a marvelous viewpoint as well as bathe in a stunning waterfall. In the evening, you will continue your expedition on a unique evening safari through the luscious foliage. This time, you will search for the impressive nocturnal creatures that call Khao Yai home. Accompanied by your expert guides, you will feel completely comfortable and are bound to discover many nocturnal creatures.

dayInfo.title: Phuket – Intimate Leisure amid Surreal Scenery
dayInfo.description: With vibrant cities and splendid wilderness checked off of your travel list, it will be off to a seaside paradise on the ninth day of your trip. You will transfer back to Bangkok from Khao Yai, where you will take a brisk plane to the renowned Phuket Island. As you descend into Phuket International Airport, you will witness what makes the island so unique. Encompassing the vast coastlines are paper-white beaches and turquoise oceans, and sprawling across the landscapes are luscious forests and ornate Buddhist temples. The views are seemingly lifted straight from a postcard, capturing the tropical destination’s immense beauty. You will transfer to your luxurious villa in the Cape Panwa area. Off the beaten path, this picture-perfect location boasts unspoiled beaches with crystal clear waters. You can spend the afternoon soaking up the sun at one of these pristine palm tree-lined shores. Tonight, you will bring your evening to a splendid close with excellently-prepared seafood dishes at a revered, seaside restaurant.

dayInfo.title: Phuket – Explore a Postcard Coastline
dayInfo.description: The following day, you will explore the best secrets that Thailand has off the coast of Phuket. You will meet your knowledgeable private guide after a sumptuous breakfast, and from the comfort of a luxurious speed boat, you will set off on a riveting island hop to secluded, island destinations. With only your guide to direct you, you and your partner will indulge in complete serenity as you spend the day in each other’s company. The beaches that you visit will grant you with beautiful snorkeling opportunities. You can dip your heads into the warm waters and dive in search of the magical marine life where you may encounter a vast collection of impressive creatures as you wade past the colorful coral reefs. You will create lifelong memories of your adventurous exploits with an underwater camera before settling under the shaded palm trees and letting time slowly pass. Once you have experienced enough of the tranquil atmosphere, you can return to the shore later today for lunch at an elegant, seaside restaurant. Afterward, you will have the opportunity to completely relax on the paradise island from the comfort of your secluded beach. Ultimately, you will indulge in Thai cuisine for dinner. Your stay in Phuket will provide you with the perfect opportunity to unwind and connect as you enjoy long romantic walks on the beach and reminisce about your journey thus far.

dayInfo.title: Koh Yao Noi – A Romantic Retreat Less-Traveled
dayInfo.description: You will revel in more of the secluded island paradise the following day as you transfer to the idyllic island of Koh Yao Noi via private speed boat. This renowned destination boasts world-class resorts with remarkable ocean vistas. You will arrive at one of the most exclusive resorts on the islands and check into your luxurious villa by the sea. Set amongst the enchanting green hills, you will be completely immersed in nature at this luxury accommodation and will feel worlds away as you soak up the isolated splendor. This is the perfect final destination for your romantic tour of Thailand. You can spend your afternoon traversing the white-sand beaches or swimming in the azure oceans. The sea will be teeming with life and equipped with your snorkels, so you can discover awe-inspiring moments together. To culminate your day of true relaxation, you will indulge in a gourmet meal at the resort’s exceptional restaurant, where you will delight in deliciously prepared meals as you witness magical sunsets by candlelight.

dayInfo.title: Koh Yao Noi – Nourish Your Minds, Bodies, and Souls
dayInfo.description: The following day, you will indulge all of your senses with an endearing yoga and spa treatment. You and your partner will participate in an utterly engaging experience that will be geared towards reinvigorating your minds, bodies, and souls. Accompanied by professionals, you will brush away all stresses and lose yourselves in the ancient-inspired practices. This is an intimate opportunity for you to reminisce about your recent experiences through Thailand and celebrate your love together. The retreat will leave you refreshed and ready to make your way back home. Finally, you will enjoy one last meal that will be prepared by the revered chefs at the prestigious resort restaurant. This will round off your incredibly uplifting and intimate stay in true style before your return home, having created lifelong memories and captured magnificent moments of your unforgettable adventures.

tourName: North Thailand Adventure Tour for Couples
placesVisited: Chiang Rai, Golden Triangle, Chiang Mai
generalInfo: Northern Thailand floats on a carpet of enchantment, harmoniously blending fascinating culture, astounding nature, and absolutely unique experiences. Intimate and authentic, this North Thailand adventure is handcrafted for the adventurous couple, offering a compelling romantic luxury to compliment the omnipresent charm. A spa in the jungle, private temple ceremonies, elegant river journeys, trekking in postcard perfect wilderness...this is the land of smiles at its most atmospheric.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Rai – Elegant Relaxation
dayInfo.description: Land in Chiang Rai and soak up the panorama. Jungle clad mountains dominate the landscape, a thousand shades of green mingling amidst rugged rock and gaping valleys. Smiling locals wave hello and the quaint town blends into its natural surroundings. Welcome to Northern Thailand, a place where harmony and vibrancy combine with enthusiastic locals and elegant experiences. Your experienced driver-guide is waiting in arrivals and it’s just a short transfer to your five-star accommodation. This peaceful riverside paradise is ideal for recuperating from your international flight; soak up the elegant views from your private veranda, indulge in sumptuous gastronomic feasts, and allow the magic of Northern Thailand to slowly soak into your senses. Today enables you to explore Chiang Rai at your own pace. The guide and vehicle are at your disposal and the guide will be full of suggestions depending on your mood. Chiang Rai sparkles with authentic culture; the town is imbued with a deep sense of spirituality and ancient relics. Explore vivid local markets, weave into the mountains for stunning vistas, and experience the resplendent brilliance of Wat Rongkhun. Admire the unique kanok architecture of Wat Rong Khun and learn about the region's history at the Hill Tribe Museum. Or simply sit back and settle into the region's serene rhythm.

dayInfo.title: Golden Triangle – Exclusive Luxury Camp on the Riverside
dayInfo.description: As the sun rises, the mist clears; the Chiang Rai landscape is filled with an evocative sense of mystique. Enjoy a leisurely breakfast and then weave into the green valleys towards the Golden Triangle. Decorous scents guide you through the Doi Tung Royal Flower Garden and then the road winds towards the Mekong River. Look across the jungle valley. Over there is Myanmar. To the right is Laos. And before you is Chiang Saen, the last remains of an ancient kingdom along the irrefutable river. Relics are lost in the sand, the temple ruins standing in a wonderful sense of decay. Yet some pagodas stand revitalized and restored, proud monuments that recreate the feeling of a once powerful city. Wander through these remains and absorb the 500 year old narrative from your guide, then stop at the Opium Museum for an insightful look at the region's battle with addiction and illegal crops. The Mekong River is flanked by beauty, the jungle extending from the shore and the mountains dominating the horizon. Board a long-tail boat and gently head into the wilderness, the charms of local life ever-present along the riverside. Your destination is an exclusive retreat in the heart of untamed nature. Settle into your secluded luxury tent, the canvas exterior ensuring nature's resonant soundtrack accompanies your every moment. The interiors are like a five-star hotel, the custom wooden furnishings and huge beds carefully completing the submersion in nature. Now it's time to really relax...in one of the world's only open-air jungle spas. An indulgent 90-minute treatment is included for both of you. With the renowned therapists working on your body, you will find unrestrained Thailand luxury at its most unique.

dayInfo.title: Golden Triangle – Sailing the Mekong River
dayInfo.description: Your day will begin at the edge of the Mekong River, where you will board a traditional form of transport, a private long-tail boat. The calm waters will rush beneath lush bordering reeds. You can admire the local life by the riverside where men fish from tiny wooden canoes, women wash clothes in the shallows, and waving children seem to come at increasingly regular intervals. The scent of the grass will fill the air as you drive along the warm waters. Cruise along to the exact point where three countries meet to view the natural landscape at the Golden Triangle to find the borders of Thailand, Myanmar, and Laos. You will continue to explore a local market, where the baritone shouts of traders will accompany the aromas of limes and pineapple as you float between stalls of fresh produce. There's even time for a temple visit before you return to your luxury camp. Every romantic escape should include some memorable candlelit dinners. Tonight you walk into a jungle clearing and sit down amidst the trees with silhouettes of the forest fill the distance against the soft moonlight to create a sense of bliss. A sumptuous five-course dinner is served as nature's organic chorus accompanies this private piece of paradise.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Mai �– An Intimate Journey to Chiang Mai
dayInfo.description: Wake again to the sounds of nature and savor the last moments in this tranquil tented camp. After a short long-tail boat journey you rejoin your guide for the spectacular journey to Chiang Mai. Meander through the mountains, each corner bringing fresh vistas and ongoing beauty. There's half a dozen stops en route, each concealed from the road and lost amongst the trees. Wander through a forest clearing to the Mae Kong hot spring, visit local factories specializing in Thai silk, and admire the soothing elegance of temples hidden in the greenery. There's always picturesque brilliance along the riverside, so stop to relish the vistas and enjoy lunch. Just on the other side of Chiang Mai is the Padong Long Neck Hill Tribe village. Dazzling brass rings cover women's necks here, the gleaming metal contrasting colorful pieces of cotton that dangle from hair and arms. Girls as young as five wear the rings, this unique practice maintaining a millennia-old tribal tradition. Explore this small village and wander past the quaint wooden houses, ubiquitous children's smiles accompanying almost every turn. Then keep wandering to the nearby Mae Tang River where a cute bamboo raft floats you downstream to the waiting vehicle. You're lost in the wilderness, cruising through untamed jungle at a pace that befits the rural beauty of Northern Thailand. You'll arrive in Chiang Mai by mid-afternoon and check in to your hotel. It might be the last stop for the day, a romantic deluxe room the perfect place to relax for the evening. But your guide and vehicle are always waiting outside should you wish to explore Chiang Mai in the evening.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Mai – Serene Enchantment
dayInfo.description: Early risers are rewarded in Chiang Mai, your 6 am wake-up call bringing the city's most evocative sight. Red-robed monks wander barefoot in the dawn light, a procession of spirituality moving through the streets. Participate in this daily alms giving ceremony by placing food into the monks' bowls, then continue the spiritual slant by climbing the 309 steps of the Golden Naga staircase. You're now standing above Chaing Mai at Wat Doi Suthep, one of Thailand's most famous temples. Admire the fabulous murals and pagodas, feel the enchantment of incense filled temple rooms, and listen to the monks' soft chanting as it floats on the mountain breeze. The tour continues at Wat Umong, a mysterious temple hidden beneath moss and trees, standing in an indelible sense of decay. Slowly wander beneath the greenery and through the transcendent hallways, holding hands as you follow the incense smell to a darkened temple room. A monk waits for you, softly reciting mantras and conducting a private blessing ceremony. This unique and rare experience brings the architectural relic to life, epitomizing the blend between aesthetic exterior and hypnotic interior. Return to the Chedi Chiang Mai for lunch and a leisurely afternoon. Then an evening discovery tour unveils further enchantment; join the monks in their nightly chanting and stroll through the vivid stalls of the Waroros Market.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Mai �– Fabulous Thai Organic Cooking Course
dayInfo.description: Thai cuisine will already have made a rich impression during this trip and the secrets to its sumptuousness are revealed with today's organic cooking course. Like always, this is an exclusive experience and the two of you will be the only participants; so there's no interrupting the private reverie. Start in a local market where fresh ingredients and fragrant spices are bought. Continue to the chef's own herb garden and snip the most fragrant leaves to add panache to your culinary masterpiece. It's a hands-on cooking lesson, the renowned local chef starting with how to make your own curry paste. After you've had fun in the kitchen, settle down to your own creations and allow them to melt in your mouth. The rest of the day is at your leisure and your guide will be full of suggestions depending on your mood. Relax in the stunning surroundings of your hotel or explore further cultural relics in this fascinating city.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Mai – A Day of Natural Wonder in Doi Inthanon
dayInfo.description: Northern Thailand's landscape has revealed its intimate beauty, the last six days filled with journeys into the wilderness and through the jungle. For your final day it's time to appreciate the scale of the landscape. Drive to Doi Inthanon and it's just a short hike to the nation's highest peak. Look left and green valleys effortlessly roll beyond the horizon. Look right and it's the same view. In fact, spin around with the camera and take in the 360 degrees of natural splendor in all its vivacious glory. Dozens of hiking trails head off through the park and the two of you can decide which is best suited. Whether it's 20 minutes or two hours, expect every corner to bring more astonishing vistas and jungle clad valleys. While the itinerary is extremely flexible in Doi Inthanon National Park, there are a few enigmatic highlights that are difficult to miss. Nestled between the trees is the King Inthavitchayanont Stupa, a captivatingly unique monument lost in the jungle. Wander to the Vachiratarm Waterfall, an idyllic spot for a picnic in the wilderness. As you descend from the mountains and wind back to Chiang Mai, there's time to stop at the Doi Suthep, a hilltop temple and one of Northern Thailand's most famous. The evening is free so soak up the enchantment of Northern Thailand for one final night; your guide is always full of ideas for indulging in personal romantic revelry.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Mai – Farewell to the Land of Smiles
dayInfo.description: This morning you transfer to Chiang Mai airport for your onward flight. All facets of this itinerary are fully customizable and you may wish to extend the vacation with some tropical beach bliss on one of Thailand's renowned islands.

tourName: One-Week Bangkok History Tour
placesVisited: Bangkok, Ayutthaya, Samut Prakan
generalInfo: Thailand is an incredibly diverse country with rich cultural traditions at the core of its historical roots. Bangkok, its bustling capital, boasts many of its most significant heritage landmarks. Serving as the meeting point of charming tradition and modern sophistication, it is the perfect destination for a luxuriously enriching getaway. On this 7-day tour of the culturally enlightening destinations in and around Bangkok, you will uncover the marvelous history of this beloved country. From exquisitely authentic dishes to age-old relics of the past, you will delve into the sensory awakening tastes of Thai cuisine and explore Bangkok’s endearing historical sites.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok – All Things Traditional Thai
dayInfo.description: Your private transfer will meet you shortly after landing on the runway of Don Mueang International Airport. As you travel towards the city center, your articulate driver will highlight a few of the pivotal points of interest that you will soon enjoy the luxury of exploring. Sit back in comfort as you are acclimated to bustling Bangkok’s exuberant energy. On the way, you will witness the extensive city skyline that shows off its sophisticated design, marvelous golden temples that sparkle under the sun, and vibrant food vendors that serve wholesome Thai meals. Let the sights and sounds soak in before you arrive at your 5-star heritage hotel. The elegant hotel will boast a boutique experience that is complete with immaculately designed concept rooms. Your traditionally-inspired and private room will be the perfect place for an evening escape after each culturally immersive day. Your enlightening tour of Bangkok’s historical highlights will be in full swing shortly after check-in. You will be met by your private guide in the hotel lobby and transfer to the banks of the Chao Phraya River. As you weave your way through the busy streets, your charismatic guide will keep you thoroughly enthused with stories that pertain to significant landmarks. From the riverbanks, you will board a long-tailed boat and meander through the khlongs , which is a Thai word that means canals. As you discover the city by boat, you will encounter striking views of the surrounding area. The boat will slowly glide through the khlongs . You will witness luxurious old-world houses that are perked up on teak stilts, hovering above the water. You will also see colorfully decorated lean-tos that protrude from the riverbanks, sheltering family-run businesses. On this captivating journey, you will capture the long-established riverside lifestyle as your knowledgeable guide traces its roots. The khlongs tour will take you to Thailand’s magnificent temples. As you hop off your long-tailed boat, the towering 250-feet tall Wat Arun will welcome you. Adorned in colorful, mosaic pottery, the imposing temple will urge you to take photographs. After which, you will climb its stairs to the top of the tower. From here, you will have uninterrupted views of the city in all its glory. After a thorough exploration of the famous temple, you will journey to more of Bangkok’s coveted, Buddhist temples. Each temple with its distinct grand design epitomizes the country’s devotion to its spiritual tradition. From the last temple of the tour, you will transfer to your charming room across the Chao Phraya River. In the evening, you will transfer to an upscale restaurant for an elaborate display of traditional Thai dancing. As the resplendent performances sweep you away, you will delight in intricately prepared Thai cuisine.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok – The City’s Creative Scene
dayInfo.description: Beyond the golden temples and multi-colored, riverside abodes, Bangkok boasts many more enthralling cultural activities to fulfill your zealous wanderlust. On the second day of your trip, you will continue exploring the city’s best attractions as you uncover more of Thailand’s ancestry. You will begin your day with a delightful breakfast at your hotel before setting off on an adventure. Your private transfer will pick you up and deliver you at your first destination: the Jim Thompson House. Here, you will learn everything there is to know about the man who revived the Thai silk industry and introduced it to the world’s leading fashion houses. As you explore the decorous museum further, your appreciation for Thai design will grow tenfold. The majesty of the museum is in its unique blend of Southeast Asian and Western design. Pushing new design and architectural boundaries, the House exquisitely highlights the endearing traditional influence while narrating Thompson's gripping story. From the House, you will continue your tour with trips to more notable museums. The tour will impart valuable insight into traditional Thai culture, and you will view ancient artifacts along the way. After visiting these leading landmarks, you will venture out for lunch, and spend the late morning eagerly dining on authentic Thai meals that are served with sophisticated flair. After lunch, you will transfer to Bangkok’s blooming creative district for captivating displays of modern art. The location is home to the city’s youthful art renaissance. With new exhibits popping up frequently, the thriving hub of creativity is a must-visit destination that will offer never-before-seen experiences. The zestful area will invigorate your day, and after exploring it fully, you will make your way to the city’s most prestigious art galleries. On this artistic appreciation tour, you will view riveting pieces by the country’s most reputable names, and enjoy elegant cocktails while socializing with other art aficionados before making your way to a Michelin-Starred restaurant to round off the fashionable day. Here, you will delve into the culinary expertise of Thailand’s most revered chefs who will awaken all of your senses.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok – The History of Thai Cuisine
dayInfo.description: Thailand’s diverse culture is heartily represented by its exotic cuisine. Both reputable chefs and family-run business owners masterfully craft their dishes through the combination of age-old tradition and meticulous attention to detail. For these reasons, it is no surprise that the country is widely renowned for its delectable dishes. Throughout your tour of Bangkok, you will discover the tantalizing tastes that Thailand has to offer. However, your third day will be entirely dedicated to the wonderful dishes that draw millions of travelers here year-round. In the morning, after enjoying a light snack at your hotel, you will transfer to the heart of the city’s extensive food and beverage scene. Your private tour guide will take you to must-visit districts, which proudly embody authentic Thai culture through the creation of traditional meals. The immersive tour will not simply end with a few tastes of each dish. On your adventure, you will meet some of Bangkok’s recognized local cooks and award-winning chefs. From high-end restaurants to jam-packed vendors, you will delight in this behind-the-scenes tour of the city’s remarkably delicious courses. Some of the key standout dishes, only scratching the surface of what awaits, including Chicken Satay and Kao-Na-Ped . You will enjoy each dish worry-free as you skip the reservations and queues for a one-of-a-kind cultural food tour. After the exquisite experience, you will transfer back to your hotel for an hour or so at leisure. Later today, you will visit a traditional floating market where you will hop on and off your long-tailed boat, to view the vendors’ treasures as you cruise through the traditional canal market. In the evening, you will soak up the picturesque scenes and enjoy dinner by moonlight as you glide across the calm waters of the Chao Phraya River. From your hotel, you will transfer to the nearby pier and board one of Bangkok’s premier river cruises. The multiple-course gourmet meal that will be served to you on this elegant excursion will be one for the books. The delicate touch of the candlelit dinner, paired with immaculately curated cuisine, will culminate into one of the most captivating eating experiences. After you cannot eat or drink anymore, you will make your way back to your room for a peaceful night.

dayInfo.title: Ayutthaya – Relics of the Past
dayInfo.description: With Bangkok’s key cultural highlights checked off of your list, the following two days will transfer you away from the bustling city for a greater look into Thai heritage. Some of the country’s most significant historical landmarks can be found a few hours from your hotel. Thus, you will rise early on your fourth day for a scenic train trip to the ancient city of Ayutthaya. After picking up light snacks, your private transfer will deliver you to the city train station where you will board for the picture-perfect journey. Accompanied by other eager travelers, you will slowly venture through the surrounding Bangkok settings while sharing stories along the way. From the cabin windows, you will capture images of the far-reaching rice paddies, pineapple plantations, and sugarcane fields. As you approach Ayutthaya, you will bear witness to the famous River Kwai in all its glory. Gently flowing downstream and surrounded by lush greenery, the river will be a truly serene sight to take in. After arriving in Ayutthaya, you will transfer to a boutique, riverside hotel with impeccable views. Its Siam -inspired design will transport you back in time, and its world-class amenities will ensure that your stay is most comfortable. Shortly after check-in, you will journey to the Ayutthaya Historical Park. Ayutthaya, which is an ancient Thai city that was captured during the Thai-Burmese War, is home to some of the country’s oldest and most revered temples and relics. In the historical park, you will discover the ruins of these temples and remnants of the old-world city. An in-depth discovery of these famous sights will offer a cultural experience that is rarely rivaled, and you will be humbled by the ancient ambiance that is still firmly represented by the ruined city. Your trip will be highlighted by the exploration of the ruins of the magnificent temples, untouched Wats , and revived palaces. After the immersive journey, you will transfer to the remainder of the city’s significant landmarks. A trip to these opulent palaces and national museums will yield further insight into ancient Thai culture. Later today, you will return to your hotel before transferring to a luxurious restaurant on the river. With the sun slowly yielding to the night and sweeping views of the surrounding city, you will marvel at the authentic atmosphere of the city. A delightful dining experience will bring this day to a perfect end.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok – Regal River Cruise to Bangkok
dayInfo.description: The Chao Phraya flows from Ayutthaya through Bangkok, making it the perfect alternative route back to the city. After a delicious breakfast at your hotel, you will check-out of your boutique room and transfer to the nearby pier where you will board a luxury cruise. The first-class cruise will be complete with rooms to rest, patio loungers to relax and unwind, and a dining area to delight in Afternoon tea or snacks. All of this will be set inside an exquisitely restored old-world barge. On this regal journey, you will encounter breathtaking sights of the scenic surroundings. Birds will sing from trees on the shoreline, and animals will rustle through the shrubs as you slowly cruise downstream with uninterrupted views of Bangkok. You will arrive this afternoon and transfer to an exquisite hotel along the Chao Phraya River. From your balcony, you will have private access to the best riverside views of the cityscape. After check-in, you will leisurely enjoy the rest of your afternoon. You can lounge in luxury by the pool or make yourself cozy in your 5-star room. Later this evening, you will transfer to an upper-end night market for a culturally classy evening. A traditional tuk-tuk will deliver you to your destination where you will enjoy the lively nightlife of Bangkok. You will stroll through the seemingly endless stretches of stalls and browse the stylish goods and treasures that are available. The eccentric market will offer a taste of tradition with a sophisticated flair, making it the perfect stop to shop for keepsakes. After a fancy meal at the market, you will transfer to a truly unique Thai experience that is essential for your cultural tour: a Cabaret Show. At one of Bangkok’s premier Cabaret’s, you will be wowed by spirited performances that will be expressed in colorful fashion. The wonderful show will keep you thoroughly enthused throughout and bring your flamboyant evening to a close.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok – An Old-World on the Outskirts
dayInfo.description: While Ayutthaya is a pivotal ancient city destination far from the city, Samut Prakan is a must-visit historical city that is located on the outskirts of Bangkok. On your final full day in Thailand, you will journey to the 320-acre gardens and capture the country’s age-old preservations. Visiting many of its extensive highlights, you will celebrate the opportunity to dive into Thailand’s heritage and tradition. Witnessing traditional art, architecture, temples, markets, and pavilions will fill you with wonder. Your private tour guide will ensure that you do not miss out on any significant landmarks on this final day exploring Thai culture. In the afternoon, you will transfer back to your hotel to pack up your belongings and unwind. In the evening, you will visit one of Bangkok’s world-class rooftop bars for one last panoramic view of the city. You will capture the magnificent moments while tucking into elegant cocktails and cuisine. After which, you will head back to your hotel for a secluded night near the river.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok – Breakfast by the River
dayInfo.description: With first-hand experience of Thailand’s rich culture, you will wake with feelings of great admiration for the diverse country. Before you bid your final adieus, you will journey to an enchanting cafe along the Chao Phraya River. Here, you will escape the Bangkok rush and let your morning slowly pass by. While tucking into a tasty breakfast, you can spend your leisurely time reminiscing about this enriching week abroad. Later this morning, you will return to your hotel to collect your belongings and meet your private transfer. You will make your way to Don Mueang International Airport and indulge in the scenic surroundings one last time. Shortly after, you will arrive at the airport and board your departure for home. Soar into the sky with unforgettable memories that you will share forever.

tourName: Romance in Siam: One-Week Thailand Getaway for Couples
placesVisited: Chiang Mai, Old City, Elephant Jungle Sanctuary, Krabi, Koh Lanta, Lanta Old Town, Koh Samui, Railay
generalInfo: Welcome to an indulgent seven days in Thailand, where intimate cultural encounters will blur into white-sand escapism and spaces made just for two. Handcrafted for couples, this private tour mixes Thailand’s tropical promise with an authentic Chiang Mai experience. Think elephants and getting blessed by monks, and then five days of empty beaches and exotic waters where there is the privacy you need for romance to flourish.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Mai – An Indulgent Spa and a Charming City of Old Laneways
dayInfo.description: Take a window seat as you fly into Chiang Mai. Jungles cascade across rolling hills and the odd granite peaks tower above fields of green. Rice paddies line low-lying slopes, which are ferociously green for eight months of the year. If you land in Bangkok, it is hard to see much of the smog. Chiang Mai is cut adrift from the bustling city life; it was cut off from the rest of Siam until the 1920s, which means its culture has survived invasions from the Burmese, among others. When you touch down it will seem like you are in a small town, as you will experience a handful of quiet streets nestled beside a shady canopy of trees. Chiang Mai is much larger than it initially seems, however, you will probably only see the interesting old neighborhoods and a tranquil areas along the river. After a long flight, this is an ideal place to land. You will be greeted at the airport and then transferred to a hotel on the riverbank, which is a five-star retreat that is hidden away from the rest of the population. Check in to the suite and relax. You may also wander to the on-site spa and settle into a one-hour couple’s treatment, which has an array of packages to choose from. Chiang Mai is Thailand’s spa hub, and there is a variety of traditional and contemporary treatments, as well as Thai fusion options. You will continue to relax around the pool and in the suite, perhaps just laying back on the balcony as the river curves before your eyes. Chiang Mai is considered Thailand’s cultural hub as well. In reality, Bangkok has just as much to see, but other destinations must contest the claim. The attraction in Chiang Mai is how easy it is to experience this culture. It is an old walled city with pedestrianized streets that lead to night markets and ruined temples. This is a city where you will walk through the culture rather than drive to isolated attractions. Such a way of exploration will really help you feel immersed in the Thai culture, from a spiritual history to an enthusiastic way of life that continues to be based on traditions. You will find old Chiang Mai is a beautiful place to get lost while walking hand in hand.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Mai – Elephants and Monasteries
dayInfo.description: Deep in the jungle, a giant stirs and a trombone sounds. Finally, trunk-swinging elephants explode from the trees. It is a giant more than twice your height and many times your combined weight. Yet, the elephants here are incredibly timid and peaceful. They live a slow, relaxed life and have a long connection with their mahout (elephant driver). Later, you will meet with the mahout and learn a handful of signals to be used when you are aboard the pachyderm. Greet your elephant and ride into the jungle that both of you will ride. It is a safe and intimate connection, as the elephant will effortlessly carry your weight. From this vantage point, you will enjoy views into the jungle where monkeys and gibbons swing about the canopies. You will stay on the elephant as it trods into the water and playfully squirts water aimlessly. Bath-time is always cause for excitement and enthusiasm as this is one of the most intimate experiences you will have with these magnificent creatures. Then, on your way back to base you will stop at a small waterfall for a romantic couple’s picnic deep in the trees. After most of the day in the jungle, you will visit a monastery late in the afternoon. Incense tends to linger, as the aroma will then entice you into a simple room. As you enter, you will notice incredible details that are illuminated by candles and lanterns. There is a pervasive silence here - one that continues even when temple bells are ringing. Here, a monk will greet you. Sitting cross-legged in front of him, you will receive a couple’s blessing; regardless of your religious beliefs, this is always an interesting and eye-opening experience. The evening will be left free, so you can head out into Chiang Mai or visit the popular daily night market that is found on different streets throughout the week.

dayInfo.title: Railay – An Exquisite, Cut-Off Beach in the Andaman Sea
dayInfo.description: A different world awaits in Railay. Railay is home to palm trees and vertical cliffs where white beaches hide and become cut off at high tide. Getting here is simple. You will fly directly to Krabi before you will be transferred privately by car and boat to a resort that feels impossibly opulent. You will be staying at one of Thailand’s ultimate beach retreats, which is a retreat that is far enough away from the popularity of Railay’s main beach for some romantic seclusion. Tucked away here, you will have everything you need: just the two of you, a sublime setting, all the modern amenities, yet none of the crowds. So, check in, indulge, and relax. Here, you may descend steep steps to the mostly private beach, find personal viewpoints along the cliffs and between the trees, and relax in your room with endless Andaman Sea views from the patio.

dayInfo.title: Railay – Relaxed Beach Day Plus Jungle Viewpoints and a Lagoon
dayInfo.description: With two days in Railay, you can really drift away. You may wake up late, order breakfast to the room, take a barefooted stroll to the beach, and dip into calm turquoise waters. You have gone from experiencing the culture to walking along the beach, and it is time to indulge in Thailand’s classical offering. Most couples that stay here choose to do nothing. There is no need to search for activities when so much is on your doorstep: white-sand beaches, thick jungles, tropical waters, and a feeling of privacy that you will not even be able to get at home. All meals will be included in your package, and these can be ordered to the room with a wide-ranging menu to pick from. If you can sacrifice an hour of lounging around, there are beautiful and secluded places to go and to see. You can strap on a decent pair of cross trainers and hike up to a viewpoint where there are stunning views over Railay and nearby Krabi. If you climb down the other side, a lagoon awaits, and its waters are a soft turquoise hue. Local food stalls litter the lagoon entrance that specializes in condensed milk pancakes. You can also book locally-guided activities on land and water that are arranged easily at the resort on the day you would like to go, so there is no need to book ahead and reserve a spot. When it is a romantic retreat like this, there is no need to plan too much, especially when the atmosphere is so tranquil and serene.

dayInfo.title: Railay – Old Town Magic and Island indulgence
dayInfo.description: The journey to Koh Lanta is part of your Thai experience. Whizz across the Andaman by speedboat while vivid tropical colors extend in every direction. In Railay, you were tucked away from the world, and Koh Lanta is more about exploring an island and experiencing new places. You will be greeted at the port and head to a small boutique cafe for coffee, perhaps a cake, or even lunch. The guide will introduce you to the island and the experiences that can be had there. You can plan a day that is as active or a relaxed as you like. Stroll around Lanta Old Town in the South, where you will follow the sea breeze to street-side restaurants and charming old architecture. You may wander among old fishing houses that are built out of sticks that jut out into the Andaman. Most couples like to spend the afternoon on the island’s beaches, and there are plenty to choose from. Some are lively, especially geared for sunset cocktails and dancing with your feet in the sand, while others are more escapist driven, which specializes in getting away from the world. With your own private guide, you will be able to customize the day, including a dinnertime restaurant before retiring to your resort.

dayInfo.title: Koh Samui – Doing Nothing At All
dayInfo.description: This morning, you will head out by speedboat to a famous island. Koh Samui was the first Thai island to really grasp international attention, and it has become one of the country’s most popular destinations for backpackers, couples, families, divers, and just about every other possible visitor. Fortunately, the island is large enough to absorb them all. Over the last two decades, Koh Samui has developed specific enclaves that are popular dependent on who you are. It is on the quietest side of the island where you will find the smaller, boutique resorts, as well as those more suitable for couples. From Krabi, there is a direct flight to Koh Samui. From here it is a 45-minute transfer to the resort. Check in, check out the view, remove your shoes, and forget about the world. From the room, you will walk barefoot on to the beach, where the white sand twinkles beneath the sun. There is snorkeling available right from the beach, as well as more adventurous snorkeling by boat. Palm trees provide shade even during the sunniest of days so you can rest up on the sand or choose the privacy of your personal terrace. The beach is not private per se, but it is cut off from the road and difficult to reach unless you are staying at the resort. All meals will be included in your package, and there will be flexibility over when and where you would like to dine. This could be on the beach, beneath the stars, surrounded by lanterns on your terrace, in one of the restaurants, or another romantic spot that you and your partner have developed an affinity for. These two days are left completely free, and most couples staying at the resort do not go further than the beach. You can walk nearby jungle trails without a guide, or you can book something locally, such as a jungle safari tour, visits to mountain farms and waterfalls, or the crimson temple of Wat Sila Ngu, which stands directly on the cliffs above the ocean. It is all up to you, and Koh Samui is the sort of place where you never feel guilty about spending a long time doing nothing: this is what a romantic vacation is all about.

dayInfo.title: Koh Samui – Departure
dayInfo.description: Koh Samui’s beauty is only matched by its convenience. The island’s airport is international and makes for an easy departure, so enjoy some final beach and relaxation time before the airport transfer.

tourName: Romantic Bangkok Getaway for Couples
placesVisited: Bangkok, Hua Hin, Kanchanaburi, Samut Songkhram
generalInfo: Thailand’s most sought-after destination, Bangkok, is a bustling city that offers unforgettable experiences, which are best enjoyed with those closest to you. Displaying a truly unique blend of traditional authenticity and modern sophistication, it is the idyllic location for adventurous couples wishing for a luxurious and romantic getaway. On this 12-day journey of Bangkok, you and your partner will make lifelong memories as you bask in the romance of the city’s most endearing attractions and intimate locations. If you are planning a special honeymoon, commemorating a relationship milestone, or seeking passionate time away together, this customizable trip is perfectly tailored for you.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok – An Idyllic Arrival
dayInfo.description: As you and your partner approach Bangkok Airport’s runway and peer out of the plane’s windows, you will witness the bustling capital of Thailand in all its glory. The cityscape will exude opulence with towering skyscrapers that reach up to the clouds. The streets will be as vibrant as ever with streams of people that are eagerly shopping colorful markets and dining at authentic food vendors. The traditional temples are eye-catching spiritual landmarks with their golden forms that majestically shimmer under the sun. You two will soon explore these significant sights, and more, on this romantic and luxurious stay in and around Bangkok. You will meet your cheerful private transfer upon touching down in the Land of Smiles. You will journey to your Bangkok home, which will be a lavish 5-star hotel in the heart of the city. From your private balcony, you will have panoramic views of the city and a cozy escape to retreat to after the adventurous days. You can spend the afternoon acclimating yourselves to the bustling Bangkok energy before you make your way to one of the city’s leading, local restaurants. You will enjoy a gourmet dinner with a view as you witness the sun slowly dip down behind the cityscape and bring the idyllic day to a close.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok – The Country's Rich Culture
dayInfo.description: With so many appealing attractions to explore, your second day in Bangkok will be designed to give you and your partner a completely immersive cultural experience. You will wake feeling refreshed after a peaceful night's rest, eager to spend the day together discovering Thailand’s rich heritage. You will enjoy an exquisite breakfast by the pool before hopping in your private transfer and jetting off for an adventure. On this day, you will awaken with a deep admiration for the country’s culture. Visits to the pivotal points of interest around the city will be utterly inspiring. The Jim Thompson House, a commemoration to an American man who re-established the Thai silk industry and introduced it to the leading European fashion houses, represents the pinnacle of Western-influenced, Southeast Asian design. After this, you will discover an immense collection of ancient artifacts and art at Thailand’s original national museum. Then, you will delve into the modern Southeast Asian art scene with a tour of Bangkok’s finest contemporary art museum. Each captivating location will offer a unique experience in which you and your partner will truly delight. In the evening, you will be whisked into the sky for fine-dining at one of Bangkok’s premier rooftop bars. Here, you can tuck into exceptional Thai cuisine and sip away on elegant cocktails while you appreciate the sweeping 360-degree view of the city.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok – Old-World Charm
dayInfo.description: On your third day, you will awaken your senses with a beautifully prepared breakfast at a prime café that is located on the Chao Phraya River banks. This charming start to the morning will give you and your partner time to connect and reminisce about the adventures that you have had and those that are yet to come. After the delicious breakfast spread, you will head back to your hotel to meet your private walking temple tour guide. Today, you will visit the awe-inspiring age-old temples of Thailand and learn more about the country’s extraordinary history. You will stroll through the streets of Bangkok, passing many multi-colored markets along the way. Some of them will release tantalizing aromas into the air, drawing hungry travelers to their stalls, while others will boast an assortment of intricate trinkets and alluring gems. You will encounter smiling faces with each turn of your heads at these spirited markets. You will continue your walk until you reach one of the most significant temples in Thailand. Shortly after arriving at Wat Pho, your first destination, you will marvel at the majesty of its 150 foot golden Reclining Buddha. After this, you will visit more magnificent temples that each have their own distinct design and striking presence. You will transfer back to your hotel before connecting with Bangkok’s luxurious Chao Phraya River cruise. You will spend the evening gliding along the river, viewing Bangkok by boat. As you do, you will enjoy a multiple-course haute cuisine meal by candlelight. As the sun fades and the moon shines, this fine-dining river cruise will epitomize romance in Bangkok.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok – The Endearing Outdoors
dayInfo.description: There are many ways to see Bangkok, but one of the most endearing for couples is by bicycle. Rather than maneuvering around the busy city, you will transfer to Bang Krachaofor a romantic escape to the lush, urban oasis. Full of incredible wildlife and cocooned by stunning plant life, the artificial island will seemingly transport you out of the city and into a rainforest setting. Together, you will delight in scenic rides along the winding trails, feed fishes in the ponds, and round off the picture-perfect morning with a light picnic in the green forest. Before returning to your hotel, you will transfer to a beautiful Bangkok treehouse near Bang Krachao for an afternoon cocktail and snack amongst the thick foliage. Then, you will journey back to your room to relax and lounge around the pool. In the evening, you will visit a remarkable restaurant in the city for a Michelin Star meal. The award-winning chef and his experienced team will prepare one of the most elegant and exquisite dishes you have yet to experience. The luxuriously intimate dining experience will end off a picturesque day within nature.

dayInfo.title: Hua Hin – An Intimate Retreat
dayInfo.description: On the fifth day of your trip, you will make your way out of the city and travel to the fashionable seaside town, Hua Hin. The diverse destination will be a surreal blend of cosmopolitan and tropical living, and it will boast an array of lively markets that sell divine, freshly caught seafood in addition to a beautiful stretch of white sand beach where you will soak up the sun in style. Upon arrival, you will check-in to your exquisite suite that overlooks the ocean. The turquoise sea will welcome you with warm waters if you wish to take a quick dip. Shortly thereafter, you will transfer to a premier wellness resort. Here, you and your partner will be spoiled with an assortment of spa treatments of your choosing. This day will be dedicated to refreshing your minds and bodies through carefully curated, holistic health therapies. Enjoying it together will be all the more rewarding. Later this day, you will return to your hotel for an afternoon under the sun, and venture to a vibrant night market for authentic Thai dinner after witnessing the stunning seaside sunset.

dayInfo.title: Hua Hin – Captivating Coral Reefs
dayInfo.description: Rarely do couples get to experience exquisite island-style living when visiting Bangkok. However, from Hua Hin, you and your loved one will have the incredible opportunity to visit the wonderful island of Koh Talu. After breakfast, you will transfer to the island via a short speedboat trip. You can let your hair down in the wind as you are whisked away to paradise for the day. Koh Talu is renowned for its crystal-clear waters, which give swimmers an uninterrupted view of the brightly illuminated coral reefs. After arriving, you will dive into one of Thailand’s most pristine snorkeling experiences where you will have the opportunity to view all sorts of wondrous sea life as you wade through the warm, turquoise waters. You will return to the uncrowded shores for an intimate lunch on the island. Here, you will capture unforgettable memories and stunning scenic views. Later today, you will transfer to your hotel in Hua Hin for one last enchanting seaside supper and sunset.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok – Afternoon Tea in Style
dayInfo.description: The unique tropical getaway will leave you two feeling refreshed and ready to discover more of Bangkok. On day seven, your private transfer will take you to the city where you will check-in to a 5-star hotel on the banks of the Chao Phraya River. The luxurious and comfortable suite will offer unparalleled views of your surroundings. This day, you will appreciate an admirable Afternoon tea at Bangkok’s elite hotel. Here, at the turn-of-the-century style lounge, which has hosted prominent celebrities and dignitaries, you and your partner will spend a few hours in complete bliss. The selection of delightful, traditional teas and treats that are accompanied by the lounge’s period charm will keep you thoroughly enthused. After the fabulous tea, you will return to your hotel for an evening at your leisure. You can enjoy fine dining at award-winning restaurants nearby or visit an authentic market for traditional Thai cuisine before a rewarding sleep.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok – Indulge All of Your Senses
dayInfo.description: Thailand is exceptionally well known for its incredible cuisine. Years of tradition and meticulous attention to detail will culminate in masterfully crafted Thai dishes, which entice each of the five taste categories. On the eighth day of your trip, you will further your knowledge about their authentic meals and try your hands at preparing a few famous dishes. You will begin the day with a street food tour, and you will have no doubt relished in the gourmet dining experiences, but street food is as authentic as it gets in Bangkok. These meals will be age-old recipes that highlight the distinct craft of traditional Thai cuisine. On this tour, every sense will be invigorated as you taste your way through Thailand. After the mouthwatering journey, you will venture to one of Bangkok’s prestigious culinary schools. Hosted by experienced chefs and set inside a stylishly designed building, this intimate cooking class will uncover the secrets behind a few of Thailand’s most coveted meals. After fine-tuning your culinary expertise, you will make your way to an animal cafe. Popularized in the Southeast, animal cafes allow patrons to play with all sorts of spirited creatures as you sip on your beverages. Bangkok boasts an array of exciting animal cafes, each with its own species specialty. Whether you wish to meet huskies, bunnies, cats, or foxes, the animal cafes will add a joyous touch to your memorable trip.

dayInfo.title: Kanchanaburi – Whisked Away to Paradise
dayInfo.description: On day nine of your trip, you will check-out of your hotel on the Chao Phraya River and meet your private transfer who will take you to the train station in Bangkok. Here, you will board the train and make your way through the scenic Bangkok surroundings on your way to the popular destination, Kanchanaburi. The ride will be comfortable, and from your cabin, you will have picturesque views of the rice paddies, sugar cane fields, and pineapple plantations. You can snap up the idyllic moments as you approach your stop. You will transfer to an immaculate hotel that is situated along the bends of the River Kwai. The luxurious hotel features intimate rooms that float above the water. Surrounded by the lush greenery of the river banks, you will relax in style with only the sounds of nature around you. You will dine on exquisite dishes in the evening before unwinding in your private room or soaking up the setting from your riverside balcony. You will be enchanted by the beautiful, romantic views from this incredibly comfortable location.

dayInfo.title: Kanchanaburi – Discovering Mon Culture
dayInfo.description: There is a wealth of history to discover in the Kanchanaburi area. On this day, you will transfer to the destinations with the most significant points of interest where you will gain in-depth insight into Thailand’s wartime past. You will venture to an intriguing war cemetery and museum before exploring the famous Death Railway. The immersive trip will instill feelings of sincere gratitude within you. In the afternoon, you will explore Thailand’s Mon culture with a tugboat trip to a local tribe village where you will gain an introspective understanding of the lives of rural Thai villagers as you witness traditional dance ceremonies and timeless cultural practices. You will return to your hotel later today for an exceptional Thai meal under the setting sun.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok – Markets like No Other
dayInfo.description: You will transfer back to Bangkok via train after a romantic getaway on the River Kwai and a riveting exploration of traditional Thailand. You will arrive at the hotel where your journey began in the heart of the city of Bangkok. Now familiar with bustling Bangkok, you will have found your bearings. Today, you will experience one last significant adventure before you depart for home. After check-in, you will meet your private transfer and journey to Samut Songkhram. Here, just over an hour from Bangkok, you will visit the Maeklong Railway Market and a nearby floating market. The famous railway market is an incredibly unique experience in which vendors position their stalls right on the train tracks. As the train approaches, the vendors will quickly move their stalls out of its way, and after it passes, they reposition their awnings. It will be a riveting thing to watch and one that you two will truly enjoy. After browsing the rich selection of products and enjoying local eats, you will transfer to a floating market that is just a few minutes away. You can hop on a long-tailed boat and glide along the canals as you jump off to view odds and ends that the locals offer. After experiencing the rush of these diverse markets, you will transfer back to Bangkok where you will enjoy one last divine gourmet meal by moonlight as you look out over the city from the great heights of an exclusive rooftop bar.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok – One Last Day
dayInfo.description: Once you rise from bed after a peaceful night’s sleep, you will wish that you had a few more nights in this exuberant city. Looking back at the luxurious and romantic Thai getaway, you will delight in the beautiful moments that you have shared and yearn for an extension to your trip. Sit back comfortably as you enjoy an intimate breakfast with one another, taking in the views of the enchanting cityscape. You will return to your room and pack your things before checking out and meeting your private transfer in the lobby. Finally, you will fly off into the sky with spectacular memories that you will never forget.

tourName: Siam History & Culture: Seven-Day Thailand Itinerary
placesVisited: Bangkok, Ratchaburi, Ayutthaya, Viharn Phra Mongkol Bopit, Wat Arun, Sukhothai, Phrae, Baan Pratubjai, Ban Tung Hong, Phae Muang Phee, Chiang Rai, Sop Ruak, Mae Salong, Chiang Dao, Chiang Mai
generalInfo: Thailand’s history is both surreal and sublime. It is a tale of ruined cities, extravagant tastes, inspiring temples, and unforgotten stories. You can journey to the heart of this history and culture with evocative days in Thailand, which includes Bangkok, Sukhothai, the Golden Triangle, Chiang Rai, and Chiang Mai. You can expect personal connections and a keen sense of former times.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok – Long-Tail Boating on the Back Canals
dayInfo.description: Bangkok can initially appear as an overbearing metropolitan area. Thick glass towers, bustling streets, and seemingly endless traffic. However, beneath the surface, there is a legendary city to find that unfolds around canals and ornate temples. After an airport transfer, you will check into a hotel along the river. After some time to refresh, you will set off towards Ratchaburi, which is located on the west end of the city. You will switch to a private long-tail boat and snake into winding canals. Small bamboo houses will line the water as boats chug tenderly towards the market. Many of the long-tail boats are punted or paddled, especially as you get deeper into the canals. Some of these are not just modes of transport, but also market stalls that are thickly laden with piles of bananas, pineapples, oranges, ropes, cooking bowls, Buddha images, motorcycle tires, and just about everything you can imagine. You can grab a snack or fresh coconut juice from one of them, or haggle with traders in wooden canoes that will be overstocked with tropical fruit. A floating market that is as old as anyone can remember is an exotic introduction to Thailand’s culture. From here, you will twist slowly back towards Bangkok, using the back canals to explore life along the water. There is contemporary energy and vitality, yet history remains omnipresent as shown by the small temples that dot the banks. As you get closer to the hotel, you will stop at Wat Arun, the towering Temple of the Dawn, where incense swirls and bells are often chiming. You will be back at the hotel before sundown and the evening is left free, which is an opportunity to try one the city’s superb fine dining restaurants, or for a chance to experience a night market and street food.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok – Exploring the Fabulous Ruins of Ayutthaya
dayInfo.description: Wat Chai Wattanaram still peeks amid the jungle and is about 100 feet high and reflective of an old Khmer style. Wat Phra Si Sanphet is bell-shaped and is the iconic image of a city that was the capital of Siam for many centuries. A Buddha’s head tangles with tree roots at Way Phra Mahathat as it mysteriously folds into nature. This is Ayutthaya, a grand old capital that was left in ruins for almost two centuries. It is being slowly restored, and its current state is a mixture between old grandeur and evocative ruin. Of all the history in Thailand, this is where you will find the longest chapter of stories, as told by your private guide. It will take an hour to reach the historical city, and you will spend the morning amid its mostly picturesque remains, temples, and streets. After lunch, you will explore Bang Pa-In, which is an eclectic neighborhood of the royals, where traditional Thai architecture mixes with Chinese and European Gothic styles. It is an almost bizarre congruence, especially at the Summer Palace. It is always relaxing, and you will be traveling by boat between the well-preserved regal landmarks. This is a full-day trip, and you will return to Bangkok late in the afternoon. The guide will also offer personal recommendations on the city’s culinary scene.

dayInfo.title: Sukhothai – Best of Two Contrasting Capitals
dayInfo.description: Bangkok’s highlights are best explored during the morning while the temperature is cooler, and there are fewer people on the streets. Like in Wat Pho, you will see the statue showing Buddha entering nirvana. Then at Wat Phra Kaew, Thailand’s holiest site, you can see the Emerald Buddha. Opulence dominates the Grand Palace, a structure that is distinct from any palace you would encounter in Europe. Its striking architecture is complemented by oriental interiors that are decorated with dragons, mirrors, jewels and gold leaf. This afternoon, hop on a quick flight to Sukhothai. You will always need two visits to the Sukhothai historical park. Here, temples and landmarks stretch across a large area, from small peaks to dusty tree-dappled plains. Doing it all in one long day can be tiring, especially given the heat you may encounter from 11 am to 2 pm. Instead, you can head into Sukhothai during the beautiful late-afternoon hours, where temples glow golden, and the sunset turns early Siam into a hazy orange hue. Small chedi dot the plains, which are Thai-style stupas that flank many of the temples. Check out half the uninhabited city, and then head to Wat Saphan Hin, which is a glorious temple that rests on a small peak. From here, the views showcase Sukhothai’s scale and former beauty, and there is no better place to watch the sunset.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Rai – Ornate Temples and Serene Forest
dayInfo.description: You will want an early start today. Sukhothai is blissful at sunrise, and there is half a city you are yet to uncover. The guide will provide historical tales to accompany the redolently-cast ruins. After a second breakfast, this busy day will continue with a short drive to Phrae. Here, temples stand amid lush rice paddies, and monks wander barefoot and go about their daily rituals. Wat Luang is the oldest and most impressive site, dating to a time of Phrae’s foundations. As the midday heat arrives, you will be tucked up in Baan Pratubjai, which is an extravagant house carved from teak and will provide an example of Phrae’s eclectic history. From Phrae, it’s around 3 ½ hours-drive to Chiang Rai. The road winds at first, and then head into forested mountains and the strange rock formations of Phae Muang Phee. Carved by wind and rain, the rocks appear like mushrooms, pillars, and symbols of natural history. Chiang Rai is a city of tradition that has not been altered by the tourism boom in Thailand. Its night market is a wonderful place to hang out with aromatic food stalls, live dance performances, and the social atmosphere of a city that loves to socialize. Just how Southern Europeans like to gather on central squares, the people of Chiang Rai meet on their own public square to eat, drink and dance the night away.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Rai – Villages and Hill Tribes Around the Golden Triangle
dayInfo.description: Cultures collide in the Golden Triangle, yet they also stay distinct. This is the region where Thailand meets Myanmar and Laos. At Wat Phra That Phu Khao Temple, you can gaze into all three of these kingdoms, just as people have done for over a thousand years. As you travel far down below and along the river, you will then get to experience Sop Ruak, which is the true place that the three nations come together. There is a frontier feel and, in each direction, there is a completely distinct vista. You can cross the border into Laos and experience what a market is like on the Laos side of the border, and then check out the curious village of Mae Salong. Other hill tribes dot these hills, and you can spend an afternoon with two of them. The Kayan are the most numerous, who famous for their long-necked women. You will need an excellent guide and community host to understand their culture, especially if you wish to experience more than a few photos. Later, compare the Kayan’s rather extravagant style to the less showy style of a different tribe. As with other days on this tour, you will see how old traditions are being proudly kept alive and turned into vestiges of culture that is then passed through many generations.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Mai – The White Temple, Sacred Caves and Pre-Eminent Thai Spirituality
dayInfo.description: Onwards you will travel through Northern Thailand, connecting the old with the new, and always having an eye on tradition. Just outside Chiang Rai lies the White Temple, a fantastic art piece designed by Chalermchai Kositpipat. Super heroes are painted on the temple wall, which is part of an allegory to religion in a changing time. A dazzling white bridge will take you there, and then you will wander through a gallery of rich art works. A sacred cave can be found here, and it is very atmospheric and alluring as it extends into a mountain. You can imagine people worshipping thousands of years ago, or perhaps you may even see people worshipping within the gloomy space. It’s 2 ½ hours by road to Chiang Mai, although the journey takes most of the day. There are many rural hill tribe villages to be seen along the way, and the guide will customize the trip to your interests, stopping at villages and cultures that are of most personal interest. You will check into Chiang Mai and head straight to northern Thailand’s most important temple, Wat Phra That Doi Suthep. As bells ring and prayer wheels turn, you will get lost in the spiritual ambiance. The views are exceptional from this mountaintop temple, but it is the energy you remember, so many local believers turn Wat Phra That Doi Suthep into a very moving and emotional place to be.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Mai – Historical Highlights of Chiang Mai and Departure
dayInfo.description: Chiang Mai has a well-connected international airport so you will not need to retrace your steps back to Bangkok. Instead, you will have most of today to explore a city that was cut off from the rest of Siam until the 1920s. The city remains behind walls, even if these walls are aged and cracked. Once inside, there is little traffic. It is a low-slung city, dotted with small temples and interesting back lanes. With a guide this is a place of stories, and just like every day on this seven-day Thailand tour, the stories make the destination come alive. Late check-out will be arranged, so after a day of exploring you can freshen up before departing.

tourName: Siam Past & Present: Best of Northern Thailand Tour
placesVisited: Chiang Mai, Sukhothai, Bangkok
generalInfo: Amid the rice paddies and the elephant-studded jungle, northern Thailand is a region of cultural treasures and evocative tales. You will be in a land of mystique, where monks wander the streets and ancient ruins stretch across dusty plains. In this part of the world, you are immersed in the culture, as exemplified on this 7-day Thailand tour. With nights spent in Chiang Mai, Sukhothai, and Bangkok, you will discover traditions and histories with local encounters and incredible personalized experiences.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Mai – Easing Into the Cultural Experience
dayInfo.description: Your plane will swoop across the mountains and the jungle as the city of Chiang Mai slowly comes into view. Surrounded by green and tucked between mountain folds, this old city was cut off from the world for most of its history. Only by elephant back or tortuous upriver cruising could you reach it, meaning Chiang Mai was saved from the Burmese and Angkor raids that devastated cities like Sukhothai and Ayutthaya. It was only in the 1920s that Europeans made it here, but small hill tribes have always used Chiang Mai as a trading post, giving the city an ethnically diverse flavor. You will see many different faces and clothes along the streets, a testament to Chiang Mai’s continued domain as Thailand’s cultural hub. You will be greeted at the airport and transferred to your hotel that is within the old city walls. Most of the surrounding area is pedestrianized, characterized by narrow cobblestone lanes, small shops and cafes, and the odd, intriguing temple. The city is a quiet place for easing into the Thai experience, with monks on the streets and many cafe corners for watching the world go by. Your guide will take you to Doi Suthep this evening. Walk up a few hundred steps, see the spinning prayer wheels and listen to chiming bells as you go. Sunset is magical up here, especially as pilgrims help create a spiritual atmosphere.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Mai – Exploring Chiang Rai and the Golden Triangle
dayInfo.description: Head north this morning, and the road to Chiang Rai is covered with small wooden villages and the peculiar outpost that is Wat Rong Khun. This modern temple appears more like the palace of a snow queen, dazzling white and connected by bridges. Strange sculpted flourishes mark the exterior, with serpents and other creatures not typically seen in Buddhist temples. The interior murals are an allegory to modern life, stretching from enlightenment down through commercialization and the idolization of false heroes, as illustrated by Superman and Nemo among other painted characters. There really is no other temple like this one, and it is changing every year as artist Chalermchai Kositpipat adding more to his controversial creation. Continue north to the Golden Triangle, a misty swathe of jungle where Thailand meets Laos and Myanmar. With a short boat ride across the Mekong River, you can reach Laos, bringing another stamp in the passport and a local market experience. Back in Thailand, the Hall of Opium Museum tells a harrowing tale of the Golden Triangle’s important role in world history, particularly how it helped to fund colonial empires. This is a relatively long day, but it’s worth making the drive back to Chiang Mai rather than spending the night. You should arrive back in time for the night market, where hundreds of small stalls cook up regional gastronomy.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Mai – Buddhist Temples, Night Markets and Meeting the Monks
dayInfo.description: If you are jet-lagged and up early, then today is perfect for checking out the daily alms ceremony as lines of barefooted monks wander the streets at dawn, receiving offerings of food from locals. Or sleep in, ignoring the chime of temple bells – there will be plenty of monks with seven days in Thailand. In a small yellow tuk tuk, you can take a tour of the city, your guide helping to connect the historical eras as you piece together Chiang Mai’s seven centuries. There is nothing too ostentatious here. The temples you visit are working, breathing places of worship, where monks and locals can be seen beneath Buddha images. Step inside one of these temples, and its cavernous red-brick design will bring respite from the midday heat. In a small aromatic room, you can sit cross-legged with a monk, receiving a blessing as swirls of incense cascade through the air. Regardless of any religious beliefs, this is a powerful experience and a chance to glimpse into the everyday life of a temple and the equanimity of those who reside there. The rest of the afternoon and evening are left free so that you can determine your plans at your leisure. Chiang Mai is also well known for its spas, so several options abound if you would like to go that direction, or you can visit the night market as it moves locations through the week, so you should be walking a different street of traders and food stands tonight.

dayInfo.title: Sukhothai – A Day Visiting Traditional Hill Tribes
dayInfo.description: Small hill tribes occupy jungle areas all around Chiang Mai, including across the border in neighboring Laos and Myanmar. Each is a little different from the next, and some have particularly unusual traditions. Perhaps the most famous are the Karen, those of the elongated necks. The Karen are also the most numerous people here, and it is essential to have a good guide. Some villages are little more than amusement parks with tourists happily snapping photos, while other villages are less photogenic, yet far more authentic with a chance to really understand the history behind the traditions. Karen are just one of many. As the road twists towards Lampang, you can stop at two other hill tribe villages as your guide offers a selection of experiences depending on who and what you want to see. By mid-afternoon, you will be in Lampang, where a grand 15th-century temple is covered in mosaics, and another temple hides the most exquisite Buddha images. As before, the sights will continue as you travel onwards to Sukhothai and a hotel on the edge of the UNESCO World Heritage area. By now, it will be dusk, and the temples will be seen as silhouettes, proudly cast against a changing night sky.

dayInfo.title: Sukhothai – Sublime Highlights of the Ancient Capital
dayInfo.description: A surreal city unfolds at dawn as through the mist and dust come the chedi, with so many of them marking the open landscape. Temples rise from the shadows, suggestive of an early medieval century. Most of this city was built between the 13th and 15th centuries, a time when it was capital of a kingdom by the same name. At first, you will admire a handful of temples. But as this day continues, you will be in awe at the scale of Sukhothai. Wat Sri Chum and Wat Sri Sawai are temples on a phenomenal scale while Sri Satchanalai is more than large enough to hide its secrets. You will have options today, and it is good to combine different modes of exploration. A bicycle is the most relaxing way to get around the entire site in a day. Walking is possible and best combined with the tram so that you can disembark to clusters of temples and important sites. It is also worth taking a break in the middle of the day to let the heat pass and reflect on what you’ve seen. Your guide will know a good spot to watch the sunset, and you can watch another night come down on a city that has not been inhabited for centuries.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok – An Ancient Legacy and an Afternoon on the River
dayInfo.description: Sukhothai finally has a domestic airport, and there is a morning flight to Bangkok. Touch down to a meet and greet service and spend the morning discovering Bangkok’s major sights. Begin with Wat Po as monks wander and a breathtaking Buddha reclines with well over 100 feet of sculpture shimmering softly. Move next to the Royal Palace, opulent yet simple in its own way for an insight into regal tastes that is entirely different from those in Europe. There is also the Emerald Buddha, an exquisitely carved symbol of Thailand. By the time you have finished with these three sights, you can check into the hotel and freshen up, and have lunch with a beautiful view over the Chao Phraya River. While Bangkok has become a giant of a city and is more developed than the rest of the world gives credit, it retains a local feel. To head out into the city’s outskirts, you must travel by water, first down the Chao Phraya and then switching onto a small boat that can navigate a maze of canals. It is here that you will see impromptu markets inside boats, and bamboo villages that overflow with waving children and roving buffalo. In just an hour, you will be a million miles from skyscrapers. Put your feet up, watch the world slowly roll by, and drift into the depths of old Bangkok. It is a dreamy journey, and when you return to your hotel, you will pass another dreamy sight with the Temple of Dawn illuminated at dusk.
