dayInfo.title: Bangkok – Visiting Ayutthaya and Late-Evening Departure
dayInfo.description: Ayutthaya is an old capital where mystique roves effortlessly through the streets. A Buddha’s head is cracked, the features entwined in tree roots. Another Buddha reclines, so large you can get lost in it. The whole site is not on the scale of Sukhothai, yet the individual temples are sublime and fully restored to their former glory. Spend your morning in the reconstructed city, and then an afternoon drifting on the river once more. This time you will float to the Summer Palace and Bang Pa-In, both monuments that mix Thai, Chinese and Baroque European styles. You will be back in Bangkok by late-afternoon and still have access to your hotel room. Relax and refresh before a private transfer to the airport and your outbound flight.

tourName: Tantalizing Thailand: Bangkok, Chiang Mai, Krabi Tour
placesVisited: Bangkok, Chiang Mai, Krabi Town, Koh Phi Phi
generalInfo: Culturally enriching and breathtakingly rewarding experiences abound from the bustling skyline of Bangkok and the pearly beaches of Krabi during this ravishing 11-day tour to Thailand. Whether basking in the spiritual glow of golden temples or lapping up the wondrous wildlife sightings across the countryside, you will find pleasure in the scenes and highlights of Thailand in each enchanting destination you visit.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok - Your Thai Beginnings
dayInfo.description: Few places in Thailand capture the country’s fascinating blend of cultures and traditions quite like Bangkok. The city is atmospheric, bustling, and overflowing with an authenticity that is reflected by its iconic street food culture and modernity. Upon your arrival, you will fast track through immigration and transfer to your comfortable accommodation in the heart of the city. Your Thai beginnings in Bangkok may be spent tucking into the city's famed delicacies.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok - Visiting Ornate Temples
dayInfo.description: Spiritual sites dressed in gold and veiled in porcelain rise among Bangkok’s skyline. Today, you will access these cultural sites during a guided tour that will incorporate a distinctly Southeast Asian mode of transport: the Tuk-Tuk . Your three-wheeled vehicle will zip through traffic to the monumental Grand Palace. Within the decorated confines of the royal complex, you will uncover the spiritual roots on which Thailand’s culture was founded. These discoveries will continue at other significant temples, such as Wat Arun and Wat Pho. These temples will showcase towering spires and an enormous golden statue of Buddha.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok - Floating Markets and Serene Canals
dayInfo.description: Today, you will explore Bangkok like a local on traditional boats that glide gracefully across the intricate web of the city's narrow canals. You will visit the cherished markets that have established themselves on the canal. From within your boat, you may purchase fresh produce or watch the locals drift by in their vessels that are loaded with colorful ingredients and curious trinkets. These floating markets, particularly Khlong Lat Mayom and Taling Chan, are an integral part of Bangkok’s commerce and culture and will prove enchanting to explore.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Mai - Northern Thai Specialties
dayInfo.description: Thailand’s northern capital, Chiang Mai, is nestled at the foothills of Doi Suthep Mountain, which is a natural geological wonderland you will explore with a guide shortly after you land and check in to your accommodation. Panoramic views of Thailand’s golden countryside and Doi Suthep’s temple will allow you to capture their breathtaking spectacles. Before returning to your room, you can delight your palate with a taste of the Northern Thai delicacy, Khao Soi , a distinct curry noodle soup.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Mai - Elephants and Ethnic Hill Tribes
dayInfo.description: As bewildering as Thailand’s cities are, the country’s true magic can be found in its unspoiled wildernesses. Here, endangered animals are protected, and the greenery is allowed to proliferate. Today, you will venture to an ethical elephant sanctuary in the lush countryside. Here, you will meet and play with these majestic creatures in the luxuriant forest. Afterward, you will head for the hills and visit an ethnic Karen hill tribe, whose culture is reflected by their colorful garbs and the thatched homes they have constructed.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Mai - Learn to Cook Thai Cuisine
dayInfo.description: Your morning in Chiang Mai will be yours to enjoy as slowly or as quickly as you please. Whether you wish to wander the history-enriched neighborhoods, explore venerated temples, or practice Buddhist meditation under the guidance of a monk, you can choose how to spend your morning. In the evening, you will learn the art of Thai cooking with a local family of the Lanna village. Set to the backdrop of the sprawling forest, you will master a selection of Northern Thai delicacies and savor them together around the table.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Mai - Towering above Thailand
dayInfo.description: Today, you will set off to Doi Inthanon National Park, a bucolic expanse of evergreen forests and spreading vegetation that is dear to the local people. Within the jungle, you will rise to the summit of Doi Inthanon Mountain for staggering landscape views from 2,565 meters. Swooping down along the shaded pathways, you will arrive at ethnic hill tribes beneath the thick foliage. Here, rice paddies and coffee plantations thrive. Soon you will return your accommodation in Chiang Mai, where you will have the remainder of the evening to spend at your leisure.

dayInfo.title: Krabi - Thailand’s Tropical Beaches
dayInfo.description: With moments in Thailand’s forested landscapes checked off your travel list, you will pleasantly venture to the picturesque destination of Krabi to luxuriate in the country’s seaside splendor. After flying to Krabi and transferring to your accommodation, images of the tropical paradise will be revealed to you when you take your first steps on the golden shores Krabi's enchanting beaches. Karst islands rise from the sea and white sand stretches between craggy cliffs. You will be immersed in this tropical environment within minutes of landing.

dayInfo.title: Krabi - Wondrous Watersports
dayInfo.description: Your first full day in Krabi will be yours to enjoy at your own pace. Regardless of what you choose to do, you will continue to cherish the wondrous sea that flanks olive-green headlands. Along the bright beaches, watersports abound and will give you the opportunity to enjoy the scenery from unique perspectives. The activities range from exhilarating to calm, such as jet-ski rides and kayak excursions to caves. You can wallow in the wonderful water sports on offer and unwind in this tropical sanctuary in style.

dayInfo.title: Krabi - Visit Phi Phi Island
dayInfo.description: Krabi, although part of the mainland, is a coastal gateway to the bewitching islands of Thailand. One such island is Phi Phi Island, and you will cruise to this tropical haven today. Here, you will discover the surreal serenity that Thailand is cherished for as you swim in the water and snorkel over coruscating reefs with colorful marine life. Your dreams will become a reality when you bask in the radiance of the Thai sun on postcard-perfect beaches that have been featured in movies and magazines.

dayInfo.title: Krabi - Departure
dayInfo.description: Your enchanting Thailand tour will come to an end today, although you may treasure your last moments within the tropical paradise of Krabi before transferring to the airport. Whether finding comfort on the luxuriant beaches with a good book or basking in the radiant sunshine, your last minutes in the country will be as pleasant as your first.

tourName: Taste of Thailand Culinary Tour
placesVisited: Bangkok, Chiang Mai, Phuket
generalInfo: There are endless unforgettable flavors to discover and enjoy on this custom tailored tour through Thailand and its remarkable culinary traditions. From sensational cooking classes to magnificent local restaurants, opulent temples to immaculate beaches, you will make a culinary journey from spice to decadence and you will relish everything in between. Uncover the secrets of famous restaurants, delight in the cultural traditions of home cooks, and taste the diverse flavors from north to south that bring you into the unique and unparalleled tastes of Thailand.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok – Tasteful Beginnings
dayInfo.description: Welcome to Bangkok, Thailand, the metropolis filled with unexpected tranquility hidden within the secret niches that make the city your own. You will be met at the airport by a private transfer who will take you to your plush hotel located along the bustling streets of the cityscape. The Peninsula Bangkok offers you the luxuries of modern Thailand overlooking the expansive city that surrounds you. The afternoon is yours to explore the city at your own pace. Initially the sidewalks of the metropolis can be a bit overwhelming; however, you will quickly become an expert at maneuvering the streets as you discover the open friendliness of the people. The aroma of fresh noodles and lemongrass fill the air. Stroll through serene Lumpini Park, known as a ‘tranquil oasis,’ within the fast paced rush of the city. The large pond reflects the shimmering skyscrapers, the trees offer respite from the sunlight, both are entangled within the city but seem to be miles apart.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok – Taking it to the Street
dayInfo.description: The morning sun reaches over the horizon and you can see the orange-robed Buddhist monks parading single file through the city streets. The morning ritual brings the dedicated out to the sidewalks offering rice or cookies, along with donations to the monks to help support their daily, pious lives. After breakfast you will journey to Wat Po to hear the morning chanting ritual that brings in the new day in a collective, deep hymn. The gracefully elongated reclining Buddha stretches over 120 feet long and adornments glitter along the temple walls and even on the underside of Buddha’s feet. Touring through the Grand Palace will bring you to the exquisite Emerald Buddha, the most celebrated and ornate statue in Thailand. The illustrious green figure watches over the lavish gallery located within the Royal vicinity, and the King changes the statue’s robes once a season. In the afternoon you will find yourself in the neighborhood of Bangrak where you will experience the historic food on an adventure behind the local sights and flavors of the well-known neighborhood. To locals, the area is a center of diverse and still local flavors. From home-style mom and pop cuisine to superb restaurant displayed dishes, you will be able to taste the down-home cooking that has brought Thai cuisine to the forefront of the international palette. From vibrant fried prawns that maintain their glowing orange color to grilled pineapple and forceful bird’s eye chili; one taste and you will never want the tour to end.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok – When Elephants Are Blue
dayInfo.description: After a lush breakfast you will venture out to the historic Blue Elephant restaurant, open since 1980 and known for bringing Royal Thai cuisine to the world. You will meet your guide who will tour you through the local market in search of ingredients. You can watch, listen, point, try, and order the freshest produce, from jackfruit to lettuce, including fresh, daily caught seafood. The restaurant is located within a historic mansion that harkens back to the days of colonial architecture, featuring arched window and tiered roofs. Your guide and instructor will demonstrate each dish, giving you a tasting of the vivacious ginger or subtle spice before you attempt to prepare the cuisine yourself. The secrets of the cuisine, known for its deceptive simplicity, are told to you through instruction, flavor, and offer something to take home with you. In the evening you will be able to dine at Alzamendi at Iniala, a three-Michelin-star restaurant that carefully assembles some of the best of the various and focused culinary traditions of the city.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok – Fabulous House and Royal Cuisine
dayInfo.description: Today you will journey to the fabulous house of Jim Thompson, an American who settled in Thailand after World War II and helped rebuild and restructure the Thai silk industry. His home was once transferred from Ayutthaya to Bangkok, and is now a grand combination between eastern and western architecture, sitting beneath the dangling shade of banyan trees. The checkered tile entryway and enrapturing porch are touches of the western style while the 17th century standing Buddha sits beneath a charming lighting arrangement and promotes the eastern sensibility. As the day continues you will begin another tour of the Mandarin Oriental with a three-hour cooking class. The menus are themed and change monthly, giving you a unique course and look inside Thai cuisine. You could try your hand at making lotus leaf rice or even prawn dumplings, tasting the flavors every step of the way. The kitchen fills with the fresh aroma of herbs, where lemongrass gives off a floral fragrance. When the dumplings begin to cook you can hear the sizzle and imagine the sensational flavors to come.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Mai – Urban Jungle to Mountainous Jungle
dayInfo.description: In the morning you will have a luscious breakfast before transferring to the airport and finding yourself within a city surrounded by plush forest. Chiang Mai is considered the capital of the north and upon your arrival you will be greeted by a private transfer to begin your fabulous exploration. Wat Suan Dok is a temple that was built in the 14th century standing just outside of the ancient city walls. The prayer hall is unique because of its size and its open sides, giving a view of the surrounding foliage. Beside the tree line is a series of lavish white-washed shrines that radiate in the morning sun. After a stupendous visit to the mountain Doi Suthep, and the adorning temple known for its panorama and the 309 steps that ascend beneath the marvelous dangling forest, you will find comforts in the Anantara Chiang Mai Hotel. The pool resembles a pond, surrounded by blossoming lily pads. The rooms open out to a view of the ever-present jungle. You have found that the flavors of Thailand do not reside in the food alone.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Mai – Land of 1,000 Rice Fields
dayInfo.description: There is an image that lives in your mind when you think of Southeast Asia, a place overrun with the beauty of sweeping rice fields and the incredible fragrance of sesame oil. Today you will journey outside of the Chiang Mai spending the day in Khum Lanna, founded in the 13th century. The property is surrounded by mountains, located within a small valley and neighbored by the quaint village of Phrao. The orchards sparkle in the sunlight and the emerald-green fields are mesmerizing. You are led through the garden to begin your tour. The vegetables are remarkable, vibrant, and perfumed by the surrounding herbs. Gather your ingredients and ready yourself for the demonstration to come. Five diverse dishes will be exhibited, from ingredients to preparation, displaying the wonderful cuisine, simple techniques, and flavorful outcome. After lunch you will travel on a bicycle tour along the lively fields to visit a traditional healer, where you will learn about the traditions of herbal medicine that have grown throughout time within the culture of the region, before returning to Chiang Mai.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Mai – In and Around the Walls
dayInfo.description: The day brings with it endless adventure that will take you throughout the Chiang Mai. After breakfast you will journey along the fabulous San Kamphaeng district, home to the heart of the silk and cotton industries, where you can watch the intricate weaving process and see the splendid colorful final products. Wander through “Umbrella Village,” at Bor Sang, where you can stroll the paper umbrella-clad aisles that are filled with remarkable color and which somewhat resemble a fabulous, blossoming garden. The afternoon brings with it a feast for the senses with a small cooking class at A Lot of Thai, a family run class established in 2001. Your instructor blends science and tradition bringing the flavors and culture of the food to rich, new life. You are familiar with the comfortable flavors; however, the technique adds new depth to pad Thai and massaman curry. They even tout a visit from acclaimed chef Gordon Ramsey.

dayInfo.title: Phuket – Flavors of the Forest to the Sea
dayInfo.description: When morning comes you will make your way to the airport to catch your flight to the stunning island of Phuket. A private transfer will pick you up from the airport and have you journeying through the islands grandeur where the mountains are filled with fabulous jungles and the beaches are no less than effervescent. Look out over the exceptional panorama from Phuket Viewpoint where you can see the trees sloping down into the cityscape and the distant pure water glittering in the sunlight. Afterwards you will be taken to a cashew factory to experience the delights and importance of the nut in various Thai dishes. Before traversing the streets of the centuries-old Phuket Town, filled with quintessential Sino-Portuguese architectural beauty, your tour through the factory gives you more than just history and culture but also a taste of the fantastic cashew whose crunch and flavor you have come to know well throughout your time in Thailand. As your tour winds down you will settle into the grand comforts of The Surin Hotel, where a one-bedroom superior cottage is dressed and ready to welcome you.

dayInfo.title: Phang Nga – Somewhere Along the Sea
dayInfo.description: Today can take an optional adventure out onto the luxurious water that surrounds the island for a tour of the sensational Phang Nga Bay. The June Bahtra eases through the glass-clear water where various shades of blue shimmer in the morning light. The rocky edges of Phuket have glistening limestone that peeks beneath the carpet of trees. At the edges of James Bond Island, named for its cameo in The Man with the Golden Gun , the limestone karsts are as magnificent in person as they seemed in the movie, almost unreal in their magnitude. On Panak Island and Hong Island you will explore the varied labyrinth of mangrove swamps. It’s almost as if you have stepped back in time into the Louisiana bayou, with dangling barren vines and remarkably clear water that reflects the green canopy. Monkeys run along the branches, birds chirp in their hidden niches within the leaves, and you have found a flavor of Thailand that you had yet to have tasted.

dayInfo.title: Phang Nga – Within the Wondrous Caves
dayInfo.description: Another day on the island brings you back out along the Andaman Sea and its calm, immaculate water. At the edges of the Phang Nga Bay National Marine Park you will be able to paddle through the bay in a canoe that will glide you through the maze of islands, allowing you to explore the varied grottos and hidden lagoons up close. The limestone dangles down from the powerful and imposing cliffs, with edges that look like they have melted and frozen over time. It is easier to see the clarity of the water as you drift and paddle along the soft cool surface. In the evening you will come to the final tastes of Thailand cuisine at Aziamendi in Iniala where the essence of tradition gives a decadence to the light flavors. Your final dinner in Thailand will be memorable in everyway, offering you one last taste of the country’s fresh quality.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok – Endless Flavor Undone
dayInfo.description: Once more you will awaken to the rich and fresh flavors of breakfast, where pineapple juice and coconut help bring in the new day. After your delightful meal you will have a private transfer to the airport where your flight will be ready to ferry you back home. Your time in Thailand brought you the diverse flavors of the country, from delicate to forceful, minty to spicy, as well as the styles of cooking that vary from north to south and from town to town. As you journey home you know you will never forget the exquisite food and remarkable people that have made the tastes of Thailand more than just a vacation but a wonderful experience. You may even consider extending your trip. For trip extension ideas, be sure to browse the reviews for travel agents for Thailand .

tourName: Ten-Day Thailand Family Adventure: Culture, Jungles & Islands
placesVisited: Chiang Mai, Pai, Mae Hong Son, Doi Suthep–Pui National Park, Ko Samui
generalInfo: Thailand brings adventure and mystique as an exotic destination that is comfortable for all ages. Elephants hoot in the thick jungle, monks will greet you at sunrise, and the tribe villages will impress an alternative way of life. A jungle camp will immerse you in nature while an island retreat provides sun, sea, and sand. Handcrafted to maximize your family time together, this 10-day Thailand tour avoids the city to create the classic Thai mix of culture, jungle, and island.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Mai – A Tuk Tuk Through the Old and New
dayInfo.description: Chiang Mai reflects so many preconceptions often thought about Thailand. The city sits serenely beneath a mountain, deep in the north of the country. Crumpled city walls still stand, enclosing 700 years of history. Although the streets can be a little dusty, they are mostly pedestrianized with hardly any traffic once you cross a bridge and wander between temple remains. Until the 1920s, the only means of reaching Chiang Mai was to ride an elephant through the jungle or take a boat upriver through various rapids. This cultural hub was hidden from the world and was able to preserve its culture, incredible in comparison to other great Siam cities that were razed to the ground by invading armies. Touch down, and it will be an easy transfer to your centrally located hotel. You can then stretch your legs with a wander on a lane of stupas and small shops before a tuk tuk provides your first genuine Thai experience. Squash into the back together and travel slowly through the streets, gazing out at red-brick temples and orange-robed monks. Thailand, especially a city like Chiang Mai, can be an enormous culture shock for adults and kids alike. In a tuk tuk you are anonymous, so you can just sit back and soak up all the new impressions with colorfully-dressed locals, swirling incense, temple bells, other tourists, market stalls, ornamental architecture, city walls. A tuk tuk is also an iconic means of travel and one that confirms that you have landed in Southeast Asia and are setting off on an exotic adventure together. Don’t take just our word for it - consider reading some of our travelers’ reviews of Thailand , and see how you can customize your own dream vacation.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Mai – Visit Elephants and Karen Hill Tribe Village
dayInfo.description: Elephants meander through the forests just beyond Chiang Mai. Ears flapping and trunks swinging, the elephants traverse the trees with elegance to their gait and a sense of mischief in their eyes. You will be walking alongside in the shadow of these giants as you notice their calls, gestures, and movements. Enjoy the ambiance of the jungle as the elephants move through the trees to a river, where the pachyderm will stop for a bath squirting water wildly from its trunk. Your elephant experience will be at a widely regarded ethical elephant sanctuary in northern Thailand. After a morning spent with giants and lunch in the forest, you will continue to explore. Drive, and then walk, among the trees to a small village cut off from the world. The Karen people live here, traditional in their ways and surreal in appearance. While many Karen communities once lived here, only a few remain, so they use tourism to supplement an otherwise meager income. Meeting them is an authentic experience that will be eye-opening for all. Children everywhere tend to be curious souls, and younger visitors typically end up playing with Karen of similar age. It will be a great opportunity to experience a different way of life with a chance to meet with a shaman before returning to Chiang Mai.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Mai – A Spiritual Morning With Monks Plus a Thai Cooking Workshop
dayInfo.description: Monks wander the Chiang Mai streets at dawn, and you will want to take it all in. It is difficult to get up early when you are on vacation, but persevere with the alarm and pull the kids out of bed. You will soon stand on the street, and a line of orange will come towards you, the monks barefoot and holding small bowls. This is the city’s daily alms ceremony, a surreal and serene experience, and beautiful to take in. Back at the hotel, there will be time to rest, perhaps around the small pool. Chiang Mai can easily be explored on your own as well, the pedestrianized streets and quirky shops good for families out together. This afternoon you will be in the kitchen, gaining dirty hands and food-stained faces. It is a Thai cooking workshop tailored towards children, with lots of tasting and an introduction to the wide variety of flavors and spices.

dayInfo.title: Pai – Cycling Past Paddy Fields to Shan Villages
dayInfo.description: The road from Chiang Mai to Pai famously contains 762 turns. It’s a steep and winding drive through stunning scenery, taking 2 ½ to three hours in private transport; note you could also choose for flying into Pai in a 12-seater aircraft, with superb views over jungle and mountains. Rice paddies surround Pai, locals appearing like colorful dots in the fields. Small temples and chedi (Thai stupas) stud the landscape, along with villages of bamboo houses. The best way to explore is by bicycle, taking you off the main road and along ochre-hued lanes. A support vehicle follows so you can leave the saddle at any time. It’s a 12-mile cycle loop to a string of Shan villages and back, although this can be shortened or lengthened dependent on how your family feels. Peddle up then down and rest in one of the Shan villages, meeting a family and comparing their lifestyle to the Karen. Lush landscapes mark the forward path as you cycle to natural hot springs and pass innumerable rice fields. Returning to Pai, you cross a Japanese World War II bridge then descend through Pai Canyon, returning elated and perhaps exhausted. Pai is a small place, and there are dozens of eating options within walking distance of your hotel.

dayInfo.title: Pai (Jungle Camp) – Immersed in Nature on a Rafting Adventure
dayInfo.description: Into the jungle you go, setting off in a raft, getting soaked by the sights of nature. The first few rapids are tepid, allowing everyone to get accustomed to the boat and what to do. Mostly you’re drifting, the guide navigating you past wild mango trees and remote sandy beaches. After lunch the action intensifies, a handful of class three and four rapids meaning everyone gets thrown around a little in the raft. It’s very safe, even if the rushing water provides plenty of thrills and perhaps a spill. After 15 more rapids, you reach the jungle camp, a place that’s hidden from civilization. Sit around the campfire, listen to the monkeys, and settle into a two-night wilderness experience.

dayInfo.title: Pai (Jungle Camp) – Appreciating Life Deep in the Jungle
dayInfo.description: Spend the day deep in nature as you can bathe in the river as tropical birds sing their song, or follow self-guided jungle paths in the search of monkeys and gibbons. Listen to the silence, and experience the remoteness of nature. Your accommodation will be in comfortable, wooden huts with comfy beds and private outdoor showers. This will not be luxurious, but it connects you to nature, especially the natural choir song drifts across the camp. The rustic setting is a beautiful place to stop and unwind as a family. There are no interruptions here, not even any Wi-Fi. A program of activities will keep you occupied, and all are included in the stay. Just decide on the day, from canoeing and guided hikes to learning about local insects.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Mai to Koh Samui – Tucked Away on a White-Sand Beach
dayInfo.description: From the jungle to the island will be an exhilarating journey. Continue by raft, the river being the only way out of the jungle. Of course, you will continue downriver and through a collection of grade two and three rapids to the take-out point at Mae Hong Son. You will need to set off early in order to reach the mid-morning flight back to Chiang Mai. From Chiang Mai, you will transfer onto a flight to Koh Samui, an exotic island of white sand and palms. Once more, it will be a forest that provides a backdrop, and this one sends cooling shadows across the beach. Check into your quiet resort on the least developed corner of the island, far from the backpacker scene and relax. For the next three days, you will not even need to think about shoes.

dayInfo.title: Koh Samui – Space and Time to be Together as a Family
dayInfo.description: There is not too much going on in Koh Samui. Palms sway and warm water invites. The beach is quiet, and there will be time and space for you to be together as a family. Hang around the pool or on the sand. Take a snorkel into calm waters and feast your eyes on the myriad of colors, or find your shoes and walk in the indigenous forest. Koh Samui was the first of Thailand’s islands to really become known to the world, a tropical paradise reported by intrepid travelers of the seventies. While half the island has developed into a bustling resort-style destination, the other half remains low-key, true to the island’s origins. These two days are at your leisure and activities can be organized locally should you wish. Scuba diving and guided snorkeling are popular, but do not expect to find any of the loud motorized water sports here, as this corner of Koh Samui is for tropical birds, not banana boats and jet skis. You can take cultural trips to temples and markets on the island, along with guided excursions in the forest. However, you will have done a lot of this already, so these two days are likely to be spent between the resort and the beach, experiencing why Thailand’s islands continue to be among the world’s most escapist destinations.

dayInfo.title: Koh Samui – Departure
dayInfo.description: Koh Samui is the most convenient of a famous island trilogy as it is the only one with its own airport. After a relaxed morning and enjoying the beach, you will be transferred to the domestic airport this morning, flying to Bangkok where you meet an international departure.

tourName: Thailand Adventure and Culture Tour & Island Retreat
placesVisited: Bangkok, Chiang Mai, Phuket, Koh Phi Phi
generalInfo: From the north to the south, Thailand will give you alluring culture and the adventure you crave on this custom tailored tour through the cityscape and beyond. From decadent metropolises filled with hidden wonders to jungle landscapes populated with magnificent elephants bathing in the riverbed, you will cross through crystal seas, raft along adrenaline pumping whitewater, and witness the untouched hill tribes that continue to fill the northern forests. This is where luxury, culture, and adventure meet; this is Thailand.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok - Cultural Adventures
dayInfo.description: Welcome to the city of Bangkok, a large, rushing metropolis unveils the extraordinary culture hidden in the majesty of the streets, beneath the brushing trees, and within the storied history of its energetic expanse. You will be met at the airport by a private transfer and taken to your accommodation. Experience the luxury of the hotel situated with a panoramic view of the city’s shimmering lights, where the scent of coconut oil comes as much from the restaurant as it does from the breeze wafting around the stunning pool. As you stroll along the vibrant Sukhumvit shopping district or through the quiet trees of Lumpini Park, your fabulous Thailand adventure has begun.

dayInfo.title: Temple Ventures
dayInfo.description: The sweet perfume of pineapple and rich coffee rouses you from bed. After a delicious breakfast, you will venture out into the city and find the historic sites of the capital, culturally significant and aesthetically magnificent. Situated next to the Chao Phraya River is the Grand Palace. The royal family once resided within the animated walls and continues to use the complex for large gatherings and important processions. The façade is opulent featuring arched windows and tiered and gilded roofs. The sky-blue windows stand out against the immaculate white structure. Within the complex, there is an energetic atmosphere and you will find various temples situated around the manicured garden. Step into Wat Po, the Temple of the Reclining Buddha. The statue lies over 132 feet long and is glowing with gold leafing. The temple looks as though its wall must have been built around the statue. The quiet air within the temple becomes interrupted with an elegant ring from the hall. Along the wall are 108 bronze bowls and you can drop small coins into the dishes to give a charming ring to the atmosphere and an offering of help in the preservation of the temple at the same time.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Mai - Into Culture’s Den
dayInfo.description: Once again you will rise to an enjoyable breakfast. After your meal you will have a private transfer to the airport where you will soon arrive in the capital heart of Thailand’s north, Chiang Mai. Get aquatinted with your new accommodation. The opulent façade offers a fabulous welcome on its own, touched by the Lanna-style architecture and decorated with exotic depictions of the mythical creatures that once inhabited the earth. The scenery is striking, the rooms are luxurious, and the atmosphere brings you to a time not yet forgotten, but often unremembered. In the evening you will come to a cooking school for a display and taste of the extraordinary cuisine that has taken the world by storm. You are welcomed with open arms like a friend and are ready to learn traditional dishes that have evolved with time and attention. Made with local ingredients, these recipes are often hidden from the outside world like a secret. Your guide brings you out into the field where the aroma of Thai herbs, such as lemongrass and coriander, fill the air. Gather your produce and watch your instructor guide you through the dishes step by step. Bite into crunchy spring rolls or sweet mango sticky rice. You have created a culinary delight, filled with flavor, love, and unforgettable moments.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Mai - Never Forget a Face
dayInfo.description: There is an endless amount of culture and adventure along the streets and within the surrounding jungle. Today you will venture out to a local elephant sanctuary where the revered animal has found a haven in the face of deforestation and a rise in the human population. A brief introduction and training will ensure your understanding of the elephant and the forthcoming Elephant Owner for a Day program. The elephants are marvelously friendly and quite territorial when it comes to their friends. After training and bonding with your elephant, you will climb aboard and wade your way through the forest, understanding how to interact, guide, and respect your newfound friend within the wild jungle landscape. The trees are lively, the greenery is all-encompassing, and the dust kicked up from your elephant is far beneath you. Patara has proven through understanding and encouragement that the elephant is still a celebrated animal in Thailand and gives you the chance to celebrate with both the elephants and the elephant farm. The lumbering animal sways as it walks and makes its way to the river, dipping into the water to cool down and bathe. The elephants enjoy people helping wash behind their ears. Its ears sway and waggle as the elephant lifts its trunk and sprays water into the air, playfully teasing you. In the evening you will settle into a lodge, where luxurious comfort awaits nestled within the coziness of a traditional Hmong village.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Mai - Around the River’s Bend
dayInfo.description: The morning spreads along the landscape, brushing against the open fields and tall trees. The local Hmong village is vivacious. The villagers are eager to answer questions about their culture, from their clothing to their jewelry. They are proud of their heritage and happy to educate anyone who shows interest. After breakfast you will traverse the jungle, coming to the fabulous Mae Taeng River. After a quick lesson you will board a raft and journey down the undulating waterway. The mist splashes against your cheeks. The water is cool beneath the shady riverbanks. Slide over rocks and trundle over whitewater. The river ranges from fast-paced to serene; in places you can jump out of the raft and drift quietly along the surface with a feeling of complete seclusion. In the afternoon you will return to Chiang Mai.

dayInfo.title: Phuket - Jungle Clad to Sand Covered
dayInfo.description: Today you will break from the evergreen spell of northern Thailand by venturing to the mesmerizing southern island of Phuket. A private transfer will pick you up from the airport and take you to the fantastic resort. The greenery of the island is immediately apparent, set against a backdrop of unparalleled blue sea that glistens in the light. Stroll along the Sino-Portuguese buildings in Old Phuket or the take in the spectacular views near the Big Buddha that sits on the summit. Your resort is part historical display and part immersion experience with its wooden frame that blends modern architecture and traditional comforts. Set beside the elegant riverside restaurant, the pool feels as though you have stepped into a jungle stream. Whether your room faces the water or the jungle there is grace and beauty in every direction.

dayInfo.title: Koh Phi Phi - Island’s Pristine Beauty
dayInfo.description: The island life of Phuket is quickly behind you as you venture by ferry to the charming island of Koh Phi Phi. The island was devastated by the tsunami in 2004, but has since recovered not only its development but its grandeur as well. The ferry docks and a porter will take your bags and help transfer your resort. The beauty of the island immediately strikes you. The sand is immaculate and there is endless charm in the traditional boats that sit on the shoreline. The water is crystal clear and the foliage is lush against the oceanic backdrop. Once at your hotel you will experience the comforts of the island, where the pool almost runs straight to the ocean. The gentle lapping of the water creates a relaxing atmosphere within the plush accommodations set close to the jungle and the sea.

dayInfo.title: Koh Phi Phi - Marveled Waters
dayInfo.description: It is one thing to hear that there is endless beauty on and off the coast of Koh Phi Phi but it is another thing to witness it. Today is at your leisure to experience the unrivaled wonders on and around the island, even if that means that means simply settling beneath an umbrella with a view of the sapphire water that runs against the sand. Order a cold beverage and let the sun slowly drape over you for a while. If you wish to journey into a more active day then you can set sail for Bamboo Island, one of six islands that are nestled in the archipelago. A local boat will provide you with an easy and fun ride as a gentle mist sprays up around you. At the shore you can snorkel in the pristine water. The shimmering reef is secluded, away from the bustling beaches of other islands. The lush and plush vegetation sprouts up just past the expanse of sand in tremendous shades of green. Float in the majestic water and dive down to see the spectacle beneath the surface where from vivacious clown fish swim in and out of the colorful coral, and effervescent anemones gently wave with the current.

dayInfo.title: Koh Phi Phi - Leisurely Moments
dayInfo.description: With another day in paradise at your whim and pleasure, you can take some time to bask poolside with a waiter at your beck and call, as you sip on sweet drinks and the sun drifts through the sky at its own pace. There are only right choices to be made within this backdrop of opulent landscapes and faultless beaches. You can climb to Phi Phi View Point for a panorama of the island. The main town sits on an islet where the surrounding water shines various shades of blue. Alternatively, you could enjoy a cooking course at a local culinary school. The flavors of southern Thailand will no longer be a secret, having given you the sensational tastes to take them home with you, and having gifted you a touch of the spicy south to enjoy whenever you wish. From quick tips to an in depth class, you will venture through the ingredients that make island cuisine seductive and addictive. The scent of coriander and chili paste lingers in the air as your instructor and guide helps escort you through the steps of cooking perfectly tender prawns, and to balance the combination of sauces. You will not only participate but delight in the finished fare, dining on your own creations within the island paradise.

dayInfo.title: Koh Phi Phi - Culture and Adventure Continue
dayInfo.description: There is a part of you that wants to rise with the sun for one last look of the bronzing glow of the light against the open sky. For your final breakfast can be served overlooking the combination of sea and mountains, the brilliant shades of green and blue mixing together with wondrous results, or in the comforts of your room where you can enjoy the luxuries until the last moments of departure. Soon you will climb aboard the ferry, make your way to the Phuket airport, and find yourself soaring through the sky on your way home. The cultures and adventures through Thailand have shown you northern majesty and southern splendor, on top of mountains and beneath the sea. Though you will find yourself at home, you know that there will always be another adventure waiting and more cultures to experience when you return to Thailand. You may want to read reviews of travel agents for Thailand on Zicasso. You will read about travelers' experiences on their customized tours.

tourName: Thailand Adventure Vacation Tour for Families with Children
placesVisited: Bangkok, Kanchanaburi, Ayutthaya, Sukkothai, Chiang Mai, Doi Inthanon National Park
generalInfo: Pristine waterfalls and opulent palaces, captivating wildlife and marvelous adventure, these are the ingredients for an unforgettable family adventure. Your time in Thailand is completely customizable to ensure everyone in the family gets to experience their dream vacation. Kayak down the River Kwai and swim in natural pools fed by mountain springs. Explore the hillsides to visit villages with centuries of tradition. Taste the local cuisine and learn to recreate the family’s favorite dishes. Your Thailand adventure vacation for families with children is more than just an adventure; it is unparalleled time with the whole family.

dayInfo.title: The Family Adventure Begins
dayInfo.description: Bangkok is a city that feels both oddly familiar and uniquely exotic. The metropolis overtakes villages with over 200 years of history. The streets are lined with food carts that provide insight into the locals’ favorite flavors, sweet and salty, spicy and sour. Tiny lanes open up into streets brimming with Chinese Heritage and markets Chatuchak Market encompasses 35 acres with over 8,000 separate stalls. The family meets the private transfer at the airport, and is taken to their hotel at the heart of the city as your luxury family vacation begins. You are quickly swept up in the bustling streets and prevalent culture that winds around the cityscape and lines the riverbanks of the Chao Phraya River. The Grand Palace glistens, and the historic Temple of Dawn adds to the modern skyline of towering skyscrapers.

dayInfo.title: Chao Phraya Express
dayInfo.description: The Chao Phraya River was once the most important highway in the country, ferrying merchants and royalty alike. After breakfast, your guide meets you and your family at your hotel and escorts you to the shores of the Chao Phraya River. The waterway stretches over an area of 231 miles emptying into the Gulf of Thailand. The current takes the family along riverside gardens and quaint homes. Canals wind through the cityscape and provide you a view of the life that has thrived alongside the waterway for centuries. The Grand Palace is situated on the riverbanks and encompasses an area of 2,351,000 square feet. It is an amalgamation of numerous halls, pavilions, courtyards, and buildings. The palace was constructed in the 18th century and remained the seat of power until the 1920s. You can see the Temple of the Emerald Buddha from the water. It’s golden spire glistens in the sunlight. The temple contains one of the holiest relics in Thailand. Gilded garudas line the exterior banister. When you enter the temple, you find a lavishness found in palaces. The Buddha icon is a dark green statue that stands 26 inches tall and carved from a single jade stone. The king changes the Buddha’s robes to signify the changing seasons.

dayInfo.title: Active Rivers and Forest
dayInfo.description: Kanchanaburi is a city located on the banks of the well-known River Kwai, known for its strategic location during World War II and its part in the celebrated film, “Bridge Over River Kwai.” Your private transfer escorts you to the edges of the riverside town. You meet your guides and step onto the riverboat for an excursion along the waterway. The landscape is serene and verdant. The water has a calm current. Small wooden huts are built sporadically alongside the water. These huts are built on stilts to provide space for the river to rise during the wet season. Continue your exploration of the countryside on a bike tour. Follow the winding country roads through local villages. The mountainside rolls along the horizon. You can hear the school children playing in the yard. The aromas of slow-cooking stews emanate from homes. Erwan Waterfall is an impressive system of seven falls that contain unique character and shapes. The water pours over the limestone and streams into an effervescent pool. The surrounding rainforest echoes the cascading sound. You have already experienced the vivacious urban life and the peaceful rural scenery of Thailand, and it is only your second day.

dayInfo.title: Picture of a Grand Past
dayInfo.description: The Kwai River runs along the riverbanks and reflects the sunlight. The mountains look like silhouettes on the horizon. After breakfast your private transfer takes you and your family to the ancient capital of Ayutthaya that dates back to the 14th century. Wat Niwet Thammaprawat is located on a secluded island surrounded by the waters of the Chao Phraya River. It sits opposite the Bang Pa Palace and is the only neo-Gothic monastery in the country. It was constructed in the 19th century and is decorated with beautiful stained glass. The sunlight beams through the windows and adds streams of color to the black and white tiled halls. Gold covers the Buddha in the main hall. Each window frame was designed to hold curved window. A long-tail boat will take you the remainder of the way into the historic city. The stupas of Wat Chai Wattanaram are visible from the water. The 17th-century ruins are red and deep gray against the green grass and towering trees around the courtyard. Buddha statues line the gallery that connects the outer towers. The deeper you step into history, the more fascinated the kids become.

dayInfo.title: The Local Life
dayInfo.description: The heart of rural Thailand takes the family into a photograph. Rural Thailand is filled with endless greenery that drapes over the hills and lines the riverbanks. Bamboo huts sit at the edge of the waterways and temples decorate foothills and mountaintops. Sukhothai was founded in the 13th century and is considered the cradle of Thai heritage. The images of the city take the family back in time to over 190 ruins. Wat Mahathat means the “Temple of the Great Relic.” A lintel is decorated with intricate carvings of traditional dancers and bordered by dragons. The main temple tower resembles a budding lotus. Over 200 chedis fill the architectural park. The family embraced the cultural differences and unique history of Thailand. The kids enjoy the adventure and surprises around every corner. You are delighted by their enthusiasm and endless energy.

dayInfo.title: A Taste for Rural Life
dayInfo.description: The sunlight spreads over the countryside and highlights the unadulterated beauty of the landscape. Today you make your way up to the northern capital city of Chiang Mai. En route you stop at a local farm and the family can experience the distinct connection that the rural farmer has with the land. Orchards brim with tropical fruit, from rose apple to guava. Coffee crops edge the village and fish fill a large pond. You can hear the geese squawk near the water and chickens roam around the garden. The air is fresh, and the sun is warm. You continue to Chiang Mai. In the evening, you can see and even participate in, khom loy, sky lanterns. The myth states that a lit lantern can carry your troubles and bad luck away. The large lanterns,often made of oiled rice paper, contain an opening on the bottom. The kids are eager to send their lanterns into the air. You light the small candle in the interior, and the smoke pushes the lantern into the sky. As the lanterns float away they fill the night with glowing flames that resembled the stars. You know that the time you share with your family sending lanterns into the air creates precious, unforgettable memories.

dayInfo.title: Secrets of the City and the Edges
dayInfo.description: Chiang Mai Thailand’s second largest city, and it feels like a town filled with a rich and lively history. A moat encompasses the old city and the old walls provide an ancient stronghold. Bells jingle from passing bicycles. Concentric spires rise skyward and the mountains around the city’s edges are a mystical embellishment to the scenery. The wonders of Thailand surround the city and the family is ready to experience the majesty. Located in the forest is the Elephant Nature Park. The sanctuary, established in 1995, has provided a haven for the pachyderm in a space distant from required toil. The kids are thrilled to be standing so close to an elephant. Elephants take bananas straight from your kids’ hands. They trumpet and splash water at the family. You have trouble containing your excitement as well. The female Asian elephant can grow to a shoulder height of eight feet and averages a weight just shy of three tons. They use their trunks to drink and spray playfully into the air. The children eagerly help bathe the elephants at the river, using buckets to reach the elephants’ backs. If the kids stop paying attention, the elephant splashes them. Return to Chiang Mai in the afternoon and learn the simple secrets of Thai cuisine with a cooking course that the entire family will enjoy.

dayInfo.title: Alms and Waterfalls
dayInfo.description: Devout followers head to Ton Payom market for the monks’ daily procession in the early morning. Their burnt saffron colored robes shine like the sunrise. The monks stroll by holding baskets. Locals sit on their knees and offer rice, cookies, and other goods to the monks for alms. The daily ritual is intriguing and serene at the same time. Venture into the countryside and watch the cityscape fade away. Mountaintops hover over vast fields and streams divide the trees. The Karen hill tribe is known for their mountainside culture, distinct language, and recently their coffee cultivation. The tribe now practices sustainable rice fields and lives at a lower elevation than at previous times in their lineage. After an introduction to the village, you continue into the forest. The trees provide delicate aromatics. You can hear the stream rushing in the distance. The rush turns to a roar, and you arrive at the Wachirathan Waterfall. The natural power of the falls is mystifying, and the spray is comforting. The waterfall cascades around 262 feet down the mountainside. The rocky cliff looks draped in the water and surrounded by spirited forest.

dayInfo.title: Flight in the Jungle
dayInfo.description: The city’s old quarter is vibrant with budding flowers and vines that stretch along the historic ramparts. After breakfast, your personal guide meets you at the hotel and takes you into the jungles outside of Chiang Mai. Thailand’s highlands are emblematic of steep ranges and gorges. Summits can rise over 6,600 feet above sea level. Forests carpet the expanse, and you arrive at the base of your zip line adventure. The kids, restless with nervous energy, get ready to fly through the sky. The network of lines covers an area of over three miles, including a single zip line that stretches approximately half a mile long. Your guides provide insight into the scenery, educating the family about the vegetation of the highlands and the culture of nearby villages. Mae Kampong Falls rushes along the distant hills. Your guide clips you onto the line, and you glide between trees. The wind brushes against your cheeks. Adrenaline pulses through your body. You fly above the treetops and find beauty in the canopy. Birds chirp and tweet, hidden by the passing leaves.

dayInfo.title: Family Friendly
dayInfo.description: The sounds of Warorot Market are active in the morning. People arrive early in search of quality produce, fresh foods, animated flowers, and herbs. Hill tribes come to sell their handcrafted goods, from woodworks to textiles. Stalls are lined with rows of shows and fruit is stacked in pyramids. Colors and aroma of tropical fruits fill breakfast. Fresh pineapple cut in slices, and creamy jackfruit accompanies sweet tea. After your meal, your private transfer meets the family at the hotel and escorts you to the airport. The kids want to stay and continue to explore the mountains and beaches. They want more time with the family to journey to unexpected reaches of the countryside. Nothing makes you happier than your family wanting to spend more time together. You can always stay a little longer and relax on the treasured shores of gold beach paradise on a Thai island.

tourName: Thailand for Food Lovers: Complete Gastronomic Itinerary
placesVisited: Chiang Mai, Chiang Rai, Bangkok, Hua Hin, Phuket, Krabi, Koh Lanta
generalInfo: Thai food is celebrated worldwide and for good reasons. Years of tradition and meticulous attention to invigorating all flavor profiles have culminated into a sensory cuisine that is unlike any other. Using a range of aromatic spices and locally-sourced ingredients, Thai chefs create beloved dishes for both traditional tastes and finer palates. On this immersive, 21-day tour of Thailand, you will travel to pivotal destinations that bring timeless recipes to life in perfect fashion. From authentic ethnic hill tribe meals to opulent recreations of classic meals at award-winning restaurants, you will experience much of the best of Thailand’s gastronomic scene.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Mai – A Blend of Tradition and Sophistication
dayInfo.description: Nestled beneath the striking Doi Suthep Mountain lies the thriving city of Chiang Mai. It is often referred to as the Northern capital of Thailand as it holds significant importance to the Thai people. The city is a booming metropolitan paradise that is set amongst a sprawling and unspoiled landscape. The destination is steeped in rich history, and you will explore this heritage through enchanting experiences during your stay. Beyond the alluring sights that await, Chiang Mai boasts the most authentic Northern Thai cuisine. The country’s food culture is no better expressed than on the plate of a traditional Chiang Mai Gaeng Hang Lay , which is a Burmese-inspired, sweet yellow curry. You will dabble in the delectable, northern flavors shortly after you have arrived and checked-in to your exceptional 5-star resort beneath Doi Suthep Mountain. You will witness surreal vistas of the surrounding scenery from the splendor of your private suite. Afterward, you can visit distinguished, local markets for wholesome Thai food experiences. The stalls spread spirited energy throughout the vibrant markets, and locals swarm the busy vendors as they fry timeless dishes in their works. You will become pleasantly lost in the exuberant bustle as you move from stall to stall and tuck into delightful delicacies along the way. Though native chefs are revered for their traditional creations, Chiang Mai boasts a selection of prestigious restaurants for a modern twist on the classics. You can venture out on a guided food tour to the foremost restaurants in the city, where you will dine alongside the upper-class and enjoy award-winning dishes that are paired with elegant glasses of wine. You will depart Chiang Mai feeling inspired by the unique blend of tradition and sophistication that prevails in this sought-after, culinary-centered city.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Rai – Feast Like a Local
dayInfo.description: Neighboring the flourishing city of Chiang Mai is the less-frequented Chiang Rai. Popular among travelers who are searching for an even more authentic experience, this humble destination is a food-lovers paradise. Here, you will stay at a premier, boutique resort that takes its design inspiration from the areas of Burmese-Siamese heritage. With world-class amenities and sumptuous breakfasts to kick off each day, you will bask in complete luxury among the pristine countryside of Northern Thailand. The city limits are bordered by magnificent and luscious hills where native ethnic tribes still reside in rural bliss. You will have the opportunity, accompanied by a knowledgeable guide and translator, to spend the day with one of these friendly communities. As you connect with the local lifestyle and encounter deep-rooted traditions, you will feel overwhelmed with enthusiasm for the simplicity of this way of life. The tribes cherish communal gatherings, and you will delight in a family-style Lanna meal, or Northern Thai meal, with them. Everyone plays their part and works on the spread for lunch, giving you a behind-the-scenes look into what brings their beloved dishes to life. You will share in the stunning spicy flavors of traditional Northern Thai Curry and tuck into marvelous steamed rice meals. Your hosts will ensure that your palates are catered to, and their time-tested recipes are sure to awaken your senses. Your immersive exploration of Chiang Rai’s culinary scene will continue with stylish restaurants that add an innovative flair to their dishes. An elegantly prepared plate of Gai ban tom sab , which is a soybean sauce boiled chicken dish, and Pad mee Yunnan , which is a mix of stir-fried egg noodles with vegetables and meat, should not be missed.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok – Thailand’s Celebrated Culinary Scene
dayInfo.description: A quintessential stop on any gastronomic tour of Thailand is Bangkok. The exuberant capital boasts some of the country’s most exceptional cuisine. From street-side stalls that sell exquisite and traditional delicacies to luxurious restaurants that cater to the finer Thai palate, you will be spoiled for choice as you meander through the many meals that Bangkok has to offer. Each evening, you will retreat to your premier, 5-star hotel that rests on the banks of the Chao Phraya River. Your room will share panoramic views of the skyscraper-dominated skyline and an immense stretch of the calm river below. You will feel worlds away in this luxury-minded city, which enthusiastically retains its ancient influence. You will venture out on a walking tour of Bangkok and witness the immaculate temples for which the city is recognized. These iconic and sacred complexes are home to grand Buddhist displays, and there is a wealth to learn about the age-old traditions from your private guide. The tour will be lead through colorful markets, where the scent of Pad Thai , which is a famous noodle dish, sweeps in all directions. You can peruse the many marvelous vendors and tuck into exceptional snacks throughout your tour. You should be on the lookout or ask your tour guide to spot, Chicken Satay , which is a peanut-sauce-covered, chicken snack that is all the rage in Southeast Asia. Before bidding your farewells to Bangkok, it is essential that you experience the finest eating establishments in the city. You will set off in search of the most magnificent meals at celebrated and award-winning restaurants. You will tuck into revered food, sip on prestigious glasses of wine, and witness surreal views from delectable restaurants on a luxurious food tour of the city. Furthermore, you will have the life-changing opportunity to meet the coveted chefs behind the world-famous meals, sharing in stories and culinary secrets that will have you truly cherishing these delightful encounters.

dayInfo.title: Hua Hin – Fresh Seafood with Sunset Views
dayInfo.description: Hua Hin is a seaside district that is located a few hours south of Bangkok. As a result, it is a tremendously popular travel destination among Bangkok locals. Originally, it was designed as a luxurious getaway destination and has since become one of the most sought-after tropical locations along the Thai coast. The love of great food has followed, and among the 5-star resorts, you will find a collection of some of the finest seafood restaurants in Thailand. You will arrive on the sunny shores of Hua Hin and check-in to your immaculate, 5-star resort. The grandeur of your private suite offers uninterrupted vistas of the white-sand beaches. Your accommodation also boasts an impressive assortment of first-class amenities to keep you thoroughly entertained when you return from your gastronomic expeditions. You will start your memorable stay with a sumptuous seafood meal at the resort’s renowned restaurant. Freshly caught fish will be prepared by a team of professionally trained chefs, and you will unwind in complete style from the restaurant’s sweeping balcony. Afterward, you can delight in the splendid Thai sun on the shores of the premier beach and take a dip in the warm crystal-clear waters of the Gulf of Thailand. In the evening, you will enjoy a remarkable sunset over the sea from a pinnacle rooftop bar and restaurant. The remainder of your stay will leave nothing to be desired, and you can find yourselves soaking up your leisure at a leading wellness center. With an array of traditionally-inspired treatments to choose from, you will enliven your minds and bodies like never before. The expert staff will ensure that you are completely comfortable as you inhale the aromatic wafts of essential oils and feel the tension slip away with each spa remedy. You will delve into the delightful seafood of Hua Hin at more of its classy establishments after your spa treatment. Then, you can indulge in King Size Prawns, enjoy delicious oysters, and dine on extravagant Crab Curries at these recognized restaurants.

dayInfo.title: Phuket – Treasured Meals in the Tropics
dayInfo.description: Phuket, Thailand’s largest island, is a treasured, tropical destination that is known for its tremendous white-sand beaches that stretch across its palm tree-lined coastline. Here, gourmet restaurants serve sumptuous seafood meals and share breathtaking views of the serene seaside. Further inland and beyond the shoreline, you will find compelling landmarks that are waiting to be explored. You will enjoy a completely comfortable stay within your private suite at a prestigious resort that is located on the beach. With a gourmet restaurant situated in the resort, you will have exceptional meals within arm’s reach. During your stay, you will visit pivotal destinations across the luscious landscape, and you will transfer to the sacred Big Buddha and capture images of the entire island. Then, you will visit majestic temples and marvel at their intricate designs. You will also spend time on premier beaches and catch rays of sunshine in the Andaman Sea. Perfectly blending leisure and style, your stay will be world-class. You can peruse the exuberant stalls of one of the island’s beloved markets and taste your way through the exciting, authentic dishes. Then, you will sip on elegant cocktails and fine dining on immaculately prepared Tom Yam , which is a fragrant hot and sour soup with seafood, at leading restaurants all over the island. Your memorable Phuket tour will culminate with a romantic, candlelit sea cruise on board a private boat. You and your partner will cherish fabulous memories together of the meals that have been cooked right in front of you by a revered chef as the sunset radiates over the horizon.

dayInfo.title: Krabi – A Taste of Stylish Seclusion
dayInfo.description: A short, luxury speedboat cruise will transfer you across the Andaman Sea to the immensely popular, mainland destination of Krabi. Along the Krabi coast lie stunning shorelines that are encompassed by rugged limestone cliffs. Opulence exudes from every experience in this luxurious location, and you will enjoy your culinary adventure from a fashionable resort on the beach. You will check-in to your stylish suite and soak up the afternoon sun around the secluded infinity pool. Afterward, you will indulge in a fine dining experience at an award-winning restaurant. With uninterrupted vistas of the surrounding area, you will appreciate the finer moments on this memorable evening in Thailand. The following morning will allow you to escape to the isolated and secret beaches on board a private speedboat. You will find yourselves under the shade of a palm tree on soft sands that are rarely visited before discovering the surreal beauty of the jagged limestone cliffs that tower over the emerald sea. You can also kayak across the gentle water for close encounters with the breathtaking sights. A snorkel out to the colorful coral reefs will reveal the majestic sea life that lives below the surface. Schools of fish will surround you, and luminescent coral will ebb and flow with the waves. You will be able to reminisce on these magical moments as you delight in a private lunch on a hideaway beach. This gourmet BBQ will highlight the country’s delicious meat dishes, and you will return to your resort utterly satisfied. To culminate your stay, you will learn to master a few essential Thai dishes at an exemplified culinary school, where you will uncover the secrets behind the country’s most beloved dishes.

dayInfo.title: Koh Lanta – Opulent Bites within Paradise
dayInfo.description: Koh Lanta is a bit less developed than some of Thailand’s most popular islands; however, it still packs a wealth of luxurious experiences. You will arrive at one of the island’s first-class resorts that truly captures the secluded beauty of Koh Lanta. Among the unspoiled and natural environment of the vast seaside, your private suite shares an intimate getaway that is unlike any other. You can breathe in the fresh air and feel the enchanting embrace of freedom on the island before venturing out to an eco-aware restaurant for a sustainable take on traditional Thai cuisine. The incredibly progressive and beautifully back-dropped restaurant will be the perfect place to celebrate your holiday over a sumptuous meal. Your stay within the tropical hub of Thailand will continue as you transfer to Koh Lanta’s jungle skirted secret beaches. With the help of your private guide, you will board a speedboat and visit insider locations that are rarely visited. You will bask in the intimate seclusion of these hideaway beaches and snorkel the stunning sea that is teeming with life. Koh Lanta’s dining experiences flaunt sophistication, and you will tuck into delectable haute cuisine throughout your stay. Your knowledgeable guide will ensure that you visit the most recognized and celebrated restaurants on the island, and you will return to Krabi and make your way to the airport after seeing, tasting, experience almost all that Thailand has to offer. You will cherish these memories of the gastronomic magic that you experienced in a country that firmly rooted in timeless tradition.

tourName: Thailand Thrill & Adventure Island Tour for Families
placesVisited: Krabi Town, Koh Samui, Koh Tao, Koh Chang, Phuket
generalInfo: On this customizable 2-week tour to Thailand’s famed karst islands, nothing separates you and your family from the enthralling activities and enchanting sights. Submerge yourselves in the magical atmosphere that emanates from this culturally rich country as you witness wildlife spectacles from an array of electrifying vantage points. Come immerse yourselves in the decadent flavors of Thai cuisine and the country’s iconic landmarks.

dayInfo.title: Phuket – Welcome to Thailand
dayInfo.description: When you land at Phuket International Airport, your private chauffeur will be waiting to transfer you to your luxurious accommodation. Your opulent suite will be complete with a spacious balcony that will afford you unobstructed views of the Andaman Sea and one of the island's premier beaches. Once you are settled in, you can begin to get used to the laid-back lifestyle, which radiates from this sun-kissed location. You will then retreat to one of the many marvelous restaurants that lie on the banks of the sea.

dayInfo.title: Phuket – An Exhilarating Tour
dayInfo.description: Today, the pristine jungle wilderness that encompasses Thailand's tropics will reveal itself along the course of a guided ATV tour. A group of highly trained ATV guides with a comprehensive understanding of the rugged terrain will direct you to each of your very own ATV's for the morning. The trip will lead you away from the tourist crowds and into the depths of the forest as you loop around a massive, off-road path across winding dirt trails, river bends, and tree-lined hills. You will then retreat to your resort, where you may peruse the bustling streets in search of colorful souvenirs to commemorate your stay.

dayInfo.title: Phuket – Cycling to Koh Yao Noi
dayInfo.description: Before you and your family venture off to witness the wondrous countryside, you will sail across the Andaman Sea on a private speedboat. You will cut through the turquoise water in style as you sip on beverages that have been prepared by the crew and lay back to the warming embrace of the beaming sun. As you take your first steps on Koh Yao Noi, you will immediately feel all your stress melt away. You will then collect your bicycles and pedal your way through the island to admire the tranquil stretches of rice paddies and age-old architecture. Along the way, you will make frequent stops at sightseeing spots and charming villages, where authentic food will be served with a smile.

dayInfo.title: Phuket – White Water Rafting
dayInfo.description: Today, you will sail to the beautiful waters of Phang Nga Bay, which is a destination that is famous for its limestone isles that rise out of the sea. Your journey will lead you to Ton Pariwat Wildlife Sanctuary. A team of professionally trained guides will welcome and brief you on the adventure ahead of you, which will be a white water rafting trip. You and your family will navigate the falls as you glide along the river around sharp bends and down steep gorges. For lunch, you can indulge in a tantalizing Thai restaurant that is nestled along the tree line. Once you arrive, you can sample some of the distinct flavors for which the country is revered before partaking in a drive through more of the sanctuary.

dayInfo.title: Krabi – Islands in the Andaman Sea
dayInfo.description: After breakfast, your guide will escort you to islands that are sprinkled across the Andaman Sea. During this excursion, it will be tempting to follow the beaten path and check off tourist recommendations, but your guide will have an in-depth understanding of the archipelago and will lead you away from the overcrowded shorelines toward remote islands that are less frequented. The coral-covered seabed that surrounds Ko Jum is a delight to discover with snorkels. You will continue to a few more idyllic islands, such as Koh Ngai and Koh Muk, and your guide will avoid hotspots in favor of vacant beaches. Your tour will culminate at a secluded beach that will be tucked away beneath the tropical forests of Krabi.

dayInfo.title: Krabi – Swim with Bioluminescent Plankton
dayInfo.description: It is ultimately up to you how you wish to spend your final day in Krabi, and there will be a plethora of ways to spend your time. Krabi Town is a destination of historical significance that once stood as a small fishing village on the banks of the Krabi River. If a walk around town today is not quite your tempo, then you may prefer to lay down on a comfortable massage bed and experience the ancient practice of a Thai massage. After the sun disappears over the horizon and only the faint light of the moon is left, you and your family will paddle out into the dark water to watch it illuminate around you. To view the plankton when it is most active, it is best to schedule your trip between November and May.

dayInfo.title: Koh Samui – Relax on Pristine Beaches
dayInfo.description: You will venture to Koh Samui this morning via airplane, which will prove to be the most efficient and comfortable means of reaching the beloved island from Krabi. Koh Samui is a large island in the Gulf of Thailand, which served as the origins of small fishing communities. You will have a few hours at your leisure once you reach your suite. There is no better way to treat your family on your first evening than by immersing them in the fine dining that Koh Samui has to offer. Elite restaurants on the island are run by revered Thai chefs, who expertly combine their knowledge of Thai cuisine with their experience in some of the world’s finest kitchens.

dayInfo.title: Koh Samui – Test your Culinary Skills
dayInfo.description: A morning trip to a distinguished culinary school will elevate your second day in Koh Samui by allowing you to dabble in the delightful flavor profile that is typical of the country’s meals. You will venture to the school in the morning, and a brilliant chef with years of experience in cooking will welcome you to the culinary school. Under the close tutelage of your culinary instructor, you and your family will be provided with an in-depth understanding of the unique facets that constitute the cuisine and how select dishes bring the philosophies of traditional Thai cooking to life.

dayInfo.title: Koh Samui – Animal Encounters
dayInfo.description: Your final day on Koh Samui will be dedicated to discovering its environmental highlights. You will transfer to a base camp, where professional rangers with a comprehensive knowledge of the terrain and creatures who inhabit it will be expecting you and your family. You will be led on an off-road tour in a 4WD Jeep. During your tour, you will navigate dirt roads under the shelter of an evergreen canopy. You will arrive at the Na Muang Waterfall, where you will witness the pounding streams of silver water as they beat on natural swimming pools and revitalize your bodies. A catered lunch will satisfy your hunger pains before you pose alongside a moss-covered Buddha image to learn about the intricate art of rubber tapping.

dayInfo.title: Koh Tao – Stellar Beaches under the Sun
dayInfo.description: Less densely populated by tourists than the likes of islands like Phuket and Koh Samui, Koh Tao will make for an ideal retreat today. You will board a private speed boat after breakfast and witness spectacular scenery from the deck of your boat. You will venture to an unspoiled slice of paradise Koh Tao, which will provide you with the perfect opportunity to unwind in style. Your suite will be complete with views of the luscious forest and pristine beach. Much of the day will be at your leisure, so you can choose to spend it however you choose. Koh Tao is an excellent place to relax and unwind after a few busy days of adventures.

dayInfo.title: Koh Tao – Discover Marine Life
dayInfo.description: Koh Tao has made a name for itself as one of the premier scuba diving destinations in Thailand, and this is as a result of the incredible sea life that lies below the water’s surface. Accompanied by highly trained scuba diving experts, you will learn what it takes to swim with the marine animals in addition to receiving your diving certificate to commemorate your training. Your instructors will know the whereabouts in which to spot the marine life and, if all goes according to plan, you should capture underwater images of massive sea turtles, illuminated Yellow Boxfish, and Whale Sharks. Furthermore, should eco-conscious involvement fit the bill of your travels, then the award-winning diving team will provide you with a variety of conservation efforts that you may learn more about and participate in during your expedition.

dayInfo.title: Koh Chang – The Tropical Surroundings
dayInfo.description: This morning, you will travel in style as you make your way from Koh Tao to Koh Chang. First, you will venture back to Koh Samui in a speed boat before boarding a flight that is bound for Trat. From here, you will zip across the sea to Koh Chang within the comfort of a speed boat, and before you know it, you will have the immaculate vistas of Koh Chang to absorb your attention. Entangled in a melodic web of waves and echoes of the breeze, you will be completely at ease as you reach your luxurious resort and spa for an afternoon of rest. Once you arrive, you will have the remainder of the day to laze away however you see fit.

dayInfo.title: Koh Chang – Beachside Barbeque
dayInfo.description: Teeming with fish and vibrant coral, Koh Chang is a premium snorkeling destination in Thailand that is away from the overcrowded waters of some of the more popular islands. This makes it an exquisite place to snorkel and swim in the relaxing waters of the sea, where you can witness the majestic sea life that swims below the surface. Accompanied by a well-versed tour guide with an outstanding knowledge of the land, you will find yourselves under limestone cliffs that shelter the bays from the sweltering sun. You will also stroll along quiet shores for peaceful exploration of the many diverse and environmental highlights of Koh Chang. You can retreat to a desolate beach, where your gifted chef will prepare a Thai BBQ on the sand.

dayInfo.title: Koh Chang – Departure
dayInfo.description: Sun rays shimmer off the sea in the morning, and the wilderness will come to life. After you wake in Koh Chang, you can wander to your breakfast table, where a remarkable spread of fresh juices, steaming coffee, puffy pastries, and delicious egg dishes will be waiting. Your friendly private transfer will be waiting for you in the lobby and will transfer you to the international airport once you are ready. As you board the plane and soar into the sky, you will look back toward the illustrious landscape of Thailand’s dotted islands and wish that you were just beginning your luxurious vacation.

tourName: Thailand’s Hidden Cultural Gems: Immersive Isan Itinerary
placesVisited: Bangkok, Ayutthaya, Nakhon Ratchasima, Ubon Ratchathani, Khon Kaen, Udon Thani, Kumphawapi, Ban Phue
